Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money. Friendly service staff.”
Reviews.Author: GrimesMasters
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palmer House for a week. This is a "fine" hotel. There was nothing outstanding, but everything was "fine". No complaints. The lobby lounge was busy and crowded, but that's to be expected with over 1600 rooms. The thing that struck me was how friendly the service staff was. Throughout the week, every housekeeper, waiter, etc., was friendly. They all greeted, said hello, have a good day, etc. That was a refreshing touch in a time when most people won't even look at you. The food in the Lochwood Restaurant was good. Room service was good...although my filet was a little on the small side...the red wine reduction sauce was amazing! Overall I give this hotel a solid very good. For the rate is was worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious style”
Reviews.Author: Flowerdiva71
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Palmer House dozens of times and each experience is wonderful. They have undergone recent renovations but the splendor of the lobby surpasses all else. We miss the days of Trader Vic's being on site but there are terrific options for dining and shopping just steps away. You can never go wrong when staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel/Good to see they finally have WIFI”
Reviews.Author: jamesteroh
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this property and it's historic charm. I haven't been staying here as much as in the past with a couple other hilton properties in the area (The Wit and the Hilton Garden inn), but still enjoy my stays here and stayed there the weekend of 3/9 for a weekend getaway. Hotel location is perfect. The Red and Orange lines are right outside the door and if you are using OHare, the Blue line takes only a couple minutes to walk to. Lots of stores and place to eat at that are a close walk and very convenient to most theaters in the loop. Fitness center is the best of any hotel I have stayed at. As much variety of machines as most gyms and very clean and modern. One thing I use to hate about this hotel was no wifi except in the lounge. They now have wifi in the rooms and it worked without any problems and was pretty fast. I like that the free code they give you works on more than one device so I was able to use both my phone and IPAD with it. This was my first time staying there since Hilton Honors added suite upgrades to the benefits for diamond members. I had read reviews about some properties not honoring this benefit. Fortunately the Palmer House did and gave me a very nice suite upgrade to suite 11-150. Suite was large and quiet. I used the luggage storage service after checkout and the guys working when I retrieved my bags were great. I didn't think I would have enough time to get to the airport on the blue line seeing I was checking bags and was going to grab a cab and they assured me I had plenty time. They were right and saved me a lot on a cab, and the train ended up being faster than a cab would have been with the traffic backups at a couple spots. The only thing I dont like about this property is how crowded the lounge always is at breakfast time. I usually just take the tray from under the icebucket up with me to the lounge and put breakfast food on it and go back to my room to eat. That can be a pain though if your room isn't in the elevator bank serving the 23rd floor and having to switch elevators. Other times it isn't difficiult to find a seat and it nice they are open most of the day for things like grabbing a soda or bottled water. During breakfast time though they REALLY need to enforce the T&C of the HHonors program of only the member and ONE guest being allowed access if they aren't on the executive floor to help keep congestion down.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ceiling in the lobby, but food trash in room”
Reviews.Author: Dixie C
Reviews.Content: I checked in with my daughter on March 16. She wanted to stay in a five star hotel so we chose the Hilton. The first morning I reached for my eyeglasses which had fallen to the floor by the bed. When I reached down my hand landed on a nasty, dessicated orange section which apparently house keeping missed. I took the piece of food trash in a tissue and showed it to the concierge, who asked me if I wanted a manager to contact me. Yes. 8 hours later I got a call from an uninterested manager who asked me if I wanted him to find out if one of the services in the hotel would give me a credit. He never followed up. By the third night in the hotel, our sheets were soiled and dirty. We left the sheets down so housekeeping could see that they needed changing. They were not changed, so my daughter and I had to spread towels on the bed to sleep. The toiletries were not replaced as required. Very disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Top Spot”
Reviews.Author: CanberraWorm10
Reviews.Content: First trip to chicago and found it to be a great location. Hotel has lots of history and a very comfortable place to stay. Plenty of things to do. Would definately stay there again should I ever visit chicago again which I hope to do. Great place Chicago...

Reviews.Title: “Executive all the way”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel with an amazing lobby! Nice and spicey bloody marys at the lobby bar :) We stayed on one of the 'executive' floors and I really recommend doing so! They have a few separate elevators specifically for the executive level floors, so you don't end up waiting long at all -and you get breakfast and apps on the 23rd floor. Perfect location as well!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Betsyat240
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Palmer House Hilton this past weekend thanks to a great deal from Orbitz. The location isn't in the heart of the Magnificent Mile but that wasn't what we were looking for. Still the Mag Mile is an easy walk away. Our room was beautifully updated and considering the age of the hotel in remarkable shape. We were VERY impressed. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub after long days of walking around the city. There is a historic tour with lunch of the hotel that would have been great to participate in, maybe next time. We were concerned about the L being so close and therefore loud but our room was blissfully quiet and noise was not an issue at all. We would stay here again in a heartbeat and whole heartedly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “ask for extra chair in room at booking”
Reviews.Author: raceaveal
Reviews.Content: only office type chair in our room ask for extra chair in room when booking. quiet room with no view, but very good senior rate. palmer house lobby outstanding, hotel restaurant fairly reasonable for this venue. i would recommend this hotel, especially if you are going to symphony or theatre. opera house a good mile away, but very walkable in nice weather only 2 blocks from MACYS, and tons of fast food restaurants in area.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel , So I will Forgive Its Few Trespasses”
Reviews.Author: northsoutheastwest
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for a college program held at the Palmer House in February. Although the place was jammed between our program entering and a Model UN convention departing, check in was well controlled and quick. Our room on a Hilton;s Honors Floor was not huge but was very well decorated and had great beds, and updated fixtures. Maid service was spotty but minor problems were quickly renovated.. The hotel of history as mentioned by others. A favorite feature are the photos of the performers who played the Empire Room from Sinatra to Pearl Bailey , Jack Benny and Buddy Hackett. I upgraded to a package that included internet and gym membership. Since I brought work with me, the upgrade was well worth the cost .The gym is fantastic with many machines and loaner ipods. There is also a great spa.. Our last morning the internet was not working and their really was no hot water. However a quick request yielded a discount of my bill. The location is of course perfect,close to several El and subway stations, and literally a block to the Art Institute. Three are many restaurants to choose from in the area (Miller's Pub two doors down is just great and open through the wee hours) so there is no need to dine in the hotel's mediocre restaurants. Staying at the Palmer House was a great part of our Chicago experience, and I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Gary B
Reviews.Content: It isn't so much the property as it is the customer service ... Hilton Customer Service I prepaid a reservation at Palmer House to have a birthday dinner with my daughter in Chicago. Unfortunately, my mother passed away on March 6 and the reservation was for the day of the funeral. I called on Thursday prior to the funeral to cancel the reservation (out of courtesy and so they could resell the room). Also inquired about any possibility of a refund due to the circumstance. I was told to FAX the confirmation number for the cancelled reservation, along with the obituary and death certificate. That I did. No confirmation of receipt. Called to day to check on the status of the refund and I was told 4 - 6 weeks to process. Asked to speak to a supervisor and was told that none were available and I would get a call back in 48-72 hours. Really? Is this customer service? So I sent an email and the automated reponse says I should expect a reply in 24-48 hours. Really? BE CAREFUL IN DEALING WITH HILTON ON PREPAID RESERVATIONS. They appaerently don't like to refund your money even with the death of a parent. Very caring company ... not.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hilton option but not the best”
Reviews.Author: gazooby
Reviews.Content: This is a classic, worth a stay just to have a chance to see the lobby ceiling and review the photos of Empire Room entertainers who line the walls of corridors (Dorothy Dandridge, Sonny and Cher, Louis Armstrong, Jerry Lewis). The rooms are small and lacking in some conveniences we expect from mid/high-end hotels. I could not find a hook to hang my bathrobe or a coffeemaker in mine. The makeup mirror was mounted five feet high -- no use to anyone of my smaller stature. The staff on the Executive level were a tad too pushy in their effort to get us to stop breakfasting at 10 a.m. The elevators are impossible -- I had to go from 10th floor to 7th to get to 25th in order to reach Exec Floor amenities to which my HHonors status entitled me. And the concierge never did pick up that phone, despite 4-5 attempts at calling for info. But on the other hand, the staff are cheerful and will make good on mistakes when they happen. The towels are plush and plentiful. The beds are Hilton-amazing. The price at $174 tax included was acceptable. The location is IDEAL for downtown sightseeing -- a 2 minute walk to the symphony, 10 min. to the Art Institute, 20 min. to Union Station. So I have given them a 4/5 for failing on some counts, but they are still a classic and a legend, and you could do much worse. I should note that there are several good Hilton options just north of this location and within close proximity to one another.

Reviews.Title: “Well-aged haunt in the ideal location”
Reviews.Author: latrell1
Reviews.Content: Some hotels play up their old-school charm and glory-filled past to mask the fact that they're old and grimy. The PHH does a great job of combining its past with useful touches of the presence to make it a surprisingly comfortable stay. The ground floors of this place are massive, but they're filled with useful shops for both the local resident and, germane to my interests, the traveler. The hotel has a full-size Starbucks and a UPS store in its lobby, each of which were useful. There's also a restaurant and a cavernous bar/lounge with plenty of couches and tables for meeting people. The decor is elegant and befitting of a more expensive hotel, and the enormous elevator bank gets you up to your room really quickly. The common area looks classy and actually backs it up. The rooms themselves are a little small, but functional. The king bed in my room was very comfortable and the wi-fi worked, but the bathroom was tiny and the shower had questionable water pressure/temperature. After all that, though, the best thing about the hotel is its location. It's one block away from the red line of the El and two blocks away from the blue line, which is a direct route to the airport. You can get off your flight and be in your room at the hotel an hour later for a single fare, which is quite nice. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Palmer House, Chicago/GO!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn P
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House in downtown Chicago is an institution.It was built old style with boutiques on the ground floor and a grand entrance to the main floor and lobby.The 4 entrances were manned by courteous and helpful doormen,but enter through the main entrance on East Monroe so you can be amazed by some fantastic brass work on the old elevator. The lift is not in operation but is worth ogling for its craftwork.Go upstairs to the main floor and sit at the bar and watch the world go by. The ceiling has some beautifully restored artwork that appears to be murals but are actually canvas paintings with mural work between. It is museum quality. The tile floor is worth admiration as well.Gorgeous! A tidbit of history is that many of the rooms here were used to house the armed forces during WW2.I don't know if the rooms had the great beds that they have now, but I wouldn't doubt it. Comfort and service reign supreme at the Palmer House. The Chicago museum is within walking distance and has some of the most classic pieces of Impressionist art.Everything worth seeing is close at hand at this great location.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Stepsite
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel over 30 times over the last 5 years and it is very reliable. The rooms are clean, albeit some are very small with very unusual bathroom configurations, but I guess that since I stay at corporate rates, I tend to get the smaller rooms. The hotel floors are gigantic and you can sometimes feel like you walk a mile to get to your room, but it is fairly priced and a minor inconvenience. The rooms are fully-equiped (iron, hair dryer, etc) and I can only remember one time when something didn't work. The lobby is to die for and is a glorious place. No matter how many times you stay here, look up at the ceiling and you will be wowed yet once again. The location is great, right in the heart of everything. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: ashley627
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House Hilton for four nights while in Chicago for a conference. The public spaces are beautiful, and the service is top-notch. I was so impressed with how the staff handled the check-in process, room service, valet parking, etc. My only complaint about the hotel was that my room was much smaller than I expected and a bit run-down. The desk lamp and one of the phones did not work, and the bathroom had not been thoroughly cleaned. Had the hotel not been booked solid for the conference, I would have transferred to a different room. Bottom line: This wouldn't be my first choice for a Chicago hotel, but I would stay here again if it seemed convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: micherry
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully kept older hotel. Like the kind you see in old movies. They treat you wonderful, and the bed was the best one I have ever slept in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DragonLady13
Reviews.Content: Just a couple of blocks from the Blue Line (to O'Hare) and the Red Line is right outside - they even include the directions on the website. Super convenient downtown location in a fairly recently restored classic building. Gorgeous lobby and ballroom. The Executive Floor Lounge is a little odd because it's not in a room, but in the elevator lobby on the executive floor. I prefer this property over the Chicago Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel & Dimed by Faux Luxe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: poetinny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a conference. We were given an accessible room with a "roll-in shower" without a divider between shower & floor -- we soon learned this meant a giant puddle in the middle of the bathroom floor that didn't dry the entire day. This room would be better used for someone with actual need for accessible accommodations. The room was small and dark, with a dismal view of an alley. But all this isn't unexpected for a city hotel; what really rankled were the outrageous charges for every single amenity that by all rights should be included in a luxury hotel. Internet access was $15/day (!! is this 1991?), the daily use of gym cost the same amount (!!!), and I was charged a $5 handling fee for a package I received at the hotel -- which wasn't even delivered to my room; I had to actually walk over to shipping to pay for the privilege of being handed my package. It's truly disappointing that a landmark hotel should so gracelessly charge for basic amenities. The hotel showed signs of past splendor, but is now just a fancily wallpapered cash cow. Staying at a modest Holiday Inn Express, with free internet, gym and breakfast, would have been better. Shame on you, Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but in a good location”
Reviews.Author: sharonsoon
Reviews.Content: It would suit you if you liked "classic" hotels with ancient architecture and all. It is slightly overpriced, but in a good location for shopping. Macy's is just at the doorstep, and many good restaurants are also within walking distance. Try Weber's Grill while you're there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: AnikaC
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 nights at The Palmer House Hilton and had a terrific experience. Although it was packed full for the AWP conference, the staff could not have been more courteous and helpful. I was fortunate enough to to receive an upgrade to the executive level and wow! what a treat! Breakfast and evening snacks were very good. But what made the experience even better was Ernest who worked the breakfast shift. He was everywhere with a smile and an exceptional professional attitude towards customer service. The hotel itself is historic and lovely and very well-maintained. I am not typically a fan of large downtown conventions hotels but I plan to return to The Palmer House on my next visit to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: greeneyedpirate
Reviews.Content: A bit on the older side but still a great find. In a central location in The Loop right by The Art Institute as well as Millennium Park. The lobby is really quite beautiful and worth a visit even if this isn't where you're staying! I wish that the internet access was included with the rooms and that the water pressure was a bit stronger, but overall my stay was very satisfactory. If only our room was as easy to find within the hotel as the hotel itself was to find in the city!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel that could be a great one”
Reviews.Author: EnglishViv
Reviews.Content: Plus points first: excellent location. You can get around the city so easily on the various metro lines that are within minutes of the hotel. Minutes from the park and the Art Institute. The recent renovations have produced an historic hotel that looks very modern. The room I was allocated wasn't too small, as many historic hotel bedrooms can be. The new soft furnishings and decoration were very effective. The air conditioning efficient and unobtrusive. One of the concierges was outstanding - Diane? - everything a concierge should be. They're lucky to have her. Sadly, the three other concierges I came into contact with during my four night stay were useless. More interested in talking to each other about their families than helping me book a city tour. One young man was positively rude. Why work as a hotel concierge if you don't like the public? The breakfast service at the Lockwood Restaurant was also very poor. One of the managers was rude and dismissive when I asked for another table to the one she showed me to. I prefer not to be close to the restaurant entrance. The restaurant was virtually empty. I got a grumpy face and a surly 'what entrance?' I also like a light breakfast so on two occasions I ordered eggs and toast from the sides menu, plus coffee and juice. On each occasion I got aggressive 'you want bacon with that?' no. 'you want potatoes with that?' no. And then both questions repeated. On two different days. Are they on commission if they sell bacon and potatoes or did they just want a bigger tip on percentage terms? Who knows. But the impression was one of aggression and made for a tense atmospherere. No one wants to do tense for breakfast. Also, as a restaurant principally designed for dinner and perhaps lunch, it was a very dark space. So after two breakfast attempts, I gave up and started the day outside the hotel. This really is a beautiful hotel in a wonderful location with excellent amenities. Some intensive staff training and better monitoring of quality of service could really make it a great, not just a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They make you feel special”
Reviews.Author: Nancy B
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House in Chicago is one of the finiest hotels that I have stayed at. Even though it feels like you are walking into the elegance of the past. With its beautiful ceiling painting, dark wood, high back chairs, you still feel very comfortable. The staff no matter who or what their job is, you are treated with great care and kindness. I so highly recommand this hotel 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: gogreenspartans
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through that "name your own price" website. I had wanted a 4 star hotel and this is more like a 3 1/2 star. Not the luxury I expected. I'm sure because of the way we booked our room we were not given one of the best rooms intentionally. Those are probably reserved for Hilton Rewards members and those paying top dollar, which I guess I can understand on a night the hotel is booked, but I don't believe it was the 2 nights we were there. Our room on the 12th floor had a glorious view of a brick wall. But at least we didn't have any street noise or noise from the train other reviewers have complained about. Although the room was a reasonable size, had a flat screen TV, updated decor and had a walk in closest (never had I seen this before in a hotel), the bathroom was so tiny. Like uncomfortably tiny where you are bumping into the toilet while trying to brush your teeth, etc. Not to mention, since this hotel is old there were issues with the water pressure and the hot water remaining a consistent temperature while you were in the shower. These are not issues I would have expected to have to deal with from a 4 star hotel. There was no minibar in our room or coffee maker, but since there was a Starbucks downstairs I would have gone down there anyway. Although I appreciate the close and convenient proximity of the self-park, it was some of the most expensive parking I found in all of Chicago; $44 self-park and $62 to valet per night. They were not that forthcoming at check-in about the location of the self-park garage (even though it ended up being right across the street) because they were pushing you to valet. I would strongly suggest to anyone that they bite the bullet and just self-park to save yourself some money, because it was not a hassle at all. There was really nothing outstanding about this hotel that would bring me back. Yes, the lobby is beautiful and I would recommend to anyone going and checking it out, even if you do not end up staying at this hotel. We had several drinks in the lobby bar and rather enjoyed the ambiance the lobby provided. But this alone would not be enough reason for me to recommend this hotel. To someone that is not used to staying in nicer hotels, this would probably be fine. But like I said, I just expected more. Better customer service, better amenities, a better room and just a better overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Lobby”
Reviews.Author: jennypenny1234
Reviews.Content: We adored our experience at the Palmer House. It's central, the staff are lovely and the beds so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “It was stunning”
Reviews.Author: dorothea m
Reviews.Content: From the lobby when we walked in I was overwhelmed by the beauty of this hotel. Stunning, jaw dropping beautiful. we had an executive level room. 2 bed & 2 bath with everything we could ask for. the beds were full, fluffy like a pillow bed should be. Slept great! the sound of the train was low and actually worked as a white noise, enough to let my 7yr old sleep all night & morning. The food was amazing, the staff accommidating, & pleasant, The pool was warm, the hot tub even hotter. We rarely left the large room except for walks around this grand hotel. Breakfast & hor d"ourves for us every day for free. The negatives: Our view was lacking, next time I'll request the corner room. Our only disappointment was housekeeping. Hard to catch them & took 2 days to turn our sheets, had to ask for towels, & they forgot to clean the 2nd bathroom. Otherwise, I'll never go anywhere else. Wish you had a book so I could just look at the pictures and remember my wonderful time. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Kay M
Reviews.Content: The location is great, many other things were not. Topping the list is the loud banging pipes (steam?) that really prevented us from getting a good night's sleep, and isn't that the main goal in a hotel? It took days for them, and several requests, to get the feather pillows and comforters out of the room. We received down-free pillows the first night, but the feather ones weren't removed and the maids kept putting them back on the bed. We would have to go through them ever day to find the down-free ones. The room safe never worked. We complained the first day, it was not fixed and we heard nothing. Their comment that we could go to the front desk and use theirs would not have been convenient because there was almost always a line of 4-8 people, and the time it would have taken to drop off and pick up our items would have taken 20-30 each day. After paying for internet, having read the agreement, we found out that it is per device, not room. It is not stated anywhere that we could find, even after speaking to internet customer service . As we were here for business, several devices were needed, very deceptive! The only place to sit was one desk chair. There seemed to be room for a more comfortable chair, it would have been nice. Definitely not worth our time or money.

Reviews.Title: “Corner Room”
Reviews.Author: Barbaralee45251
Reviews.Content: I used to travel extensively for business and when in Chicago my preferred hotel was the Palmer House Hilton. Gorgeous rooms, great location. I walked all over Chicago from this hotel. Request a corner room - larger, more windows, more light. I'm working on getting my husband to Chicago for a long weekend and plan on staying at the Palmer House Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic as always!”
Reviews.Author: tjv6
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend at the Palmer House. Once again, from Rasha and the rest of the crew at the Front Desk, to Ernest up at the Executive Lounge, our time was superb. Kudos to the Palmer House as they consistently exceed our expectations. We have been going about 6 times a year for the last 8 years and have always had a wonderful time. Clean rooms, great food, fantastic service and a great location. In my book, can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jana S
Reviews.Content: The lobby was under slight construction, but was still beautiful. Staff seemed generally pleasant. The room was much smaller than we anticipated, but the bed was extremely comfortable. The room was very clean (although perhaps 10 years outdated). It was great having a Starbucks on site, this made my morning. :) Beware if you drink at the hotel bar... I ordered two standard shots and two domestic beers and the tab came to $46. (ouch.) Shopping was right around the corner, and we were able to walk to millennium park and the art museum. Overall a great stay, would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwstonesifer
Reviews.Content: To be clear, I'm a Hilton Diamond member and travel to a lot of Hilton properties throughout the world. I have a soft spot for this place, it have wonderful ambience and great historical beautiful that you find in only a few hotels in the world. The lobby is breathtaking. However, there are a few aspects of the hotel where it truly shows its age. The rooms aren't that big, bathrooms smaller yet for example. Internet can be spotty and the TV was out this morning in my room as well. Overall I like this place, it has tons of charm but there are better Hilton family options in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Hotel Can Use Some Updates”
Reviews.Author: EventPlanner_7186700
Reviews.Content: The room I was in was a nice size. Very difficult to navigate the numbering system to the floors but as a compromise there are pictures of very famous entertainers all along the hallyways so you can remember "turn right at Nat King Cole".. or something similar. The room I was in had been upgraded at some point because it had granite in the bathroom and a newer bowl shaped sink. But the age of the hotel still shows through in the tiling in the bathroom. Also I had wallpaper peeling in my room and the part of the showerhead that attaches to the wall was hanging off. Not appreciated for this level of hotel and the rates it commands. I didn't have a view, just some part of the rooftop. Kept the curtains drawn. However I did not have a view of the train tracks, which I heard several complaints about. The tracks are very close to the hotel. This is not the hotel's fault but if you are on that side of the hotel it may disturb you. Seems they run more frequently during the day but it's something worth checking out. For sure if you are on that side of the hotel request a high floor so you are not literally next to the train. There is no shelf space in the bathroom if that is important to you. The sink takes up most of the counter and there is no additional shelving. There is a small glass shelf about the size of a couple of postcards on the wall but that was very loose and unstable in the room I was in. The bathroom door would not remain open so I propped it open with an ottoman and put a towel on top of that and used it for additional space to lay items. In room dining was fast and very nice; usual hotel pricing. About $22 for a full breakfast of meat, potatoes, eggs, juice, tea and toast, including tax and mandatory service charge. I found the service to always be top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall but annoying extra charges and few amenities in standard room”
Reviews.Author: biophiliac
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is a very nice hotel, perfectly located for the Loop and Art Institute of Chicago (or walks along the lake and Grant Park). The people on the staff are extremely helpful and pleasant. It's an older hotel, and the standard rooms are nothing special (although certainly pleasant enough). You can control your own thermostat, the beds are comfortable, and you get the things you expect in the bathroom. The TV in my room was large but "old style." I was surprised that there was no refrigerator or coffee maker, but you can ask and get a coffee maker for free. (Well, they said they usually charge but wouldn't.) The "extra charges thing" is a bit annoying. Internet works fine, but they charge for it. (They were having some problem collecting charges, so they gave me 3 free days--probably because they weren't able to figure out who was logging on). The gym cost extra. I guess these things are typical of more expensive hotels, but I don't know if customers should just accept this since cheap motels usually provide free internet and a coffee maker and often even some recreation space. The walls were a bit thin, and I could hear when the next room turned on the water (but I didn't hear noise...maybe they were just quiet or else the walls did insulate sound). Overall, I enjoyed staying there. The Loop may not be the preferred place to stay for many people (restaurant scene in the Loop was disappointing...best places are elsewhere), but if you do want that area, it's perfectly located.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet expectations of a 4-star”
Reviews.Author: Mekha
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Palmer House, and although the lobby is beautiful, our room and experience did not match up. King room on 9th floor was tiny, but I suppose that is to be expected at a historic hotel. We had a view of a partition wall between other buildings, and room positioned next to an elevator shaft so we heard elevator noise for much of the time we were there. Tried calling the front desk four times to inquire about changing rooms, but there was no answer so we gave up and didn't feel like slugging all the way down to the busy and crowded front desk. Other reviews indicated there are better rooms, so not sure if we got a poor location due to the fact that we paid the hotwire rate, because the hotel was full, or just bad luck. On the plus side, the bed was super comfortable, room was clean, and the location very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great, except for the paper-thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Senefeld
Reviews.Content: Very close to all the subway lines, millennium park, and the art institute. Staff was provided ideal service. Only downside was that we could hear everything going on in the nearby rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Class grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: tom1memphis
Reviews.Content: The service and the ambiance were everything you would expect from a landmark hotel. I was there for a conference and will go out of my way to attend the next conference in my area that is scheduled there.

Reviews.Title: “You don't get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: dtsohio
Reviews.Content: Fantastic entry-way/lounge, but unfortunately, that is the best part of the hotel. Checked in and was told I was being upgraded (and paid for it). Room was just as small as others, with a bonus of a mildew smell in the carpet. I could have changed rooms if I wanted to pay more.....? You read that right. Not what I would expect from a hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff; Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dogfire
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton clearly has a lot of history. It's also in a great location: a very short walk from the Adams/Wabash and the Madison/Wabash train stops, a biscuit toss from the Art Institute and Millenium Park, and surrounded by many good dining options. The hotel itself is attractive and is staffed by very pleasant, competent people. My room was high enough (the 16th floor) and well enough sound-proofed that I could barely hear the L train, though the train went by below my window. My disappointments with my room were minor. First, there was no in-room coffee maker. That made the mornings harder than I would have liked. Second, the wallpaper, carpet, and bathroom fixtures were showing their age a bit. The leaky faucet wasn't audible with the bathroom door closed, but I would have preferred that it not drip. And, as at other large downtown hotels, I had to pay extra for wifi in my room. I hate that. Still, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the room was quiet, so I slept very well there. I was at the Palmer House for a conference and I found the conference facilities fine. The rooms in which our sessions were held were not all beautiful, but they were all adequate and *some* were indeed beautiful. There are few windows in the conference rooms, and I found the absence of natural light a little depressing. Not much to be done about that, though. The business center was frustrating. I ultimately gave up on using the printer because it appeared to require the use of a code, but I couldn't tell what I was supposed to use as the code (my room number didn't work, and there were no codes posted anywhere).

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Auto Show weekend”
Reviews.Author: Markt1120
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is elegant and priced nicely, but best of all, perfect location. When we break up Winter with a Chicago weekend, and include the auto show, like this year, we also took in a musical show, the Art Institute, and a Sunday morning run from Millenium Park to the end of Northerly Island. All these within a couple blocks of the Palmer House. Nice late night desserts too!

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby and location”
Reviews.Author: jonezy
Reviews.Content: Very elegant lobby and well restored. Our rooms have been very spacious but due to the age of this hotel there are many different sized rooms, so your experience might vary. Found he staff to be very professional (except one bartender who was a bit surly, but he was the exception not the norm.) In this Hotel its almost better to be on floor 12 or lower as there are banks of elevators going to different levels (i.e. 1-12, 13-20), and we found that the top floors have slow elevator service and can also be very crowded during peak hours (checkin-out). Out last visit we were on the 12th floor and we never had any problems with the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old hotel, but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: SRTravel07
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for business in late January. I was in a bigger room this time (it looked like they joined 2 rooms, as I had 2 closets), but the elevators were very slow at times. The hotel is very good for conferences, and there were several dining options within walking distance, which helped after long meetings during the day. Overall, a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room Experience”
Reviews.Author: MadridClydo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 11-270, and was disappointed. My room was very close to the L train and I heard it all evening and in the morning. Luckily, I slept with my iPod in. I would have expected better sound proofing. Definitely ask for a room that does not face the train. The room itself was nice, as was the TV and internet access. The other amenities in the hotel were very nice. Appreciated having a Starbucks and shoe shine stand on the lower floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Historic Hotel Charm; Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: RazorTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 14th floor for three nights in February 2011; the room was a "regular king" but was very spacious with lots of open room even though the room included a king bed, desk, two end tables, and a chair with ottoman. The bathroom was tight- definitely only room for one person and not much room for toiletries on the counter. Staff at the hotel were very helpful and professional. The location is great- located less than one block from a stop for the "L". The hotel is located conveniently to several shops and restaurants with easy access to Millenium Park and Michigan Avenue. The hotel was clean, and I would definitely return for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and good service”
Reviews.Author: Rippe39
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here on business. The room in the 20th floor was huge compared to typical European hotel rooms. Breakfast was not included in the price, so I took the Hilton buffet breakfast (USD 20) every morning. In this option you can also order omelette, pancakes, etc. separately, but all waiters did not remember to tell that. The buffet was very good. The swimming pool is too small and warm for serious swimming, but nice for just relaxing. I did not find any change room, so I had to change the swimsuit in the separate toilet/shower room. The location is great, and the hotel is very beautiful, especially the famous lobby. There was a large meeting at the hotel, and during the meeting the elevators were really slow: in some cases I had to wait 5-10 minutes to get one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in the heart of Chicago- Old-Time Chicago Experience”
Reviews.Author: willma1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Palmer House (a Hilton property) over a long week in February. The classic hotel was the perfect spot to see the sights of downtown Chicago. The historic hotel has been beautifully restored. The lobby is amazing and worth a visit by itself. Our stay was on the Executive Floor and all the amenities expected were there. The Executive Lounge provided a bountiful breakfast buffet. Snacks and beverages were avaiable throughout the day with a "cocktail hour appetizer buffet" from 5:00 to 7:00. The rooms though a little small, were very comfortable and fit the historic decor of the hotel. Service was excellent! The location is ideal for exploring the Loop area and is two blocks from Michigan Ave and the Art Institute. There are restaurants within the hotel and within easy walking distant. Two nearby recommened restaurants are Miller's Pub and Berghoff both serve hearty meals in a beer house/pub atmosphere. Although a little pricey, I highly recommend staying at the Palmer House for a truely old-time Chicago experience.

Reviews.Title: “All the details wrong”
Reviews.Author: TravelhoundPortland
Reviews.Content: A grand old building with a very impressive lobby area, unfortunately, this hotel lacked all the details. Where to start? As expected with an older hotel, rooms were sometimes of a funky layout with cramped bathrooms. That much I understand. But why would you put the only shelf in the bath above the toilet (don't drop anything!) or put the toilet paper holder at a position right where your knee would hit when "sitting on the throne" thus requiring one to sit at a 45 degree angle on the toilet? Water pressure stunk. Want to work in for dinner and order room service? The room service menu for dinner is ridiculous. A few sandwiches and pizzas. Hallway floors were seldom clean. I would see food that had fallen off of plates on the floor in the morning then would still be there in the late afternoon when I returned. Oh yeah -- they charge you $10 to use the gym (which is okay but no great shakes).

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel. Easy to get where you want to be.”
Reviews.Author: PhilipL4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my son's auditions. It is a beautiful classic hotel. Old hotels can have small rooms, but I was pleasantly surprised at ours. The lobby is amazing. The hotel is VERY big and hosts a lot of groups/conferences. But you don't notice it much. Read the traveler tips. State street side can be noisy from the L trains. Middle and other sides are fine. Being that close to the loop trains and the red line on the other side makes it easy to get all around town without as much walking or cabs. You can buy passes at the CVS on the corner (either corner!)

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Choice”
Reviews.Author: whoknows987
Reviews.Content: As you probably know, the Palmer House is a large, very old, historic hotel and it has all of the character you would expect from such a hotel along with a few quirks. It is well run, has fine furnishings, and has a general feeling of quality. The Palmer House is a reliable choice. I have never had a really bad experience there. Additionally, it is centrally located in the vibrant Chicago downtown. Access is good as several main rail lines have stations within a block or so. You can get to it from Oâ€™Hare airport (Blue Line) or Midway airport (Orange Line) without changing trains. The Palmer House is a very popular hotel for big conferences. I have stayed there probably 10 or so times over the past 35 years and every time it was for a conference I was attending. If you stay there, chances are there will be a major conference going on. Not necessarily bad but something to keep in mind. The hotel elevators are a problem at times especially during meeting change times at conferences. Even if you are not part of the conference, you will still be affected. Five to ten minute waits for elevators are not terribly uncommon. The Palmer House does have many stairways and stairwells spread throughout the building. Unlike many hotels, most of the stairwells open onto all floors and there are signs on the doors that tell which floors they access. Thus, it is very easy to use the stairs to go from floor to floor and, if you are only changing several floors, the stairs are often a good option. However, sometimes stair doors open into unusual places. During my last visit, twice I came off of the stairs right into a meeting room. The guest room elevators are divided into three banks: floor 12 and lower, floors 13-17, and floor 18 and higher. You can decrease the impact of the elevator problems by asking for a room on floors 13-17. Then, when you are going up, take whichever elevator comes first. If it is not the right bank, get off at 12 or 18 and then take the stairs to your floor. There are also escalators that cover the four or five lowest floors. They are usually a much better choice than the elevator. Or, use a combination of the escalators and stairs. The hotel layout is confusing and is much like being in a multi-floor maze, especially the meeting room floors up to floor seven. It is really easy to get confused. Fortunately, the hotel has excellent signage and you can easily find most rooms, whether meeting room or guest room, simply by following the signs. There appears to be no standard guest room layout in the Palmer House and you will see a variety of room arrangements. I think all of the rooms are reasonably well furnished. If you do not like your room for some reason, ask to move. The front desk seems to make every effort to accommodate such requests. A colleague ended up in a room with loud banging, evidently from pipes banging in the steam heating system. A room change request was cheerfully provided. My room was very nice and reasonably spacious. However, the bathroom, while nicely furnished, was extremely small. There was just barely room to get inside the bathroom and close the door, and I am not particularly large. I heard other guests make the same complaint. Not a problem for me but it would have been impossible for two people to be in the bathroom at the same time. Many of the meeting rooms have wifi access. However, I found it almost useless much of the time as it was terribly slow. The wifi in my guest room was pretty good and only occasionally bogged down. The front desk was efficient and the staff was friendly and helpful, as was all staff throughout the hotel. Pricewise, the Palmer House is no bargain but what do you expect for downtown Chicago? While I have focused on some of the negative aspects of the hotel, all-in-all, it is a pretty reliable choice if you have reason to stay in downtown C

Reviews.Title: “Stunning entry, solid room”
Reviews.Author: Compassrosa
Reviews.Content: The lobby is phenominal! I won't lie, we chose this hotel for the lobby. You can feel the history of the building when you enter and I just loved it. We even splurged on the overpriced lobby drinks just to sit and enjoy the painted ceiling (and the people-watching). The room was nice enough. It was a smaller room, but the fireplace was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but a little off.”
Reviews.Author: Mikebrez
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the oldest, most historic in chicago. The hotel itself is very aw striking. the rooms were remodeled{good thing} but, they were done super modern which does not match the hotel. the standards rooms are a shoe box and the front desk service is very lacking. helps to be a diamond member where your treated like very well. but other people its a wringer.

Reviews.Title: “The tiny room”
Reviews.Author: j3ffyang
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located downtown Chicago, and has the most fancy lobby. Must- see :-) The streets around is very beautiful. Breakfast is pretty good and a lot of choices. Service staff is friendly and professional. The room is so tiny and giving me a surprise. And it's just beside elevator and I couldn't fall sleep as it's so noisy. I was told the internet @ lobby is complimentary but still questions me passcode. Gave up. 2 days @ Chicago is short.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great service & accommodations”
Reviews.Author: AnnaR517
Reviews.Content: We took the train into Chicago for the weekend and stayed here for the first time after it was recommended by a co-worker. There was a huge convention going on there, but still felt like I had above average service from most the staff there. I didn't have any problems with noise or anything else for that matter. The one thing that was a small downer was that since the hotel was so busy and there are certain elevators that go to certain floors, it was a longer wait to get a ride up or downstairs. The location was great. Short walk to Grant Park and the "bean" or the outdoor skating (in season). Easy to catch the bus down to Shedd or the Field Museum. It was cold walk up to Magnificent Mile shopping and to the Amtrak station, but wouldn't be bad in any other season. A few good options for dining around the hotel (and within the hotel), but most of the well known restaurants are up north of the river. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: sunnid94
Reviews.Content: I am frequently in Chicago and rarely stay downtown but chose to do so because I caught the train and everything I planed to do was in the vicinity of downtown. The location of the hotel was perfect. A friend was able to catch the Metra from the airport almost to the front door of the hotel! The front desk staff were helpful when needed, nothing spectacular. they are very encouraging of explorers. We roamed around the hotel and were offered tours or tid bits of information from helpful employees. We had drinks and appetizers in the lobby, great for people watching and amiance. Our only real complaint was that the walla of the hotel were so thin I felt we needed to whisper in our room so that everyone didn't hear our conversation like we couldhear theirs! Walking down the hall I could bits of everything happening in each room we passed. It's also easy to get lost because it seems like each hallway has a sub hallway but the pictures on the walls are so interesting I didnt mind being lost!

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Dame of Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Chris K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend of January 27 here for SoxFest. Although the rooms are a little small (but typical for a city hotel) they are very comfortable. The staff is wonderful, and the convention facilities are superb.

Reviews.Title: “Classic with great location”
Reviews.Author: 01dFo1ks
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite small and the hotel is older, but reasonably well renovated. The beds are very comfortable. The executive floor has a very good continental breakfast and snacks throughout the day. The wireless internet worked well. The hotel is close to great shopping and restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to the theatre district”
Reviews.Author: dkuchs
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Drake for the past few years after having stayed here a few years ago with disappointment at the noise and room size. I returned with my sister for the weekend and we were pleased overall. As some have commented, the wait for the elevators is a problem. We were lucky as we were upgraded to the executive level and so had use of an express elevator. A couple times though we took the regular ones and the wait was very, very long. The hotel was quite busy this weekend for Sox Fest which could explain the long waits. All staff we encountered - at the bar, restaurant, front desk and even housekeeping were so nice and friendly. Even the doormen were exceptionally nice. As others have stated, the rooms are a "bit" small but not tiny by any means. We had no noise issues this trip whatsoever and that might be because we were on the executive level. It's not the most convenient for shopping, but taxis are frequent, prevalent and inexpensive so really no issue at all. I thought the price was very reasonable at $130 per night for downtown Chicago. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All the Glitz But None of the Glory”
Reviews.Author: MrFoster
Reviews.Content: This has one of the most beautiful entryways and lobbies I have ever seen. Unfortunately, you do not get to sleep in the lobby. The accomodations are the smallest tiniest rooms I have ever stayed in that did not have wheels on the bottom. The closet door will only open part way because it hits the bed. The bathroom has no shelf space to place your toiletries. There is only one chair in the room, and not really much space for that. Yikes! - were people really tiny in the 1930s when this place was built? The staff is cordial and polite. The place is kept clean and tidy. The elevators are extremely slow. Admittedly, the hotel was fully booked on the nights of my stay, but my wait time to get an elevator averaged 17 minutes, and the longest wait was more than 25 minutes. Here is the problem: the room rates are outrageously high for the size of the rooms and the general accomodations. Unless you derive great pleasure from looking at neo-classical art and art-nuevo architecture, you do not get a decent value here.

Reviews.Title: “Smart and crisp with history”
Reviews.Author: CMKNY
Reviews.Content: Palmer House is the perennial city classic with history details and warmth. Service is excellent, the rooms are clean and the food is good. For any history buffs, perfect selection and for anyone who just wants top notch with great service, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Roach in Bathtub!!”
Reviews.Author: Gayle P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are native Chicagoans so we had been so proud to have the legendary Palmer House in our city. We decided to splurge on a 2 day staycation at this 5 star hotel. The location, common areas and lobby lived up to it's reputation however our room was nothing short of pathetic! Old faded carpet, "gray" bedding (which should have been white), peeling wallpaper and broken wood split doors met us. We had an archaic big tv ( no flat screen) in a large cabinet that was full of dust and horrific. Don't do the overpriced breakfast buffet. For $51 for 2 people you can get a better selection at Denny's. The restaurant staff was quite pleasant though. This was so close to a continental breakfast it was shocking. Directly across the hall from our room was a LAUNDRY supply room. It was full of unkempt debris and soiled linens that had the door open ALL day until we called the front desk to ask that someone come up and secure the room and lock the door. Not wanting to take the time and hassle from our day to request a room change, we toughed it out until the next day when we saw a roach in the bath tub. After calling the front desk we were NEVER even given an apology or another option. We requested the manager, Fay..e and her response was apathetic and unprofessional. She seemed bored by the whole account. I am an experienced world traveler and this was one of my most unpleasant stays. This was a 1 star stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location, good service”
Reviews.Author: DiFranco11
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly old-fashioned decor. Friendly and competent service. Room was large and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Palmer House Hilton is a reliable option”
Reviews.Author: jskielb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Palmer House Hilton in Chicago multiple times and appreciate it's reliability--large rooms by big city standards, lovely grand old lobby, perks for Hilton diamond card holders, and close proximity to the Chicago Art Museum (which is in easy walking distance), lots of shopping, and other sites. Recommended, particularly at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Stranded in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Amaretto641
Reviews.Content: Unexpectedly I did end up in Chicago- with no Hotel-. I went to the O'Hare Airport Hilton, because I wanted to stay at the Palmer House Hilton- Downtown.. Unfortunately the Airport Hilton was not cooperative at all. And since I did not have any Internet access I arranged a reservation of "my place' over a relative who was far afield. Complicated enough - right?? How much was I taken by surprise that the Palmer House was just the place for a stranded soul. I got a room at the "Executive level"- Breakfast- food and liquid, as well as internet..- 7/24. It was the absolute right place to stay during foggy- raining and windy January days which you have to spend in Chicago. The next time I will end up in Chicago I certainly will know where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Did we stay at the same hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Sharon O
Reviews.Content: After reading the latest reviews of the hotel, I wondered if we visited the same hotel as mentioned in the reviews. We stayed four nights the middle of January to celebrate our 46th wedding anniversary. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful and upgraded us without knowing about our anniversary to a king size suite with two full baths. It was lovely and very large with a dining room table for six and wet bar. The hotel even sent us a bottle of wine as a complimentary gift soon after our arrival. The employees at the concierge desk were very helpful each time we approached one of them. We thoroughly enjoyed our fifth visit to the Palmer House. Also we found it was very easy to get around the city either by bus or train as stops were located near the hotel. We were able to take the train back to Midway for $5.00 for both of us. It was a one minute walk to the train and then an easy half-hour ride to the airport with no change of train. We had paid $35.00 (with tip) for a cab ride from the airport on arrival at the hotel because we did not know about the train. We would highly recommend the Palmer House to anyone staying in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Palmer House still a Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Othello36
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palmer House Hilton for business and pleasure. And if I had my choice for any hotel in Chicago this is my pick. . . .If you are looking for a new, steel look and feel of a hotel, don't come here. However, if you are looking for charm, old world class, beautiful lobby and a step back to an era gone by, DO stay here. Note: there are two sections to this hotel, the older part has larger rooms with some vintage furniture and charm. When making a reservation if that appeals to you ask for it. Then make time to sit in the lobby, have afternoon tea (if they still serve it?) and watch the world go by. It is a great place to meet friends, relax after a day of running around Chicago or just look at the grand architecture. Imagine what it would be like to live in early 1900's and stay at this beautiful hotel! It is in the loop within walking distant to the Art Institute, many theatres, shopping and a taxi ride away from almost everything else you might want to do. I have never had any problems with the staff - as I have read in other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't find its grandeur 'faded'”
Reviews.Author: Paddingtontraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. I'm not sure if it was because of the special conference rate but it was exceptional value. I was a bit worried about other people's comments about 'faded grandeur' etc. but my room was in excellent condition (as were all the public rooms). The staff were generally friendly and helpful. The location is, as other people have noted, excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: blessedbunch5
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in downtown Chicago and my husband booked this weekend for "fun" to relax. The Palmer House sounded nostalgic and elegant. We looked forward to this "reward" stay through the Hilton honors program as my husband achieved Diamond status this year from frequent travel. We looked forward to the perk of the executive lounge and the on-site Balance Spa. Upon arrival, we pulled into the self-park (entrance located on Wabash) under the hotel and were directed to a spot...but then the attendant disappeared. The signage to the hotel elevator/entrance was not very good in the structure. It seemed a little confusing. Next, at the check-in desk, the staff was business-like but no warm greetings or smiles. Anticipating a room upgrade, we were slightly disappointed in our 1st room on the 15th floor. Although told it was recently renovated, the ceilings in the hallway were noticeably low and the room was TINY. When my husband, who is on the taller side, asked for a different room, we were given a corner room on the 9th floor (Wabash St. side of the building). Let me say the room was beautiful and huge BUT it was right next to the train...which was downright loud when you are only a few stories away. Since our key would not work for the lounge access (they must have forgot), we had to go back to the check-in anyway..so I mentioned the loud train, and asked if there was any rooms available on the executive level. There were. I cannot help but wonder why we were not given the Diamond upgrade immediately when the hotel was not full capacity? Does Diamond status mean anything? Shouldn't Hilton brand loyalty be recognized? Anyway, the executive lounge added a little pampering to our weekend and we enjoyed the snacks. In fact, the only staff of Palmer House that seemed at all happy were there (excluding the bartender). Don't waste any $ on specialty drinks as they were very poor quality, very little alcohol and VERY expensive...stick with wine/beer. We found a very nice place on Wabash St. steps from the hotel called Miller's Pub that had Guinness on tap. Overall, the Palmer House delivered on atmosphere. The regal foyer was beautiful and the historic photographs and trivia in different places I found very interesting. I loved the Thomas Roth toiletries and the spa treatments were awesome. ( I had a massage and pedicure.) The fitness center was huge and well equipped but the pool area was disappointing. It seemed smaller than the photo and the hot tub looked ancient and had a ring around the water-line. Not very impressive for such a high-end hotel. In the end, we enjoyed our stay at the Palmer House but hope that this is not what to expect from Hilton (in terms of service/friendliness) in future stays.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed in service”
Reviews.Author: cubs28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Executive Suites and found the staff to be very helpful and pleasent. However, the rest of the staff were not so helpful and friendly. When we arrived we were given a ticket from the Valet to park our car. When we checked out and gave the valet our ticket to retreive our car, we were told that we had the wrong ticket and that he could not help us. He also accused us of not paying for the parking (which was clearly charged to our bill). He sent us to the basement to get our car. Another instance involved a question about the wireless service and was treated (by a man at the Hilton Honors desk) like we were idiots. We have stayed at the Palmer House many times and NEVER have we had been treated this poorly. It was clear that the only staff that made us feel welcomed was on the Executive Floors. How sad.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but grand hotel now faded”
Reviews.Author: GloriaAnchio
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton is an historic hotel. Its lobby area is spectacular. Some of the public rooms are truly beautiful. The location is great; e.g, in the business district, within walking distance of the Art Institute and Symphony Hall. Huge convention type hotels often have employees who are either pleasant but vacant/unknowledgeable or non-comprehending of even simple requests. In contrast, the Palmer House has excellent staff, all pleasant and responsive including the housekeepers, doormen, etc. The food is the standard Hilton fare (somewhat overpriced) but there is a Starbucks on the lower level, and right on the corner are places for breakfast and lunch. The rooms, however, are way below what one would expect from a standard business hotel of modest price. For instance, there were bedside tables on each side of the bed, but a lamp on only one side (so if two people were in the room, and the one by the lamp wanted to go to sleep earlier, the other would have to get into bed in the dark). THe desk chair could not be adjusted regarding height. There was not enough lighting in the room (partly because of what might have been high efficiency bulbs, but some gave off that harsh, greyish light). The closet was small and the door would not stay open and the ironing board hanging on the door kept banging everytime one moved the door. The bathroom was small but ok; however, it looked like it had not been redecorated in 20 years, had no makeup mirror, etc. If one is travelling alone and will not be in the room much, this hotel is acceptable. Finally, when I was there the ethernet connection for high speed internet would not work. I called the free number and they said there was a problem at the Palmer House. There was still a problem the next day. [The literature in the room said there was a "nominal fee" for this service. There was only the 24 hour option, at a charge of $19.95 which is not nominal.]

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: jabsChicago
Reviews.Content: After looking at reviews online, I called the Front Desk to request a renovated room away from Wabash Ave. due to the noise of the elevated train all night and a room with a view. There are no rooms with a view, but we did get a quiet renovated room that was spacious, with a chaise lounge and king size bed. Everything was very clean and the floor was very quiet. The bathroom was quite small but clean. The toilet paper rolls were in a very odd place and hard to reach. Other placement would be better. We had breakfast at the Lockwood Restaurant on the premises. Breakfast was good but not special. We stopped for a drink the night before at the Potter's Lounge and it was fine. It started off quiet but got a bit noisier when a sales group arrived. I was surprised that a newspaper was not delivered or at least next to the elevator for guests.

Reviews.Title: “A Classic”
Reviews.Author: macguire
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite and it was absolutely beautiful. Tastefully renovated, beautiful white leather chairs, very nice bedroom and bathrooms, and as this was a corner suite, huge living room with and lots of windows. Great service. Ate at one of the restaurants downstairs. Food as ok, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Building; Quiet, Tasteful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: PrefersWindowSeat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House Hilton for one night when my husband and I were in town and we had a wonderful stay. We arrived after midnight after a horrid series of delays at the airport and a late dinner and upon arriving were upgraded to a concierge level room. The rooms were dark and silent and we slept soundly in the comfortable beds. Some of the decor in the room was old fashioned, but I consider this a stylistic choice. It's warm and inviting and classic, and I find it easier to relax in this environment than in a sterile, angular room that feels like a cross between a museum of modern art and a hospital. The decor was warm and inviting and the lobby was like stepping into an old Hollywood movie. In the morning, we enjoyed the concierge lounge at a leisurely pace and slowed down for a cup of herbal tea before taking on the action-packed weekend. The Palmer House took good care of us, and I plan to stay there again when we return to Chicago in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: CeW587
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Palmer House for one night in early January this year. During the check in, the front desk lady asked me to show my confirmation letter of my reservation. I did not bring the confirmation with me because I had not been asked to present it in other places during check in.So she asked to print out one copy in their business center and bring the confirmation to the bell station to get the room key. I did what she told me and went to the bell station. However, people at the bell station was totally confused and none of them have the key. A bellman was nice enough to help me go ask their staff at the front desk. I finally got checked in after waiting at the lobby for about 15 minutes. As other people pointed out before, the room I got was small and old with a twin bed, and I could hear people next door using the bathroom. This was not a pleasant experience, even though I paid over 100 dollars to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Classic Hotel Gem in Central Chicago”
Reviews.Author: traveler06032
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton's location is perfect if you wish to explore the city on foot. It is close to shopping on Michigan Avenue, the fantastic Field Museum, and the Shedd Aquarium among other attractions. Our guestroom on the 23rd floor was immaculate and had all of the amenities of a grand hotel. The Peter Thomas Roth toiletries and lovely bed linens were exceptional. A substantial breakfast was available daily as well as afternoon snacks and early evening hot hors d'oeuvres. Our future choice in Chicago will be The Palmer House. You can not go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: carpetbagirl
Reviews.Content: Myself and 5 girlfriends came to the Palmer House for a birthday getaway weekend. We had such a fancy time. Everything was perfect and I couldn't speak higher of this hotel. I absolutely love and appreciate the old fashioned elegant grandeur and don't want them to ever change a thing. It is the very reason we picked the Palmer House. It has been beautifully maintained through the years and has an excellent standard of service. We were treated like royalty! We definitely recommend the executive floors because of the private lounge that provides drinks, hor'deurves, snacks, and breakfast and coffee. It was wonderful. Our room was perfect, beautifully decorated with 2 full size beds and a pull out sofa and sitting area. As well as 2 bathrooms which came in handy. Huge closets to put our stuff, and an in-room safe. Loved the large flat screen tv and dvd player. The bellhops and maids were also very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed Afternoon Tea at the Lockwood Restaurant shortly after checking in and highly recommend it. The receptionist at the restauraunt was very friendly and recognized me from speaking on the phone to make reservations. She made every effort to make it special for our birthdays. Looking forward to my next visit to the Palmer House Hotel. The quality and service is impeccable. As far as the spa goes I had to give them a poor rating because they just couldnt accomodate us. We wanted in-room services and they do not provide them, so we used a local spa instead, that came highly recommended, and they came to our room. We couldn't have been happier. Also it was difficult to book 6 girls around the same times for pedicures and massages. And lastly they closed so early and we needed evening appts. It wouldve been nice to have the pool open later than 9pm as well. We would've like to use it until midnight at least. Pizanos is a nearby pizza delivery and you have to meet them in the lobby but it was delicious pizza and they got there quick and are open until 5am!

Reviews.Title: “This was one of the nicest rooms that me and my wife have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Darrylogle
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with a lot of history. It is very centrally located. We were there during Christmas and it was so nice to be able to go to the room and go back out on the town when we were ready. I hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: spadesqueen74
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty ritzy hotel near Michigan Ave - downtown Chicago. It is south or the river (I usually prefer north of the river, but it works). Our room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. We traveled down over the Christmas holiday (nine of us total) four adults and five young children, ages 8-12. Kids enjoyed the pool, but I thought it left something to be desired. It's small and crowded and the hot tub was broken when we first arrived. it later re-opened and was fairly hot, so we made due. We especially enjoyed the common areas of this hotel. Played cards on the 7th floor where the pool is located while the kids swam nearby. Overall, it's a nice hotel and what you expect from a typical 4star location downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mengha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Palmer House for four nights last July and I thought it was great. We stayed in a twin room and were pretty surprised by the size of it. It was huge. The hotel lobby is fantastic, the most beautiful I have ever seen. The location is exellent. There was no breakfast in the hotel rate, and the breakfast in the hotel restaurant was rather expensive. But with a Starbucks at street level, that was no problem at all. I would like to stay at Palmer House again some time. As a matter of fact, I am going back to Chicago this fall. How ever, while we this summer travelled with a group with specially negotiated room rates, I find the room rates just too high for me this time.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and classy but with teeny tiny rooms and very limited in-room amenities”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld012
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the past for a work conference, so I decided to book a room again for a pleasure trip to Chicago because I received a special room rate offer through Amtrak. We stayed 4 nights. Our reservation said we had a room with a king bed, but upon checking in we were switched to a room that they said had a queen bed. Turns out the room we received had just a regular full size bed. Aside from the room being very small, there were very few in-room amenities (no coffee maker, refrigerator, free internet, limitedTV channels and other common hotel room extras). The bathroom was so small that I had to close the bathroom door in order to turn around in it. The hotel itself evokes a ritzy bygone era with an enormous lobby area with a 30 foot high mural painted ceiling.The bar and restaurant are very expensive and the food just so-so. The free wi-fi in the lobby area did not work very well, connection was intermittant and sometimes didn't work at all. The staff seems jaded and with sour/snooty dispositions. However, the location is VERY convenient to walk anywhere in the downtown loop and lakeshore.

Reviews.Title: “EASY TO GET TO FROM O'HARE”
Reviews.Author: KingOfTheValley
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a conference. It was easy to get to from O'hare. Just go to the CTA train station in O'Hare. Please bring exact change of $2.25 for ticket since the machines do not give change. Get a ticket and go on the blue route and get down at the Monroe station in downtown, walk three minutes and you are at the hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location and is really beauftiful!! Internet at this place is $14.95 a day which I do not understand. Why not provide free wifi especially in this connected age!!! This was the only downside... Hotel room was nice, nice comfy bed and nice bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Alicia R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palmer House the week after Christmas. It was beautiful! I have read other reviews saying that the rate was expensive. We had a very good rate that was inline (or a bit lower) than most Hilton properties of this class. The staff was helpful for the most part - the front desk check in woman was apparently clueless about how to manage the phone versus Hilton Diamond members standing in front of her - However, another check in gentleman picked up her slack and set things straight. Good location for staying if you plan to "play" in the city! Bed was actually comfortable and pillows were plump- Room was clean. Retro feel to rooms and hotel - It is THE Palmer house after all!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, overestimated and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: domingos_soares
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there for a week on a business trip two months ago. The lobby is wonderful as well as the location and that's it. The rest is completely overestimated. Most of the staff, with some exceptions, was not friendly and sometimes even rude. The food of the restaurant at the lobby is ok but overpriced. The room is small and old furnished and the TV has very few channels. The bathroom has no tube, was kind of dirty (but no bugs) and it was hard to adjust the temperature of the shower. The location is perfect - very close to the Art Institute and Millenium Park. The hotel offers no Wi-Fi Internet to its guests, not even at the sumptuous lobby (however, the restaurant does, if you buy something and ask kindly enough). I could give three stars to this hotel but as it's expensive and offers at most and average service I'll give it only two.

Reviews.Title: “A great start to our trip to the USA”
Reviews.Author: jandseaglesham
Reviews.Content: We are from England and had a special reason for staying at the Palmer House Hotel as our late (American) mother had worked there as a stenographer and receptionist in the 1930s. We were very happy with our stay there. The staff were efficient and friendly and the rooms were fine. The hotel may be rather old fashioned but, for us, that added to its charm and that's what we loved about it, particular the spectacular lobby. We'd be very happy to stay there again. I think our mother would have been delighted to see how well the hotel has survived the years.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: common-family
Reviews.Content: When you walk into the Palmer House lobby, your jaw will drop. The lobby and other areas are gorgeous and nicely appointed. This is definitely not your average late 20th century cookie cutter hotel! The Palmer House is ideally located for a walking vacation in Chicago. It's just a couple of blocks from The Art Institute and Millenium Park, and it's easy walking distance to The Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, the lakeshore museums. It's also close to public transportation if you're not a walker or want to venture further afield. My husband and I stayed here for a romantic getaway in 2010. We returned in 2011 for a family vacation. Although the PHH is not a discount hotel, this was the only hotel in the downtown area that would let our family of 5 stay in one room (2 double beds plus a roll-away) which meant we paid less that getting 2 rooms at a seemingly less expensive hotel. And let's face it - you're not going to find cheap in downtown Chicago! You're paying for the convenience of the location. We got a room with 2 bathrooms which was a nice touch - allowed us to get ready more quickly! We were there over New Year's Eve. Because of some parties on site, they had extra security checking people entering the elevators (nice touch). My husband was awakened by some noisy revelers in the hallway around 3 AM, but the rest of us slept through it and they quickly disappeared. We also heard car horns honking around midnight through the windows, but beyond that, the noise level was not different from any other comparable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for friends and family”
