Reviews.Author: linkfamily6
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palmer House several times, mostly with adult friends, but this last trip was with my 11 year old daughter for her birthday. All of my visits have been great. The staff is always helpful, no matter how many people are in line. The bartenders in the lobby were fabulous. The rooms are comfy - mostly small - but the last one I had was quite large, with a sitting area. The old details of this hotel makes it charming, even though it is huge. I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Tradition”
Reviews.Author: Sandra M
Reviews.Content: For the past 5 years, our family has spent Dec 23, 24 and we check out Christmas Day! This is and will always be our home away from home. The staff is fantastic and always willing to make accomodations - when our youngest was 3 & 4, we requested a corner room so as not to disturb other guests, we were upgraded to the Executive Floor since the hotel was empty and rooms were available. Our kids now 13 & 7, refuse to stay anywhere else and cannot wait to return to Chicago next Christmas. It's centrally located, near the best Theatres, Museums, any activity. We have been seeing broadway shows the past 2 years at the Ford Theatre and this year, La Cage au Folles at the Bank of America Theatre - 1 block away. We recommend this hotel to anyone we know. The history, updated decor, great service is worth every penny. My oldest daughter wants to have her wedding reception in the Empire Room !!! (we'll have to see about that)

Reviews.Title: “Dingy rooms, but great location and lobby”
Reviews.Author: mehicano
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a Chicago landmark I guess. It has an amazing lobby, kind of reminds me of the Waldorf in New York, but smaller. The staff is friendly. I am here for business, and as the hotel is located right in the loop - it is really well located. I imagine that if you are here for tourism it's also well located because it is near Millenium Park and things. But the rooms are old and strange. In the room I had, the TV was 5 meters away from the bed. There was a big empty space in the middle of the room. The bathroom was very cramped with no space to put my things. The furniture was worn.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Lknlndmom
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in a big city with two small children. This hotel was a great place for us. It is a great location to catch the bus/subway and the staff were friendly and knowledgable. We had no problems checking in/out with minimal wait. The room was spacious with plenty of room for the kids. When our son got sick in the middle of the night, housekeeping responded within minutes and checked in on us twice. Overall this was an excellent place for the family to explore the city and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not the best 'deal'.”
Reviews.Author: TLAOrangeville
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very historic and beautiful...clean, efficient, friendly etc. Room was lovely with a REALLY comfortable bed. However, bring earplugs as it is right beside the L train which goes by every few minutes and could annoy light sleepers. Also, NO coffee machine which was surprising. Internet is NOT free...I think it was 14 dollars per day or something ridiculous. And, movies are almost the same price as going to the actual theatre. We would probably choose elsewhere another time due to 'extra' costs that were not expected...Starbucks coffee and lack of internet (we did not pay this amount but used the free service in the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “A Place Full of Rich History!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy J
Reviews.Content: When I first came to Chicago, I visited this hotel and I have beel as if youen impressed by it every since. It takes you back to old Chicago. The minute you walk into the lobby you feel as if you have stepped back in time. A defiite must see when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Be wary of price games”
Reviews.Author: john h
Reviews.Content: Great location, and worthy of a stay based on the history of the hotel alone. But whatever you pay, add about 3/4 of the price to your expected daily bill. Parking (self, not valet) is half the price. Internet is another daily fee. I needed to use the business center, and was nailed for another $5 to figure out their internet wasn't working. No service for that and the front desk was too busy. Maybe good thing -- if I could have accessed my document and printed it the charge would have been over $20. So, not saying these charges only occur at the Palmer House, just that you need to be fully informed and expect nothing but a nice room, great location and historic ambiance. You will be bled dry for everything else. This is important to know because the hotel is a frequent Priceline and Hotwire seller, and if you go that route, the price you pay isn't nearly as attractive as many other comparable area hotels when you get to an apples to apples comparison. Other issues: Front desk staff less than helpful. Hot tub not working. No Queen beds, when you get two beds you get doubles. All in all, though, the inherent positives of the property itself make the visit average, if much more pricey than it would appear at face value.

Reviews.Title: “Palmer House - Great Place to Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Chicago (other than changing planes at O'hare airport). We Arrived at the Palmer House 25 Dec 11, and from the moment we stepped foot into the property, we were immediately impressed with the hotel. From the doormen to the counter staff, all were extremely warm and welcoming, and we knew we had made the right choice. The entire staff was outstanding! The gentleman that helped us get our bags to our room was an excellent ambassador for Palmer House, ask for "Smiley". The concierge staff was very knowledgeable about what to see and do in Chicago and had some great recommendations for places to eat, particularly ones that our children would enjoy as well. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. What was real nice was that we were on the 9th floor and you would never know we were so close to the "L" trains because we could not hear them. In addition to a beautiful and historic hotel (check the gorgeous fresco's on the ceiling as you get to the checkout counter), we found we were within 1 block of Millenium Park (must see) and about 3 blocks (easy walk) from Lake Michigan. As mentioned previously, we were within about 100 yards from the "L" trains and 1 block from the CTA buses, which made traveling around Chicago simply awesome. We parked our car and used public transportation for our 4 days in Chicago. We will be returning to Chicago and will indeed make staying at the Palmer House a priority in Jun '12 when our friends from the UK will be coming to visit. Most definitely would recommend this Hotel, and our sincere Thanks to the Palmer House staff for making our 1st visit to Chicago a memorable and comfortable occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Room did not have flat screen high def tv!”
Reviews.Author: vdux
Reviews.Content: Was the size of a match box. The Starbucks inside hotel has poor-poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Beautiful Lobby. OK Room & Service.”
Reviews.Author: cardswin_cardswin
Reviews.Content: We were very excited for our stay at the Palmer House in downtown Chicago as we had heard wonderful things about it. Our stay started off very rocky. We called ahead to make arrangements for the room because we were going to arrive very late (after 11:00 pm) with three small children (7, 5 & 1). We spoke with a woman at the front desk and asked that we have a pack n play or crib ready in the room. I was told "no problem". I also asked if they had down pillows or comforters. I was told that yes they did. I asked if one of the beds have the down removed. She replied "Would you like us to make the entire room down-free? That would be no problem." I told her that would be wonderful. Upon our arrival at about 11:10 I asked the man working the front desk if they had prepared the room for us with a crib and removal of the down comforters and pillows. He said that they had not, but did see that the request was noted on our reservation. He said they'd have someone up right away. We went to our room and did our best to settle in given that we could not put our baby in a crib. We removed the down pillows and comforterfrom one bed and put them in a pile while we waited for housekeeping to arrive. After 20 minutes I attempted to call the front desk from the phone located between the beds. The front desk answered and I asked for a status update on the cribs and pillows. I received no answer and the front desk hung up. About 10 seconds later, I received a call from the front desk asking if I had received the materials I requested. I stated that I had not, but then the man at the front desk hung up. It became apparent to me that they could not hear me and that the phone receiver must be broken. They called back right away and I answered the phone on the desk (thankfully they had two phones). The man at the front desk seemed shocked that they had not yet delivered the crib and pillows and said that they would be up right away. I also informed him that the phone between the beds was apparently not working. (The defective phone was not replaced during our stay). 15 minutes later we received a knock on the door. They had brought the crib, but no pillows. We informed housekeeping that we had also asked for a down-free room. They left and came back about five minutes later with the pillows. So, we got off to a rocky start to say the least. (Note: a previous review stated that the Palmer House charged extra for a crib. That was not the case for our stay as the crib was free). The room itself was ok. Not very big, but that's to be expected in downtown Chicago. It seemed a bit dated with a tube TV. The heating/cooling was not the best. We had to turn the thermostat down to the coldest setting possible just so we didn't burn up. We also cracked the window to cool it down a bit. (It was 29 degrees outside). The lobby was BEAUTIFUL! There were many people just lounging around having drinks and taking in the beauty of the place. The location was GREAT! It was just across from Milennium Park. There was a Starbucks, Corner Bakery, McDonalds and Dunkin Donuts all right there for breakfast. We were also very close to the El, which was great for hitching a ride to the north end of the Magnificent Mile, but it was quite loud. The Concierge was helpful providing directions and a map of downtown. Unfortunately, the Palmer House charged an arm and a leg for internet and offered wired only in the room. Too bad iPad/iPhone users. I utilized the 3G on my cell phone instead. Not sure why these older hotels don't get with the times. Strange that your cheaper hotels include internet for free. I guess if you're willing to pay for an expensive hotel, you don't mind the extra for internet (and parking for that matter, which was not cheap). On day two we checked out the swimming pool. It was a decent size and had both a shallow and deep end. Unfortunately, someone had detached the safety rope dividing these two sections making it too easy to meander to the sloped part of the pool on the way to the deep end. Not the safest thing for kids. The water was warm enough. They seemed to have a bit of a drainage problem on the pool deck as there was a LOT of standing water that was very cold. They had plenty of towels for guests to use and a number of chairs and tables. We didn't try the restaurant and opted instead for delivery from Giordano's Pizza. Overall, we had a nice stay, but it was not nearly as good as previous stays in downtown chicago. I do not think we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay at an Historical Gem”
Reviews.Author: dler
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights when we combined a convention trip with a family Christmas celebration. We have previously stayed at the Congress and both downtown Embassy Suites, but decided to see some history and stay at the Palmer House. It far exceeded my expectations. The lobby is worth visiting, even if you choose to stay somewhere else. The room had been updated, very clean, spacious, and comfortable (probably the best mattress I have ever slept on). I like fresh air and had the window open a bit, and while we could hear the L we all slept well. Some of the updating choices may not be historically accurate, but overall the hotel seems well cared for. As others have mentioned, no free Internet, but the Corner Bakery is very close (and has great coffee). My only gripe is the lobby is so inviting to have a drink or two that is was crowded and very loud in the evening. It would seem more appropriate for tea or sherry and elegantly quiet conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Classy place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: kendra8809
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September for one night. We picked it based on location and availablity (walkable to Soldier Field, Grant Park, shopping, etc.).The hotel is gorgeous inside, and you instantly feel like you're in for a treat. Our room was large enough for the two of us with a king bed and updated bathroom. We stayed on one of the executive levels, which had a different elevator and lounge where breakfast was provided. We went on a Sunday morning around 9:45, and the place was totally crowded. We managed to get in to sneak a banana and some coffee and took it to our room to enjoy, since there was nowhere to sit. This along with the long wait we had to check in dinged the Palmer House from 5 stars to 4 for us, but we would gladly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected from a 4 star + hotel”
Reviews.Author: allison1127
Reviews.Content: The palmer house was not what we expected at all. The room was small which is to be expected of an older hotel in Chicago and the fact that there was basic cable and a tv from the early 90's was not even a problem either. I think what was the problem was the lack of service, no mini bar in the room and the old outdated bathrooms. The tile was cracked and dirty, the sink cabinet was old and all dinged up the toilet was tiny and everything was so outdated. Even if space is limited there are ways to update the bathroom and room to feel more comfortable. The fitness center is not complimentary and neither is a crib thank goodness we brought our pack and play. I guess free wi-fi is not standard in most hotels but the Palmer really over charges on everything and anything they can.The room was ok it was fairly clean but the carpets looked old and dirty. The view was of a brick wall and the "L" to the left. It was nice because we were able to walk out the hotel door to the Thanksgiving parade but I would not select this hotel again. We frequently visit Chicago and this will not be on our list of places to stay. Good location though.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfortable, right in the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: nawlins95
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a few times. We always go down there around Christmas time to see the big tree and to go to Chriskindlmarket at the Daley Plaza. The hotel is huge, it has a pool, jacuzzi, bar, at least one restaurant, a few shops, Starbucks, etc. Very classy. The beds were comfortable and nicely decorated. We were 2 blocks from Macy's/State Street/Daley Plaza and 1 block from our favorite pizza place down there (Pizano's).

Reviews.Title: “Like Stepping Back into Another Century”
Reviews.Author: katgonmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a teachers' convention recently. This has to be one of the prettiest hotels I've ever stayed in. On top of that, the service was excellent. The rooms had many features of the old hotels including being quite large for a double queen room. Both of us had our own closet which is quite unusual in today's hotels. Be sure and enjoy afternoon tea as well.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay when you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: MaureenJohnsburg_IL
Reviews.Content: We stayed last summer and it was great for walking to attractions. But hotel itself was just OK as not much offerings (i.e. coffee in room). I'd rather stay at Holiday Inn Express for the money spent for this over the Palmer House charges.

Reviews.Title: “Step Back in Time”
Reviews.Author: TeacherKat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Palmer House Hilton while at a convention. I felt as if I had fell back into the 19th century. This is a beautiful property with great service!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HaydnLambert
Reviews.Content: This downtown Chicago hotel is absolutely terrific. Upon pulling up to the hotel guests are greeted by hotel staff. Luggage is then taken away while the guest checks in. We, being gold members, received a free upgrade to the executive lounge and a 2 bathroom suite. The executive lounge was a great addition. Free soda, coffee, and light snacks all day and a larger variety (wings, noodles, etc.) from 5-7. The hotel is perfect for families as it is in the center of downtown (within walking distance from nearly everything.) The pool was small (typical of Chicago) yet very nice. I wish I had more time at the hotel. The old-fashioned charm and extremely friendly staff are what makes this hotel so very special.

Reviews.Title: “business travelers be wary”
Reviews.Author: dbt
Reviews.Content: i love the history of the hotel and i'm glad that the property shows off the building's original woodwork and also highlights photos of the many stars that performed here in its hey day. the spa was an excellent spa - top notch service but oddly it looked completely unlike anything else in the hotel. the spa is ultra-modern and slick looking, while the rest of the hotel looks very ornate and historic. the business experience left much to be desired and the wi-fi could not be relied on. the hotel would benefit from a major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: Ted C
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Chicago with our two daughters for Christmas shopping and plays. I got the hotel via Priceline and was initially disappointed I got the Palmer House. It has been about 25 since I last stayed there and it was great then as it is now. I was hoping for a hotel closer to the Magnificent Mile rather than the Loop. We were pleasantly surprised with our location. Within blocks of our two plays and the girls liked the area for shopping. As for the hotel, it was as grand as ever and was pleasantly surprised with the level of service which can be rather aloof or stuffy. Not so here. We were checked in by GeRae, who couldn't be more pleasant. Although we had a very good Priceline rate, he didn't make us feel like 'sub-guests'. We paid an extra $49/night for the executive level, more to ensure a larger room than for anything else. The room had two beds (doubles, not queen) and a sitting area and two bathrooms (much appreciated by me and the three ladies). Also included was a good breakfast buffet (fruit, yogurt, cereal, breads and scones, oatmeal, etc.). The only complaint here was that it was too crowded. Finding an empty table was a chore and it closed at 10:00 even though the place was full. A real bright spot at breakfast was Ernest. He was always in a terrific mood and made it a point to learn all of our names. He couldn't have worked harder - a real joy to be around and a real asset to the hotel. Bar prices were high as you would expect at this hotel - one example: four drinks=$60 with a good tip. Didn't have meals there. Check-out was uneventful and efficient. I had HiltonHonors cards and inquired if they were still valid. The gentleman at the desk merely said it didn't matter since no credit would be honored for a Priceline reservation. I just wanted him to check if they were valid and didn't really care about points earned for this stay but decided not to pursue it. That did make me feel a bit like a 'sub-guest' but no big deal. All in all, I would heartily recommend the hotel. Ask for a larger room, exec level if possible. The area was much better than expected for shopping, theater, Millenium Park, and museums.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Chicago hotel for many years.”
Reviews.Author: LifeJourney222
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Palmer House when we visit Chicago for 20 years now. It has the charm and ambiance of the great hotels in history. It feels like going back in time to an era of opulence where hotel visitors were treated like royalty. The rooms are always wonderful. The staff is incredibly attentive to everything. The hotel is also a good value for the level of service and quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our weekend at the Palmer House Hilton”
Reviews.Author: DNJINMAY
Reviews.Content: Last weekend, we spent a fantastic 3 days at the Palmer House Hilton, Chicago! We were there for my nephew's wedding. Everything from the Bride's shower to the Sunday morning brunch was held there, with the exception of the rehersal dinner. It was unbelievable! We saw nothing but smiles from everyone on the staff, from the valet parking to the chef on Sunday morning! Even the women cleaning the rooms were an absolute delight! The rooms were clean and beautiful the wedding was a fairytale - decorations that took our breath away. The food at the reception was 2nd to none we've ever had anywhere in the world and the wait staff was tremendous! Every single one of them was happy WE were there and they were happy to serve us. I can't stop talking about the friendly, exceptional people who call themselves PALMER HOUSE STAFF! Thank you all!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas In Chicago with Grandkids”
Reviews.Author: kytraveler59
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend at the Palmer House for our Christmas gift to our grandkids, ages 4 & 6. They were totally awestruck by the giant Christmas tree in the amazing lobby & the choir which greeted us as we checked in - different choirs & musical groups were featured at lunch & tea time daily - really awesome. The hotel is a short cab ride away from the Shedd Aquarium, the Field Museum & the Children's Museum at the Navy Pier and, of course, the American Girl & Disney stores. We kept room service busy & they were prompt, courteous & food was very tasty with good selections for both kids & adults. We swam in the hotel pool which is very nice & has a hot tub. We booked adjoining rooms, both of which were spacious & well appointed. The staff were very accommodating & answered any requests promptly. We finished each day with dessert in the lobby lounge. Truly a great Chicago weekend for both the grandkiddos & the grandparents!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for loop location”
Reviews.Author: BeachVacationer2
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for nice (not excellent) hotel in the loop close to many attractions, then check out the Palmer House. It's the longest continuously operated hotel in North America, so it is an older building which has been maintained well. Lobby is great but it's cramped because there are so few chairs to sit and relax and enjoy the view. If you're planning an afternoon tea, please ask where you will be seated because we saw couple ladies trying to enjoy a nice tea service in a very busy area with people constantly walking by them. They didn't look very happy. I'm sure there are multitude of room options from very basic to executive types. We always get the least expensive ($105/room this time) which is fine with us. At this rate the room is basic; TV but not flat screen, no coffee machine (get free coffee in the lobby in the AM, no tea though!), no fridge, very small bathroom, and no view. But the room was clean and the beds/pillows were great. We checked out the pool but didn't swim this time; wasn't very crowded at the time. We planned to eat at local places in the loop, but being Sat night, every place was packed with 1hr wait times. We just couldn't wait with our kids there with us, so we went back to the hotel to eat. There is one upscale restaurant (kids didn't like what they served) and a bar with limited selections. We ate at the bar, food so just so so a bit greasy and fries tasted a bit old. It was freezing in the bar too. Kids had to get their jackets from the room! In summary, for the price we paid, this is a GREAT value for a loop location. Well except for parking which is definitely not free. $42 parking fee for 24 hours!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: dddtravel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Chicago where we stayed at The Palmer House. Our room was small, but since we weren't in it that much it wasn't that big a deal. The hotel is lovely, with all the historical details in the lobby beautifully maintained. Everyone we encountered was so friendly, and the festive air really put us in the Christmas spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect for business or weekend getaway.”
Reviews.Author: RobBN
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palmer House many times in the past, and just recently decided to stay there again during a convention in Chicago. The Palmer House is a really incredible property in the Chicago Loop. The grandeur of its fabled history is still evident, and the management is continually upgrading the rooms and common areas to bring back much of the original lustre while making the hotel rooms more updated and comfortable. Everything you would expect from a 4-5 star hotel is there with regard to services and facilities. There are many reasons to stay here. While the majority of the rooms are not super-luxury (I am sure you can get some that are if you want to pay for that), they are very nice with updated amenities, pleasant decor in tones of dark woods, and fabrics in lime, raspberry, crisp white and black, and are a comfortable size by Chicago standards. The location is terrific, situated between the Red Line by the west entrance, and the Brown, Green, Orange, Purple and Pink Lines by the east entrance, it is really easy to get around town, or get to/from O'Hare or Midway. The theatre district, State Street shopping, Art Institute, Orchestra Hall right outside, and Union Station is a ten minute walk. I have also found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. I read some of the other reviews and have never experienced any of the problems that some of them described. Check in is pleasant, elevators are fast, rooms are sparkling with the new decor, common areas (such as the lobby) are truly impressive and beautiful, and even the hallways have classic pictures of the numerous celebrities who have stayed here in the golden age of stage and film. Yes, parking (especially valet) is expensive, but - welcome to Chicago! That is the way it will be anywhere downtown. Also, in a business hotel such as this, the amenities you expect do come at a price. Internet is costly, and if you want coffee you order it from room service rather than make it yourself, etc. This is not a Hampton Inn, it is The Palmer House. I certainly understand that these expenses can mount up and get out of hand quickly, so I suggest parking free outside of the city and taking the CTA, Metra or Amtrak instead. My round trip train tickets from Normal IL are around $22 round trip whereas parking downtown can be $40 per day. Stop at the Corner Bakery downstairs and enjoy your coffee there while people watching on Wabash, then get a free refill and take that to your room if you don't want to do room service. Use your smartphone to check e-mail and websites rather than hooking up your laptop. Enjoy some of the incredible (and inexpensive) restaurants nearby such as the Flat Top Grill or the Eleven City Diner, and use the CTA rather than drive or take taxis. The only reason this is a 4 star and not a 5 star review is that there are newer hotels in the Loop that have larger rooms with larger windows, larger and more updated bathrooms, and better views. But that should not overshadow the fact that this is a wonderful hotel in one of THE most wonderful cities in the country. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Tired and shabby. A tourist spot perhaps, but don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Tom P
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE. Was first put into room 21-156. Reception said this was "upgrade, special large room". Room was large (huge actually), but totally bare except for bed, one arm-chair, small desk, and old small TV on a little dresser at distant far end of room. Room was barren, depressing, and dimly lit. Dirty carpet. Room had an strange wet bar alcove with an ugly partially dismantled sink. Wallpaper peeling, paint dirty, dim lighting. No amenities whatsoever- just two water glasses and an ice bucket. Small windows with view onto an air-shaft. Bathroom tiny, shabby, old, 1950s style, could barely get in the door. Nothing charming about this room - all just old and shabby. Last straw - sound proofing was so bad that I was woken at 6am by people talking in normal quiet voices next door - I could have easily joined their conversation. Complained the next morning and reception then moved me to 'modern' room 20-209 for second night. This room was tiny, old style TV, barely room for a bed, small dresser, and desk. I suppose it had been renovated, since style was 1970 instead of 1950. Dirty carpet, peeling wallpaper in bathroom. Single small window with 'view' of a hotel wall 50 feet away. At least it was quiet. By way of apology, reception gave me a $25 certificate usable only in hotel restaurant. Big deal - at least it paid for breakfast. Valet parking was $100 for two days! Rates not posted outside when I checked in, so this was total surprise and shock. Internet was wired and slow, for $19 a day. Elevators were incredibly slow - sometimes had to wait 5 minutes for one. My business associate was visiting from China and I'd hoped to show him a good Chicago experience. Palmer House was a big mistake. He had the same problem as I did with his room - he was first booked into a 'large' room, also found it barren and shabby, immediately asked to be moved to a 'better' room, which was small and shabby. As a Hilton Honors member, I've often been upgraded to the Executive Floor. Not possible this time since hotel was full. No great loss though - I peeked into the Exec "Breakfast Lounge" on the 23rd floor, and as far as I could see all they'd done was crowd some tables and chairs into the elevator lobby on that floor. Finally at checkout, they confused my associate's booking with someone else and only after some prompting did the front desk search their database to find and print the correct invoice for his expense report. Everyone at reception was nice and polite, but they were far from efficient. Yes, the lobby is impressive, so maybe nice to stop in and see this place as a tourist attraction. But as a hotel to stay in, forget it. Rooms are Motel 6 quality at a premium price. Yes, it's a 'good location' near Millenneum Park, Mag Mile, etc, but there are a dozen other hotels in the same area. PS. I provided exactly this same information in an online Hilton survey. Next week I did get a call from someone in the Palmer House Maintenance Department (maintenance? this place needs a major remodeling). He offered my a free one-night stay, which I declined (why would I want to repeat this miserable experience) and then offered 50,000 points, worth one free night at another Hilton property. At least they listened and made a small attempt at rectification.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but lacking some modern amenities”
Reviews.Author: TacoMel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House for a Friday and Saturday night after bidding on Priceline. Walking into the lobby you'd think it was a palace. The check-in was efficient. For us the best feature was the location, since we traveled around Chicago on the "L" and the red line stop was literally just outside the door. The room was comfortable (we had an end room) and the staff was friendly. There were some things missing that we have come to hope for, and indeed expect, when using hotels. Chief on our list was the lack of an in-room refrigerator or coffee maker. Our leftovers became waterlogged when we tried to keep them cool in the ice bucket and the bag broke, and having to go downstairs and wait in line for Starbucks is much less convenient (and more expensive) than brewing coffee in your own room. Also the pool was extremely small, the TV was outdated, and the number of elevators servicing our floor was inadequate. Internet was extremely expensive (nearly $20/day). Overall, it's a nice place, and at the price I got on Priceline I certainly can't complain. With that said, if I was choosing my own accommodations instead of naming my own price, I'd be inclined to look for a place with some more modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Modern heritage hotel”
Reviews.Author: SUBODI4R
Reviews.Content: Wow, from the time you walk in to the time you spend time inside the hotel, everything is WOW. Indescribable. This is a perfect example of heritage being maintained while amenities going modern in the downtown Chicago. Net trip to Chicago and this Palmer House is a definite stop.

Reviews.Title: “Their only downfall is the price of all the extras!”
Reviews.Author: ForeverHeidi
Reviews.Content: It was lovely as long as you know what youâ€™re in for. The front desk was kind, and apologetic about the outrageous fees the hotel charges for parking, access to the gym & internet. I couldnâ€™t get free wireless in the hotelâ€™s Starbucks, but there is a cafÃ© next door where you can. And yes it's true - valet parking is $61 a day, regular parking is $38. The location is great, the atmosphere canâ€™t be beat, and I loved the gathering space in the lobby - the view of the lobby makes up for the lack of view from the room. Our room was sizable and had a walk in closet, but our traveling partner's room was somewhat cramped. The design of the hotel is interesting, and it was quite a trek from our room to the elevator/ice. The pool & hot tub were tiny, and didnâ€™t really lend itself to being a lounging area.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, great staff, comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeTeacher
Reviews.Content: Two colleagues and I stayed at the Palmer House for four nights during a convention we were attending. The hotel is beautiful and is an excellent location right near the L. There are great places to eat within walking distance and a CVS right across the street. Our room was very spacious and had two bathrooms, which was a big plus. Overall, the staff was very friendly and helpful, although one waiter in the lobby restaurant/bar was a bit rude. The city is clean and I always felt very safe. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beausdad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palmer House twice and let me tell you it is one of the most beautiful properties ever. I rank it with the Waldorf in New York. The customer service was impeccable. The location is fantastic. So close to Grant Park, The Art Institute, The Field Museum, Soldier Field I could go on and on. The rooms are very plush and well kept by the housekeeping staff. The first time we stayed we had a suite and it was amazing. Two bathrooms and separate closets for the two of us. The beds were like sleeping on a cloud. Views aren't much, but again the location is phenomenal. I looked at the Hard Rock and other hotels closer to the Magical Mile and the river, but I will stay here every time.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: DebinNewYork
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for a conference the week after Thanksgiving and was very disappointed. I was there about 5 years ago and was booked at the Palmer House but it was overbooked and I was sent to another Hilton Hotel. The lobby is gorgeous! It is so vast and beautiful I thought I was in a palace. When I went to my room I thought I was in a prison cell. I was on the 15th floor. When you went into my room you walked about 3 steps and you were at the bed. It was so close to the hall (that was noisy) that I thought I was sleeping in the hall. When you were at the end of the bed there were 2 large wooden doors. One was the bathroom. The bathroom door could not open if you had the room door open since they were so close. The bathroom was tiny. The other door opened to a closet (or a very small square box). Again tiny. Outside of the window was a fire escape that obstruted any view you might have had. I guess the real disappointment was there were none of the amenities I have grown accustomed to when I stay at a hotel. No bottled water, no coffe/tea maker. Nothing! Next conference in Chicago I will be staying at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Style Matter”
Reviews.Author: Mikecbu
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic "early December" rate through Amtrak. The experience was worth twice what we paid. The desk clerk gave us tokens for free bottled water, advised us that a spectacular breakfast would be included each day (although it wasn't mentioned in our booking confirmation), and provided us with his extension for any additional needs we might have. He seemed really to mean it. The concierge made excellent dinner recommendations, as one might expect at such a property, but even the passing housekeepers and maintenance folks stopped to say hello. The decor was elegant without the pretension of the more modern and much more expensive hotels. It is discouraging to see that many reviewers discount what matters to make an hotel stay enjoyable by discounting their reviews because the bathroom fixtures are of an older type and the walls of the restaurant aren't all glass. The location is one of the best in Chicago, just a block from the Art Institute. Besides location, it's the service and style that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful historic Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cliffandbeth
Reviews.Content: This beautiful old hotel has been renovated and updated and run by Hilton so you know the service will be great. The place is amazing and in a great location in downtown Chicago. If you like history and the feel of the grand old hotels, this is the place to stay. Potter's lounge was lots of fun and there is a Starbucks in the lower level for morning coffee. We thought the rate was also very reasonable for downtown and our room was spacious, the bed was very comfortable and the linens lovely. You can't go wrong staying here when you visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “HOLIDAY TRADITION”
Reviews.Author: Errol M
Reviews.Content: The Palmer house on Monroe St in Chicago has one of the most beautiful lobbies I have ever seen. The art deco interior is of a bygone world of elegance. The ceiling mural was restored by the same artist who restored the Cistine Chapel, truly mesmerizing. To sit in the lobby and have a drink( a bit pricey, though) and take in the Holiday decor is an experience you will not forget. The lighting, stone statues, marble stair cases engulf and transport you to another century. If there is one thing you should do when in Chicago is visit this hotel. I highly recommend it. Having said that, there is one down side I must mention, the rooms. They are clean, but, need to be updated yesterday along with the bathrooms. The long hallways could have a bit more decor. I felt I was in that resort that was in "The Shining" waiting for the kid to come around the corner on his bike.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: phillip b
Reviews.Content: My resent stay at the Palmer House Hotel in Chicago was outstanding! What a great guest service team. The Concierge Tracy and Phillpi went above and beyond to make sure we found the resturants and the shopping we were looking for, Sussan the housekeeping manager fixed our housekeeping problem with a big smile, and Mike the S Guard in the lobby was really friendly and helpful. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room on the Executive Level”
Reviews.Author: Chris42310
Reviews.Content: Would stay in this hotel again in a heart beat! Beautiful room with 2 bathrooms, 2 closets and a seating area. Amenities on the top two floors were great!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Aspiring_Parisienne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in October and found it to be a clean, comfortable hotel. The Hotel This is an impressive hotel. The lobby area is beautiful and certainly has the wow factor. There are some small shops and a Starbucks located on the ground-level, with the Reception and Concierge on the upper ground level. As a result of the size of the hotel, some of the rooms can be a few minutes walk from the elevator - absolutely no issue for us, but if you have mobility problems it might be worth requesting a room close to the elevator. The Rooms We stayed in a room with 2 double beds. The room was very spacious with modern decor and was a very nice place to rest. The room had a TV, desk / dressing table & chair, 2 telephones, an easy chair with foot stool, 2 double beds each with bedside tables, 2 wardrobes, bathroom with bath and shower, and a hairdryer. We found the room to be very clean (with the exception of a used tissue in the sink on arrival!) and it was maintained well throughout our stay. Our only gripe is that there was no mini-bar and no tea / coffee making facilities and, for the price of the room, I would expect both of these things. I assume that the lack of these facilities was to encourage guests to use the (quite expensive) bar in the lobby and the (similarly expensive) Starbucks franchise on the ground-level. The beds were very conformable and we certainly had lots of space in the room. Staff We found the staff, without exception, to be helpful and friendly. The Concierge staff were very accommodating and were more than happy to make all reservations for us. Door staff similarly were very helpful and had taxis waiting within seconds. Location The hotel is located just inside the Loop on East Monroe about a ten minute walk to Millennium Park and the Harbour and about a 5 minute walk to Macy's and other shops. We walked almost everywhere from here and found the majority of places to be easily accessible. A walk to the Shedd Aquarium / Soldier Park took us about 50 minutes, but this was a gentle stroll along the harbour, and could be done in less if you walked with purpose! There are El stations just outside the hotel, and a couple of nice bars / eateries just next door to the hotel (The Exchequer Pub & Restaurant offers a discount to Palmer House Hotel guests). Overall We had a very comfortable and enjoyable stay in this hotel, and we would definitely stay here again if we were to return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: xirxy
Reviews.Content: I can confirm the following coments made by previous reviewers: - The lobby is great - a touristic attraction - centrally located, directly at the loop - price is OK for Chicago - rooms: can be either very small and old, or quite large and newly renovated; unfortunately I do not know how you could get the better ones, maybe just ask; I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Old Charm”
Reviews.Author: mrpackethead
Reviews.Content: The lobby is something worth seeing ( even if your not staying there, go and have a look ).. The rest of the hotel is just a hotel.. Rooms were clean.. Decor i guess was in keeping with the hotel, but not my cup of tea.. Was very quiet.. Internet is pay.. ( please, its like water these days , i.e. should be free ).. Didn't use the restranaunt or room service, theres a million places to eat all around the place.. Location is really useful. Its only a minutes walk to the Loop lines, and subways.. 15 minutes walk to the Magnificent mile.. Yes, i'd go back and stay there... Probably was a bit more expensive than i anticipated.. The lobby space is very busy, and theres no-where to sit, so, its a bit useless i guess.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AC312
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend at the beginning of December. Overall, the hotel was middle of the road - some great positives and a few negatives. A few days before my stay, I made sure to call the front desk and request a king size room in the renovated section of the hotel. Thankfully, despite booking on a 3rd party website, they were able to accommodate my request even though the hotel seemed to be near capacity for the weekend. The hotel room was extremely large (it looks like they combined two rooms during the renovation) with a nice sitting area in front of the king bed. The room was clean with no signs of wear, but despite being recently renovated (within the last couple years) it did not have a flat screen TV. The bathroom was very small, and my girlfriend and I found it hard to be in the bathroom at the same time to get ready. The room was extremely quiet - you can occasionally hear the L outside, but this was not noticeable at night. For me, one downside was that the building seems to slow down internet connections on mobile phones. Since I did not want to pay for internet, this was annoying when I needed to get a few things done. The hotel has a great location! A block from Millennium Park/Art Institute and a 10 minute walk from N Michigan Ave shopping. The employees were helpful and nice during our entire stay. The lobby is beautiful, but it gets very crowded in the evening and there are not many places to sit.

Reviews.Title: “The Grande Dame continues in style”
Reviews.Author: chalouisduletz
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with the Palmer House, as generations of travelers have known. From the first impression of the lobby you know you're in for a grand experience. The staff is unfailingly friendly. There is something about seeing a uniformed doorman/bellhop that makes stepping back into an earlier age of elegance seem the right thing to do, even if said doorman is most likely greeting a contemporary porker wearing a baseball cap. Never mind, they keep up their side of the bargain. Outside the public spaces, adjust your expectations of spaciousness to circa 1925 standards for the rooms themselves. With this location a stone's throw from the Art Institute, Orchestra Hall, and all the rest of the best Chicago has to offer you shouldn't be spending many waking hours there anyway. Beds are firm and comfy, linens are high quality. Walls are solid and thick. Elevators don't appear instantly, but one never feels trapped. Package rates at just over $100 per night really can't be beat for a property of this quality. One or two warts could be pulled off: the Muzak at the ground floor elevator bank is so horribly loud that guests can't even hear the "ding" signalling elevator arrivals. Second, do I really want to pay $7 per hour/$20 per day for Internet access when it's free at Corner Bakery in the same building and Starbucks across the street? It's now free at Motel 6, for heaven's sake. Luxury hotels need to accept new realities. You don't charge for hot water, do you?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel / Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lori S
Reviews.Content: The employees were very helpful but not all of them. The rooms are narrow and kind of old looking (wallpaper needed to be fixed - coming off the wall) and the room smelled musty. Food during our meetings was okay but it is hotel catered so not terrific (breakfast potatoes were always cold). For the atmoshpere and history of this hotel it is cool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: rachaeld82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideally located, and beautiful inside. The downside was my TINY room. When I opened the door into the room, it touched the bed. There was no room to put a suitcase on the floor - there simply was not enough floor space. That said, I arrive about 5/6 hours before the correct check in time, and the hotel had a room to give me straight away - I was not expecting that, and it was a blessing after an overnight flight. Given the size of the hotel, it was also very quiet, and the room service was AMAZING. Speedy, hot and very tasty. Overall, I was really happy, I just wish I'd had a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretty lobby, shabby room”
Reviews.Author: bdesmart
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palmer House Hilton for a conference. The lobby and conference facilities were beautiful, and the location of the hotel would be hard to beat. But the guest room was pretty depressing. Dingy, poor lighting, peeling paint, a window looking across a small courtyard into other guest room windows. One shouldn't expect a room in an older hotel to be large, but the layout of the furniture was a bit ridiculous - the space between the desk and armoir (leading into the bathroom) was perhaps 14 inches! If location is important to you, this might be a good choice. But I wouldn't recommend the Palmer House for any other reason.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby....that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: DetroitGirl39
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of summer 2011 with another couple. Since we were only staying one night, we only booked one room. We asked for a room with two beds. We actually called three times to confirm we had two beds and were old each time, "Yes, you have a room with two beds". Well, upon check in, we were told we had a room with one king bed. Nothing could be done since the hotel was completely booked. So, one couple got stuck sleeping on a roll away....which they tried to charge us $48 for, even though it was their error that caused us to need the roll away. The room was a little small, but would have been sufficient for one couple (which is what it's meant for). The tv was a small tube tv. The lobby is gorgeous and historic. The elevators take some time, but it's a large, old building, so it's to be expected. The location is decent, but about a twenty minute walk from downtown, especially if you plan to visit the Mag. Mile or Navy Pier. Staff was mostly rude and unhelpful. One upside is after 9:00 pm you are not permitted into the hotel without showing your room key. That made me feel safe once inside. Also, there's not too many restaurants on this block, so you're stuck walking a bit or eating at the hotel itself. Overall, just an ok visit.

Reviews.Title: “terrific location/beautiful large rooms”
Reviews.Author: travel_p_04
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here recently during a business trip and will definetley return. Main perks: self-parking garage is very convenient; great location to get on highway quickly/with ease; huge rooms; many dining/lounge options in hotel; comfortable bed; nicely appointed rooms. I found a great deal on priceline. I would return on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Historical Hotel in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Sofieah
Reviews.Content: We were immediately impressed when we entered the lobby. This historical hotel is very grand and beautiful inside. Lots of elaborate details in the lobby and Empire Room. The rooms themselves were very modern and updated so it didn't lack any modern conveniences. It is right next to shops and restaurants and a short walk to Millennium Park or Macy's. We got a fantastic price for a holiday weekend, it was worth every penny. We will definitely be going back here on our next stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Historic....but not "Hilton" quality.”
Reviews.Author: Blair0201
Reviews.Content: Love the lobby!! Love the historical value!! Love the old world feel!! Gorgeously decorated for Christmastime!! Sadly the rooms were a bit under par for Hilton. & the housekeeping wasn't quite up to usual... Stayed for 3 nights & 2 of the 3 days had to call down to have the room cleaned (3pm). The fitness center is extremely clean & machinery was state of the art. Disappointing that robes weren't available for the steam room..... & the spa is 4 floors away....the massage therapists are amazing though!! Not sure if the rest of the staff was just over-worked b/c of the holiday or just underwhelmed in general.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from such a beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: klmn16
Reviews.Content: We were there for a family wedding at the hotel. They canceled all the reservations under one name when one couple with that last name canceled. So three couples were left with no reservations. The parents of the groom had reservations for a two room suite which they did not have when they checked in. The bride and groom could not get into their room after the wedding. The keys would not work. Took three trips to the front desk before security came up to help. The concierge was rude and unhelpful when needing to print our boarding passes. However, the housekeeping staff was so friendly and accommodating. They did a great job and were always asking if we needed anything if we ran into them in the hall. By the way, if you have an event there, don't book through the event! Save $70.00 plus per night by booking online. Plus you can get parking discounts online that were not offered to the guests who booked through the event people. Our room was across the hall from the housekeeping storage closet and apparently the mechanical room for the elevators. We heard banging and noise all night and talking and banging early in the morning. Not a great night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel with a modern twist fantastic”
Reviews.Author: F1Macca
Reviews.Content: Our fist visit to Chicago and what a great choice of hotel we made. The hotel is full of history which is evident from the photographs of some of the greats that have stayed there over the years however it doesn't live off past reputation and has a modern twist having undergone a refurb, a real class act. The rooms have everything you would want including a really comfortable bed and powerful shower. It is spotlessly clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. One of the best hotels we have stayed in anywhere in the world and we will most certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Experience and World Class Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: tonethetiger
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton is not like any other Hilton Hotel you have been to. The rooms are older but are fairly nicely retrofitted to be modern. The health club/fitness club is a nice perk. The atrium is something to behold, don win italian renaissance style with murals on the walls and ceiling and gilded accents on the balconies; the registration area has chilled champagne complimentary and the breakfast at the house restaurant is very upscale and don't bother with the buffet; the continental (apps $14 USD) is filling. The Palmer is a great locale if you are planning on spending a weekend trip at the theaters, the lyric opera, a festival in Grant Park or other activities in the Loop area (the blocks N-S-W-E within the Orange Line Elevated Train loop). If you are planning on doing just shopping on Michigan Avenue, I'd suggest something north of Wacker Drive (The Sheraton, etc.) but if you are visiting a child at DePaul downtown or Columbia College, it's as good as it gets!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: GPW22
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels - ever. From the moment you walk in the huge lobby is spectacular, the rooms are big, huge actually comfortable and very nicely furnished. Beds are very comfortable although not huge I guess the first class linens and pillows make up for their size. We have even had a room with 2 baths which is luxury indeed when traveling. The only negative I can think of is wifi is not free, which just seems cheap on the part of the hotel, given the room rates and price of food and drink they could give guests wifi and avoid seeming like they are nickle and diming you but to be fair it seems no place in Chicago gives you free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, comfy,pricey”
Reviews.Author: drmgeorge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the PH for a recent convention. The hotel is beautiful, well situated, and the service is good. The rooms are retro chic and very comfortable. My only complaint is related to Internet service at the hotel. The fee of $8 per hour or $15 per day is out of line. Furthermore, the only available option is hardwired connections in the guest rooms, so leave your iPad at home. And, for whatever reason, my 3G service on my iPhone seemed to be blocked in the hotel building. It is 2011 and Internet service should not be this difficult or expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and charming, but crowded”
Reviews.Author: LavanRose
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palmer House with my husband and adult children four times now. We are usually pleased with the place, but we keep coming back mostly because of my husband's Hilton Honors membership. I agree with the other reviewers who complain about the charge for internet service, and the lackluster breakfast in the executive lounge. The main problem we had on our most recent visit was that the breakfast room was so crowded it was difficult to find a table. We took our food back to our room, but not before having to wait in line to get it. In spite of the breakfast problem, though, the rooms we have stayed in were beautifully decorated and comfortable. The hotel is in a perfect location. The housekeepers do an outstanding job and they are very friendly! As is the rest of the staff, who should be commended for making us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Buffalo5
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Chicago on business an brought my son. We stayed at this grand old hotel on the executive suite level. Service was excellent. The suites have two full baths, are very large, and the hotel overall was very nicely restored. One block from the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The subway is right outside. The restaurant is OK at best, room service is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Dame Drifting”
Reviews.Author: Hiroshige
Reviews.Content: The first thing I should note about this four-star hotel is that it charges (and charges plenty) for internet connection. This fact alone should lead one to avoid this hotel. That said, the hotel is large and historic. It has generally a good atmosphere, starting with the elegant and bustling lobby. The rooms are generally clean, but they vary. We stayed part of our last visit in a small, odd room with a poor bed and the rest in a larger room with a perfectly acceptable bed. Had we stayed the whole time in the first room, I would probably give the hotel two stars above, but the second room would have gotten a four. So I averaged. While I said the rooms were generally clean, there was a piece of plastic wrapping on the hall floor between our room and the elevator that stayed there for the whole time we were there. It seemed to be no one's job to pick it up, and so no one did. That may be part of the problem of running such a large hotel, but it symbolizes to me that the staff here are not going the extra mile for the guests. I did not think the club floor breakfast was particularly special. We recently stayed in a few hotels in Europe, where the breakfast in similarly priced hotels was much better and more varied. The breakfast here was identical, day after day. And on a crowded weekend, the club floor was really a zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: allen006
Reviews.Content: The lobby in this old hotel is beautiful and is a great way to begin your stay. Unfortunately, they've filled the lobby with bar tables in place of the quiet classical music of a couple years ago. Do not book this hotel through an internet agency - they have very very small rooms for those who pay lower internet rates. Book the hotel through Hilton, and specify a large room. The location isn't bad for the loop area, but its a bit of a walk to the North Michigan area. This is the perfect hotel for CTA availablilty - the elevated is available at the Wabash entrance, and the Red line is available at the State Street Entrance. If you do not use the valet parking, there will be very little room to leave your car while checking in - and they bell hop will be very upset with you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but service was a bit sporadic”
Reviews.Author: amandabgraves
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a mother daughter weekend in Chicago...two adults and two children. We arrived a bit early on Friday to check in so we left our bags and were to receive a text when the room was ready - we realized around 6:00 we never received a text. When arrived back at the hotel and got to our Executive Floor room - housekeeping was currently in our room so we were never sure if the room was ready early or not...she did however turndown one of the 2 double beds. If this was a turndown service we never received it again. We decided to head upstairs for the appetizers from 5-7 but got there a few minutes before 7 and it was all cleaned up - we were able to grab a few apples and sodas. We stayed in Friday and had local pizza delivered and watched a movie available from the service on tv. Breakfast was included on the floor above and it had so much to choose from but with a conference there it was very tight in the small food area and not much seating available. We spent the morning out and came back for a few hours and left again - that day we did receive new towels but the trash was never taken nor were the glasses cleaned or replaced with new ones. Sunday breakfast was a mad house with no where to sit - people eating at the credenzas in front of the elevators, kids running around, etc. Overall we had an excellent stay and the room was very comfortable and beds very comfy but just found the housekeeping service to be a bit off...the bellmen and valet were all excellent. We could hear guests in the room beside ours at various times of the day and they were not being "loud" - there were a few places in the room that needed cosmetic help such as wallpaper peeling and this was the case in the hallways too. Overall a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A grand historic hotel with average rooms”
Reviews.Author: adb123
Reviews.Content: The lobby is grand, although almost completely taken over by the bar. There are few hotels in Chicago that can claim or display the kind of history that the Palmer House can. Once leaving the lobby, the rooms are not great. They are large, the room we had would be a Jr suite anywhere else, and included 2 bathrooms; however, the furniture included was inadequate, the layout made no sense, and the tiny tv was so far away from the bed it wasn't easy to view. The hotel is large, and it is difficult to avoid stairs. The entry doors are not automated, which makes the hotel difficult for anyone loaded with luggage or who has mobility issues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown business stay”
Reviews.Author: G0ldenTraveler
Reviews.Content: With a company office downtown near Union Station, I have stayed at this hotel twice for my business travels. While my stays have been fairly limited to a quick overnight trip, the professionalism of the staff made this hotel stand out among other options. During the last visit, I was treated with a nice "upgraded" to a corner room with plenty space to stretch out and relax. I will continue to stay at the Palmer House when my travels take me to downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....lots of character”
Reviews.Author: hbhakh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five nights while attending a conference in Chicago. I arrived around lunch time and a room was ready. No executive rooms were available but I was put in a large room on the Hhonors floor. The executive lounge was two floors above and was accessible via room card. The lounge had a decent selection for breakfast and afternoon snacks. Sodas were always available. My room was very comfortable. It included a king bed, two chairs with a table, and a wet bar. The bathroom, however, was very small. The view was of the other wing of the hotel. I found the service and staff to be very nice and efficient. The on site restaurants are a little pricey but the food and service was good. On my first day, I needed a fast lunch. The server suggest several items that could be ready in less than 5 minutes. They had be out in plenty of time for my meeting. There are a variety of attractions nearby, many within walking distance. There is a "L" station adjacent to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: FRGFRG
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Palmer House did not disappoint. Wonderful upscale hotel. Am planning to stay again. Wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Chicago hotel; the Lobby still makes my heart skip a beat”
Reviews.Author: travelinlight58
Reviews.Content: OK, I admit it. I am more than a little biased when it comes to this hotel. This is my favorite hotel in Chicago. Everything about it is great. I have always had great service at this hotel. Great info and advice from staff on things to to, places to eat, etc. We requested a place to eat that had both free range meats and organic veggie options at a certain price point. Most hotel staff would give you a sigh or blank stair. Not the staff at the Palmer House. They immediately recommended a little place dow the street that was excellent and fit everything we were looking for! I could sit in the lobby for hours and look at the celing. The lobby bar is a great place to hang for this exact reason. One more thing ... when we stayed some of the rooms were newly decorated ... others had the old decor. Get the NEW rooms with the peacock theme. You will glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: anonymousBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels, but this was surprisingly nice. Its location is extremely convenient to downtown attractions, an easy stroll to the lakeshore, a block or two from the Magnificent Mile and the Art Institute (wow, what a collection! like a "greatest hits of art history"), right next to the El--I kept being surprised at how close we were to everything, and with entrances on several sides of the block, you could pop in and out so easily. It is an old, grand, historic property and the room and bathroom were small by modern standards, but very nicely appointed, and the bed was exceptionally comfortable (I'm fussy about beds). The staff stood out for great service--just really pleasant, good-humored, and helpful right down to the smallest, most casual interactions. The spa was good--soothing without being snooty. I had a great massage and pedicure. Room service was super-fast, too. I'd stay at this hotel again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We had another good experience at the Palmer House Hilton. Our room was renovated and comfortable. This hotel does not have wireless Internet, which makes getting online more difficult than it should be in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel grandiose”
Reviews.Author: lelou18
Reviews.Content: The hotel is grandiose and extremely wide. Has a lot of rooms and services for conferences and meetings. They have a wonderful Spa. not to miss the Balance Spa. They have access to many streets in the area which makes commuting easier.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in downtown Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: jonesycrush
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely old hotel in Chicago. However, the rooms can be on the smallish side. The bed was great and the decor was lovely, but the room is one of the smallest I've ever stayed in; ditto the bathroom. Great staff, great location. No free wireless and getting online is a bit of a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, Location & Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Cabinfever2011
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here numerous times; staff always courteous and rooms have an old world charm. Walking distance to many places you will want to see. Millenium Park, Michigan Ave, Shopping and Theaters. Also, close by train systems. Including the one for Indiana. The restaurant there is good but service was lacking on the day we were there. Wait staff too busy or not attentive to there tables. Rooms are beautiful, quiet and clean. Excellent choice while in Chi town

Reviews.Title: “Dazzling!”
Reviews.Author: MB_7783
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is just dazzling, great lobby, foyer and above-all great friendly service and very very clean! The concierge staff were excellent, very helpful in terms of choosing local amazing restaurants, bars, clubs etc. Beds were super comfortable. Well placed in Chicago close to all the main sites! Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dallasdeeker
Reviews.Content: Palmer House is a beautiful, historic hotel--opened 13 days before the Chicago fire, then rebuilt. It's smack dab in the middle of the theater district, magnificent mile, and a block from the Art Institute and Millenium Park. A bus goes directly to the museum campus. The front door is right at the red line subway, and the back door a half block from the brown line EL. I got a CTA pass and never took a taxi. My room was spacious, but dimly lit, and the bathroom was tiny. Although reviews stated the hotel does not provide a coffee maker, and a phone call confirmed this, one appeared in my room soon after I checked in. I learned (but was not able to attend) they have a historic tour of the hotel. From the trivia questions that play on the elevator screen, I'm guessing this would be interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Denise B
Reviews.Content: We held our annual leadership conference at this hotel. We bring in medical professionals from all over the world and so excellent service is a must. We expected a lot and this hotel delivered everything we needed in service as well as handling last minute surprises from our group. If you're looking for a stunning hotel and great service, this is the one. I stayed in one of the renovated rooms and found it extremely comfortable, bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was very nice. The hotel lobby bar area is stunning and plenty of room and chairs to hold impromtu small business meetings or comfortable and impressive to meet friends for a drink.I would definitely stay in this hotel again as a personal stay, but also highly recommend it for business meetings. The sales and banquet staff were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby bartenders especially Tim, went out of the way to correct what could have been a bad stay into a GREAT stay!”
Reviews.Author: Postman708
Reviews.Content: The lobby bar is like sitting in an art gallery! Very busy! Service at tables very slow! Waited a long time to order, get drinks And even longer to just pay our bill! Sit at the bar instead (if you can get a seat)! Tim & Marty were full of knowledge on where to go in Chicago! We loved all of thier reccomendations! Tim even got us a reservation at a restaurant that was full when we called! We were all very impressed about the knowledge of the Hotel's history that he knew! It is nice to see people that enjoy ones job and share that with thier customers! We only stayed at the Palmer for one day, because they were sold out, but we went to the palmer everyday for happy hour and reccomendations all week we were in town! The doorman (I believe his Name was patrick) remembered us everytime!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Accomadations.....more bang for the bucks at other Chi Hotels”
Reviews.Author: gobluegirl
Reviews.Content: I personally thought this Hotel was overpriced. The only reason why I stayed here is because the wedding party that I was in chose this hotel. Our room was small; there were charges for internet and the fitness center. These items should be complimentary with the price I paid. I also thought that the bathroom could be a bit cleaner and bigger. Some updating to the decor would be nice too. I did find the bed comfy, the lobby beautiful and the location great. I have stayed at many Chicago hotels and I have paid less and gotten more. I would not stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old fashion hotel”
Reviews.Author: honora44
Reviews.Content: This is a great hilton with a lot of character. This hotel has a great history and beauty, especially in the main lobby. It has been recently renovated and the rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. However, the bathrooms are a little small and the theme is still older. Overall, a nice Hilton hotel with a great location in the heart of downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but remember: old hotels will have small bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: nickiwms
Reviews.Content: Overall a great stay at the Palmer House. Love the elegance of the lobby and the history about the hotel and it's originators (the Palmers). We hotwired the room for $120 and got a double bed oversize room. It was nice, bathroom very small but the room was spacious. two nice chairs, ottoman and nice sized desk. The maid service was kind enough to help us with additional bedding as our son made a bed out of the chairs and ottoman. the room was recently renovated so everything was new. nice darkout drapes, comfy beds and nice linens. this hotel is perfectly located for travelers wanting to be without a car and definitely would recommend. i have Heard there are some older rooms that haven't been renovated. make sure you get a new one!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: FlavioBrazil_11
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton is an old style hotel with a excellent location. It is just one block away from the Art Institute of Chicago and 10 minutes walk from the Milleniun Park, Chicago Theater, Sears Tower (now Willis Tower) and main shops in downtown Chicago. In a 10 minutes taxi ride you can get to the Fields Museum, Shed Aquarium and Soldier Field. Around the corner you can find Corner Breakfast for a cheaper breakfast. If you are foreigner and you have dinner late, Miller pub is just beside the hotel. If you are into shaving goods, skin and hair care visit the Merz shop inside the hotel. Minus: internet in the room for 7.50/hour and breakfast for 20.00.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, great restaurant, disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: Mary77030
Reviews.Content: Even if you decide not to stay here, at least go in and see the incredible ceiling in the lobby. Recently restored, it reminded me of the Sistine Chapel. Check out the Tiffany wall sconces and statues at the entrance to The Empire Room. We ate dinner at the Lockwood Restaurant. It was excellent--I had a special of pork chops with autumn veggies in a fabulous sauce. My daughter enjoyed her cod dish. Our room had been remodeled by removing a wall between two rooms, so we had extra space. The bathroom was tiny, and I had to step in and close the door behind me in order to use the sink or toilet. We had a courtyard room, which meant that it was a bit dark, but it was quiet. I wasn't fond of the lime green color theme or the patterns in the bolster pillows and wallpaper. But the strangest thing was the extra corridor by one of the double beds. It had an extra closet (a bonus) and behind the other door was an old bathroom that was disgusting. Tile had been partially removed, the toilet was filthy, and dirt was everywhere. The light still worked and the wallpaper was at least 50 years old. They could have removed that bath and enlarged the other one. Or even just locked that door so we didn't have such an unpleasant discovery. It was creepy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jennylynn24
Reviews.Content: The hotel was running a full occupancy the night I stayed, so when I reserved my room the only type left was a standard room with one queen bed. The room was small, but it was clean and lived up to the Hilton name. The staff was friendly and accommodating and always willing to lend a hand. Unfortunately, valet parking was filled when we arrived, but the staff helped with storing our bags until we had checked in. The check in line was very long, but there was a separate line for HHonors, which moved quite quickly. It was a very nice stay and I would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, peeling wallpaper, amenities not included”
Reviews.Author: KathleenRN218
Reviews.Content: I was initially excited when I booked a room at The Palmer House on Priceline for a romantic getaway to Chicago, this this was very short lived. Upon arrival we were greeted by a Valet, who spoke very broken English. He asked if we needed assistance with our luggage to which we answered yes, he proceeded to give us our ticket and said we were all set. We then stepped in to a very impressive lobby (which is all that was impressive in this hotel) and waited in a long line to check in. The front desk clerk acknowledged that we booked through Priceline and assigned us a room, whcih was to have a been a room to accommodate 2 adults. We then entered a very TINY room that consisted of about 120 sq feet and a single bed. We promptly realized that this would not be acceptable accommodations for two people, as guaranteed by priceline, and returned to the front desk. At the desk we were informed that there are no guarantees when booking through Priceline, that we pay less than their other guests, therefore the rooms are assigned to the full paying guests and Priceline customers get the remaining rooms. After some argument we were able to be assigned another room. This room was slightly larger in size and included a "Queen bed" a little room to walk around it and a very small bathroom. There was construction outside of our room. The room had peeling wallpaper in multiple areas and was very dated with an old tube television and dated bathroom fixtures. It did not meet my expectation when I think of a "4-Star" hotel. The hotel did provide a 15x25 foot pool to accommodate it's over 1,000 rooms. It had a fee to use it's fitness room, a fee to use it's wired internet (as there was no Wi-Fi available)and we were not able to use the concierge due to an extensive line, therefore we chose to fend for ourselves rather than spend hours in line. Our luggage never did make it to our room, we had to contact valet and were escorted through the parking garage to retrieve our luggage ourselves. I would not recommend staying at this hotel to anyone and would not return to it. The time we spent outside of the room was very enjoyable and Rock Of Ages was great! I would recommend checking out Rock of Ages while in Chicago! :)

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel with incredible lobby”
Reviews.Author: Marybeth58
Reviews.Content: First I must disclose that I am not a fan of big old hotels. This place is huge and very busy. Rooms are small even by downtown Chicago standards. Internet not free. I was here on business and would not make this choice if I were visiting Chicago for fun. There is a Starbucks on the ground floor!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: wahinekawi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an excellent location. It's literally one block away from the Art Institute and Michigan Avenue, a 5-10 minute walk from Millennium Park, and a 15-20 minute walk to the main shopping and restaurants of the Magnificent Mile. There is a Starbucks in the hotel itself and many nice coffee shops and restaurants located nearby. It is also very close to the main metro and bus lines, so it's easy to get around downtown Chicago. The hotel staff was also very helpful. The room itself was like any other Hilton, nothing that spectacular. However, I do wish that there was more seating in the room, as there was only a desk chair and the beds to sit on. There are some minor problems with this hotel though...
