As other posters have mentioned before, there is no wifi in the rooms or in the lobby (we inquired about access in the lobby but were told that it wasn't available to us). Many hotels have free wireless access these days, so I found this very odd, especially in a hotel where there are many business travellers. There is, however, wired internet access in each room, but that means you can't use your iPad or other wireless devices. Another thing to keep in mind is the close location to the "L." Although convenient, we heard trains rush by throughout the night even though we were on the 20th floor. So, if you're a light sleeper, make sure to request a room on the other side of the building! Overall, the Palmer House is a decent hotel in a great location with some minor flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Quietest hotel night ever.”
Reviews.Author: 40StatesAndCounting
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the night at Palmer House when we visited Chicago for business. We had some Hilton Honors points that reduced the room price (a lot), and since we had saved some money, we splurged and upgraded to the Executive Level. Boy, was that worth it. We were roomed on the top floor at the far back end of the "wings." The great thing about the room location was that no one would tromp by there unless they had reason to be there. The bed was soooooo comfortable. The shower? Amazing. Really - we both came out of it saying "wow, that was a great shower." The exec. level also has a couple "private" express elevators that keep you from having to stop at all the other floors on the way down, which is probably a nice perk. We both really enjoyed the complimentary exec level continental breakfast, and we had just enough space to do our video workout in the hotel room. All the staff members we talked to were super friendly and helpful. The location is AWESOME. You can practically live in that hotel and never leave the building. There were some downsides, of course. Some major things to be aware of: 1 - parking is expensive (but it's downtown Chicago, so what do you honestly expect? Every place downtown is like that.) 2 - Wifi is not gratis. There were 2 computers on our floor that people could use for free, but they were always in use. This does annoy me, especially at expensive hotels. (Again, unfortunately, it's downtown Chicago, so what do you honestly expect? In my limited experience of staying at hotels at this price in big cities, NOTHING is included. So, it's on par with my experience of staying at, say, Westin, except this room was MUCH quieter.) 3 - The health club is $10 a day, but I heard it was quite nice. If you have HHonors, you can get discounts depending on your level of membership. We decided against it. 4 - The pool looked nice, and no one was in there. That had to be because the music in that room was horribly loud, and the speakers were blown and sounded scratchy and awful. I usually love to soak in the hot tubs, but I had no desire to spend ANY time in there. 5 - On the more nit-picky side: my husband thought the exec level snacks could have been better (I thought they were awesome). Although we requested non-smoking, the room did have a slightly faint odor of smoke to it, as though someone snuck into the bathroom and smoked there. We determined that it was the shower curtain, but it wasn't a strong smell at all. We got used to it immediately, and we did not notice it on our clothing or luggage when we left the building or returned home. The TV was old and had a habit of turning the screen off and on while it was warming up (it stopped eventually). Also, the Potter Bar had only mediocre drinks and small plates of food at expensive hotel prices. All in all, even with the negatives above, we loved our stay and had a great time. I would happily stay at the Palmer House again, provided I had points to knock down the price and got the snazzy upgrade to the exec level.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old hotel didn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: 1treehouse1
Reviews.Content: Grand common areas elevate the experience. Hard to come by such graciousness these days. This alone makes the stay worthwhile. The room was nice and spacious too. Beds were comfy. Superior location. Accommodating, courteous service. Nice gym. Lacks some modern amenities. We had some trouble with internet availability. I would recommend this hotel without question.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: cpolides1
Reviews.Content: I paid $275+taxes for 5 nights at the Palmer House and I can honestly say it was a complete rip-off. It started off bad when they refused to give me Wifi access eventhough it was included in my terms and conditions when I booked. They wanted me to pay the usual $30/day wifi access fee which is ridiculous. You would think if Im paying in excess of $1200 I would at least have wifi access. The rooms are 3 stars. They havent been renovated since 1988ish. The carpets are blanched for overuse. The room smells of mold. The wallpaper was peeling. I felt I needed to search for bedbugs. The bathroom was mediocre. The lobby itself is 5 stars, the rooms 3 stars max. Dont pay over $150 for this..ripoff

Reviews.Title: “Historical hotel with some modern features”
Reviews.Author: FairLady80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palmer House Hilton on business. My initial impression was one of amazement as the ceiling in the lobby area is stunning. Staff are helpful and rooms well appointed. A little disappointed that there was no wi-fi available. Also despite reporting a leaking toilet on Tuesday, by the time I checked out on the Thursday, it still hadn't been taken care of. If you need to take the elevators, allow 5 minutes! Seriously slow and always had to wait for them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Chi-town stay”
Reviews.Author: miletaxia
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very beautiful lobby. My friends and I had two rooms. mine was large and nice but the other not reaching the Hilton standard to me. Good experience overall

Reviews.Title: “Great antique building. Great location but pricey”
Reviews.Author: schulich
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice place to stay. Atmosphere: great looking very nice. Gold plated everything. Lobby is gorgeous. Food: it's ok but way too pricey. Not worth it Rooms: they are ok. Nothing special tho. A bit tired looking. Washrooms need update. Service : good Locale: great. Surrounded by quick bite places like Starbucks n mcdonalds. Minutes walk from art institute. Close to millennium park and the bean. Mag mile us close too. Just like 10 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “The common areas are outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: KP_SpeakerFreak
Reviews.Content: The common areas of the hotel are outstanding. The main lobby area is breath-taking. Walking into that room brings you back! Attention to architectural detail is amazing. The hotel staff are wonderful and attentive; everyone was very polite and seemed genuinely concerned with guest satisfaction. The downside for me was the room size. I didn't spend much time in the room, but what I had was small. The bathroom was tiny and the TV/dresser was somewhat in the way when walking into the room. There was a desk which was key since this was a business trip, but there was no chair to relax in, only a desk chair. The bed was SUPER comfortable! Down pillows, etc. The hotel lobby bar was always crowded with a good atmosphere to relax or grab a drink. Overall a very good hotel and a nice stay. Very conveniently located to shopping and to the lake. Close to the CTA trains as well. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: CraigLMcCloud
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ Palmer House for a good friend's wedding. At check-in was upgraded to Executive Floor Suite (which comes with free breakfast, cocktail hour c/ snacks nightly...very good deal). The room was spacious with 2 full bathrooms. The hotel itself was very nice and well kept. Service was great. Food was wonderful--no complaints. The hotel lobby was unbelievably beautiful with AFTERNOON TEA ! Who does that anymore?!? Very classy and cool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ychamyuen
Reviews.Content: Its location is great, history can be touch through its building. Great services, the room was really comfortable. It just needed acces to Wi-Fi in the room

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SamJUk
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, great location. Stayed on business, but if I was travelling on vacation, i would consider staying at this hotel. The facilities were great, the staff helpful and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our time at the Palmer house!”
Reviews.Author: Anna B
Reviews.Content: We loved our recent stay at the Palmer house. It was our first Chicago experience and the hotel did not disappoint us! We loved all the history of the Palmer house. Our room was nice and cozy and there was lots of great food and experiences close by.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: travelsbydori
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to Chicago for business for years and stayed at many of the top hotels, however, last month when I was in town, there wasn't a room to be found. After much searching, a room came up at the Palmer House. Reluctantly, I booked it as there was no choice. Boy, was I pleasantly surprised and delighted. I can't believe I never heard about this place. Loved the unique look and feel of the place. Everything about hotel itself was just wonderful. A perfect blend of old world opulence and today's hip vibe. A must see and must stay. My room was a little on the small side and would have liked the bathroom vanity to be larger. But it's worth the concession. [However, my colleague had a huge room.] Bed was incredibly comfortable. Concierge staffers were great with recommendations and very helpful. Desk staff that night must have had a bad day - not even a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and excellent overall!”
Reviews.Author: smv0689
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at The Palmer House Hilton and I would definitely visit again! The staff was very helpful and friendly. It was very nice to have the complimentary snacks and the champagne was excellent! The lobby was elegant and very convenient to have Starbucks downstairs! This is a must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellingsuz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and this is a beautiful old hotel. The lobby is amazing. Because it is old it has some updating in need but overall very nice. Service was good but didn't interact with staff much. It is a large property and full of business travellers. Good location to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “The GREAT Palmer House, icon of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: suitcase_10
Reviews.Content: If you care about who you sleep with then you should stay at the Palmer House. Being among international guests only helped to make my recent stay all the more exciting. An impecabbly courteous staff, well appointed rooms, great public areas and "full service" facilities within the hotel make for a most enjoyable stay of "what more could one ask for"? And, there's more, location, location, location - excellent - in the heart of the loop convenient to public transport such as trains, busses and taxis. Convenient parking too in the hotels own indoor garage. The historic ambience makes the Palmer House a true gem!

Reviews.Title: “Older, but Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrm4013
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here while attending a trade show. The hotel is obviously older, but classy and historic (Although, I never found out why it's historic). The lobby floor is actually one level up from the street, which isn't that unusual for Chicago. The lobby bar and lounge area was very nice, and crowded during cocktail hours. My room was clean and larger than I expected. The bathroom was tiny, but again that's a older hotel in Chicago. My room actually had a fireplace (although it appeared to be just for looks). You do hear the trains regularly, but that didn't bother me too much. While my status with Hilton gives me free WiFi during my stay, I never was able to get it to work. My only other complaint is the free continental breakfast offered on the Executive Level was so crowded both times I went up that there was no place to sit. I ended up just walking down the street to McDonald's. This is the second time I've stayed here and I'd do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, with average size rooms and small bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: KCA71
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal through Priceline, which made this a good value. The lobby, with bar and restaurant, is grand- makes you want to sit and have a drink. The rooms, however, had the older carpet and drapes; also a decorative fireplace. Small bathroom, but very comfy bed. I would go more modern next time.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION! LOCATION! LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Marie J
Reviews.Content: As a native of Chicago and former resident of Austin on the West Side, I was delighted to be able to walk to the Art Institute and Millennium Park instead of needing public transportation or a cab. Some interesting restaurants were also within walking distance. Our room was lovely. Staff was extremely friendly and courteous. I hope I can stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: CJHoffman
Reviews.Content: Expensive, but well located in the heart of Chicago. A walk to Hancock Tower and great location for State Street shopping. Art Museum just a few blocks away. Staff very nice. The bell captain arranged for someone to take our bags up to the train platform--and he wouldn't accept a tip after doing it for us. Breakfast (didn't have the pricey buffet) downstairs the morning we left was just ok--I would have gone somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hype - not value”
Reviews.Author: VJZR
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is great on location, so-so on anything else. Be prepared to part with money, nothing is included with the room -- including a morning cup of coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel...just a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: juicebox48060
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a prime location. It is close to public transit, shopping and lots of good food. The downside is that internet is 20 a night and the breakfast is also really expensive. I understand it is a luxury hotel but the quality of the food is not worth that price.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to spend days in Chi-town”
Reviews.Author: xicolopes
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two very nice nights in the Palmer House last October 21-22, electing the executive level rooms for the added comfort and convenience. While a bit more pricey than regular rooms, the executive level included a continental breakfast and a happy hour, both with substantial offerings of good , solid foods. In this regard, don't let the title "continental breakfast" fool you. It included hot and cold cereals, cold cuts, a broad assortment of rolls, coffee and teas. Alcoholic drinks were available during happy hour at a reasonable price (champagne cocktails for 6 dollars each). The rooms were LARGE, very clean and comfortable. Within walking distance of the Civic Opera House (which we attended both nights) and the Art Museum (be sure to check out the new addition to the museum) and north Michigan Avenue, the Palmer House is an ideal spot from which to launch your sightseeing of the windy city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: kpham04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for Lollapalooza and it was perfect. It is a bit older so don't expect a snazzy modern room. The walls are also a bit thin, but that is expected of any hotel. The hotel is beautifully decorated, the HHonors line is great and it was perfectly located by the metro station as well as right by Grant park. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DeeJayVA
Reviews.Content: Was in Chicago on a business trip. Located downtown, close to a CTA stop, walking distance from the Willis Tower and the Millenium Park. Even though it is an older building, the hotel is well maintained and very comfortable. The last time I was there, I got a small room, but the folks at the reception asked me when I was checking in. Had high-speed internet access, so no complaints on that. Courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: meowable
Reviews.Content: this is a very beautiful old hotel. a lot of really nice touches. bed is comfy as are the pillows. was very disappointed there wasn't a coffee maker or fridge in the room though. great location for both convention as well as tourists things. and very close to the monroe exit of the train. the gym is really great - didn't see the pool, but heard it was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's Palmer House Hilton a triumph of style”
Reviews.Author: srschrier
Reviews.Content: What can one say about the Chicago Palmer House Hilton, the oldest continuously open hotel in North America (established 1871). The Hilton's landmark standards of quality and elegance are greatly welcomed and appreciated by returning guests such as myself. Although this is the "oldest" hotel in the United States the modern quality is apparent from first arrival in the beautiful atrium to the very modern & comfortable updated guest rooms. Continuous quality improvement has always been apparent during my visits over many years. The hotel's well managed and the staff very professional showing the greatest courtesy towards guests. Well worth a visit for many reasons, a superb big city Hilton hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GAhiker
Reviews.Content: A group of runners travelled from Georgia to run the Chicago Marathon. The majority of the 20 or so folks stayed here. It is an interesting historic hotel with great architectual features inside. Great old history, from the Peacock brass doors to the painting on the ceiling in the lobby and bar area. The service was wonderful. Check in was easy and they had a little extra from those guests running the race. We were memebers of the HH club. I highly recommend getting this service on the 23rd floor. Breakfast was good, better than most continential breakfasts. In addition you had space to spread out during the day, watch tv or read. At 5pm they have happy hour ( no free booze) and the food again was great. It was enough encourage you to wait a little for dinner, stay out late, and see the city nightlife. It is located right next to the "EL" and two blocks from the Art institute. Great food and sights are all within walking distance. the rooms were small - i will warn you - but clean and comfortable. That was really the only disappointment. Other than that it was great.

Reviews.Title: “$7 an hour for Wi-fi??”
Reviews.Author: Ellen091
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well placed - the room was fine even if the view was a brick wall and the wash basin badly cracked, but given the Loop is outside it was blissfully quiet. Registration was slow to put it mildly - just two receptionists and a long line of weary people trying to be patient. The staff attitude is perhaps best described as 'take it or leave it' - both on the desk and in the very expensive Lobby bar. Except for the people on the Concierge desk who were unfailingly polite, friendly and helpful. My main compaint was access to wi-fi and the cost - none in the rooms and a $7 per hour charge which had to be paid by credit card each time - for overseas visitors this means transaction costs each time. AND if you only use thirty minutes of the hour you have paid for you lose the rest - no mechanism for logging back in to the time you've paid for.The Starbucks in the hotel charges the same even though another branch a few minutes away, as usual, doesn't charge at all. Overall The hotel made me grumpy - portrays itself as up market - in price, and it is an interesting building, but until they stop making guests feel they're being ripped off they can't claim to be 'up market'.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: karengab
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 20-23 October for business. I couldn't help but notice that some of the "basic" rooms were MUCH smaller than others. Same for the bathrooms. The room I had was small but I had a king size bed. Not much room for more than 2 peopleâ€¦and I think even that would be tight. The hotel is old but they have put in an effort to keep it updated with the furnishings. The rooms are cleanâ€¦the entire hotel is clean. Staff are friendly. It is a huge hotel and there were a lot of people. It is located in a nice part of the city and it is close to a lot of great shopping. I never needed to take a cab to the magnificent mile (about 15 minutes to walk), and you are close to the Macyâ€™s, JC Penny, etc along State street. Overall, a very good experience and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago experience”
Reviews.Author: suamadre
Reviews.Content: This famous hotel has a beautiful lobby, our room was clean and fresh smelling. The elevators are prompt, once you understand how different floors use different elevators. The cleaning staff were outstanding! They are very friendly and ready to assit with you with whatever your need. The location is perfect for seeing the city of Chicago. It is located within the "loop" practically walking distance to many tourist locations. Needless to say, when I return to Chicago I will surely plan a stay at the Palmer House. Just a side note, this is the place that created the first Brownie. And they still make them from the original recipe you must try one at least!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Elegant, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: asiapointriders
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Palmer House Hilton while on business in Chicago. The room was spacious, a two bed, two bath upgrade due to a reservation hiccup, but the bathroom was so small it was hard to turn around and use the facilities, if you know what I mean. Like, really tiny. We were on the 21st floor with a great view of buildings and thankful for the heavy drapes that kept all those twinling lights outside where they belong. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet; it's crowded in the mornings and coffee service is slow, but the spread was fresh and filling, and covered everything from lox and smoked trout to oatmeal and scrambled eggs. Elevators are slow during morning and evening "rush hour" but our longest wait was only 5 minutes. The place is chock full of history. The staff even pointed out some secret escape hatches carefully concealed in the panelling of some rooms, and rumor has it Al Capone and other shady legends used these to disappear and escape to the streets when necessary! The lobby boasts a painted ceiling that one could gaze upon for hours and never take in all the detail. Wow. No charge just for looking! The Palmer House is in a great location, a block or so off Michigan Ave and an easy walk to Millenium Park, uptown, shopping, Marilyn Monroe statue, and tons of museums, restaurants, and other attractions we didn't have time to visit. There are a subway and a mcdonalds right by the hotel, which is a big help for a quick, cheap, meal. Although our room was huge, I did get to peek into some of the ones with just one bed. Wow. I am not sure there is room for luggage in there, so consider asking to see your room before you fork over $250-$300/night. It might be worth the upgrade. The staff was friendly, and the place was sparkling clean. I would stay at the Palmer House again, and I bet it is really decked out during the Holidays! Enjoy your stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: gail911
Reviews.Content: Great service, accommodations, food and experience..One of the best stays at any hotel we've gone to.

Reviews.Title: “Not so posh rooms”
Reviews.Author: 2007Traveler
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Palmer House and thought I was getting a great deal online but found I got only what I paid for. The lobby and common areas are very upscale and fancy. The room I was in however, not quite so posh. The room was very small, which wasn't an issue, though for the record, a full size bed is really not meant for two people. Unless those two people enjoy sleeping perfectly straight with their arms at their sides. The carpet and wallpaper looked pretty dingy. And even with some nice, new furniture, etc, the hotel rooms had more of an "old hotel" feel than an "historic hotel" feel. I also had to call room service twice for a wine key, and finally got one over 20 minutes later. In the morning, the wait for the elevator down took 15 minutes, so if you have a train to catch, make sure you leave some extra time to get out of the hotel! If I had paid full price for my stay, I would have been a bit unhappy. Luxury rates for not such luxurious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok...”
Reviews.Author: sanders16
Reviews.Content: The lobby was wonderful and the staff was very friendly. But...the room was nothing special. The wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the mattress was rock-hard, and the TV was from 1997. And, I had a nice view outside my window of the fire escape. The bathroom was very nice, however, with a nice showerhead and big thick towels, and it was very clean. However, overall the room was a disappointment. The rest of the hotel was very nice, though. I would probably look for a different hotel my next trip to Chicago. I like the location here, but I'm really using the room the most, so when it is a disappointment, I feel like I'm not getting everything I should be getting, especially for the cost of a room here.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: wamslem
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Palmer House for business. I had stayed there maybe 15 years ago. It has been remodeled beautifully. The rooms are large and tastefully done. The staff are extremely courteous. It's on the Loop, and an easy walk to Millennium Park, the Art Institute, the Magnificent Mile, and Lake Michigan. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A step into elegant history”
Reviews.Author: nlester
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel, therefore the rooms are small, the decor is reminiscent of the Hollywood era. Beds are comfortable, lots of electrical outlet and an extension cord. One thing, if you get late check-out there will be added cost. The staff is very helpful, friendly, and polite. We ate lunch in the Lockwood restaurant in the hotel. Prices were reasonable, i.e. sandwiches less than $15. Drinks are expensive to me, a glass of wine was $11. You are just a couple of blocks from the Grant Park, and the Chicago Art Museum. Hotel has good location, good transportation available.

Reviews.Title: “Good and elegant.”
Reviews.Author: Hornet_72
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in perfect location ! The hotel is located in a heart of Chicago downtown. 7 blocks to Willis Tower (formerly Sears Tower), close to the Lake Michigan, just round the corner the famous "Route 66" begins. Shops, cinema and Chicago Theatre are close to the hotel. There are shops and Starbaks coffee in the hotel also. Rooms are clean, staff is wiling to give any info you need. Very professional and friendly. All the best to Tatiana from the front desk. The hotel is a bit expensive but worth to stay there at least one time..:)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Palmer House Hilton”
Reviews.Author: JAP_20
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night while we were in town for the Chicago marathon. This was our second time staying here (stayed here in 2009 for the marathon). The service was great. The room was clean. They even let any guest running the marathon have a late check out which was nice because we didn't have to rush after running. We really enjoyed staying here and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's hotel with the right attitude”
Reviews.Author: MikeTLondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed 4 nights at The Palmer House in Chicago, October 12th -15th, 2011. I have stayed at this hotel the previous year, and it is an older hotel, but one of character and elegance. Located in The Chicago Loop area, and close to theatres and shopping, the real bonus is the friendliness of the staff. While there we stayed on the Executive floors, which included access to The Executive Lounge and offered up a lovely deluxe continental breakfast, with the best porrtidge I have ever had, and a very enjoyable afternoon Happy Hour which included hot hors d'ouvres and a fully stocked bar. Beer, wine and mixed drinks were at extra charge, but the hors d'ouvres and soft drinks, coffee, etc. were all complimentary with our Executive floor rooms. Ernest, who kept the tables clear of dishes from our snacks, offerd his own brand of friendliness that was very genuine. The staff always acknowledged us, especially the maids every morning and evening when we walked to or from our comfortable room. At one point, while my wife and I sat in the Lobby bar, a security person named Dave, came over and politely asked my wife to not hang her purse off the back of her chair, as it was a temptation to pick-pockets. We appreciated his vigelance. Everyone there was what you hope to experience when you travel. I would completely reccomend this hotel for anyone enjoying the sights and sounds of one of my favorite destinations, Chicago. Mike T. London, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience!”
Reviews.Author: RetNavy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the oldest in the city, having been rebuilt after the fire of 1871. It was a great experience not only in being able to stay downtown in Chicago but to be surrounded in history where I stayed. I highly recommend this establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Go there to eat and drink, but be careful of the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: cvmadison
Reviews.Content: I had a relatively enjoyable stay at the Palmer House. I will say that the concierge and bell staff is absolutely exceptional. For example, I had a question about parking and asked the bell man. He was unable to answer me, but then later sought me out to give me an answer. That is above and beyond service and is definetely appreciated. I have stayed at the Palmer House several times. The first time I had the lovely accomodations which included two bathrooms and absolutely fabulous fixtures and finishes. The second time I was put into a room where the wall paper was falling off the wall, the fixtures were rusted, and the tile in the bathroom was moldy. I literally threw a fit and was granted a free voucher for my next stay. That brings me to my most recent stay. I was once again put into a not-very-nice room with rusty fixtures, a dirty bathroom, and scratched furniture. Since it was free, I was okay with it. But thank goodness I was only staying one night. I travel quite a bit, and I will tell you that I've stayed in nicer hotels in the middle of nowhere Wisconsin (for example the AmericInn). The lobby of the Palmer House is outstanding. The vibe is wonderful, the restoration is beautifully done. The food and drink is delicious. My recommendation is that the Hilton people find a way to improve their dumpy rooms ASAP. I will continue to recommend the Palmer house for a drink and dinner, but will advise all travelers to be sure to specify one of the suite rooms (green decor) if they choose to stay there. Otherwise, you are better off at one of the other fabulous hotels that Chicago has to offer in its downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Classic Hotel With Traditional Charm”
Reviews.Author: bobandrewsjr
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the Palmer House and stay there every time I come to Chicago (8+ times per year on business). If you like the feel of older classic luxury hotels (big rooms, windows open, smoking rooms still available, spectacular lobby) and want to be in the heart of Chicago (close to the Art Museum/Grant Park, one block from Michigan Ave, right next to the L), then definitely consider the Palmer House. It is kind of place that make you wish the walls could talk because there such a sense of history there. Staff is fantastic as well - it all makes for a truly enjoyable visit to one of best cities.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating Stay”
Reviews.Author: russell c
Reviews.Content: General Manager Palmer House Hotel Delivered via email (commentsph@hilton.com) October 22, 2011 Dear Sir or Madam: I stayed in room XXX at the hotel recently, and I was very disappointed with aspects of the room and of the service. As a Hilton customer for many years, and a former Diamond HHonors member, Iâ€™ve had the opportunity to stay in many Hilton properties. The problems I noted make me wonder if you ever visit or use the average rooms in your hotel (you should, if you donâ€™t). I also wonder why these things are not reported to maintenance by the housekeeping staff. Is there no QA or QC function that randomly tests all aspects of a room (there should be, if thereâ€™s not)? Closet The closet door will not stay open, so while I was standing in the closet working with my clothes, it kept hitting me in my back. The string on the closet light is way too long and right in your face and shoulders when trying to get your clothes. A hotel of this type should have a wall switch, at least, or more appropriately a switch built into the jamb so that the light comes on when the door is opened. At the very least, the light string should not be placed so as to hit people in the face when they try to use the closet. Bathroom Again, the door wonâ€™t stay in the closed position without being latched. The room is so small that the door canâ€™t be left in the fully open position when showering. So, you have no choice but to latch it, which causes an excessive amount of moisture in the room, due to no active ventilation, as evidenced by peeling paint on the ceiling. Due, I suppose to the passive vent being in the shower, the curtain wants to suck in to the shower, giving a person no room to shower. To avoid that, one must rest it on the tub lip, and then the floor floods. The placement of the soap holders on the side wall of the shower is in the almost exact position someone has to stand in to use the shower, which makes the shower extremely narrow in that critical spot. The lack of thought that goes into things like this never ceases to amaze me. Put those things on the front or back wall (or just nearer the front or back of the sidewall), and the problem is solved. Given the curtain sucking in and the soap holder placement, itâ€™s a very narrow shower, indeed! The lighting globes were installed crookedly, and the GFI outlet was amazingly crooked. Donâ€™t you or your staff have any pride in how your rooms look? Service The TV listing in your Guest Directory is inaccurate â€“ the channels do not match up with the TV. Do you know how frustrating it is to try and watch TV after a long day of travel and work, and you have no idea what channel is what. Itâ€™s very frustrating to try to find the channels and to remember where they are. I pointed the problem out to the front desk clerk (Vera, I think, on 10-18), and she seemed surprised. It would not be a surprise if there was a QA function. Who is charged with keeping that book up to date? What else was wrong it in (e.g., safety information)? I asked the front desk for an updated listing that morning before I left for work, and I didnâ€™t get it â€“ nor did I get an explanation of why I didnâ€™t get it â€“ very sorry service. I assume my book was not the only one outdated, so all of your customers are suffering. When I attempted to use the Zip-Out checkout on the phone, I only heard a few clicks and then another dial tone. There was nothing in the instructions on the phone or on the receipt to indicate thatâ€™s the way it worked. As it seemed to be malfunctioning, I waited in a long line at the front desk to checkout - again, a very frustrating encounter that could have been easily avoided by disclosing simple information. Someone (everyone?) at the hotel needs to approach the hotel through the customerâ€™s eyes. I donâ€™t want to be frustrated while in my hotel. If I stay at the Palmer House again, how will you ensure these things donâ€™t recur? The receipt says to send feedback to commentsph@hilton.com, but if that is supposed to be a web link, it doesnâ€™t work. I hope it works as an email address. Sincerely,

Reviews.Title: “Historic Beauty”
Reviews.Author: Alice C
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend staying at the Palmer House. Chicago is well known for its architecture, and this historic hotel is a perfect example. The lobby is breathtakingly beautiful, and the location is excellent. We were very close to the Art Institute and Grant Park, and we had easy access to the L (rail). Shopping, theatre, great restaurants, and live music venues were all minutes away by foot, rail, or taxi. The valet service was also helpful, but I do not recommend driving in Chicago. The traffic is horrendous. Try to look for good deals, either by booking early or through various sites. These rooms can get pricey. We stayed on the executive floors and enjoyed a nice evening snack and private breakfast service on our floor. While I loved the Victorian furniture in our room, it would have been nice to see a more updated bathroom and at least a small flat screen TV (ours was a old "tube"). While we spent most of our time out in the city, my husband and I like to watch the news and sports highlights while we get ready every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotels The Way They Use To Be”
Reviews.Author: ConchKid
Reviews.Content: Found myself and my wife stranded in Chicago by South West Airlines. Sice they blamed air traffic control the hotel was on me so I decided to turn a negative into a positive. Booked a room here at the Palmer House and I wasn't disappointed. There are newer hotels in Chicago but the Palmer House still remains one of the best. From front desk efficiency to a wonder view from our room of the Chicago Loop, everything was perfect. The bed was so comfortable we almost overslept and missed our flight home. This is a classic hotel and wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: pdiaz1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a stay at the Palmer House Hilton for a weekend in Chicago. The staff was really nice at checkin. We stopped at the bar a couple of times and the bartender was quite pleasant. It is close to a lot of things one would want to do in Chicago - Michigan Avenue, Skywalk, Art Museum, etc. The hotel is a little dated and the parking situation is not favorable ($38/night) but from what I have read, any place in Chicago costs just as much. Overall was happy with the location and would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Historic hotel, ask for renovated room”
Reviews.Author: TGU-ORD
Reviews.Content: If you have a priceline/hotwire reservation you will get a non renovated noisy room...that is the rumor I heard in the lobby waiting to be checked in but fortunately I book at hilton website. Got a bargain rate so decided to do a weekend staycation! Checkin was busy, long line, but I am Hilton honors so went express to that line and check in was quick. I think they also have a dedicated honors elevator. Room was nice, classical dÃ©cor, very spacious, renovated bathroom, all is functional. But it does have that â€œvintageâ€� look, it depends on your taste. I am more of a contemporary look kind of person, but really appreciated the classic look, it is a historic hotel, it has a grand lobby. Well kept up. Very busy though, so although everybody was friendly, did not get very personalized interactions with staff. I had access to lounge, afternoon snacks, limited and ok choice, same with breakfast. This lounge was always packed, too loud and crowded, but it is always nice to have access to lounge for coffee. Hotel has great location for shopping, theater shows, or close to a lot of business. Chicago has very good hotels and a lot of them, so competition is fierce, but if you want a historic hotel, with a comfortable stay, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Hope you have an extra half hour to get to your room”
Reviews.Author: ronskin
Reviews.Content: This outdated hotel has significant problems with its elevator system and card readers. 3 days in a row I was denied access to my floor and the executive lounge. Hotel staff rekeyed and issue still continued. They said we know, you just have to deal with it. Unnaceptable. Stay at the Hyatt. Better property, cleaner, better lounge nicer staff. The Palmer House is old and they refuse to maintain it. Walpaper falling off the walls, mildew on the bathroom tiles, musty smell, and a mile walk to your room once you get to the floor your on. The lounge food is cheap and not worthy of the HILTON name. I will not be back until they fix he elevators. DOnt say I didnt warn you. THat why they have sofas in the elevator area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: GabrielaCh
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for the marathon last October 9, and stayed in this perfect located hotel (for the marathon and everything else!). Checking-in was fast and efficient. We used the Concierge several times (charging a cell-phone, asking for directions, recommendations for restaurants) and were polite and helpful each time. The bed and the pillows were VERY comfortable but the noise coming from the 'chimneys' outside was a bit annoying (we stayed on the 9th floor), otherwise, a very pleasant stay. We loved the cafÃ© around the corner, good food and coffee, free wifi. Our room was always clean however in the halls, there were always food and drinks (from room service) laying on the floor for hours and hours, even overnight without being picked up by the maids, which was disappointing for a Hilton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: galexa07
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for the marathon last October 9, and stayed in this perfect located hotel (for the marathon and everything else!). Checking-in was fast and efficient. We used the Concierge several times (charging a cell-phone, asking for directions, recommendations for restaurants) and were polite and helpful each time. The bed and the pillows were VERY comfortable but the noise coming from the 'chimneys' outside was a bit annoying (we stayed on the 9th floor), otherwise, a very pleasant stay. We loved the cafÃ© around the corner, good food and coffee, free wifi. Our room was always clean however in the halls, there were always food and drinks (from room service) laying on the floor for hours and hours, even overnight without being picked up by the maids, which was disappointing for a Hilton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: mca353
Reviews.Content: It just gets 2 out of five points because to get only one from me you have to make me sleep on the floor! Horrible!!!!!!!!!!!!! I booked it on hotwire. 130$ per night, 2 people. We arrive there and they say that hotwire doesn't guarantee 2 single beds and so they don't have them (unless we pay 20 $ more, so this means they have them!!!). For us it was ok to stay in one bed, but they gave us a SINGLE QUEEN bed, and as we are two boys we don't obviously fit! Expecting a king size, we call and the best they could offer was a KING in a SMOKING room. Hoping it was more or less ok we accepted. It was literally a smoking room, like those in the airports: it was even impossible to breathe inside there. Really disappointed, after that they've been making fun of us for more than an hour, we complain again and finally we get something decent (acceptable, but still a rob for me): a SINGLE room with an additional temporary bed. BUT WE PAID FOR A DOUBLE. We felt like thieves there!!! I will never go there anymore unless I'll be able to afford the top suites at full price. Never ever dare to book them on hotwire (and similar I would say)! And the staff was so unpleasant and really not friendly at all, caring only about who had the Hilton club card (whatever it is called). I still wonder how that hotel could be part of the Hilton network after my experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand old hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: Berkeley_Trader
Reviews.Content: Spent the first weekend in October here in 2011. Nice older hotel with a grand lobby, the Palmer House reminds me of hotels like the St Francis in San Francisco, the William Penn in Pittsburgh and the Biltmore in Los Angeles. It is a grand property with very nice public spaces. Well located for both loop businesses and situated very near the Art Institute/Millenium Park. The rooms are nice, clean and a bit dated. The front desk is very professional and courteous, but can get a bit overwhelmed during check out hour. A great tip for those shopping on the Miracle Mile is to take the $4 Shoreline Water Taxi from under this Michigan Ave bridge to the Union Station-Sears/Willis Tower instead of walking back. The walk is the same distance, but you'll get to ride past Marina City, the new Boeing Headquarters, the Lyric and more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: oconnorn
Reviews.Content: My friend and i stayed at this Hotel for 4 nights in August. We arrived into O'Hare Airport and hopped on the L Train for 40 mins approx to Monroe. The hotel was just around the corner from the L stop, very convenient. We were given a room on the 18th floor. The room was a great size with 2 very comfortable double beds and 2 bathrooms. The hotel is just a 5 min stroll to nearby Grant Park. The Bike n Roll and Segways are only a 10 min walk away from the hotel. There is a bus stop right at the corner on the Grant Park side that will bring you along Michigan Avenue. The only negative we experienced with this hotel was the fact that they charged my friend's credit card twice for the cost of the room...most annoying when we were traveling to 3 more States within the US. Numerous phone calls and unnecessary time spent on hold being transferred from one department to another, the mess finally got sorted. This is something that easily could have gone unnoticed, thankfully my friend was careful at checking the charges to her credit card. It took 3 days to rectify this problem. Too long really.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you get it at the right price”
Reviews.Author: scotsonholiday
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business recently - and didn't manage to get a cheap price, but was late booking. It is a very historic hotel right in the middle of the loop area of downtown Chicago -very well placed for most of the big attractions. The foyer is fantastic, and you can feel the history in the walls - but the bedrooms are pretty ordinary for those who pay the full price. There is very limited wifi and it is expensive (although the starbucks across the street (not the one in the hotel) has got free access!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DEI2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick overnight trip to Chicago with my wife. We got this hotel through Priceline at $83/night. Check-in was easy, the (waiting in line) greeter was friendly, and the representative that checked me in was very nice. The lobby was nice. This is an older hotel, so it wasn't as open and airy as many of the others, but it was clean, and I enjoyed the historic aspect of it. The lounge/bar area was comfortable, and the staff was all very friendly. We were given a room on the 14th floor. Our view was the side of a building with an alleyway, but it wasn't a big deal. There was a light to mild smell of smoke in our non-smoking room, but it didn't bother us too much. The beds were soft, and comfortable. The bathroom, although modernized, was very small. We used the wi-fi in the lobby, but the in room wifi had a charge, which I consider a huge ripoff. Parking cost me $38 for one night, as long as I was out of the garage by 5:00pm the next day. Ridiculous, but I guess it goes with all big city hotels. Did not try the restaurant. Overall, I would come back at the rate we paid. Pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great get away”
Reviews.Author: Catomy
Reviews.Content: I'm from Chicago Just wanted a 4 day stay downtown, stayed at the Palmer house. Wonderful. Had tea, took the historical tour of the Palmer house, loved it. Room was clean bed nice and comfy. Sitting in the lobby having a cocktail was such a pleasure, I look forward to having this experience again and again

Reviews.Title: “Great History, Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa A
Reviews.Content: A positive experience from many angles. Room was fine, and lobby / bar / reception room upstairs fabulous - so pretty we sat and took pictures of the ceiling architecture. Conveniently located, easy to catch hop-on hop-off bus about 1 block away. Connected to shops indoors, nice to browse while waiting for friends. Somewhat overpriced, but very interesting to stay in such an old, historic hotel with some gorgeous public main rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not all all impressed”
Reviews.Author: MannyScotch
Reviews.Content: I try to stay at Hilton properties however I was not impressed with this hotel. It has so much history to it that you would think service would be amazing or al least what u would expect from a Hilton. Everything was just average. The bed was very uncomfortable. Sorry I won't be back until things improve.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Vivien K
Reviews.Content: I stayed for six nights at the end of September on a trip from the UK with my daughter, to see the architecture, art and sculpture of Chicago. Both the hotel and Chicago were fabulous. I had asked for a quiet room away from the elevators and on a higher floor and this was assigned with no problem. All the staff were friendly and helpful and all the sites within easy reach either by walking or catching the train. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, but bad hotel for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Bobwphilly
Reviews.Content: Nice classic hotel, but doing business or work in this hotel is awful. Internet blocked if available, no wifi in rooms. Stop in in the lobby for ambiance, then head to a real hotel to get your work done.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, good ambience”
Reviews.Author: toerist
Reviews.Content: Just took a break in Chicago to see architecture, museums, take in some plays, etc.. Selected for location and that could not be better. Good service at check-in. Room was fine, did have a Chicago-type view. Furnished for a single business traveller but when we asked for another bed-side lamp it arrived promptly. Bathroom needs some upgrading but very comfortable overall. Had dinner in Lockwoods on arrival and breakfast on last day; both were good & not unreasonable. Great lobby. We would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “All the Hotel Development Money was Spent in the Lobby and Very Little in the Sleeping Rooms”
Reviews.Author: optimusprimeiowa
Reviews.Content: So my friend Jim has been telling me that he prefers Hilton and I tell him that I prefer Marriott. So I decided to go "out of brand" for a stay. I am so sorry that I did. When you walk into the lobby of the Palmer House Hilton, you will be overwhelmed by the beautiful lobby. They must have spent millions $$$ on the public areas. The areas outside of the elevators are spacious and that is where the spaciousness comes to an end. The room that we had was so small and a beautiful window that looked out onto a roof HVAC area with quite a bit of trashed sitting around. (Room 10-212) This room had the smallest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel and I travel a lot! The toilet was situated between a vanity top and a wall with about 20 inches of room. I won't go into any more. The wallpaper is peeling in the bathroom and the floor is supposed to be white tile I believe. Check-in was long and frustrating. The lines were terrible and the staff appeared to confused. Every front desk transaction seemed to baffle the staff there. The rooms at the hotel are not cheap. Parking is not cheap and it seems to be the biggest rip off to pay so much for so little. If you want to stay here, that is up to you but you will never see me back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OKay”
Reviews.Author: windyks
Reviews.Content: We booked through priceline.com (first time using priceline). The price was $190 for a king bed on the weekend of the Chicago Marathon. Not bad. Rooms were clean though the hotel was an older classic property. Service was good. We would have preferred to be closer to the 600 block Michigan Ave which is more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: swahl
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago to celebrate our 30th anniversary. My own fault I went through Priceline to book the hotel and took our chances that a 4* rating would give us what we want. The hotel is absolutely beautiful! Definitely rate it at least a 4* if not higher. The staff were nice - I wouldn't say exceptional. The room was a huge disappointment. Very small King room. The bathroom was 3* or less due to it's size and decor. If you have a bad back, you would not be able to reach the tp. It was also very dark.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Surroundings, Average Service”
Reviews.Author: Carilynne
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton is an outstanding property, situated very close to many of the museums (most notably a short walk down a block or so to the Chicago Art Institute). The history is fascinating and the decor is stunning. The rooms are well appointed, but alas, missing most of the complimentary amenities (such as free or ANY in-room Wi-Fi, coffee maker) making it necessary to shell out for any extras, whether for wired in-room internet or a coffee at the downstairs Starbucks. If you're used to luxury hotels, this won't come as a surprise. If you're used to mid-range hotels who put out a lot of amenities to compete, you'll not find that kind of "free" here. For example, you pay to use the fitness centre, which is very clean with the standard equipment. The concierge service in this hotel is remarkably poor for such a classy place. You pretty much have to do your own research unless it's for basic directions. I think with some advanced notice they could accommodate you, but were weak when asked things on the fly. On the upside, they do have a written list of restaurants really close by with great after-hours dining if you'd rather not spend time at the bistro in their beautiful lobby. However, it's probably good to know they will always recommend their hotel dining (even if for a coffee--kind of lame). Along with being a very old building, the walls are thin and you can hear a lot of noise between the rooms and halls. Nothing that kept me awake. On a sad note, on the last day of our stay my mom had an empty purse stolen from our room. The security took this concern very seriously, but it didn't result in any satisfaction. We were left wondering if the hotel staff took it, or a stranger walking by with the door open (as they maid service doesn't seem very conscientious about security when cleaning rooms). I did enjoy my stay (for business purposes) but I probably wouldn't stay there again on a personal vacation, unless my trip was to see the Chicago Art Institute (location can't be beat!) and splurge on a bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Style and Location with Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Valaorc
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean, decor is 'average' and most views fairly poor. But the point of this hotel is to get out of the room and it is here that it delivers. Great staff, great location (very close to key trains - leave your car at home), fantastic history. Sitting in the lobby bar and just experiencing the surroundings is well worth an hour or two.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent 1925 unbelievable lively hotel that feels pure Chicago thru and thru!”
Reviews.Author: ZzZzzzzzzzzzzzjjhh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palmer House a couple of times now. Would definately Pprecommend! Recently did Mr. Ken Price"s lunch tour in hotels Lockwood Res. And personal tour for $50 totally worth it! Still think about! I am a Chicagoan and go downtown often, always stop it in to visit and admire, look at lobby and people watch, always feel welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Business Property with Class”
Reviews.Author: Nancy C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palmer House for five nights while attending a national conference in Chicago. What a delightful experience! The hotel is nicely located a short block plus from the south end of Michigan's busy district and a 'stone's throw' from the Art Museum, the theatre district, and Symphony Hall. Macy's is on the next block and many restaurants are close by. From the afternoon I arrived until the evening I departed the entire staff was always friendly and attentive to my needs (hats off to Youssef in the restaurant and Rey the bellman). My room was facing Monroe with a peek of the lake - I got a bit of morning sun - and was comfortable and spacious. It was very quiet on my floor and I barely heard another guest even passing by. I had breakfast each morning in the Lockwood restaurant and even though I am on a special diet I found several items I could enjoy. (I recommend the fresh sauteed veggies and eggs or the quiche and veggie options.) There was also a nice, but limited, breakfast buffet. The hotel has a nice lobby bar with a light meal option plus afternoon high tea. In the evenings the other restaurants seemed busy all the time. The Business Center on the seventh floor had all I needed (at a price) and was available 24/7. The lobby has free WIFI, but the in-room internet is pricey. The fitness center was also available when I could get there, but since the weather was glorious and the city park was only a block away, I walked outside amid the flowers most days. I used the free luggage storage service to hold my bags on the last day - made my meeting less of a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: Rooms are extremely small. No wireless Internet. There updated rooms have a flat screen TV but there are a bunch of wires sticking out all over the place. The elevators didn't work for the 23rd floor access and I had to go to the front desk twice to get it fixed

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with lots of history”
Reviews.Author: Pookie188
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend here for only one night earlier this week. The place is very cool & nostalgic. The staff is very helpful, pleasant and always smiling. The rooms were nice (not huge, normal for older hotels), clean and decorated like the rest of the hotel in a 20's movie star style. Beds were comfy too. We ordered room service and I was amazed at how good the food was. We both had the roasted chicken and I also had the mushroom soup. Since I was in and out of the room in under 16 hours I didn't get to walk around much however, the train is close by and there were a lot of shops and a starbucks across that stayed open later than the one in the hotel. There is no coffee maker in the room but, the gentleman who delivered room service said we just needed to request one and they would bring it for us. Side note: I didnt know the history of the hotel before arriving but, my cab driver filled me in. Chicago cab drivers are always very helpful :0)

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls. Even though it is a nicely remodeled hotel you can't sleep. You can hear anything going on in the room next to you.”
Reviews.Author: nduquesnay
Reviews.Content: Good location and decent rooms. The maids need to clean better and the food needs some work. Most irritating was the thin walls and having to feel like the people next door may as well have been in my room.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hilton, not the best, nor the worst”
Reviews.Author: Ascottowers
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago an awful lot for work and I have been lucky to stay at a lot of properties in the Windy City. I was excited I was booked into the Palmer House and was expecting a real treat. Sadly, after 2 nights in the property I left feeling somewhat indifferent about the place. I arrived after a long flight and a long wait at immigration so I was looking forward to getting to my room quickly and freshening up. The first thing that put me off was the pink light bulbs in the overhang on East Monroe. It makes the hotel look like something out of Fremont Street in Las Vegas. And then the fact that you need to find your way to registration, dragging your luggage up the stairway. There are escalators and elevators but they're at the back of the street level floor. I found them on the 2nd day but they were not apparent when I arrived. The line at the HHonors desk was longer than the standard one and staff seemed to take an age to serve folks. Armed with my key cards I headed up to the 19th floor and to my room. Because of the sheer number of rooms and corridors, it did seem like a bit of a labyrinth to find my room. The room itself was ok, but paper and paint were peeling off the wall and the TV was a 1990s clunky Philips version. There were no free bottles of water in the room nor a coffee machine. The bathroom was fine, complete with Peter Roth shampoos and conditioners. The bed was comfortable but there was no wireless internet, just standard wired version. So - like The Drake Hilton - totally useless if you want to use your iPhone or iPad. I had access to the exec lounge on the 23rd floor but it's very odd. As soon as you arrive in the elevator, you walk straight into the lounge. The free breakfast was ok, not the best, unless you like filling up on carbs (pastries, cereals, bagels etc). The only healthy option was apples and bananas. They have a bar service in the evening but you have to pay for liquor, so I don't get how it offers anything different from the bar in the lobby area. The fitness area is nice, it's on the 8th floor but you are charged $5 for the pleasure of working out. There is a pool too, but I never had time to use it. The restaurant in the lobby area was nice, great service and good food. However the bar was terrible. Too few staff to meet the demand of the guests. The main issue I have with the hotel, despite its nice history (Mark Twain stayed here once, don't you know?), is that it is just too big. Next time I go to Chicago, I will stay at a more intimate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to transportation”
Reviews.Author: tinalsu
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palmer House Hilton for a weekend getaway. The hotel is in a great location close to public transportation and walking distance to many attractions. You are within a block of the bus and rail line. The hotel is a beautiful historic hotel. The rooms were clean. They were on the small side but that can be attributed to when the hotel was booked. We had access to the concierge level which was great for breakfast and snacks when we got back to the hotel. We did have an issue with a vent outside our room making noise, but it was fixed when we told the hotel staff about the problem. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “How can you not love this place?”
Reviews.Author: Michael A
Reviews.Content: Old? Yes. In a broken down area? Yes. But this is the most stately hotel you will visit besides the Waldorf Astoria. 5 minute cab ride from everything, and the nicest people that will ever greet you. I'm a fan, and always will be.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jules71
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is absolutely beautiful. I love hotels like this where the bar,seating areas, registration are in one big place and contribute to atmosphere of energy, fun--a place you want to be! Beautiful room decor, very comfortable king bed. Room was not big, but was fine for me. No coffee maker, though. And food, drinks, etc. in the hotel are expensive. All staff I encountered went out of there way to be helpful. Bartenders were particular friendly and helpful in answering questions.

Reviews.Title: “Old Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Chrystal T
Reviews.Content: Some of these reviews can be so distorted. This hotel was beautiful, very old Chicago. Loved it! I loved the lobby and our room. The decor was gorgeous epecially all the velvet settes. Location is great! The customer service was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: emalou2
Reviews.Content: After our flight from uk to come here was a dream. The hotel is grand, extravagant and flawless. It's huge and our room although a tad small was clean, modern and stylish. The area itself is fine and there are homeless people in Chicago! It's a city for heavens sake and if your gullible enough to think you wont see them you're mistaken! They do not pester you for money they actually tell you to 'have a great day'. The area is fine and is clean and respectable. The hotel bar is a bit pricey and we didn't expect to pay ten dollars to use their gym either but the facilities are very good and popular. Defo stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “No avoiding the smoke”
Reviews.Author: MIKEYDREAD
Reviews.Content: Having arrived tired after 2 flights from England, I was confronted by the desk clerk asking me whether I wanted to pay an extra 39 dollars per night for an upgraded room plus breakfast, hors dâ€™oeuvres and nibbles and no limit on non-alcoholic drinks. Unfortunately I missed the vital word continental and was non -plussed to find the next day I was not enjoying a cooked breakfast. Anyway my wife said overall it was good value-not completely convinced. The other initial problem was I was allocated an upgraded smoking room. When I got to the room I discovered that despite the assurances of the desk clerk that no smoking had occurred, the room stunk of it. The solution-one of the domestic staff with a few blasts of an air freshener! Well you can image how effective that was. We changed rooms the next day only to find that smoke from the next room was seeping into one of our bathrooms. Wedding attracted a young couple with a baby next door and the thin walls meant we could hear the screaming infant quite clearly. Not the kidâ€™s fault but the walls were a bit thin. Apart from the extra charges and smoke the hotel was quite impressive with an old world charm. New room was large with 2 bathrooms. Main Bar was a bit impersonal with a transient population. Beer prices changed on the weekend- you guessed it they went up-not come across this sort of thing before. Surrounding area was a bit dodgy at night with homeless people constantly harassing you. Overall I was a little disappointed considering the favourable reviews I had read.

Reviews.Title: “"Great stay....inviting ambiance and wonderful staff"”
Reviews.Author: oceans34
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just as the pictures suggests and can't say enough about how helpful the any staff we had a question for or approached us in making sure if we needed anything just to let them know . The rooms were average in size but nice decor and very clean. We'll definitely be visiting The Palmer hotel again ....truly an enjoyable experience all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “An art deco treat”
Reviews.Author: Kerryn P
Reviews.Content: I booked the Palmer House Hilton through Expedia for an excellent price. My husband, sister and I appreciated the fabulous foyer and the very comfortable beds. We enjoyed a delicious late arrival room service delivered promptly, and a pot of hot tea! (Australians will know what I mean here). We recieved very good service throughout our stay, and the concierge Phillipe was a standout - he suggested an archtiectural river tour and Buddy Guy's Blues Bar both of which were fabulous. The location was great and we fell in love with Chicago and wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great mix of modern and nostalgia”
Reviews.Author: GWing51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House from Sep.23-Sep.26. We booked our room through Priceline and got our room for $105/night. That's an incredible deal for a $300/night hotel. We had a great non-smoking room with a king bed. Yes, the rooms and bathrooms are on the small side, but remember, this hotel is a landmark. It was the best of the best back in the day. It has all the modern amenities but still has the old dooknobs and locks on closet doors. The foyer is beautiful. The line to check in at 1pm was long but moved fast. We were early but were still able to check in and go to our room. The room was clean and comfortable. The bed was amazingly comfortable. The hotel is close to almost evertything. And the subway is right outside the door. The staff was helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in a Museum; Sleeping inthe Warehouse”
Reviews.Author: Maddy J
Reviews.Content: We booked the Palmer House on Priceline for the nights of Sept 25 and 26 2011. Our request of 2 beds and non-smoking room was submitted to the hotel and we were assured every effort would be made. We arrived approx 2.30pm and were told the room would be ready in an hour. 5pm came and went and still no room. In fact, we were put in an 'Apollo' room which is a huge suite, like a living soom, with seperate bed ROOMS doored on each end--which were locked as they were each booked; hence no beds. It was at least another hour to procure 3 rollaway beds as well as track down our checked in luggage. The beds were sleepable once we stripped the furniture of it's cushions and placed them to serve as box springs. 2 beds arrived with no pillows or blankets. Suffice to say all of our Saturday afternoon/evening was spent trying to make a 5 star hotel room inhabitable. We were given a $50 food credit and explaination about them being totally booked for our trouble, but one night of bad beds, tiny bathroom and no mirrors to dress in front of was more than enough. By the time the dust settled we found that no food was available in the hotel--only drinks in vending machines. So I was sent across the street to a 7Eleven in the rain to gather sundries for my kids. We were assured of getting a 'real' room the next day which thankfully we did first thing in the morning. We lugged everything to a floor above and thankfully had 2 beds and a long mirror. The beds and bedding were fabulous. I likened the first night to staying in a museum and sleeping in the warehouse. A year ago we stayed at the Chicago Hilton and everything about that hotel was head and shoulders over our experience here. The bed and bath shop in the Palmer just off Monroe is a saving grace, however. Wonderful staff and products that contributed to my restraint of hostage taking. Breakfast buffet, which is a traditionally sumptious affair, was markedly disappointing both in quality and selection. I got the impression that this hotel has been tripping over dusty laurels for decades. I LOVE the classic old glamour of hotels but this stay illustrated a lack of cohesion. Chicago Hilton seems to know what makes a 5 star truly that. Palmer House seems to spend the most energy remembering when it was--which in my book knocks it down to a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay, Surprise When I Received Final Bill”
Reviews.Author: smep013
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Palmer House one night for business. The hotel lobby is magnificent. The ceiling is beautiful (make sure you look up!) and the hotel bar is vibrant. I wish I had time to stop by to have a drink! I had a small room with a queen bed. Just fine. Bathroom was small. Room was clean. Starbucks inside hotel (on Street Level) major plus. The fitness center was awesome. A lot if equipment and spacious. There was even a separate room for yoga and classes, I assume. The surprise was that it cost me $10 to use the fitness room! After I saw my final bill, I vaugely remembered seeing signs to that effect, but I thougt to myself, that fee can't possibly apply to me, a hotel guest. Unreal! I have never heard of a hotel charging guests for use of the fitness center. That is why this hotel gets an "Average" rating. THE NERVE!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SereneMoments
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Palmer House Hilton Chicago was first class right from check in to check out. We purchased the room through Priceline and got an amazing deal. We paid $105.00 per night. After my purchase on Priceline and I learned that we got the Palmer House, I immediately called the hotel directly to make my special requests. I wanted a non-smoking, king room and an early check in. After reading some of the other reviews about Priceline I was a bit worried, because when I booked it I didnâ€™t release that you basically get whatever is available and may not have your requests fulfilled. When I called the Palmer House they took down my requests and told me that they would do what they could to ensure that we received what we asked for. We arrived at the Palmer House at about 1 p.m. and there was a bit of a line, but since there was 5 people working behind the desk we were checked in and up into our room in about 30 min. total. It was an excellent, fast check in from a very friendly clerk and we did receive what we asked for. Something else that impressed us was the fact that we didn't get charged extra for the early check in. When we got up into our room we were relieved because the room was clean, and decorated very nice. The room and bathroom was small, but for the two of us it was perfect. Having said that, would I have been disappointed had I had to pay full price for the room â€“ yes I most likely would have been a bit pickier, but since I got the room for basically a steal, I was extremely satisfied. The bathroom was very small and a couple of the tiles were falling off, the TV wasnâ€™t a flat screen, there was no microwave or fridge, but I just ignored it and focused in on all the good. To name a few positives, the subway (red line) was right outside the door, friendly staff, extremely comfortable bed, nicely decorated hotel and room, walking distance to the Navy Pier â€“ which I might add was a fantastic place as well. There were also many restaurants, shopping and a 7 eleven only steps away from the hotel. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Chicago. We both felt comfortable and relaxed with our whole stay at the Palmer House Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully restored traditional hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveSmithson
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton has been beautifully renovated and is an excellent place to stay in the heart of Chicago. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, staff friendly and helpful and the decoration tasteful and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Style and Service, but...”
Reviews.Author: pauljco
Reviews.Content: Overall, I enjoyed my stay at The Palmer House. The classic style of this property can really evoke an elegant time of yesteryear. The often mentioned lobby of The Palmer House is striking and the service was outstanding. With that said, let me address the rooms. I had booked two king rooms, one for myself and one for my sister. The room my sister was given was a standard sized king room, with a typical sized bathroom â€“ very comfortable. The king room I was given was without saying the smallest (and using the term â€œsmallâ€� is generous) hotel room that I ever stayed in. The bathroom, very clean and updated, but so small (again, using the term â€œsmallâ€� is generous) that the door could not open all the way inward because it hit the toilet. There would be no possible way that two guests could be in that bathroom at the same time, unless one was standing in the very clean, tub. But, my sister and I were in Chicago to sightsee and reconnect, so little time was spent in my room, and we spent a lot of time in the grand lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Small loud rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bucketlistm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old old old. Rooms are tiny with small bathrooms. Finishes are updated but you feel closed in. When people walk by in the hall it seems like they are in your room due to the lack of any sound proofing. Central location but I would pass next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms and Service, But Inordinate Fees for Now Often Complimentary Items”
Reviews.Author: Matthew B
Reviews.Content: My room's large size and comfortable bed made up for any parts of the room that weren't completely in character with what I would consider the norm in a luxury hotel (e.g. a smaller bathroom with tile rather than marble, slightly worn carpet, etc.). Service was excellent with room service promising a 30 minute delivery and then showing up in just 15 mins. My only complaint were the steep charges for internet and the fitness center with daily rates for both topping $10 (though admittedly the fitness center was far better outfitted than that of most hotels I visit), though in mind the additional charges were more than made up for by the great rate I got through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Chicago Getaway”
Reviews.Author: joanhc
Reviews.Content: If you love hotels and history, this is the place for you. Elegant and fun and right in the heart of everything. Rooms were comfortable enough for such a large hotel - sheets were divine! Lobby was fantastic. Grab a cocktail and hunker down to enjoy the views of this delightful lobby and people watch. Everyone was super friendly and helpful espcially Tracy the concierge!!!!!! Only complaint was the powdered eggs on the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: miseno
Reviews.Content: The rooms were updated recently, the hotel has a great location, the service was great. It was a real treat to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Treat!”
Reviews.Author: Retired_Teacher_2010
Reviews.Content: Like stepping back in time in many ways. It's one of Chicago's gems although definitely pricey. Our room was spacious & the lobby is a beautiful place to hang out, have a drink, & people watch. Nice shops & restaurants within hotel. Parking is expensive, but typical for Chicago where it's best to walk, use public transportation or take a cab. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic in sept 2011”
Reviews.Author: amerinurse
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my kids, ages 5&6. The indoor pool is heated (actually warm!) so they were happy. The room was impecable, though small ( I got a really good deal by using hotwire.com... I didn't know I was chosing this hotel until after it was booked). The location couldn't be better:right downtown, and just a few minutes to walk to get any public transport. We stayed on the 12th floor, room 354, and it was quiet as could be (not streetside). I had stayed here before without the kids and both times had no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in 2011”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoMD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palmer House several times in the past and like it's location. I was in Chicago for 5 days for a medical meeting. My wife accompanied me as she enjoys Chicago. I made my reservations through my medical organization as this was one of the 'meeting' hotels. I was one of the latter ones to decide to go and the PH was the only one of the groups hotels that still had rooms available. The Good: the location within the 'loop' is excellent. It is easy to get everywhere downtown. There is a nearby 'L' train station with multiple lines just outside the exit. The lobby is large, multistory and speaks of an age now gone.
