(Although close observation shows some fraying around the edges. ) The staff (maids, bellmen and doormen) seemed truly friendly and attentive. I will say that the climate control in the room was good and allowed you to select a specific temperature. The Bad: Even though, I was early, there was a cue at the check-in desk. Check-in was not fast or efficient even though I had a confirmed reservation. Because of some function in the lobby, my spouse was unable to find a spot to sit while waiting for me. The room on the 17th floor had the king-sized bed that I had requested but the room itself was old, tired and small. The closet door was stuck, had an old key lock that made me think at first it was a door to the room next door. The room had not been updated to modern ammenities, there was no coffee maker, refrigerator or minibar. The TV, which was an old tube type, was in a large armoire which took up precious space. The bathroom was small and was the worst. The fixtures looked like rejects from Motel 6. The toilet seat was the cheapest looking plastic model I have ever seen. The towel rack over the tub, was flimsy and pulling out of the wall. The tub itself did not drain adequately even with the shower head on low-flow. Before you were done with your shower, you were standing in 2 inches of water. The final insult for me was the $14/day charge for internet access. Wireless was only available in the lobby (for the $) or a wired connection in the room. My 'convention' rate was in the high $200s and the rooms would have cost >$300 if obtained through another source. In 2011, I cannot understand this. The Grand old hotel cannot stand on it's laurels any more. PH get with the program and move into the 21st century. Next trip to Chicago, I will stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Regrets about spending company money here”
Reviews.Author: indy25
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for business because other choices with a shuttle bus to my conference were sold out. I was glad I requested a high floor, away from elevator because I would have been extremely upset to be in a room near the noisy train. Room was clean and bedding was nice, although as others have pointed out, the tiny bathroom was annoying. I didn't mind having an old tv but the lack of available coffee and the rip-off fee for wired internet was more than disappointing. Who wants to sit at a hotel room desk after a long day at work? never again.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel, historical and updated, still needs more...”
Reviews.Author: opivp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palmer House for business for 10 days. Very good experience at check-in as I told the clerk that I had heard (and read) that "some" of the rooms were on the small side -since I was going to be there for an extended time could they find me a larger room, which they did (although 2 queens instead of a king bed). As you can read elsewhere, the lobby is quite nice, and the entire hotel is living history well-preserved. The lobby bar is a fun place to hang out and the lobby in general is full of activity at night. The hotel is huge with banks of elevators serving groupings of floors - expect longer than reasonable delays at peak hours (old hotel, old elevators). The hotel is very big, the walk to the room can be far... the room was fine, nothing special - although it was pretty large based on my request :) No flat screen LCD/LED TV here, just a cheap old 27" tube TV, no coffee maker in room, no mini-bar, and NO WIRELESS INTERNET IN ROOM. One of my co-workers told me that the front desk provided him with a wireless router for his room upon request, I stuck with the in-room wired connection during my stay. Again ,the rooms are older, have been updated (although mine still had the very old AC/HEAT controls), clean, beds were comfortable, but nothing really that special. I guess people aren't staying here for the "great" rooms but you can't sleep in the lobby :) Ordered room service a few times - no need to order more than that as there are only about 10 items on the menu, VERY limited selection for such a "large and prestigious hotel" - or for any hotel for that matter. Careful if you order the "bottled water" as they will bring you the $5 glass bottle - the front desk gave me free bottled water whenever I stopped by and asked, although only once was it cold. There is no coffee service in the lobby either and unless you pre-order coffee the night before be prepared to wait (i was told 45 minutes or longer for room service, weekdays and weekend) - your only on-site options are the hotel restaurant or the Starbucks on ground floor (the street level "S"). If you arrive at the Starbucks between 7:30 and 9:30 be prepared to wait as the line got very long - I would suggest one of the many places on the block as an alternative if you are looking for a quick breakfast at a reasonable price (or the Starbucks across the street). Regarding the rating, I would give it a 3.5 out of 5 but that's not an option.

Reviews.Title: “A historic hotel with a room that took me back to the '80's”
Reviews.Author: mlsimp2
Reviews.Content: The lobby and location are tremendous but the room (18101) was tired beyond belief to carry the Hilton badge. The room was small with a bathroom that was too small to turn around in and the wired internet is ridiculous since many business travelers are ditching their laptops for Ipads. The carpet was coming up in the doorway of my bathroom and the furniture looked like 1989 wanted it back...oh and the retro television (tube type) was another drawback. The slow service of the elevators almost caused me to be late since they were so slow. I've stayed in many historic hotels and really love the atmosphere but they shouldn't get a free pass with a room this tired.

Reviews.Title: “Classic giant in the middle of it all.”
Reviews.Author: Tubman74
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby & cool bar. Centrally located in the Loop & near trains. Always crowded, incl afterthought indoor pool. Very cramped room with no view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Lots of hidden fees.”
Reviews.Author: Scott Z
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House during the Lollapalooza Music Festival weekend. The hotel is extremely close to the new Lolla main entrance and substantially less expensive than the Hilton that faces Grant Park. The CTA lines are also very close to the hotel. To the hotel's credit, the check in line was huge, and they passed out free champagne and bottled water to make the one hour wait pass more smoothly. The hotel lobby is gorgeous and will remind you of a different era in Chicago's history. People compare this hotel to NYC's Waldorf, but I would say that is a major exaggeration. Now the negatives. The rooms are very outdated. The dining options on the lower retail level of the hotel are poor quality. But most shockingly, the charges for extras (internet, parking, gym, etc) are outrageously high. I travel a lot and don't usually get sticker shock, but I actually thought they had mistakenly added an extra day to my bill when I saw it. One suggestion for Lolla travelers, if you're leaving town Sunday night after the final performances, you can buy a one-day pass to the gym and spa, check out of the hotel, check your bags at the bell desk, go to the final day at Lolla in Grant Park, come back and shower at the gym, and pick up your bags before heading out of town.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Cocktail Party”
Reviews.Author: BrLoMc
Reviews.Content: We hosted our wedding cocktail party at Potter's Lounge in the Palmer House Hotel after our destination wedding. The hotel was absolutely perfect from the service to the food to the ambiance of Potter's Lounge to the room accomondations for our guests. We had many people come in from out of town and even Chicagoans who decided to stay for the weekend to enjoy the hotel and it's surrounds. Everyone was very happy with their rooms and had nothing but great things to say about Potters-- it honestly is an ideal spot in the city to host a party, it is the perfect bar/lounge set up that comes with everything, compared to all the other rooms to rent in the city for such an event it is a steal and huge bonus to be part of the beautiful Palmer House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average, but issues”
Reviews.Author: Moonray1
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is a beautiful grande dame of a hotel. The lobby and public spaces are stunning. There is a lot of history and the location is good. There are a few issues to making it a practical, modern hotel: first off, there is only one LAN port in each room and no wireless internet access. Wireless access is only available in public spaces. So if there are two of you in the room, only one has internet access at a time. This makes no sense to me! And secondly, the room decor and amenities are a bit dated. The shower just dribbled, no pressure at all. Having said that, the room we were given on the executive floor was huge. The breakfast and snacks for executive floor guests was good. The elevator situation needs some work. There seemed to be about 10+ elevator banks, but only three seemed to really be working.

Reviews.Title: “Not good for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: JoeCT S
Reviews.Content: Nice historic hotel, but given lack of in room WiFi it is not the place to stay if you are traveling on business or have an iPad. You can get WiFi in the Lobby but even there you have to pay for it. Given the room rate internet access should be free. In addition, the TV was too small and the reception was poor. Rooms are clean, the beds are ok and the staff is friendly, but there are much better places to stay in Chicago, especially at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Public Spaces”
Reviews.Author: tookie624
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at The Palmer House Hilton for a business meeting. The doormen started our visit on a high note. They were extremely professional and helpful. The lobby of this hotel is beyond beautiful. The ceilings and walls were something to behold. The elevator lobbies had banquets for sitting. The hallways are lined with black and white picture of all the famous people who have either stayed here or played here. The empire room was simple elegant.The concierge staff was knowledgeable,extremely helpful and friendly. Unfortunately the rooms themselves left much to be desired. Our first room was really really small. It fit a queen bed and that was about it.There was no dresser for clothes. We asked to be moved to a larger room/ We were asked if we minded going to a handicapped accessible room.That room had a huge bathroom with a wheel in shower. That shower got the floor soaking wet.The bathroom was larger but alas, still no dresser. There were two desks but no dresser. It was late by the time we got to the second room so we decided to just deal with it. We left the room very early the next morning for meetings. By 3:30 the room had not been cleaned.Even though the staff was great, and the public areas beautiful, next time I'll just take the tour and stay somewhere there is room for me and my clothing.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Chrisj319
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights sorry I didn't stay longer. A very beautiful art deco hotel, ideally suites to all the attractions, room was very spacious. Loved it will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the Chicago Half Marathon”
Reviews.Author: Dianne G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend at the Palmer house and it was lovely. The room had two double beds with two bathrooms, perfect for me and my daughter. The room was spacious and clean. The lobby is spectacular! The location was also perfect, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago Institution”
Reviews.Author: CARIBBEAN757
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times at the Palmer House - they have great specials on rooms for the weekend that include the breakfast buffet! The architecture is always beautiful and makes for a very enjoyable stay - you always get a different room arrangement and some are small, but many (especially corner rooms) are quite spacious. Location of the hotel is very convenient and close to the Loop for shopping. It is a short walk to Millenium Park which is the best free attraction in Chicago - the sightseeing and people watching are great.

Reviews.Title: “Smelled like an old bar”
Reviews.Author: Drdukie
Reviews.Content: Really small bed. Smelled like an ash tray. Waited over an hour for a new room. Next time I'll pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dondotca
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by the whole experience of our visit. We arrived in mid afternoon and were told our room was not ready. The clerk gave us a $50 certificate for the restaurant while we waited. We upgraded to the executive floor and it was the best value for the dollar. Location is in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: jencircletheworld
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. Located right downtown, you can walk to all the major Chicago attractions. The gilded art deco lobby always makes me feel like I have gone back in time. We have stayed here many times, sometimes as a family, sometimes just my daughter and I. We are always treated like royalty with upgrades and special perks. The swimming pool is seriously old school (think concrete tank) but somehow we concentrate on how Esther Williams might have looked here rather than on the mild mildew smell. Beds are some of the most comfortable I have slept in away from home. The hotel is quiet with a bustling energy that we just love. Order the profiteroles and ice cream from room service for an elegant dessert treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: seeitallAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: I asked for a double bed room with two baths. Room was very spacious. Only thing lacking was coffee machine in room. They did send a complimentary one. Staff was very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in a Fabulous City”
Reviews.Author: WicklowLuigi
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights with my wife and two friends in this hotel recently and we all agreed it was one of the best hotels we ever stayed in. Excellent service throughout and very helpful and friendly staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “OK but can't compete with Hilton Garden Inn on Grand”
Reviews.Author: cgruchy
Reviews.Content: Why is it that the top tier hotels in a chain provide less quality than those in the value segment when they charge about $50 per night more? I couldn't get my favourite Hilton Garden Inn 10 E Grand Ave. Chicago, so had to settle for the Palmer House. Yes it's a glamourous hotel, but the bathroom is very small (unless you're a short supermodel) and the internet is not included in the room rate. So I had to forgo the internet because I refuse to pay extra when it should be included. The king size bed was extremely comfortable as were the pillows. I was here on business, so it was a perfect location only 2 blocks from the office. There are some very fine eateries nearby. I had breakfast the first morning in the lobby restaurant. The continental buffet is good value for the price ($13) but I don't know why they can't provide you with self service beverages. One needs to wait for interminably slow wait staff. Make sure you have exact cash or charge it to your room. So if you want to have a good breakfast and get on your way, go to the Corner Bakery on the corner of Monroe and Wabash. Noise is a bit of a problem. I was not directly facing the "L", but I could hear the trains. I could also hear my next door neighbours talking, and they weren't talking loudly. Overall the hotel is fine in a pinch, but if you like Hilton properties, you get better value at the Hilton Garden Inn on Grand Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & accomodating despite being in a smaller room over the first two days.”
Reviews.Author: happyworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel back in late July 2011 for a week and the room originally allocated to me was close to the elevator shafts and the bed was smaller than a typical Queen size (probably Double). After one night, I couldn't take it anymore so I asked if i could move rooms. The staff were quite friendly and the hotel was able to accomodate me the next day. I was moved to a King size room with a large amount of floor space between the TV and bed (it was double the size of the old room). The new room was in a quiet area....so overall, i found the hotel to be accomodating and the staff go out of their way to ensure that they respond to your request (even if the move cannot be done immediately). I do recommend however that they consider reducing the price per night of the smaller rooms because it's not worth the price if you are by an elevator shaft and can hear people going up and down the elevators all night. Plus the washroom in the older room was tiny and there was hardly a seating area.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarlosTCuracao
Reviews.Content: This was 3rd time in Chicago for the GraphExpo show. And I just can't get enough of this hotel the service is great and it's a beautiful hotel. It's close to everything . It just a wonderful hotel with great restaurants and good food and great service .I will stay there again whenever I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “EXQUISITE was/is The Palmer House!”
Reviews.Author: welovechicago
Reviews.Content: We had just read The Devil in the White City (Erik Larson) and were interested in the history of Chicago and it's buildings. We decided to stay at The Palmer House and what a good call. As well as enjoying the extremely friendly staff and our beautiful room we loved partaking of the 'Lunch and History Tour' with Mr. Ken Price, hotel historian. Fabulous meal and Mr. Price entertained us royally with his knowledge and humour. The stories from this hotel are colourful and many. This event was the highlight of our whole wonderful stay in Chicago. We fell totally in love with The Palmer House Hilton and it's past.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: annanas28
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel right in the middle of downtown Chicago. I've been to several meetings and conferences here and everything is top-notch. It's also a very historical hotel so gives you a really nice feeling of being part of something older instead of all those new, fancy, "edgy" hotels you can find elsewhere. I'd definitely recommend it, especially if you are visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of great choices in Chicago, but try to stay here”
Reviews.Author: William_from_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous historic hotel in a perfect downtown location. There is easy access to the various L lines just outside the doors, and Millennium Park with "The Bean", and Crown Fountain are two blocks away. The lobby was amazing -- you really get a great sense of the majesty and history of the building there. Our room was quite large and nicely furnished. Housekeeping did a good job and the new Peter Roth bathroom amenities were excellent. The only complaint I can register is a minor one: I was not offered an upgrade at check-in, in spite of being Hilton Honors Gold level. But to be honest, I do not know how room upgrades work on free night stays using HHonors points. I was offered access to the Executive Floor where a nice breakfast was served each day and there were snacks in the evening happy hour as well. Staff there were particularly helpful each time we interacted. We loved this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NBPezz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 20 month old daughter downtown and stayed at the Palmer house. Great location and beautiful atmosphere. The rooms are a bit small, but clean. This was our second time staying and we will definately stay again! Also, we preordered room service the night before and it came at exactly 9:00 am. We were impressed! Hope you enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Stay at Palmer House”
Reviews.Author: makeusagreat
Reviews.Content: We are VIP Gold HH members and Hilton Vacation Club owners, so we expect a lot when we stay with Hilton. We were not dissapointed with our last stay at the Hilton Palmer House in Chicago. We knew it was going to be a very busy weekend with the last holiday of the summer and the jazz festival in town but we went anyway. We took advantage of the prepaid stay with the breakfast buffet and felt the price was very reasonable. We automatically got the upgrade to the suite and had full benefits of the executive level amenities. We were very happy with both the service we recieved and the food we were served. We like the parking arrangement with the garage next door and the friendly help from the bell hops. We enjoyed a newly renovated room with excellent internet serivce and more than friendly room service. I think we called them 4 times with request in just one day and they came through with everything from wine openers to extra sheets for the rollaway. We really liked the old world charm of this hotel but it was not too over the top. Location is prefect to explore Chicago. We have young kids and we like the way they cater to families with children. You don't have to worry about what others are thinking because they all seem to have kids too. Nothing worse than going somewhere and have people act like you shouldn't have brought your kids. We make sure our kids don't bother people too, so that helps. Thanks Pamler House staff for a great Labor Day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Joy”
Reviews.Author: Mark201105
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel being a mix of history with updated facilities. Rate was good especially for big city. Loved the central sitting area and breakfast was very good. Would for sure use again next time in Chaicago.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: aarona62
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a discount website, not knowing exact hotel, only general location before I booked. Having said that, I guess I am satisfied, considering the rate I got. However, booking through this website did not guarantee a specific room, and when I arrived, I was told that there were only smoking rooms still available. Much to my surprise, in Illinois there can still be smoking rooms at hotels. We are clearly NOT smokers, and I'm not sure if I was taken or not, but we were offered an upgrade for $49/night for a king non-smoking room on the Executive Level. Observing our hesitancy to upgrade (remember, I booked the room at a discount rate for a reason), we were quickly offered another room on the Executive Level for $39/night. Detesting the smell of cigarette smoke, I went ahead and took the upgrade and still paid less than the advertised rate. The hotel itself is beautiful, nistoric etc., and in an ok location, down near Grant & Millenium Park, and is close to bus routes that will take you to Michigan Avenue, Navy Pier, etc. However, being woke up at midnight because of a woman in the next room pleading with someone to not go out displeased me. Having heard her in normal conversation earlier in the day and clearly understanding her every word I realized that the walls were very thin, and feared that this would become a problem later in the evening. I was right. Second negative on the hotel was the size of the bathroom. There was NO counter space, whatsoever, and only 1 standing spot in the tiny bath. Third negative....no free wi-fi, no free exercise room....it all cost extra. Oh, on the executive floor, there are two computers to use, and that served our purpose for our weekend trip. Another negative for some....near the train, so you can hear every one that goes by...even on the 23rd floor, but that noise didn't bother us nearly as much as the aforementioned female in the next room. Executive Level guests get free continental breakfast every morning...too many carbs for me...went elsewhere....and hors d'oeuvres every evening.....which was a nice touch. Free non-alcoholic beverages 24/7 to Executive Level guests, and private bar service on the 23rd floor (not free, obviously, but convenient). Overall, I guess if I knew all of what I have said upfront, and was paying the going rate for this hotel, I would go elsewhere. The circumstances being what they were, it was ok for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant old hotel with noisy pipes”
Reviews.Author: Weeble123
Reviews.Content: Bed was wonderful but only a double not queen. No handrails in tub. Got woken up at 5:28 am when shower next door started. Sounded Luke it was in my room. Old tv sets in armoir. Desk blocking one window so I couldn't get TP it to close curtain. Dust in bedside lamp. Easy to trip walking into bathroom because marble floor is not flush with carpet. In room breakfast was terrific. Fast response.

Reviews.Title: “Overall OK but....”
Reviews.Author: BrotherYo
Reviews.Content: Palmer House reputation as a Grande Dame is thrue. From the moment you enter, you feel a sense a history. I stayed there for sometime end of June and enjoyed much the Location, the walking around and the room. Housekeeping was great and pleasant when I encountered them. Concierge also helpful. The Main lobby restaurant for Breakfast was excessively poor in choice and service. Doorman more concern about discussion than taking care of the guests. Fitness Center welcoming poor (early AM). In brief, Granbde Dame who is missing her heart. Something can definitely be done to show how warm service can be extended.

Reviews.Title: “Too much dough for a "cheap" room”
Reviews.Author: Corissa13
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Chicago. We decided to stay at the Palmer Hilton because it was downtown, had a pool, was a Hilton hotel and had cheaper (still expensive) parking than other hotels. Originally, we booked through Marlin Travel for 179.99/night. We requested a king size bed but when we got there, we were arranged 2 doubles. They offered to upgrade to a king with premium services; orderves from 5-9pm, unlimited non-alcoholic drinks and snacks all day and a contiential breakfast for 39.99/night for the upgrade. We decided to upgrade. So the room was 179.99 + 39.99 for the upgrade + 37 dollars for self parking (they wanted 61 for valet). The building was beautiful in the lobby. The staff were so nice and courteous.Plenty of weddings and events were going on and I can see why. It looked as though you were in the middle of Italy with a painted ceiling and columns around. However. The room was small. Very small. There was no couch, just a basic bed, basic desk and a TUBE tv. The remote hardly worked. The bathroom was most disappointing. You could not sit on the toilet with the door open as it would hit your knees. The door also hit the bathrub when opened. You couldn't get ready in the morning without closing the door. The shower head was a duel-like shower which was the only benefit. There was no seperate shower. The room also did not have a mini fridge, it did have a safe though. The pool was nice- it had a nice skylight. It was also nice that the hottub was seperate from the pool. The towels in the pool area were very nice. Overall, due to the cost, I would not stay at this hotel again. You do not get enough for what you are paying.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton - Palmer House, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mdhokenson
Reviews.Content: Recently there for a 5 day business trip and was very satisfied with the hotel and the accommodations. The hotel is right downtown and very close to Millennium Park, Art Institute, and plenty of shopping and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful (but confusing) historical hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: wanderingfork
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights and three days at this enormous historical hotel and can provide the following comments/guidance for other guests: - This is a larger hotel than what I am used to or prefer. It is a very, very large hotel with a floor plan that can be a bit confusing. Similar to being on a cruise ship (or driving in the Northeast), there are routes where you can't get there from here or you may get lost. Another guest in our party quipped that he could get to his room from the lobby, but once in his room, he could never find the original elevator bank. If you are staying in your room and only going to the restaurant, lobby, and street levels, you will probably find a consistent route. However, if you are in the meeting rooms you may find the path needed to get to your destination a bit counter-intuitive. - The rooms are comfortably appointed. My room (King bed) was laid out well and comfortably appointed. I was in the "101" block and therefore right next to the elevators. There was some noise from guests returning to their rooms, but nothing noticeable after 11pm or which woke me up. The linens are of a high quality which would be expected in this level of hotel. Bathroom was small, but one of the best lit I've seen. Good bath amenities (PeterThomasRoth). Closet had real coat hangers and a good number of them. - Meeting rooms were very comfortable (both temperature and layout) and catering did a very nice job with lunches and breaks. Breakfast was not as good (scrambled eggs were a little gritty and the type of bread laid out on day one was different than day two). A nice variety of coffee (reg/decaf), teas, and sodas was available. Great cookies! (I liked the oatmeal ones best.) - I did not eat at the restaurant, but did eat at the Potter's Lounge (bar). Drinks were average. Cheese Poufs were uninspired and the sauce could not hold up to the overwhelming taste of the breading. I stopped after two. Soups (mushroom on day one and squash on day two) were very, very good. The service was a bit lax; however I could not tell 100% if it was the server or the kitchen. I had chosen to eat at the bar to have a quick bite, I was there for over 90 minutes my first day. - Big plus was a scotch tasting in the lobby. I'm not a scotch drinker, but it was fun. - Because I was there over the 09/11 anniversary, security was heightened, but not overwhelming. The communicated well with the guests, providing a letter in each room explaining that there would be additional scrutiny and additional personnel at the elevator banks; but it never felt oppressive or overwhelming. Security was very friendly, willing to interact with guests, and willing and able to answer questions.

Reviews.Title: “HAD A GREAT TIME, but had to fight for.”
Reviews.Author: ElcioBR
Reviews.Content: When I booked the hotel I requested an upgrade for a suite, but when I checked in this was not available, at least that was the information I got. I felt unwelcome and made a complaint to the reception manager asking to refund me and that way I could go to another hotel. In minutes, this manager resolved the situation and I was accommodated in a great suite. The hotel has a very special charm, but the executive lounge was very, very poor and crowded, the most crowded I had been at the Hilton Hotels and you also have to pay for alcoholic beverages. The hall of entrance is splendid and full of history and also there are many tourists 9non guests) taking pictures. The Hotel is downtown and from there you can go everywhere in Chicago. My time in Chicago, at the Palmer House (forgetting the check in stress) was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Gem Inside the Loop”
Reviews.Author: Wachs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Chicago for a friend's wedding and, I must admit, I was a little reluctant to stay at a major chain property. We are partial to Kimptons and San Francisco's JDV chain, but it was where all our friends were staying so I relented. Next time we're in town, the Palmer House will be on our short list of properties for reservations. Our room was nicely appointed, albeit a little small for our preferences, but that's the nature of urban hotels. With over 1600 rooms (down from a previous 2000-plus!), I'm sure you can find one to your liking. But how much time does one spend in their room, anyway? That's where Concierge Philippe comes in - he was spot on with each of his recommendations and when we weren't celebrating nuptials, he helped us make the most of our trip. If you decide not to stay here, that's your call, but be sure to drop by and check out the amazing architecture in the historic lobby. The soaring columns and mural on the 25-foot high (maybe higher) ceiling is worth the price of a cocktail to admire from the lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Grandure and inside the loop”
Reviews.Author: GoodLifeJP
Reviews.Content: Well restored and very comfortable. Close to the museums, and within walking distance to Michigan Ave. Nice sized rooms and very comfortable accomidations. In room dining is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, but we didn't sleep in the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: JustaCaveman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Palmer House Hilton over the 10th anniversary of 9/11 while my wife ran in the 15th Annual Chicago Half Marathon. We and another couple ended up at the Palmer because our choices were limited due to the enormous volume of marathon participants in town. We chose not to stay somewhere outside of the city and have to commute in and out. While we may be able to afford the occasional stay at $200+ per night hotel, we typically choose to stay at more reasonably priced places. This particular hotel stay is a prime example of why... The Palmer House Hilton is a historical building with a beautiful lobby. There are other nice features, such as the multitude of black and white portraits lining the hallways. These portraits of of the many stars that have played the hotel's Empire Room in years past. Pretty cool... But, of course, we didn't sleep in the lobby or the hallway. Instead, we slept in a room on the 12th floor that I would call simply, underwhelming. I've slept in $120 rooms at the Holiday Inn Express and other similar hotels across the mid-west that were every bit as comfortable and well adorned as this room. I will say that this room was a bit bigger than those at the other hotels I mentioned, but our friends' room was about the same size as the ones at those other, cheaper hotels. In truth, the extended size of our room served only to increase the distance between our bed and the small, tube-screen television, making it appear even smaller. If our bathroom was an inch smaller in any direction, quite literally, they wouldn't have been able to fit a tub, sink and toilet into it. It was clean, but just plain awkward. The room our friends were in across the hallway had a less awkward bathroom and reasonable floor space. HOWEVER, their room came with a dirty XXXL t-shirt laying between the bed pillows on one of their two double beds. Yuk. A call to the front desk, prompted a visit to their room from a housekeeping manager who appeared irritated that this had happened and offered suitable compensation. HOWEVER, the manager chewed the maid a new one (if you get my meaning) in front of us all while the maid argued with her, swearing that she had changed the bed in question. (Awkward! And, um, no you did not!) So, the manager leaves the maid to change the bedding. After the manager was out of sight, the maid proceeds to reprimand our friends for calling the front desk instead of hunting her down and telling her personally!!! She also told them that the manager was new and "not good". I'm sorry, but I'm thinking the previous manager was the "not good" one and was replaced with a better one. Now this slacker employee doesn't like her new manager because she can no longer get away with skimping on her duties. Anyway, the moral of my story is, anyone can walk in off the street without paying a dime and enjoy the view in the lobby of a hotel like this one. But paying $200+ to stay in a room that you can get elsewhere at half the price just doesn't make sense to me. Summary - Beautiful exterior and lobby. Expensive rooms with little benefit. Questionable maid service. Convenient location in the city. .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: SparkleTravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded our expectations as part of the Hilton brand. It's a beautiful historic building with a lovely interior. The lobby is stunning. We were on the Executive level, and found the rooms to be really nice and fitting for the building. Our standard room had two separate his and hers bathrooms! The rooms are not super slick or super posh, but perfectly fine for someone who is out working or touring all day. We found the beds to be really comfortable. And we enjoyed the free beverages and business center on the executive level. We would consider staying here again because it was hassle free, friendly and the location was absolutely perfect for getting everywhere we needed to be. it's just two blocks from the blue line that goes to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: fondej
Reviews.Content: My son and I had a quick overnight in Chicago and got a good rate for the Palmer House. We arrived late and were checked in quickly with complimentary internet access and continental breakfast due to Hilton Honors status. Our room was fairly small but very comfortable. Would have seemed very small for more than two people. The beds were fabulous and the bathroom was cool and retro. This is a very old historic hotel. I think they have done a great job keeping its character and updating some of its comforts. The continental breakfast was fantastic. In addition to cereals and pastries, there was meat, cheese, fresh fruit and more. Additionally, this hotel was extremely well located. Walking distance to shopping and restaurants on State street, Millenium Park, the Chicago River and Michigan Avenue. The only small negative was a terrible view to the alley.

Reviews.Title: “Sixth time here”
Reviews.Author: shalter
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Palmer House six times over the years. The lobby is wonderful and we've always gotten a nice room. The rooms vary in size, but the quality is always good. The Palmer House is nicely located within the loop--easy walking distance to shopping, Grant Park and the art museum. A Red Line entrance is located just next door--easy trip to Wrigley for a Cubs game.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Darlene2010
Reviews.Content: This elegant hotel is in a very good area. It is an easy walk to Buckingham Fountain, the Riverwalk area, and Michigan Avenue shopping. And there is a Starbucks in the lobby of the hotel. It appeared as though most of the guests got the package we had which included the Breakfast Buffet. Be warned - a long line may be experienced to get a table for the buffet. Also, you can order fresh omelets. Our first morning the waiter did not tell us this but the 2nd morning we had a great waiter and he said we could order omelets or waffles with the Breakfast Buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Palmer House is a-okay!”
Reviews.Author: Claudia C
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Palmer House is always a treat for me when I come to Chicago for business meetings. The staff does their best to accomodate my requests. The food at Lockwood is darn good and the drinks at Potters are delicious. One of these times I am going to have the high tea in the afternoon that is offered in the gorgeous lobby! Outstanding customer service - I left my bracelets on the bed in my room when I checked out and when I called the hotel 2 hours later, the Security Department already had them in hold for me to pick up. I was very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular public rooms-- not so hot sleeping rooms”
Reviews.Author: tiffanypa
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House in Chicago is excellently located and has a grand and spectacular main floor, along with equally sumptious public rooms (dining, meeting, etc.). The service is also of the highest quality. But on the other hand this is an old hotel-- historic in fact-- and the "liveability" of the sleeping rooms reflects this. I have been here twice in the past ten days, and was given a room on the 18th floor and the 17th floor. The rooms are small, the bathrooms tiny, and the TVs old (definitely not flat screen). WWW connectivity in the rooms is problematic; I am literally in the hotel now, 17th floor, and it is OK; last week, however, was very spotty and slow reception. So, if you are staying in downtown Chicago this is a perfect location, and greeting guests in the lobby will overwhelm them with its opulence. But the sleeping rooms could be a lot better-- which, given the age of the property, is not really a criticism: it is simply a fact. (I would come here again, by the way, if I needed to be in this downtown area.)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful interior public space, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: AmyNOLA
Reviews.Content: Since this is an old hotel, the rooms are tiny, it was difficult for us to move around during "getting dressed" time with two people in the room without running into furniture or each other. There is not empty floor space. Also, the walls are thin and you can hear everything going on in the rooms around you and the hallway. If you need to sleep past 8am, bring earplugs. You may also need them if your neighbors are loud. The public spaces of this building (lobby, ball room, meeting rooms) are fabulous and elegant. It is a great place for an event and the food on the property was pretty good. Also everything was spotless and clean- even in the guest rooms. We did have one challenge that we brought to the attention of the hotel at checkout- Someone sent us champagne and the hotel set it up on our bed. The problem, the ice in the bucket melted and spilled: and when we got in late that night, our entire bed, comforter and sheets were soaked! Not good planning on the part of the hotel, they should have put it on a cart or on the desk. As sweet and romantic as it looked, it was no fun to unknowingly climb into wet sheets . This is a great place to stay if you can get it on Priceline or a discount website, but it is not the luxurious rooms you would expect for the rack price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgiaseven
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel in a minute. The interior is absolutely stunning! It is historic building with a lot of amenities. The service and food was excellent! Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Sam C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great! Impressive lobby and restaurant; the room was big, clean and decorated with great taste. Although it is a big hotel, staff is very efficient and assists immediately. We got the best rate via their website, which included breakfast. The only minus for us were the pool/hot tub: they seemed sort of old and not taken care of: hot tub was stained as well as the pool, behind the steps. Other than that, this hotel is great, I recommend it. Ohhh, parking is 38 USD per day as for 09/2011.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish and traditional, but a little frayed round to edges”
Reviews.Author: TaxChic
Reviews.Content: Good location in the Loop area, just a few minutes walk from the Millennium Park, and generally easy to navigate the city from this location; lots to see and do within walking distance and very close to the "L"train The hotel is a huge, traditional style place. The marble and mirrors create a great atmosphere. The room was spacious but the natural light was poor. which I think would apply to a lot of rooms. There were just a few small things with the room that could have been improved: neither of the plugs in the bathroom worked properly, the decor in the bathrooms was a little shabby, the TV remote worked but in a somewhat random fashion. I would definitely recommend this hotel, but don't expect perfection

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: bdcho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House over the Labour Day long weekend for 4 nights in a standard room on the 16th floor. Overall, the stay was descent -- what we expected from an historic building and from reading previous reviews. Pros: - great staff, extremely helpful; - very elegantly decorated lobby/main area; - great location, we parked and walked everywhere... ...within 500m to Millennium Park; ...within 1km to Buckingham Fountain in one direction, and the Willis Tower in the other; ...within 2.5km to the north end of Michigan Ave (Magnificent Mile/John Hancock Center); ...within 3.0km to Soldier Field / Shedd Aquarium / Field Museum; ...close to the subway line/bus system; - comfortable bed; Cons: - not all rooms are nicely renovated/new; - room temperature was either really cold or humid, couldn't find a comfortable setting; - bathroom exhaust fan was not functioning, but we were able to hear someone else's conversations from it!; - no free wifi included; - small rooms; We would probably stay here again with the condition that we get one of the renovated rooms with a king bed! good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Best "HOUSE" in the CITY”
Reviews.Author: janetkuz0903
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a Anniversary. We were also going to the Sox game and the hotel gave us a great center location. We were close to Millinium Park and rented bikes and went all up and down the lake on the path that ran all along the beaches....the RED line transit train was right outside the hotel to take us to the game....no parking fees!! The hotel has a breakfast buffet that gave us a great start to our days...very good!!! The hotel itself is beautifull..and the room was very nice and the whole "Old Style" Luxury Hotel gave us a romantic feeling! We had a Great Romantic Getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: houstongal33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here labor day weekend for 3 night and didnt have any complaints- Check in was quick and we were able to get into our room at 12:30. We had a renovated room on the 8th floor. The room was fairly large and the bed was super-comfy. We didnt have any problems getting elevators our entire stay. Starbucks in the lobby was great and the lobby bar was beautiful. Friendly employees and central to everything we wanted to see on our visit! Not to mention we got a great deal on priceline for the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location......but”
Reviews.Author: BucksTraveller2010
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights at the start of a Route 66 driving holiday. The hotel location in the Loop in the centre of Chicago is very good, and the decor in the lobby and main hall is impressive. The hotel was very busy when we stayed. Our main issue was at check-in where the hotel claimed not to have our booking for 2 rooms (the only hotel to have a problem out of the 10 we stayed in on our trip). After much debate and messing around we did end up with 2 rooms - one perfectly acceptable twin bed room, but the other was a very small double with just enough room to walk around the bed. The hotel was also the only one on our trip who tried to charge as twice as we had already pre-paid for the rooms - that took a long time to resolve but the duty manager at check out worked very hard to resolve this before we left. It is only fair to state that the hotel followed up on my customer satisfaction survey comments both promptly and courteously. All other aspects of the hotel service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Robert R
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel in every possible way. Food was excellent and the staff was most accommodating and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Most likely will not be coming back.”
Reviews.Author: KaitlynElissa
Reviews.Content: The room we had was horrible, in my opinion. The space was super small. The room has 3 very small pull out drawers. We were glad we did not stay more than a day, or we would have been upset with how much space we had. Wallpaper peeling in the bathroom. Double bed was insanely small, but was somewhat comfortable. Tub drained very slowly after using, and toilet looked pretty gross. Not dirty...but just old. Carpet looked very old and somewhat dingy. We had a tv, but for the price of the room and 4 star room ratings, we were expecting to at least have an updated tv, not one that we assumed was 10 years old. We could hear a cell phone ringing, several times, in the room next to us, and could always hear people opening and closing doors and walking down the hallway... walls were obviously thin. I felt like our room was a 2 star and not a 4 star. I have used hotwire for hotels several times, now, and have booked 2 & 3 star hotels where the rooms were much cleaner and more updated than this one. I know it's an older and historical hotel, but we were expecting so much more after seeing how nice the lobby was decorated. Can give credit to the beautiful ceilings in the lobby, but that's probably about it. The whole room's feel just felt so outdated and ugly compared to the pictures we've seen on the site and other hotels we've stayed at. My boyfriend and I felt that we mostly paid for the location of the hotel than for a comfortable room, but we wanted to be right in the middle of downtown Chicago, so we were happy about that. We just felt like we were cheated out of something that could have been so much more!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton should be embrassed”
Reviews.Author: kiabent
Reviews.Content: Paper thin walls (listening to the person next door snore right now), poorly renovated rooms. The rooms are very small including the bathroom. Completely useless front desk, placed on hold repeatedly. We would not recommend staying at this property. As a Hilton Honors member, I am completely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Easy train ride from Midway Airport”
Reviews.Author: jennteam
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, especially if you can get on the upper executive floors. It is an incredibly easy $2.25 train ride directly from Midway Airport on the Orange Line to the Adams street stop, and the hotel is right there at the bottom of the stairs. The pool is so small it's almost unusable. I never did find the workout room. The restaurant in the lobby is excellent, and many other restaurants and Chicago attractions are within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel that has been preserved very well”
Reviews.Author: BakingBarbie
Reviews.Content: We loved the old pictures on the wall of former performers at the hotel. The hotel was clean, but felt the employees could have been more friendly...they were nice, but i didn't feel like a special guest when I passed them at the door, at the conciere desk or in the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KateMMac
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business in May 2011. It's a lovely hotel with an opulent lobby. The room was small but well appointed. I love the location - just around the corner you are at the park and lake! There are many nice restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: eringobalt
Reviews.Content: This place is old style elegance. If you like a place that clearly was putting on the Ritz back in the day, this is your place. Not exactly the most modern place, but who cares when it has a historical flair. They do high tea for heavens sake! I stayed for a work week and had most everything I needed, and set in the downtown has anything else you might need just down the block. While I did not eat at any of their restaurants, I do have room service and it was fine. As anywhere with tip, tax, etc added in and then an expectation for a few more bucks. If anything the downside was far too many folks all too eager to help for tips. If you are elderly and need help with bags ect, this is your place. Also young/hip folks if you can swing the price, this is how high society lived in your grandparents time. I don't mean it in a snarky way, it really is very cool. The rooms are not very large and mine did not have much of a view. The elevated subway chugs outside as well, but that can be great for getting around. Also 2 block way to Michigan avenue and then onto the lakefront area. Excellent place for a business conference with very good on site facilities. Even if you don't stay here, it is almost worth just wandering around the place it is so beautiful and historic.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we found this place”
Reviews.Author: aybsfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our 20th Wedding Anniversary. We ended up here by accident because I failed to make a reservation at another hotel and when we got there they didn't have any vacancies. I was very pleased with our stay so this might have been kismet. Our room was small but very clean. We took The Palmer House Tour which is $50.00 but you get a very big lunch at Lockwood for that price. I was so full from lunch, I had trouble staying awake for the first part of the tour which is a lecture but is very informative. Pros Excellent location for subway, restaurants and CVS. Cons There was only two people working the check-in desk and they were very busy when we were checking in. No WiFI or fridge

Reviews.Title: “Good service & Quiet room”
Reviews.Author: HoosierCFI
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with my son. Requested and received a 2 Queen room. Arrived at the hotel @ 8AM. Proceeded to check in to drop off bags, and was offered room already. Bug thumbs up for this. Room had an interior view, which I was fine with. Quiet room more important than view for me. Was offered a club level upgrade, but because it was my son and I declined it. Overall though would be a good deal for most customers. Very few negatives that I can think of. Bathroom is a little small, but I was fine with this. Thermostat was not accurate and/or didn't provide accurate cooling. It almost seems like a certain brand of hotel thermostat issue, at least that is what I am starting to notice, as I had no issues in my recent stays @ other properties with other thermostats. Big positives were super quiet room, with almost no hallway noise. Great customer service was offered by everyone I encountered. In terms of location, I think you would be hard pressed to find a more public transit friendly property. I think every El line was within 2 blocks of the hotel. For the price offered, I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: Jan49015
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a Christmas gift, and we had a wonderful time! Definately pampered by the attentive staff, loved our stay! We WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nmydream
Reviews.Content: Beautiful surroundings is not all a hotel needs to be a good hotel. Housekeeping was bad (6-night stay). Little things about our stay causes me not to recommend this hotel if you want an all round good stay. From bad bar service to bad housekeeping to food not in par with price this Hilton is not our favorite. Although one good thing is they had plenty of elevators so you never had to wait long for one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location In A Historic Hotel. Not So Great Parking.”
Reviews.Author: SteelcityHammer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during Lollapalooza in August. Thanks to a nice corporate rate we got a great deal and were on the 21st floor in room 2134. The view from the windows was 90% Courtyard, 10% street. There isn't a reason to open the curtains in your room unless you want to look into the rooms across from you. The room was very big with a King bed and large living area with a 90s style tube TV. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever had in a hotel by quite a bit. If there is another person in the bathroom you pretty much cant open the door to get in unless they are in the shower. Our room had a large room in the corner that served as a bar area with a big stainless steel sink set-up meant to make some serious drinks. I'm not really sure what the purpose of this was but it would be nice if we had a lot of friends in the room with us I suppose. We didn't spend much time at the hotel except to sleep so I cant comment on anything other than the lobby and room. Check in was VERY slow, over half an hour for sure and probably closer to 45 minutes in line. The reason for this was the huge amount of people checking in all at once for Lollapalooza but no one seemed in any kind of hurry to get people checked in. It wasn't until we got to the front of the line that we saw there was a separate line for Hilton HHonors members (which we are) and this would have saved a lot of time. There is no on-site parking. They have valet parking for $61 a day or self park across the street for $38. Grant Park was only a 5-10 minute walk depending on how crowded the streets were, so if you are in town for Lollapalooza or an even in Millennium or Grant Park this is an ideal hotel and one of the closest of the classy hotels. The Best Western near Grant Park which has poor reviews was going for double the rate and then some of what I paid. There are endless amounts of dining and shopping options all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms, But Even Worse Was the Used Condom We Found on the Dust Ruffle!”
Reviews.Author: fluffnfold
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at the Palmer House for three nights in mid-August 2011. As Hilton Hhonors Diamond members, we always check prices and availability for Hilton-branded properties first. The location of this hotel appealed to us for several reasons. It is one block from the blue line, so it's a snap to get there from O'Hare (Monroe/Dearborn). The hotel is on the same block as the red line, which was handy for getting to our dinner at Alinea (North/Clybourne). The hotel is one block from the green line (Monroe), which worked well for our visit to the Frank Lloyd Wright's Home and Studio in Oak Park (Harlem). The hotel spans nearly an entire city block, with entrances on Monroe, Wabash, and State Streets (there is no entrance from Adams). There are two CVS pharmacies and two 7-11 convenience stores within a block of the hotel, in case you are looking for a store purchase drinks and snacks for your room. The hotel is one block from Michigan Avenue, Millennium Park, Grant Park, and the Art Institute. The public spaces of the hotel are gorgeous, particularly the soaring painted ceiling in the lobby, off which the Lockwood Restaurant and Bar is found. The lobby itself has a bar, surrounded by additional comfortable seating. Potter's Lounge is accessed from the street level, where there is a Starbucks and small shopping arcade (gift shop, shoe store). The indoor pool is small but adequate. The hotel has an odd configuration. The lobby is on the second level, not the street level, so it is necessary to bring your luggage either up the escalator, elevator, or stairs to check in; however, there is a bellman at the Wabash Street entrance. Both the Wabash Street entrance and the Monroe Street entrances are staffed by doormen who can help you hail a taxi. It seems like the hotel is comprised of several different buildings, along with several different elevator banks; it is necessary to find the correct elevator that will take you to your desired floor, because not all elevators stop on all floors. The Executive Level elevators (and lounge) require key card access. Keep in mind that many of the rooms are TINY! We checked in the day before online, and after reading all the possible room options available to us, we chose the description that stated LARGE ROOM, LARGE BATHROOM. Other descriptions claimed SMALL ROOM, SMALL BATHROOM, NOISY ROOM, and the like, so we felt that we got lucky with room 10171. There was no upgrade offered to us as Diamond members, even though we had booked the second-to-lowest category of room (the lowest being a DOUBLE room with one DOUBLE bed); the hotel was not full, either. Upon seeing the room, if that was a LARGE room, I would dread seeing what the SMALL rooms looked like. Although it would have been possible for the room to be a bit smaller (there was an arm chair in addition to a desk with a chair), I don't see how the bathroom could have been any smaller unless you had to stand in the bathtub or atop the toilet to close the door. The dÃ©cor of the room was attractive and modern, but the size prohibited us from enjoying a relaxing space. On the third day of our stay, we didn't receive service on our room until about 4:00 pm (despite departing the room at 8:00 am), at which time we were showering and dressing for an early dinner. To be fair, we asked the maid to return in an hour after we had departed for dinner, and she did service our room while we were gone. The room had no mini-bar, which we found odd - it's a quick and easy way for a hotel to make a few extra bucks on the guests - although in our room, there was no space to allot for that amenity. Our room had an interior courtyard view, but at least it let in some natural light. Our major complaint about the room occurred on the evening of our second night, when my spouse, dressing for dinner, skimmed a bare foot along the dust ruffle of the bed and withdrew it with a USED CONDOM attached! It doesnâ€™t get much more DISGUSTING than that! We immediately telephoned the front desk - and our call was put on hold - then we called the concierge - and our call was placed on hold again - and finally, we called the special guest services number (I think it we dialed 26 on the phone) - also to be put on hold! Because we were preparing to depart for dinner, we attempted to stop by the executive lounge to voice our discovery (no one was manning the desk), as well as the concierge (where the lines were â€œa mile longâ€�) and finally, the Hhonors front reception desk (where there were no long lines, but where every desk attendant appeared to be waiting on the non-Hhonors patrons). We just wanted to tell someone about our "find", as well as have it removed from our room, but no one was available. Later that evening, we left a message with the front desk staff for the manager; we were told that NO MANAGER WAS ON DUTY ON WEEKENDS, which is a bit disconcerting for a hotel of this size. We donâ€™t understand how a routine cleaning of a room wouldnâ€™t remove such a personal item. The room assumably had a thorough cleaning after the previous customer had checked-out, and we ourselves had some type of service after our initial night stay. It wasn't as if my spouse had gotten on his hands and knees and looked under the bed, or that we had arrived with an ultraviolet black light searching for â€œcreepy crawliesâ€�, so there's no reason why a maid's vacuum cleaner did not uncover the condom. We spend a lot of nights in hotels, some of them at lesser Hilton properties than this full-service Hilton (for example, Hampton Inns and Hilton Garden Inns) and never has this happened before! Apparently, spending extra money on a â€œbetterâ€� properties guarantees you some extra personal-care items! We never received a call from the manager, although we did receive a message from the maid asking us to call and discuss the matter, which we didnâ€™t have time to do. The executive lounge was a bit disappointing - extremely crowded on the weekends at both breakfast and evening cocktails. The breakfast buffet was small but adequate - pastries/muffins/bagels, fresh fruit (whole not sliced), hard-cooked eggs, sliced luncheon meats, hot oatmeal, yogurt, juices, flavored waters, and coffee. The evening cocktail hour featured sliced fresh fruit, fresh vegetables and dip, and some hot hors d'oeuvre items, along with complimentary non-alcoholic beverages. My spouse purchased a beer, which was $6; I'm not sure if that was a "deal" as compared to what they were charging in the lobby bar, nor could we compare the price to that of the mini-bar because our room didnâ€™t have one. From the sizable crowds in the executive lounge, it seems that everyone is either a Gold or Diamond Hhonors member these days, although no one really checked guests in and verified that they belonged there. We saw many extended families, some with as many as 6 family members, staking out places in the lounge and partaking of the freebies. Key card access is required to access the lounge from the lobby or street level, but with the many additional elevators and staircases in the hotel, you can get around that if you know how. Overall, this was a disappointing stay, and we would not recommend this hotel, which is a shame, really, because the location is great. We could overlook the size of the room (even though it was billed as LARGE but to us appeared SMALL), but the whole USED CONDOM ISSUE is pretty unforgivable!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel, Super Location”
Reviews.Author: John Z
Reviews.Content: Grand hotel, our room was very small, but it was only a one night stay, so the location and amenities made up for it. Thanks Again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Rooms are Small”
Reviews.Author: liskarita
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous! Right downtown near all the attractions. Perfect location. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We were supossed to have a queen bed, but the bed was small, and when we called down to check they said it was a "California Queen" and smaller than a standard queen. They upgraded us to a king bed which was very comfortable. Both rooms were extremely small. Perhaps this is how hotel downtown are, but I was surprised. Also, it is an additional $10 to use the fitness center. The center is nice though and offers classes and has a steam room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: mary62652
Reviews.Content: We had great service from the minute we walked up to the front desk in the lobby. Courteous and offered services we didn't think to ask for like splitting the bill three ways. We had efficient and friendly service from the bellmen as we had to store our luggage on both days since we arrived early on the train and stayed late because of train departure times. Room was great and the optional second bathroom made things very easy.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhec
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is impressive as are many of the public areas. We felt the front desk man was more interested in persuading us to upgrade to an executive floor than anything else; he forgot to give us our coupons for the inclusive breakfast which meant I had to leave the dining room on our first morning to return to the front desk to collect them! However, the breakast was excellent - consistently so over the five mornings of our stay, although we needed to arrive by 8:15 or face a wait: a conference at the hotel meant the second part of our stay was busier than the first couple of days. We had a king size bedroom on the 19th floor - great bed, very comfortable room, but an incredibly small bathroom. Everything worked fine, but the bathroom was one of the smallest I've ever seen in a hotel of this standard. The staff were pleasant and helpful, particularly those involved with breakfast. A very central location, easy to get to everything from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel - would love to have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: 12marionc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a beautiful building with fantastic public rooms with shops and Starbucks within the hotel. Found the restaurant and bar expensive but overall a good place to stay. Would appreciate free internet connection, and coffee machine in the bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LiFrannie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Chicago. The room was nicely decorated, but the bathroom was very small. We had a king size bed which was extremely comfortable. The old black and white photographs throughout the hotel were neat! Seeing how people dressed back in the 1930's in Chicago was very interesting. As well as all of the stars that have performed there. The breakfast (which was included in the price of the room) was very plentiful. The only bad item were the scrambled eggs that were not quite cooked enough. They failed to inform us at check in that we needed coupon for the free breakfast, but we quickly got one at the front desk. Checkout was at 12, but we requested a late checkout and was told that we could extend it to 1 at no additional charge. We asked about extending it to 3 pm and was told it would be an additional $50. The only advice I would give is to not book any tours through the Gray Line tour company that is located inside the hotel. We did and were very, very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel - nice rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: GATravelGuy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times over that past year for business. It is blocks away from the museums and lakefront. And of course there are great restaurants close by including Al's Chicago Beef. The escalator ride from the street level up to the main lobby is amazing especially as you begin to see the lobby ceiling. I like ornate, old school hotels and the Palmer House is one of those. Most of the rooms that I have stayed in are updated and decorated nicely. I will say that I have Hilton Diamond status so most of them are upgraded rooms. The lobby bar is great and also the restaurant. I have used the workout facility which is top notch. The executive level 23rd floor does get a bit crowded in the morning so arrive there there early if you can. The front desk personnel seem friendly and competent delivering a speedy check in process. Overall this is one of my favorite hotels when visiting downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyC12
Reviews.Content: One of my favourite hotels in Chicago, the lobby alone is worth the price, it has all the charm and character of the old hotel but with updated amenities. The rooms are simple but have everything that you need. There is a Starbucks in the street level so you don't even have to leave the hotel to get your caffeine fix The location is close to State Street shopping (Nieman's Rack, Filene's basement, Macy's) and lots of restaurants nearby. Highly recommend the Atwood Cafe on Washington for their simple menu and Everleigh's Lemonade (vodka lemonade and fresh raspberries!).

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary!”
Reviews.Author: yakimama
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I had a girls' weekend in downtown Chicago. We chose the Palmer House Hilton because of its beauty and history. The service was outstanding, from the front desk to the concierge to the bellman. The room was comfortable and we loved our king room with two bathrooms! The hotel is so gorgeous that is was fun to be in the midst of all that history. The location is also great- a short cab ride or walk to whatever we wanted to do. i will definitely be back! We took a Segway tour with Segway Experience of Chicago- it was a total blast. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Chicago, will definitely be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: LMOP67
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel, the lobby is one of the nicest I've ever been in and I travel for work a lot. We had two reservations, one on Hilton points and one we paid the room rate for. They combined the two and actually gave us a package rate for the paid nights stay. The room was beautiful, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We will be making this our home in Chicago for any future stays!

Reviews.Title: “How the Pros Do It”
Reviews.Author: DuaneSandul
Reviews.Content: Everything you want from a world-class hotel. Polite personnel, and friendly to boot. Check-in was easy and they actually seemed happy to see you. Location to things to do in Chicago and nearness to metro is great. Only bummer is that the biz center charges 90cents a minute for computer use and an outrageous daily amount to use wi-fi,which is available only in lobby or coffee shops. Why is it that Hilton's Embassy Suites can provide free wi-fi and free use of a compute in their business center, but the other Hilton's like this charge you a small fortune. May sound nitpicking, but if you are staying a few days, the costs to stay connected, as they say, grows to the point that other hotels may be an option.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel - Worth a Visit”
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago and the hotel has been refurbished well since then. The lobby is stunning and the public areas are very good. When we checked in we were offered an upgrade to the Executive Floors and were able to negotiate a very good deal on this. The room was a little smaller than we expected but was well appointed and very comfortable. Although we were on the 22nd floor there was not real view as the room looked inwards. The breakfast and refreshments offered with the upgrade were well worth the extra we paid. The hotel is well situated within The Loop and close to the CTA stations and bus routes and shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “No wireless???”
Reviews.Author: Mentirita
Reviews.Content: Beautifully restored grand lobby. Lovely staff. Clean (though room was dark most of the day and needed lights on...and so narrow that room service delivery person had to angle self and juggle tray to get between bed and TV to deposit food on the desk...) and nice towels and toiletries. Good water pressure. That's the good news. I and a colleague on a different floor experienced the same noise issue: someone having a perfectly normal conversation on their phone in the room next door sounded like they were in my room. Not yelling. Just talking. Bizarre that sound would carry so fully between rooms. (No adjoining door either.) The big issue for me is that a conference venue hotel with all the pretensions of gradeur that the PHH has, doesn't have WIFI in the rooms. There is a plug for a computer. Low speed at $14.95 plus tax per day or $19.95 for high speed. I travel with my iPad, so I was out of luck. The front desk has "a few" wireless network boxes that you can try to borrow. They had none during my stay. The lobby has some wireless on a pay by the hour basis. I didn't use it, but others did. If you forego the internet connectivity, you can do online check in for your departing flight and print your boarding pass at the main floor UPS Store which serves as their business centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel; architectural gem; comfy room”
Reviews.Author: MidwstrnTrvlr
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. We had drinks in the gorgeous hotel lobby where they have groupings of leather chairs/coffee table seating arrangements. I've never had drinks in more beautiful surroundings! Our room/bathroom was big enough to be comfortable. Bed and linens felt wonderful. Only negative was a bit of hallway & plumbing noise, but hallway traffic was low and noisy plumbing pipes in ceiling didn't go on forever. Totally worth it for the historic ambience. I wish they built buildings like this today. But since they don't, I'm glad for the opportunity to stay in one built in 1875!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ` ~ prefect place to stay for the 1/2 marathon in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: flostoria
Reviews.Content: Very clean and nice rooms. Big rooms with comfy beds!

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: 3hundrd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business. The lobby is absolutely beautiful so it's a big letdown when you get to your room. Small, crowded, dark, not too clean and very dated. All for $200 plus per night - no thanks. I can also say quite honestly that the person checking us in was definitely the rudest person I've ever experienced at a hotel check-in. Quite a surprise for a Hilton. There's lots of hotel in Chicago - I'd suggest you stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: mma04c
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends from college and I get together for a trip every year, and this year Chicago won out as the city that would be graced with our presence =) We spent a week at the Palmer House and everything, absolutely everything, from beginning to end, was fantastic. I am a Hilton Honors member and booked this hotel on points (though none of the others did, so this review shouldn't be read as a raving review by someone who gets perks or anything). I arrived early, and upon stepping into the lobby it quite literally took my breath away. It's STUNNING. Check in was very fast, I was able to get into my room at 10:30 am (regular check in is at 3pm) and I was just in awe the whole time. I made it to my floor and eventually found my room (word to the wise...this place can be a little maze-like in the hallways, but with 1639 rooms that's understandable!) the room was impeccable (albeit a little warm) and decorated beautifully. There were some things that seemed outdated though, such as the small-ish (for the size of the room) tube tv and the extremely small bathroom (read: door could not open the whole way or it would hit the tub) the bathroom size may bother people who are a bit larger, as there really is no room to turn around in there or anything, but I am understanding the hotel is also in the works of renovating a lot of their rooms, so I may have been in one that has not been completed yet. As part of the Hilton Honors program I had access to the executive level concierge and 'happy hours' if you have access to these do go, it was a great break in the day to enjoy some snacks and drinks in the middle of being touristy =) Check out was speedy as well, just dial a number and input your departure time and that's it. Nothing to sign or fill out, pretty convenient. Room service was very fast, and the food was good, however they do stop service at 10pm. We did request a bottle opener and plates/forks/knives a couple times and they were sent up within 5 minutes even after hours. I do know they have an AMAZING spa, but I unfortunately didn't get a chance to go =( The fitness center is pretty amazing too, however I don't believe it's free (which can be a turnoff, there are, however, trainers available all the time to help you with your workout, which can be a turn on) Overall I would recommend this hotel to just about anyone. If you're in CHicago on business it's definitely an amazing place to bring clients, very impressive. The downstairs bar and lounge always had well dressed people having drinks/apps. For families, it's very spacious (well except for the bathroom in my case) and the desk attendants were more than willing to help us find tours, book dinners, etc. Couples will enjoy the romantic ambiance and everyone should enjoy the central location. Both the red and blue line trains have stops within a block of the hotel and with entrances to all four streets surrounding there was NEVER a time where we couldnt catch a bus or train or cab. Loved the Palmer House!

Reviews.Title: “palmer house hilton disappointing”
Reviews.Author: stj0hnvisit0r
Reviews.Content: hotel rooms even on executive floor sorely inneed of renovation:stained carpet, broken shower drain, old tv. no hbo or on demand. gym beautiful but cost exra, even on exec floor. no wireless , and costs extra! concierge on exec floor was wonderful, house! i wish i knew his name but he is a tall, thin african american gentleman who made our stay a pleasure

Reviews.Title: “we won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: michelle r
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Friday to attend a baseball game. We requested a kingsized bed. I guess we should also have requested a kingsized room. I have never seen a room so small.
