We paid over $200.00 for the night. The bathroom tub was not clean and the drain was stopped up so we had to shower in standing water. The iron did not work properly. The television had very limited access. The game began in the afternoon and we wanted to check out a hour later. We were told there would be an additional charge. Needless to say we just put our bags in the car.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but unfriendly front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: RBRSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August. Front desk attendees need to be more polite. Besides that, the rest was OK, specially the Executive Lounge

Reviews.Title: “A lobby to rival Europe's best and a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: farlow
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at The Palmer House and were very impressed. I had been there many years ago and knew it had the bones of a truly classic hotel, it just needed a corp. with the same vision. Happy the Hilton stepped in. The lobby is fabulous. The location terrific. Although the rooms are lovely and well appointed, they are small. But there is way too much to do in Chicago to stay in a bedroom!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but tired”
Reviews.Author: SethP3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very beautiful and old. It was full of history and the staff was very helpful. The hotel is old and tired. The room never got cool even with the air conditioning set to maximum. For the price that you pay for this hotel a few amenities would be nice. We had a 2 year old traveling with us and had to keep his juice cold in the bathroom sink with ice. I have stayed at cheaper hotels and they had a mini fridge. It appears that the more you pay for in a hotel the less you get for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Look for an alternative, not a place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: alex j
Reviews.Content: I was charged twice for parking. I had trouble getting that settled during check out because I had to wait multiple times for the right person to take care of double charges. I am a Diamond member, the wait for Hhonors line was terrible since no one was at the reception desk. I had trouble getting to the manager on-site; she blew me off by me telling to wait even more once she came to the front desk. So I just left. Also, the password for WiFi was useless, there was no WiFi signal on my floor. The elevator didn't work on the ground floor; I had to go to the 1st floor to catch the elevator. Overall, it was an inconvenient stay.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Gem”
Reviews.Author: DennisLaurieNuhn
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palmer House for 3 nights. This hotel is massive and really something you must see as it is one of the oldest in the city. My personal preference is to stay somewhere a little less busy but this hotel is clean provides excellent service and was a good value. The location was within walking distance from the train station and is only a few blocks to such attractions as Millenium park, Art institute and the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palmer House Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: mystique7
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Chicago at the Palmer House Hilton for our anniversary weekend. A friend of ours had stayed there recently and suggested it. We were not dissappointed! The hotel was absolutely beautiful (the lobby was absolutely breathtaking) and in an ideal location. The service provided by the staff there was top notch. The concierge was especially helpful in providing us with places to eat etc... We stayed on the 18th floor and I don't think it was an updated room but the room was spacious and clean. Only minor negative was that they provided internet in the room but not wifi (you had to pay for it) so that was a little annoying but nothing major. Some people on here also mentioned being annoyed by no coffee machine or mini bar but I didn't even notice there was none as we never usually use it anyway. Why make coffee in your room when you have so much available to you right outside of the hotel (including a starbucks downstairs)? :) We were also impressed by the breakfast buffet . Lots to choose from and hit the spot prior to sight seeing all day. We absolutely loved Chicago and I would go back in a minute and I would definitely book the Palmer House Hilton when we do!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown Chicago location”
Reviews.Author: Tad S
Reviews.Content: Had several days in Chicago and chose the Palmer House because of it's parking program. Beautiful classic hotel right in the middle of Chicago. Easy walks to everything we wanted to see in the downtown area. Starbucks on the street level along with a UPS location, which was great as I needed to ship a large bag of sports equipment. All the staff greets you throughout the hotel. A great place to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat to stay at the Palmer House!”
Reviews.Author: Sabrinagirl
Reviews.Content: If only we could have sneaked out the mattress set to take home and sleep on - it was heaven. The breakfast buffet was just what we needed every morning to tempt our taste buds and fuel our bodies for a day of walking. The location was convenient to everything and the staff was knowledgeable and friendly. We hope to be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Clean Room, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: volk04
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Palmer House for a quick weekend getaway in Chicago. The check in process was slow, but there were a lot of people checking in at the same time (they only had 2 clerks working). After check in I went straight to the room. We were on the 9th floor. The room was large with 2 double beds in it and two sets of windows. The room was clean, and so was the bathroom. My only complaint about the hotel was you can at time wait a long time for an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: MrP77
Reviews.Content: We stay at this property every chance we get. The staff is always more than accommodating and the location is perfect. The restaurant is average but many excellent alternatives are just a short cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Larrydj5
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Palmer House when I am visiting Chicago for over 10 years. The staff is friendly. The amenities are superb. Also, the property is located in a good area for shopping, dinner with friends, and tourist activities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful 100 Year Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terrell_Lee
Reviews.Content: Talk about strong energy, check out The Empire Room, their historic show room circa 1910, Libaratche, Durante, Sanatra and Sofe Tucker have graced that stage. Located just off the lobby and up the Grand Staircase. If the walls could talk, I'm sure you could sit and listen for years. Very Nice and Very Small Rooms, tiny bathrooms, but, the service was wonderful. The Vibe, It's there ! This hotel was featured in the 2007 Movie "The Fugitive"

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel all around, looks and service wise”
Reviews.Author: HotelsRboring
Reviews.Content: I have so many positive things to say about this hotel that I donâ€™t know where to start. Perhaps Iâ€™ll start by mentioning Dardan Mehmeti, he went out of his way to ensure our stay was special. He is very dedicated to his job and a great person to deal with. Thank you Dardan! Aside from Dardan the entire staff really made sure to take good care of us during our stay. Not just the usual customer facing roles like concierge and check in, but the person who delivered our roll away bed even took the time to learn how to pronounce my last name (and itâ€™s not an easy one to pronounce). We arrived on a Friday night around 6 pm and only stood in line for check in for a minute or two. With regards to the hotel, this was more of a weekend away with some friends and not a business trip. The lobby is obviously breath taking and I highly recommend visiting making sure to have a drink or a coffee in the lobby. The coffee in the lobby is quite good (and I travel central America) and since there is no in room coffee machine itâ€™s a great excuse to get down there. A lot of other reviews mentioned small rooms, we got a 2 bathroom 2 bedroom unit on the 15th floor. It was quite big but I realize it was probably an upgrade, we met some other people staying at the hotel and invited them up to our room. Their first reaction was â€œWow this room is bigâ€�. A lot of other people complained about slow elevators. There are a few shafts serving different floors, but we never waited more than a minute or two. The actual room itself was well appointed in terms of linen. The room has a comfortable chair and two benches at the foot of a very comfortable bed. Cleaning staff always seem to come right as we slipped out for the day. The bathrooms in our 2 bathroom unit were sufficient and not as cramped as others have described. In room safe was also provided which is a bonus. The alarm clock supported aux input which is handy. My friend forgot a few toiletry items and requested a toothbrush. A ziplock bag full of supplies promptly arrived which had everything from a toothbrush to hairspray, definitely one of the best emergency toiletry kits Iâ€™ve seen a hotel provide. I was very satisfied with my stay but the only things that were missing were a flat screen TV and in room coffee. Not really a big deal since the coffee in the lobby was quite good and we didnâ€™t end up watching much TV. The room also had a surplus of a/c outlets. I canâ€™t tell you how many hotels Iâ€™ve been to where Iâ€™ve had to unplug a lamp in order to get access to two a/c outlets. Ice machine / pop machine on every floor, and one of the pop machines accepts MasterCard PayPass, perfect since I despise change and $1 bills. There is also a starbucks in the lobby which has free wifi. We ended up using the pool and hot tub daily, the pool isnâ€™t huge but enough to swim a couple of laps and the hot tub big enough to fit about 8 people. Towels are provided at the pool but it closes promptly at 9pm. We didnâ€™t end up using the fitness center but from what we could see through the window, it was pretty large (compared to other urban hotels) and had a number of flat screen TVâ€™s. I was very satisfied that the hotel had discounted self park. Iâ€™m not a fan of waiting for a valet to retrieve and park my car, so it was nice saving a few bucks and parking myself, itâ€™s also frustrating when hotels charge you the same for valet as for self park. You get in / out privileges and its $38 a day. The lot itself is on the next block, but once you exit the garage you just have to run across Wabash and the side door to the hotel is there (important in the winter/rain). The parking is supposed to be valid until 6pm the day of your departure. For some reason the lot tried to charge us $16 on departure despite the parking being billed to our room. I pressed the assistance button on the exit gate, and was told to go into the parking office. I showed my invoice from the hotel and they let me out free. So keep your departure invoice! The hotel is close to the loop but we never bothered taking the subway since taxiâ€™s were quite cheap (compared to Toronto). The area itself has a few decent restaurants. We were very happy with the meal at Ex-chequer apparently an Al Capone spot. Millerâ€™s pub was open a bit later on Sunday and the food was also good (had a great prime rib dinner). All within blocks from the hotel. Overall I am very satisfied with my stay at the Palmer house, Iâ€™m curious what the executive floors have to offer so Iâ€™ll probably end up booking a room up there since I was so satisfied with my stay. I stayed at the Sheraton E. North Water street last time and the Palmer house was much better overall. The loop also had more restaurants and stuff to do in the evening / late hours than the area around the Chicago river. Thanks again Palmer House, youâ€™ve done a great job!

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of History”
Reviews.Author: K_The_Tourist
Reviews.Content: From the Peacock doors to the painted ceiling and chandeliers in the lobby, this hotel exudes the glamour of a bygone age. Itâ€™s fascinating to check out which artistes played at the famous Empire Room (Frank Sinatra, Judy Garland, Nat King Cole to name but a few) and see which famous people have stayed there during its lifetime. If it's a slice of history you're after, then look no further as this is a great place to stay and explore. The standard rooms may be a bit on the small side, but the one we stayed in was very nicely decorated with the furniture finished in black granite and a lovely marble bathroom. We couldn't fault the housekeeping. The hotel is conveniently located in The Loop district, and is only a short walk away from places such as the Magnificent Mile and Navy Pier. There's a nice, little Starbucks located at one of its entrances and the Corner Bakery is just a few steps away. Tip: Try Fox and Obel (not far from Navy Pier) for a great food shopping experience and a delicious lunch - loved the sweet potato fries.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: jason l
Reviews.Content: Brought my family of 4 on a 4 night trip. I only booked 2 nights at first because I've found that once we get to a destination, no matter how much research I've done, we always find a better place once we get there and look around. However, in this case, there was no place we saw that was better. The location was great; close to the park and central to all the attractions. The staff was great (bell hops, front desk, cleaning people, etc.). The room was larger than we expected and had 2 walk in closets. Lobby is great. We travled on the train from the airport and the stop is 2 blocks away. We traveled to a White Sox game and the train terminal is 1 block away. We had no problem getting a taxi. BTW the taxi fare will be about $10 for anywhere you go. We have no complaints and recommend this hotel for any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: gatsbyCleveland_Ohio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House for the first time since it's been renovated, so it's been a few years. We usually stay at Kimpton properties while in Chicago - good rates, friendly staff, the wine hour. But we were going to Lollapalooza, which was only a couple of blocks up Monroe, and I got a decent rate on the Executive floor with self-park included. The hotel has been beautifully redone. The check-in was efficient and friendly. We got to our room - no mini bar. That drives me crazy, personally. Not that I ever use it, but we do like to stuff our leftovers in the fridge! I was not going to pay for a fridge to come to the room. Also - no free internet. I may be crazy, but as a silver HHonors member I believe I had free internet before. You can go to a Hampton and get it - why not the Palmer house? Ugh. The room was nice. Small, but nice. Bed was comfy, they usually are at Hilton properties. The bartender in the executive lounge had no clue on how to make a martini with a lemon twist - my husband ended up with a lime after she asked if he wanted olives. One evening we stopped at the lobby bar, Potter's, for drinks before going to bed, and the bartender had no idea what I was asking for - a wine that was on their somewhat limited by the glass list. I had to point it out. Also - for whatever reason they were not allowing carry out of food that evening. And they were a bit abrupt telling people about it. We had our drink and went upstairs where we had a bottle of wine waiting. When it was time to check out I called the bell desk to have them get our bags - we were going to do some shopping before leaving the city. I was asked (also abruptly) "are you ready?". NO. I always call the bell desk when I'm not ready. Then he went to the wrong room. He had to go back downstairs and find out where he was supposed to be going. When we came back for our bags I was told that I couldn't have them until my husband was in front of the hotel with the car. OK. So when he got there, there was a huge line. I finally got my turn, and the bellman who had my luggage moved so s-l-o-w-l-y that I almost grabbed the cart myself. Then he just stood there and let my husband load the car! Ugh. Anyway, it was an ok stay, we've had worse in better places. But we were disappointed in little things. Next time we will be back at a Kimpton property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: AshBH
Reviews.Content: Our 5 day stay at the Palmer House was great. The staff was super friendly (especially the bell desk!), and the hotel itself is beautiful. Pros - Awesome location - so easy to get around - Great staff - Beautiful rooms (assuming you get one of the re-done ones - we upgraded to a bigger room and it was worth the extra $20 per night) - Amazing gym - Starbucks in the lobby - good place to meet and get caffeine fix Cons - No WiFi and it's not free (the hotel is one of the oldest in Chicago and built with super thick walls, making WiFi difficult) - The regular rooms are very small, but typical for the age of the hotel (if you are by yourself without a lot of luggage, it's fine)

Reviews.Title: “Coolest hotel in chicago”
Reviews.Author: vino78
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very cool and historic. The service was great and we recieved a free room upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in chicago”
Reviews.Author: jminchew
Reviews.Content: Great trip wonderful hotel and service . As a diamond member I would have liked a quicker check in

Reviews.Title: “Lobby worth the trip, but no wi fi and poor cell coverage in tiny room.”
Reviews.Author: sjjtx
Reviews.Content: Lobby is breathtaking and worth a visit on its own. Had meeting in the ballroom which was also interesting visually. My king bedroom was tiny and would never have fit two double beds. Bathroom very small. Virtually no sink counter space. It is expected you will store toiletries on shelves below sink. Felt like I was in Europe. Staff very friendly and was allowed to check in at noon and check out at 12:30 for no additional charge (I am Hilton silver level). Bed comfortable, linens good, but there was no conditioner with the complimentary toiletries. I was traveling with my IPad. There is a high speed connection in the room for a fee. Could not get coverage on the IPad even with the 3G. Went to the lobby, still did not work. Went outside by the Bellman, could not get anything because of the L. Finally, went in Starbucks at ground level in building and did fine. Location was very good only a short walk to the river.

Reviews.Title: “Old girl has charm but not what it should be”
Reviews.Author: pmny
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palmer House a few times. The hotel has character, the main lobby is very beautiful, but then it falls off. The rooms are on the small side and it appears that they are renovating the rooms in a phased approach. The upgrades are not the best and the bathroom feels very cramped. Besides that the hotel is in a great spot with in the loop and very convenient to all the sites. This hotel is a work horse and gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: “Antique Charm and average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Vw2410
Reviews.Content: I was at this historic hotel for a 3 day business trip. After reading the hotel web-site I expected modern rooms situated within a historic hotel with old Chicago era flare. However, the recent renovation must have only included the bathroom sink, mirror and bed. The rest of the room was dated (like 1960's), pale green tiles, old looking carpet, black lacquer furniture and extremely small rooms (think European). I am a Hilton honors member and I was not acknowledged as such upon check in. Normally, I receive a bottle of water or free internet, not the case at this hotel. During my second day, the fire alarm went off in my room. After I scrambled to get dressed and left, I realized it was only MY room. I went to the front desk to address the issue later that day and they laughed at me (after hearing my story) and told me not to worry about it. I was unsatisfied with this response and I called the desk back later and was transferred to security. This person was very hard to understand because of his heavy accent. He informed me that the fire alarm in my room had been replaced earlier in the day and the problem should be fixed. I wouldn't have mentioned this incident, if it weren't for the fact that no one came to my room or called when the alarm was going off or informed me that the faulty alarm was fixed. I had to initiate the requests. What if it was a real fire? As I mentioned earlier, this hotel was a historic hotel. The lobby was beautiful with hand painted ceilings and gilded lights. Additionally, the conference rooms were ornately decorated and had huge chandeliers throughout. There were so many antique features in the hotel; it felt like you stepped back in time. Overall, it was tolerable for a short business trip. However, if you are looking for luxury this may not be the place for you. The staff was not very helpful and some of them had heavy accents that made them difficult to understand.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: kbelbert
Reviews.Content: tiniest room we have ever stayed in. difficult for 2 people to pass each other to get around the bed. also rooms tired. elevators incredbily slow despite 3 banks of them divided by floors for (one would have thought) efficiency and quick response. poor staffing-at 4:30 Saturday afternoon, only 1 concierge on duty--very long lines at registration. there was one highlight--pillows were amazing and in great supply. this hotel is resting heavily on its former reputation as a chicago landmark hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: JCJCJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight for a sightseeing visit to Chicago. Great location, walking distance to all the sights and right by the train line for access to both airports. Rooms are a little small but comfortable and the hotel lobby and bar is beautiful. We got a great price online, not sure if my review would be that good if I had paid full price

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: driller80027
Reviews.Content: Outstanding historic hotel. For those who take photos of chipping paint, small rooms and bathrooms, "outdated" styling...stay somewhere else. This is an old hotel with a lot of charm. It's clean, still classy and in a perfect location in the loop. It was built in another era when men wore hats and women wore dresses. Just very interesting. Not overly expensive given that it's downtown Chicago. They charge for internet, though. Go to Starbucks downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Started iffy - but picked up”
Reviews.Author: FlyinBee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights, and when we first arrived we were put in a truly minescule double-room; so tiny that the door would hit the chair by the desktop when opened. I was not happy, but we were jetlagged and did not want the hazzle of changing rooms late at night. We slept quite well, but the next morning we asked for a twin room, since experience has showed us that such rooms tend to be somewhat larger than double-rooms. The front desk was very accomodating, and we got a twin room, and boy were we surprised when we got to the room and found it TWICE the size of the double room - same charge. It was great! The Palmer House is a lovely old hotel, and we enjoyed staying in our spacious room - everything worked perfectly, it was clean and tidy at all times. I would recommend this hotel to friends who are not boutique-fanatics, but who can appreciate such and Old Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Super close to Grant Park for Lollapalooza”
Reviews.Author: ak9574
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, comfortable beds, and great service. Just wish I had time to hang out in the gorgeous lobby bar or try the restaurants, time was limited due to Lollapalooza. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel with a lot of charm in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: OlgaGrigoreva
Reviews.Content: Palmer House might be a little bit too big, and it's easy to get lost inside (happenned to us a couple of times in 2 days), but it is very beautiful, and its rooms are clean and comfortable. We stayed in Chicago for 2 days, visited everything we wanted to see, and did not have to take a bus/taxi/subway even once, because the hotel is located, literally, in the middle of everything. Staff is friendly and helpful, the concierge serivce is amazing. Many good eateries all around the hotel, and they do have starbucks, bar and restaurant on premises. I would totally stay here again, and recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: CREA_tive07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palmer House Hilton for one night, but it was a wonderful night! The front desk staff were very nice and professional. This was our first time in a Hilton hotel. We were given a room on the 15th floor (recently renovated). Although our view was not good, the room itself was more than we expected. The two beds were very comfortable, the sofa was great and so was the bathroom. The room was quite clean and large, and had many many mirrors. It was also well decorated. Internet and valet parking (61$) were too expensive though. I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “I stay here every month.”
Reviews.Author: TripMeUpScotty
Reviews.Content: Ask for one of the medium to large size rooms, not just a king or 2 doubles. Some of the bathrooms can be small.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderful service, great value!”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom030
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Palmer House for Lollapolooza because of it's location. We had no idea that it would be so perfect. The check-in on Friday was a very long wait, but they offered everyone standing in line complimentary champagne or cold water. Can't ask for more than that! We had 2 rooms and both were very nice, confortable and furnished nicely. The bellman and valet parkers bent over backwards to be helpful as we checked out on Sundy at 12n, but the concert lasted until 10pm that night. Our bags and car were well looked after and available at my asking. Only one small complaint - they charge a mandatory fee of $40 for a roll-a-way bed, The bed was old, all springs and very uncomfortable. Most hotels offer higher quality roll-a-ways for much less. Other than that, wonderful food & drink, great lobby and a Starbucks. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Much better places in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: travelrevi
Reviews.Content: This mammoth hotel is in need of a major overhaul as it pertains to the rooms. They are small and dated. The bathroom doors (plural as I requested a second room) are split from water damage. The first room I was assigned had torn wall paper and smudges on the wall. The overall experience of the rooms is unpleasant though clean for the most part. The positives are the beds are comfortable, location, on site restaurants and amenities. Shops etc if you forget anything. Check in does what they can with what they have. The room assigment process is comical due to the number of stipulations around the type of room you can pay for. Overall not worth the trouble, not a good experience and I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but hard to get to with all the construction”
Reviews.Author: AK2TXGirl
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, excellent service and beautiful lobby - felt like a princess in a castle. Rooms were clean but dated - that said, they are remodeling floor by floor and have the bottom 5 floors done (I stayed on the 16th). Super location but with gps not able to get a signal, construction on many roads and preparations for lala-pallooza, it took me 45 minutes to get there! It was a happy splurge to stay there and friends tell me it is one of the more reasonable priced hotel in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very grand and a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: picknage
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night for a quick Chicago stopover en route to Seattle. Location is great- close to main train line from airport and within walking distance of most city centre sights. The entrance is very grand- made me think of Al Capone and that era! The restaurant was nice and not too expensive. Staff were friendly and room was nice, with good views of skyscrapers and older buildings. Liked it and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Palmer House is great”
Reviews.Author: jills3134
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby, excellent service, fairly updated and spacious standard rooms (considering the age of the hotel), excellent location to the most popular tourist activities and access to public transportation. Overall, a wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel and very well maintained. I would love to return.”
Reviews.Author: saunders-nazareth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great classic place to stay in downtown Chicago. Location is perfectly near State street, the Art Institue, and many restaurants. The lobby is fantastically restored. While we did not have a drink in the lobby, we did have a cocktail in Potter's Lounge. My kids enjoyed the pool although it was quite small if you are looking to do laps in the morning. I was a bit disappointed to find that the gym was an extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant old hotel--I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MindyK07076
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House for business in July. The first room that I received was the size of a postage stamp, but was beautifully decorated. After stripping the bed as I always do, I noted an insect in the mattress pad (don't think it was a bed bug, but I wouldn't chance it --you're in the city--you have to expect this sort of thing); they apologized profusely and changed my room to a lovely room four times the size and gave me a coupon for money off in the restaurant. The hotel is fabulous--the lobby is gorgeous, both rooms were very tastefully and fashionably decorated and I appreciated the elegant old touches, like the marble floor in the bathroom and the doorknobs and crown moldings. I would have also appreciated a coffee maker in the room, but there was a Starbucks in the hotel, so it was all good. The location was perfect for my business and a block from Michigan Ave for after work sightseeing. I loved it and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected....”
Reviews.Author: funkydrmr
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel was the lobby. Beautifuly decorated and the ceiling was a sight to see, but it all stopped there. Though the service was impecable the room seemed like it hasn't been "updated since the 30's. If the TV would have been a flat screen and little bigger with more channels it may have occupied out time in the room a little better. The room was clean and housekeeping did a good job on the upkeep. I guess if we were 30 years older (we are in our 20's) it may have been fine. Our hallway also and on "off" odor. We also experienced Potters lounge. The atmosphere was great but the music didn't match the decor. The decor says 1940-1950 but the music was 2011. Chairs were comfortable and it seemed really nice inside. The drinks were very palatable and reasonably priced for the area. The food however was disapointing. The sliders were dry and flavorless, no point in using Wagyu beef if you are going to overcook and under season 80/20 would have been better, the peppercorn sauce was....???? Also, there really wasn't a proper bun to meat ratio way too much bun. We also tried the flatbread, it was a good flavor "profile" but very poorly executed. The crust was soft and a bit chewy and the lemon zest was clumped on top. If the line cook in back took the time to bake it properly and grate the fresh lemon zest evenly on the pizza we would have been in buisness. I don't expect much out of room service but we did order the parmesan fries and a bottle of champagne. The fries were old and not fresh and withought the company of the parmesan cheese. After the disapointment from Potters we should have known better but we were still hungry! I hope this helps whoever reads this and you might want to choose a different hotel. Erik FYI, I am a Sous Chef at a hotel/spa/casino

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: Pinevalleyite
Reviews.Content: Hilton runs some great specials & we got the Palmer in Chicago for a steal with breakfast included. Stayed Fri & Sat nights. Room was great - bed extremely comfortable (only issue was a slight damp smell in room indicating possible prior water issue?). Bathroom on smaller side but shower great and plenty of shelf space. Hotel has such history & the ceiling and common areas are magnificent. Breakfast was a wonderful buffet with omelet or eggs or pancakes to order. Very busy hotel so only issue was trying to get info from Concierge at times. Great location as is walking distance to Millennium Park. We also hoofed it to a couple of further away sites & then took buses or cabs back. Trains are clean and safe & only a block or two away from hotel depending on which color train you need. Busses great too & cabs not expensive and they are metered and regulated. Save time & money taking the blue line from O'Hare to a block from hotel for only $2.25 per person!

Reviews.Title: “This Place is STILL my Favorite”
Reviews.Author: MarJor
Reviews.Content: This place has been our downtown Chicago destination for 25 years. It is located cnetrally, still has one of the finest old style lobbies, service is great and when you get a special Hilton room rate, is hard to pass up.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like old Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Grace080
Reviews.Content: My sister and I traveled to Chicago for the first time and we were immediately awestruck by the magnificent architecture, city infrastructure and welcoming vibe. The Palmer House definitely lived up to our expectations. The lobby was simply spectacular! Its glamorous decor made me feel like I was somewhere quite special! Centrally located, just minutes from the best shopping and the famous waterfront. Delicious breakfast buffet. The Palmer House delivered; the only minor drawback was the small washroom, but otherwise perfect! Would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A rare find: a charming business hotel”
Reviews.Author: miloux
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and was surprised at how comfortable and welcoming this large Chicago landmark is. The hotel, particularly its lobby, is an architectural landmark for the city, but I've stayed at famous legacy hotels in other cities that left me cold. Not so the Palmer house. Hilton is doing a good job at persuading its employees to value service and good customer relations. The rooms were comfortable, well appointed, and its executive floors are like a mini hotel within the larger hotel. All good.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here is the height of elegance.”
Reviews.Author: cakenana
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is located in the City of Chicago, IL. The rooms here are all first rate-although prices are high there are times when you can get great deals-during holiday seasons, and other promotional deals. The lobby of this hotel is unbelievable!!!!! Just sitting at the bar having a drink is an incredible experience. At Christmas and before, the famous Christmas tree is put up-really puts you in the spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & lack of amenities!”
Reviews.Author: sus7676
Reviews.Content: While the lobby of this hotel are beautiful, the rooms are TINY. Our tub was dripping all night, the bed was super uncomfortable and had a huge dip in the middle. The room was not very clean. There WiFI is $15 per day, and the fitness room is also an extra charge. I've stayed in Best Western hotels better than this. Don't be fooled by the outer appearance, the rooms are horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Vinh777
Reviews.Content: My first impression when i came into palmers was " this is beautiful i am going to have a great stay" That feeling died when i got to my smaller than average room and minimalistic bathroom. Since i was there for business, i needed internet, Which wasn t complimentary and my port was out of service the second day. No complimentary breakfast and each time i called for assistance, i was put on hold for 5 minutes At least since they were busy. Great looking lobby And location but that is it

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: JCZ14
Reviews.Content: In a word. A convenient, grand old dame in the heart of Chicago. Stay here and you will feel like you are in a tasteful and graceful movie set of the 30's or 40's. Terrance was a terrific at the front desk. I will definitely return to this hotel when my business travel dictate.

Reviews.Title: “tres Chic .. tres Fab”
Reviews.Author: LiuAvakian
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Chicago, and it is definitely not my last. Love the city, love The Palmer House. The lobby is so magnificent it takes your breath away. The decor throughout is a mixture of old and new, blended so magnificently, and yet there is a warmth and comfort that makes it feel like home. The food is amazing, the best dining experience whether for breakfast in-room, lobby for afternoon tea & cocktails, or dinner at the Lockwood restaurant, the quality of food and service was perfect. Our room (not a suite) although small, was beautifully appointed and we had the rare luxury of 2 full bathrooms ... amazing! The Palmer House is quintessetially Chicago. a place for all to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Room nice but very small”
Reviews.Author: adventurousUsa
Reviews.Content: Not sure even at a discounted on line rate that this hotel was a good value. Lots of tourists and kids, not a good place for a business traveler to stay in the summer. Kids running up and down the hall late into the night. My room was right by the utility room and the maids were chatting loudly in the AM...I could hear almost every word. Self parking was a better deal than at most in town Chicago hotels. I regret not asking to see the room first before checking in as I typically do when checking in; I would have asked for a better location and perhaps on a less family friendly floor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to visit but not stay...”
Reviews.Author: LexReviews
Reviews.Content: First of all the decor of the hotel is absolutely spectacular. Unfortunately, that is the highlight of the Palmer House. We upgraded to the Executive Level with two bathrooms but still it was a small, small room. I'm a college graduate and have traveled to many foreign countries but without question, this was the toughest check-in ever. I could not understand the hotel staffer at all. I asked him to repeat himself at least 5-6 times. American hotel... probably a good idea to have something speak fluent English at check-in, just a common sense move. I struggled to understand him and finally just nodded and moved on. The complimentary soft drinks and snacks were closed on two trips when it was listed own our "why upgrade" card as "ALL DAY." Clearly all day is NOT all day at the Palmer. Was also told valet parking was $40/day but at checkout saw the $61/day charge. Again, I would have paid it, but I hate, hate, hate being told one thing and delivered another... frustrating! It's a beautiful place but there must be other places in Chicago to stay for a better value.

Reviews.Title: “2 Nites in noisy hot ChiTown”
Reviews.Author: Loftypines
Reviews.Content: got the room for $95 on priceline. when we got there they had us in a King Bed room, to get 2 beds it cost an extra $39 a nite but with that we had access to the lounge on the 23rd floor that had snack and drinks from 6am till midnite. Breakfast from 6am -10am, hot snacks from 5pm-7pm and internet access in a business centre up there too. The hotel is in the loop and convenient to food, Millennium Park, buses and the subway, parking is $38 nite. The place is a classy joint with nice lobby excellent security and nice shops.The room was on the 22nd floor was very clean, comfy beds, clean bathroom with nice shower and soaps. The tube tv had 35 channels and the view was of air-co units and other buildings which is probably the norm in this part of the loop. It has a small pool with hot-tub if you are inclined and $10/day exercise room. Chicago is not a cheap spot when you add up room/extras/parking and all the tours we did, but it is an interesting place. Did a River tour which I recommend, John Hancock building (was later told Willis Tower is better and cheaper) rented a bike (also recommend) and lots of walking. Tour boat guide made fun of Navy Pier which we toured, he said it's a lousy mall with a ferris wheel (and it is) he recommended the Zoo. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: dr_otto
Reviews.Content: Great stay here. We were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go. We had a big room with 2 beds and 2 bathrooms. The extra bathroom was very nice since we were traveling with young children. The registration desk and concierge personnel were top notch, very helpful and friendly (note, though, that I'm a Hilton Honors member and that might have helped a bit). My only complaint would be that the elevator system is a bit complicated so you have to transfer elevators to get to some floors. Sort of annoying and time consuming. One other nit-pick: our room had 2 double beds. In most upscale hotels I would expect 2 queen size beds (or 1 king). Queen size is far more comfortable for 2 adults.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but impersonal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Braziliantraveler7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at one of the refurbished floors of the Palmer House. This hotel is a wide variety of room sizes and decors so you never know what you will get. My room was HUGE and with modern decor. I enjoyed the extra space but they forgot to update the TV to a larger model. At the end, it was impossible to watch TV from bed because of the distance. The hotel is impressive because it is in a traditional building, but it lacks in the details. This hotel is very big and it is always busy so there is not much care for personal attention to customers. I had the unfortunate experience of ordering a cup of coffee at the lobby area bar. The waitress was very unfriendly, took forever for the coffee to arrive and it was cold. Fortunately, there is a Starbucks in the premisses. Location is very good, close to many stores, but with so many hotel options in Chicago, you can certainly do better than staying at the Palmer House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to visit- not to stay”
Reviews.Author: BiznessClass
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel with beautiful architecture, rich history, and great proximity to downtown attractions. Was not impressed by front desk staff who (in my interaction) spoke poor English but delivered with curt tone as if I was inconveniencing them by needing to check in. That said, it was better than my experience with the bartender in the Potter's Lounge who spoke zero English. I appreciate the international element to be sure, but not when I have to struggle to communicate with regard to eating and sleeping. As a Hilton Diamond Member I was pretty dissapointed at the way I was treated by the staff and by my minuscule sleeping room. Will likely walk through there in the future but probably won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: silverush000
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in the Palmer House a few weeks ago for a last-minute business trip to Chicago. I really enjoyed my time in this beautiful hotel - the lobby is breathtaking and the hotel has the aura of a very old, classic hotel. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. My room was very comfortable and the housecleaning staff was very professional and did a great job straightening up my room every evening. A couple of small issues - the shower head 'whistled' very loudly. This is not enough to warrant a bad review in light of everything else, but it was a bit annoying. Also, there is a charge for both the wireless access, wired access and the fitness room ($10/use). The last charge was the most disappointing, but tolerable since there are plenty of options to jog in and around the hotel area. I was able to purchase the room at $109/night so I cannot complain too much - this was an incredible value. In short, one of the best experiences I've had in Chicago and I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone interested in a great hotel at a great price in one of the best parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “The"hospitality"industrey”
Reviews.Author: Vextraveler
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful and very well done,however lacking in basic amenities,no drawers to put clothes in and one chair.Our room was designed for the overnight single traveler who had to be in downtown Chicago,not for a couple attending a wedding and reception.The hotel knew we were a couple. A comment about a tip to get the best room,if it is required to play games go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed my stay, I would highly recommend it and hope to return”
Reviews.Author: nancy425
Reviews.Content: My room was beautiful & very clean, the bed was so comfortable... Everyone was so friendly and helpful... It was a very enjoyable experience

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ellaWI
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful. It's a well-maintained, courteously operated establishment. I was glad to get to stay here. Do try the hotel restaurant if you are staying--wonderful, wonderful food and desserts. The room was well-equiped, clean, and comfortable. The air conditioning worked wonderfully, which was great for a hot summer visit. Check in and check out were both quick and easy. There was high-speed internet available, but for a charge, so I just did without. They do, however, have a location where you can log in and print boarding passes for a flight home for free, if that's the only reason you need internet access.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieInTx
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to go to this hotel and it was beyond my expectations. The hotel lobby is so beautiful and full of life. I actually at one point just sat there thinking about this 141 year old hotel and all the people that sat in that same lobby enjoying it as I was. We really enjoyed our hotel room, we stayed in a king standard room. it was a good size and offered everything we would need. I would of course have liked to have a mini bar, but... We didn't end up eating on premises as Chicago had so many things to offer we were out and about most of the time. I would love to go back to Chicago and I definitely would want to stay at the Palmer again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendor and Elegance”
Reviews.Author: DawnM_85
Reviews.Content: The beauty of the lobby is only exceeded by the fabulous attention to excellent service. It is rich in history and yet modern day amenities. Superb on every level. And pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ColeenRN
Reviews.Content: My son and I recently stayed here while he was attending an event at the hotel. The staff was very nice and helpful, the lobby is gorgeous, and the beds very comfortable. The walls are a bit on the thin side but it is an older hotel. It was only a problem the one night when the people next to us were very loud, but I carry ear plugs when traveling so that was solved. We ate breakfast at the restaurant near the lobby (I am blanking on the name). It had a buffet that was a good deal for what was available on it. The location is on Monroe about a block off Michigan Ave. near the Art Institute and Millenium Park. It was the perfect location to walk to the lake front for the museums or just up Michigan Ave. for all the shopping. Will stay here again when we get back to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: lmnop11
Reviews.Content: Positives: Stayed one night for business and one night for personal. Booked to different reservations but on check in they were combined so we didn't have to move rooms the next day. They even upgraded my business night to the executive floor to match my personal reservation. Asked for a late check out since husband was at the office the day of check out. Asked me what time i wanted and when I told them the accomodated because of my Hilton honors status. The parking garage charged me parking and the hotel. The hotel immediately refunded my money. The room was very roomy with a queen bed, over sized chair, couch and 2 baths. The main bath had a wonderful double shower head. Negatives: The room air conditioner did not keep the room as cool as I would have liked. Opened the windows but it was very loud. They cleaning staff took forever to clean dishes out of the hallway that other guest left on the floor instead of calling to have them removed. The last day there was a storm the ceiling in the hallway leaked. At 7:00am I was woke up by vaccums outside my door cleaning the water up and later noticed a sheet stuck in the vents in the hole to soak up the water. Supposed king bed looked like a queen. I would definitely stay here again as it was pretty nice and the location cannot be beat. It is wonderful the way they tried to keep the history of the building while updating it with todays amenities.

Reviews.Title: “The Little Things...”
Reviews.Author: HamptonTraveler419
Reviews.Content: Hey everyone at the Palmer House, i stayed at your location on the 27th of July for one night for a small anniversary getaway with my girlfriend, I am a Hilton Employee and i feel like it takes a special hotel to make me go wow.. but let me tell you in previous stays as an employee i feel like staff has treated me as someone not so important.. but the little things that you guys did made the stay worthwhile.. I enjoyed your location and given the oppurtunity i would do it again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, superb staff”
Reviews.Author: Dreams_of_Travel
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy an historical hotel setting that is fully staffed and very clean then this is the hotel for you. The hotel is very well maintained, has an exceptional lobby that you just want to hang out in and watch people or view the fabulous ceiling while you drink your tea or coffee. The hotel staff are very nice for the most part. The conciege desk was overrun at times and I think that staff was not quite as patient as everyone else. The front desk clerk was a perfect gentleman and helped me work out the duplicate wireless internet charges. The maid service was great. I did NOT like having to pay for wireless in the hotel lobby plus another charge in my room--that is a big NO, NO I think. Teh room rate does not include free use of the fitness facilities. The daily fee for wireless is $15. Expect to pay about $21 for breakfast. The pool and jacuzzi are included in the rate and had children in them when I stopped in, but they were supervised. I want to give a huge nod of appreciationto the security staff member (John?) who was out meeting with the doorman on the sidewalk (7-28-2011 10:40 a.m.) when I became a damsel in distress. I missed my airport shuttle bus. He suggested taking the El to Midway and carried my large suitcase by hand up two flights of steps to the CTA Orange line station about 100 feet away so I could catch the train in plenty of time for my flight. He made sure I got onto the proper landing and had the right change. That was a nice, surprising and generous act of kindness. I hope his boss sees this!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fellowtraveler72
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton Hotel in Downtown Chicago on the loop is a grandeloquent monument to class and Style. The staff was very courteous, and the accomodations were luxurious. The beds were soft and plush, and the bathrooms were new and clean. The bar was very cool and chic, and the food was very good. I will ALWAYS stay at the Palmer House when I have business in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Old style hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyhigh1988
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while attending a convention, sad to say the hallway we were staying in was undergoing a renovation so there were many loud sounds coming thru in the middle of the day and the smell was not great either.. The rooms were a little too small for our taste as well. The location was excellent close to everything you need to see in Chicago, I guess that was our trade off. We will probably stay at a different hotel during our next visit to the windy city. Do take the time to look at the lobby area...beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “lovely historic building...not email or online friendly”
Reviews.Author: sashapal
Reviews.Content: I would come back for pleasure, but not for business

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: mauimd
Reviews.Content: This is a historic hotel and the lobby is very nice - however, once you step into your room you realize that it needs major updating. The rooms are very old and not as clean as they should be. The TVs are ancient - for the first time ever, we didn't even bother turning it on. It was quite far from the beds and not a flat screen. The mattresses were old and flimsy. The whole ambience of the rooms was outdated and our room was very moist - the papers in our room even became damp. Would choose a different hotel if you are staying downtown. They also charge you extra if you want to use the fitness center or internet.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy elegance”
Reviews.Author: ACTtherapist
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited Chicago earlier this month for some college visits; husband booked rooms here through AAA website; somehow was able to work out free continental breakfast for all 4 of us. From the moment we walked in we were "wowed". During our 3 day stay here, every single staff person we encountered was completely delightful, bending over backwards to help, offer suggestions; someone who is training these people certainly knows what they are doing. The concierge desk staff were brimming with helpful information and assurances; the atmosphere festive and lively; the restaurant/lobby wait staff made each of us feel as if we were VIP's (which we certainly are not!). The hotel itself is old , historic and elegant, but does not look worn or dated. It is beautiful! Elegant, yet cozy and comfortable. The room was large and well-equipped with nice furniture including a very comfortable easy chair (only complaint is we prefer 2 queens instead of two full size beds); having two bathrooms in the room for our older teenage boys and the parents was a definite plus we've never experienced in any hotel. We were prepared not to have a view, and frankly didn't spend much time in the room anyway. The hotel is very close to lots of stores and just around the corner from the Art Institute (an incredible treasure, can't believe I've never taken time on previous visits to Chicago to see it). Very close to Millenium park. Walking distance to Magnficent Mile, Water Tower and river locations, although that is quite a bit of walking. Right by EL and subway stations. The breakfast was far more than we anticipated; incredible! Fresh juices, fresh hot entrees, danish, yogurt and high-quality cereal, nuts, fruits, baked goods, quality cheese and meats; house-made preserves; I cannot imagine a more complete breakfast with staff cheery and thrilled to serve. Starbucks on lower level for the addicts....Although I live in the south, I have to say I've never been anywhere with friendlier people than we encountered at the Palmer House. Last but not least--immaculately clean with high-quality complimentary toiletry products in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andermeer
Reviews.Content: Beautifully restored hotel in a great location. Enjoyed dinner at the hotel's lockwood restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: CLEMS0N91
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Palmer House Hilton was terrible. Although I was there for a conference, my family was with me. The room was small and offered only two double beds. The bathroom was tiny, not even offering the rounded shower curtain rod to help the shower feel larger. For the conference, which was suppose to be a team building experience, the set up had the participants sitting classroom style, instead of with round tables, which would have made it more conducive for conversations with colleagues. For the conference luncheon we were jammed in a hallway with 8 people rounds, but they were set for 10 place settings. The wait staff were rude and rushed us out of there. As for my room, the air conditioner was not working properly. Upon returning to my room with my family one late evening, I found it was warm and stuffy. I called the front desk to see if there was a maintenance man available at this late hour (12:40am). She said yes and assured me he would be right up. I clearly asked, "He will be up right away? If not, we can do this in the morning. It is late and I have children I would like to get to bed." She said yes. By 1:10am, I called back down and cancelled the maintenance man, stating it was too late and we could handle this in the morning. The front desk lady told me she could send up a fan, however I declined again stating it was too late. At 1:25am, the maintenance man came to our door - even after canceling the call. I begrudgingly let him in. He bumped the air controller down to 65, bent a couple of vent slats downward with a screwdriver, and claimed the fan was not on but it should be fixed now. The room continued to feel warm even with the air set at 65 for the 2 days my family and I stayed. Our final night here, I returned from a baseball game and went to the lobby bar/restaurant for a late meal. The bartender stated the kitchen was open until midnight, so I still had about half an hour. I contacted a server, and stated that I wanted to order food to take back up to my room. He told me to go up to the room and call down the order and it would be brought up to me. I explained that my employer would not reimburse extra fees, and that I just wanted to order a sandwich and bring it up. He again stated to order from the room and there would be no extra charges. I went back upstairs to my room and called down. The person taking the order now stated that there would be a 18% gratuity, a 3% service fee, and a $2.00 delivery charge on the order!!! I went back downstairs with the in room menu that also stated these charges and showed it to the server. He did not really say much, but acknowledged the charges. When I tried again to order, he said he would have to check to see if the cook was still available. It was now 11:50pm. He and another server came out and said that food was no longer available for the night. With the exception of the maid service staff and the doormen, every other employee made me feel like I was burdening them with my questions and that they did not have time to assist me. My family and I will never return to the Palmer House Hilton. We stayed at the Marriott Renaissance Downtown for the remainder of our trip, for less, and had a fabuous time! They offer larger rooms, two QUEEN beds, hospitable staff, and an overall much better experience for downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, great service, perfect downtown location”
Reviews.Author: StevieJean44
Reviews.Content: Staff were great. We were offered a "parlor" room on the 23rd (Executive level) floor, which is a sitting room with a pullout couch and they brought up a rollaway bed. The price offered was very good, so we said yes. The pullout couch was not really sleepable, so we asked for another rollaway, which they brought up promptly. Executive level is really nice because they offer continental breakfast, afternoon and evening snacks, and have a bartender there. Layout of the room is a little weird, with doors opening into each other, but for $99 a night in the Loop with all the exec level amenities, it was just fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit and love it.”
Reviews.Author: Californiagirl
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. We take the train from O'Hare, which costs $2.50 (one way). There is as stop right around the corner from the hotel. There is also a station right out the door of the hotel. It's very conveniently located as far as walking or taking the train. It's inside the loop. A very nice, comfortable hotel with a lobby that compares to few. Sitting in the lobby having drinks and appetizers is so relaxing. We will stay at the Palmer House any time we visit Chicago. It's worth every penny. Great rooms, great service and a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: tessbroz
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Great "in the loop" location. Parking pricey but worth it. room was not spectacular and somewhat cramped. however, the lobby and bar for drinks and people watching is EXCELLENT.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if attending a conference in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: WeSawIt
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful historical hotel. The rooms are smaller than other hotels, but still very livable. I stayed for business. I would not want to bring my family of five here. Staff are wonderful, very helpful. The location is close to great shopping, many restaurant choices and a close commute to the conference centre. I am so pleased that I chose not to stay at the conference centre hotel as that part of town is not where you want to be (barred windows on restaurants, run down establishments, and generally unsafe). It is worth the $8 can fare. Another benefit is that this hotel is located right on two main subway lines (red and blue). So it was great to be able to take the subway to US Cellular (20 or 30 min) and to the airport (45 min).

Reviews.Title: “For the money, you can stay nicer places”
Reviews.Author: cklhll819
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for a conference at this hotel, so it was a no brainer to stay. My inlaws, not wanting to pay the steep price, stayed 6 blocks away and paid almost half, for a better view in a quieter part of town. So, bang for your buck is poor here when you have elevators that clang all night, noise from the train, no cell service unless you stand by the window, and expensive internet. The pros: historic, beautiful grand lobby, appreciate the original charm, Starbucks (which never had a line when I was there), easy to walk to food / attractions, nice bellman The cons: The place is massive and somewhat difficult to navigate, the original charm stops at the elevators and windows, for goodness sake, get some better windows to drown out the city noise. I would probably give this place 5 stars if it had not been for our first night. We were placed in a room near the elevators and at first we laughed about it, thought we'd either get used to the noise, or the elevators would stop running so much during the night. Mistake! Those things banged and knocked ALL NIGHT LONG! Just as you were lulling off to sleep, WHIIRRRRR, BANG, CLANG. At 3:00 we were so sleep deprived, we called down and asked to change rooms, were told they were full, and they would send the maintenance man up to check the noise (which they later said the maintenance man didn't hear anything....?????) The next day they changed us to a room which was actually larger, nicer, and quiet. I can get over the sorta ugly carpet and skeevy old chairs, but I can't handle not sleeping, so those rooms should come with a warning and you should get a substantial discount to stay in the noisy rooms, we got neither, not even a 'We're so sorry' from the front desk staff. Check-in line was ridiculous and LONG unless you are a 'preferred' or 'elite' or whatever Hilton calls it. Last, a warning, DO NOT TRY THE ROOT BEER CHEESECAKE. I've had bad hotel desserts, but this one tops it all! I've never had a more disgusting dessert ever. Or try it, just to say you've had the world's worst dessert.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: stephb6
Reviews.Content: If you like some old world charm, this is the place for you. The hotels ceiling is worth a visit in and of itself. There are some rooms with 2 double beds and two bathrooms. Every room I have stayed in was very spacious. It is usually a busy place, but the rooms are quiet. It is located near the park and museums but a short walk from Michigan ave. If shopping is your goal there are many other hotels closer. The biggest negative of this hotel is the location. There are many poor people who hang out near the hotel and it makes it feel unsafe at night. All of the staff are wonderful though and it is a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Old Chicago Charm”
Reviews.Author: philz01
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire for $100/night for a family weekend trip. The location is great and within walking distance to many great restaurants and local venues as well as transportation. Parking was easy and having in-and-out access all day was nice. Cost 38 bucks a day but par to better than most in the city. We loved the detail and charm of the hotel which makes you feel like you are back in the roaring 20's or something. Rooms are small but adequate, especially if you are basically just sleeping there. The walls were thin and lots of noise from pipes and all but not too bad. Concierge helped us find some great places to eat within a short walk, since we have two small children. We did not use room service, the restaurants, or pool while visiting so cannot comment on those. It is a neat historic hotel in a great location for any stay in Chicago but maybe not the most comfortable nights sleep. Definitely great value for price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, nice stay, expect to pay additional fees for everything”
Reviews.Author: graysnow18
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is absolutely beautiful and our room was comfortable and clean. I did not appreciate having to pay extra fees for amenities that are included at less expensive hotels however. There was a charge for wifi, the fitness center, and even local phone calls. This made my stay frustrating as I am used to looking up maps and other visitor information on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Love the decor and service!”
Reviews.Author: BigGig
Reviews.Content: For some reason the entire city was booked but we were able to stay here and found it very convenient with a Starbucks in the base of the hotel. Everyone was friendly and helpful in getting cabs and making sure late arrival was secured.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in most ways. . . where's the free wifi?”
Reviews.Author: boner666
Reviews.Content: I usually like a more contemporary/spare/modernist design sensibility but the Palmer House was pretty grand without being gaudy, and I really liked it. The service was excellent, the place was meticulously clean and well-cared-for, and I would gladly stay there again if it hosted another event I planned to attend (I was there for a conference). Only one problem: it's 2011 and they don't offer free wifi, even in the lobby. I seriously doubt they make enough revenue from charging for this fundamental service to offset the inconvenience/irritation/ill will from having to pay for Internet. Why don't they also charge for towels and running water?

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow19
Reviews.Content: Although the location of the Palmer House is great is was downhill from there. On the day my husband and I arrived there were massive lines to check in on a boiling hot day when we had just arrived from the airport. A nice touch was the small bottle of water the staff provided while waiting. The room was especially disappointing, small and lacking in facilities, i.e. no minibar or tea/coffee making equipment. My husband is a member of Hilton Honors but even if he weren't we would have expected better. Compared to other Hilton hotels we have stayed in this was a serious let down.

Reviews.Title: “Rich in History, Poor in amenities”
Reviews.Author: lapvn
Reviews.Content: The Lobby and it's history is nostalgic as it comes. Hands down no question about it. For my money, I would have gone somewhere else. The in room wired internet is more expensive then other major establishments, and it doesn't include phone calls. Then there is NO free wireless internet in the lobby which other major establishments do have. There is a Starbucks, but only my iPhone could connect to it. My iPad would have needed to pay for a wireless connection in the lobby and it is PER HOUR. The starbucks unfortunately (by no fault of the hotel) was under staff. Lines went out the door. This should not be, and management should call for action from Starbucks. Parking, this coming from someone from NYC. Way too expensive for valet. Room, sad to say, I have had bigger rooms for much less. Service, well I never ran in to them except for my usual 4PM Vodka Martini, so I would say average. No one was rude, staff was friendly, but for the money........I would go elsewhere. I would come back to take pictures of the Lobby, and have afternoon tea here. Thats it, nothing else

Reviews.Title: “A grand old hotel that hasn't quite kept up.”
Reviews.Author: Vaney
Reviews.Content: This famous hotel is in a great location and is a pleasant old-timer in many ways. But it doesn't have the little things that justify it's rates...no wireless in the rooms (ever heard of iPad?), tiny bathroom counter space, no coffee maker, very weak lineup of cable tv stations, minimal room service menu. Comfortable rooms but not really worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: princessria1
Reviews.Content: This was my first time visiting Chicago; it was a family trip so I wanted it to be a memorable and rewarding experience. The Palmer House was definitely the place to make this happen. The hotel was great. Had a little plumbing problem, notified the front desk and we were placed in another room and compensated. I really enjoy the historic ness of the hotel and my eleven year old daughter loved it. Would definitely stay here again. It's in the heart of everything could not have picked a better hotel. The breakfast buffet was awesome. Homemade omelets cooked to order and all the extras you could want. The concierge was a great help very knowledgeable about the surroundings. Loved it, Loved it, Loved it! The beds were like sleeping on CLOUDS!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Less Than Great Service”
Reviews.Author: abelle85
Reviews.Content: This is a great, old Chicago hotel. BUT when I stayed there with my friends and family, we could not believe how bad the service was!!! We paid a lot of money to stay there, so we were very very disappointed with the service. No one answered the phone when we wanted to order room service, our room wasn't ready on time, and we waited in line forever at the check in and concierge. Also, the suites are really outdated and the normal rooms are actually nicer than the suites. After talking to a number of staff members, we finally found someone who was helpful and was able to take a good amount off our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but slightly overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: NemosAunt
Reviews.Content: Honestly, one of the most beautiful hotels I've ever seen. However, historical does mean old, so the hotel was not without its problems. There were wires hanging from the ceiling, the elevators had a hard time keeping up with the increased traffic, and the room key kept deactivating in spite of being careful. However, the staff was wonderful from start to finish and were very, very helpful. The rooms were a little on the pricey side, and the extras (food, parking, and internet) were, too. There were very few luxuries included or extra. There is a 50/50 chance that I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, but Extra for Gym was NOT worth it”
Reviews.Author: shurl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Palmer House Hilton in the Loop several times, for business and just for weekend getaways. It's in a convenient location for the Art Inst. & concerts in Millenium Park. Plus, I find the beds comfy, I like the lobby, and it's usually very clean. I never pay more than $100/night on hotwire for this hotel (even in July). There is such as wide range of room types in this large hotel; my secret for getting a good-sized room is to ask for 2 beds. Twice at check-in I asked for a room with 2 baths (great if you're traveling with a family) - once they didn't charge me extra, and once they did, $19. After reading on TA that the gym was great, I paid $10 this past weekend to use it. It's an okay space, but not great. Equipment was standard and mostly in good working order. But there is only room for one person at a time to do floor/core exercises on a mat. It was FREEZINGLY air-conditioned - to the point where as I started working up a sweat, my glasses fogged up! People were wearing the little towels as sweaters! Also, really too loud pop music piped in - I asked attendant to turn it down, but she didn't. And there was no view at all. The Conrad Hotel does have a super-gorgeous workout facility with amazing views of the lake, and they don't charge extra for it (but of course the Conrad comes at luxury prices too). But I wouldn't pay extra for the gym at the Palmer House again.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessentially Chicagoan Elegance”
Reviews.Author: BearX220
Reviews.Content: From the doorman's loud basso welcome as he flings open the taxi door, to the soaring lobby with the fantastical illuminated ceiling, to the public areas' happy, egalitarian mix of families in shorts alongside locals in finery enjoying a night out... the Palmer House exemplifies a particular broad-shouldered, inclusionary Midwest grandeur I can't imagine finding anywhere else. The location is near-perfect, on the eastern edge of the Loop across from the Art Institute, two long blocks from Lake Michigan. The architecture is big, bold and old, but with ten times the character of some soulless glass tower. The service ethic is top-notch. And rates via Hilton.com are usually surprisingly good. During our stay amid the July 2011 heat wave, a cooler full of complimentary ice cream novelties greeted sun-baked arrivals to the check-in desks -- one of countless thoughtful touches. On Saturday afternoon at Lockwood, the long bar in the lobby, pooped tourists in flip-flops poured down beer and lemonade passed across the cool marble by impeccable bartenders. In New York or Paris there might be some quacking about a dress code. Here, somehow, among the overstuffed leather furniture and the painted, brass and woven peacocks that comprise the Palmer's motif, it all works: relaxed, tolerant, and endlessly friendly. Our room was big and beautifully appointed with numerous updates, including new luxe bathroom fixtures and strong water pressure (often a concern in older properties) and unstoppable AC. About 40 percent of rooms have no view, though -- they face an interior air shaft. Ask if you want one. And for Hilton HHonors elites, there's a big, comfortable lounge on the 23rd floor serving snacks and drinks all day. The Palmer House is the perfect base for Chicago touring, family reunions, business, you name it. Everyone is welcome, and everyone fits in. it's only a little more than the nondescript Hampton Inn in the next block, and it makes any visit to this great town more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Brownies were invented at The Palmer House and our stay was just as sweet!”
Reviews.Author: kdedwards555
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Palmer House a few times and we are always treated like we own the joint! You just can't be treated better as a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Traveled on Business and Brought My Spouse Along”
Reviews.Author: aaptreas
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous restored hotel. The amenities are perfect. The Starbucks on the street level was very convenient. The service was wonderful. The pool, spa and workout facility were clean and well maintained. Even the elevators were fast. My only complaint is the business single rooms are furnished with double beds. Who sleeps in a double bed in 2011? If there were larger rooms anywhere in the hotel, they weren't offered at the group rate or the meeting I attended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: DJWalker27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary trip. We previously lived in Chicago so we knew the location would be great. However, we were not prepared to pay extra for everything! The fitness center should be complimentary but $10/day?? That was ridiculous. The hotel was very clean with one of the most comfortabe beds ever! But, a word to the wise..we reserved our room through Expedia with unpublished rates and were originally checked into "the only room they had left" which was a full bed. It was a tiny, cracker box smoking room that reeked of cigarette smoke and it was so tiny that you couldn't shut the bathroom door if you were on the toilet! lol! I laugh, but I'm serious! My husband got sick due to the smoke smell and we immediately called back down. So, they put us in another room that had a king bed which was totally different. We were told that the 16th floor was the only floor with smoking rooms and they just happened to have the "only room available" there. So when I say the hotel is clean..I'm totally basing it on our 2nd room. Don't plan on getting a cup of coffee ($8) or a banana ($4) unless you are starved! There are many more reasonably priced restaurants on the same street.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice and historic but rooms aren't anything special”
Reviews.Author: tcouncil
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a work event over this past weekend. It is truly a historic hotel with a great lobby and entrance. The hotel is huge and houses over 1,000 rooms. The rooms however are quite small and outdated. Renovations are definitely do up especially if they want to get me to stay there again when I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Beautiful Hotel with just some minor issues”
Reviews.Author: FaronShiem
Reviews.Content: Like everyone says, the lobby will take your breath away! The first two floors are clean, upscale and beautiful! The staff is great, friendly and very helpful. The location is semi-decent. All the color lines (subways and trains) are right outside the doors of the hotel. The Blue Line (which goes to Chicago O'Hare Airport) is only 1 block away on Monroe Street and Dearborn Street. Millenium Park is only 1 block away. However, there's not a lot of attractions in the immediate walking distance e.g. the magnificent mile or the river fronts. But you would have know that if you did some research on the area. The only thing I'd like to have seen done better was the interior of the room. Even though I stayed in the spacious Executive Suite, there were still some things I'd personally have liked to see. There were some small areas of torn carpet, and when you're standing in the tub, you can see the "dusty" A/C return vent. Oh and yes, the TV's are really old not that it mattered to me because I don't watch that much TV on vacation. But these are just minor issues you wouldn't want to see in a high class hotel. It can still be classy and historic with some minor modern upgrades and room improvements. All in all, it was a good hotel to stay at, a true downtown Chicago Hotel with great modes of transportation right around it.

Reviews.Title: “Third times a charm”
Reviews.Author: CharlieC33
