Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The rooms had plenty of space; the staff was very friendly; and you right in the heart of the city. We were just a block away from the park and three blocks from the lake. 10-15 minutes away from most attractions. Starbucks on ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this beautiful hotel..............we will definitiely stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: amylc26
Reviews.Content: The staff was absolutely great! The front desk staff/bellman helped us with a room change upon arrival at 130am (nothing wrong with the first room just a bit small for the four of us). We were transfered to a 2 bathroom room on one of the executive floors which was marvelous. The staff in the resturant went out of their way to accomodate one of our "picky eaters". All in all it was a great stay in a great city. I have stayed there two times previously and I will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Historic, but not worth staying here.”
Reviews.Author: DagnyTaggert
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: The lobby and a few of the ballrooms are as old town Chicago as you can get. The sense of history in the lobby alone is magnificant. It's a busy lobby area with lots of casual drinking throughout much of the late afternoon until late evening. It is next to an L stop. It is adjacent to Grant Park and walking distance to De Paul, Solider Field, several museams, the Chicago Theater and the Lake. I flew into Midway at rush hour and it was very convenient to get to without much traffic. My window actually opened to let in the outside air. The hotel staff, when available, were very helpful and courteous. THE BAD: The rooms were small. There was a very crummy hotel store. The bathrooms could not have been smaller. The shower curtain clung to my body. The TV was not a flat panel. The cable options were very limited. THERE WAS NO IN-ROOM COFFEE!!!!! It was too far away from the Mag Mile to walk. There were a few nice restaurants nearby, but not the amount you would find closer to the Mag Mile. The concierge desk was constantly crawling with people and had a large line. The elevators were very slow (2-8 minute waits each time).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LastMinuteTraveler2
Reviews.Content: The concierge staff was tremendously helpful - especially Tracey who was truly interested in us having a wonderful time and making the most of our visit. The Palmer House is a beautiful historic hotel of a bygone era. Anyone interested in history and architecture will truly appreciate its beauty. Only criticism is that our room (with king sized bed) was rather small and with no closet or place to hang clothing. There was also no rest for a and little room for a suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “A Chicago Gem”
Reviews.Author: jaluca04
Reviews.Content: We played tourist in our own city and chose to stay here for an anniversary weekend last week. The staff was attentive and courteous and the hotel is just beautiful. The rooms were clean and well appointed. It is the lobby of this hotel that truly makes staying there spectacular. Old, historic architecture that has been brilliantly updated to be used and enjoyed for cocktails or relaxing. The location couldn't be better. You are walking distance to everything from Millenium Park, State Street, the theater district and "Mag Mile". Wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “I expected better...”
Reviews.Author: lolawally
Reviews.Content: ... than this. As a traveller on a short business trip, staying at the Palmer just two nights, I am pretty disappointed. Here's why: 1) Line of 12 people deep to check in at 10:00 PM on a Friday 2) No bottled water available for purchase in the room AND the hotel shop was closed (again, when I checked-in). 3) Tiny room - could have been cleaner, too. 4) $20 for highspeed internet and it's not even wireless 5) Limited gym hours and it costs $10 to use the gym per day 6) Overall, just a crowded place with no room to breath. What I like? I like the location in the city. Would I stay here again? Only if my work travel demanded that I do so (like for a conference). It's an old hotel, which is nice, but then again, it's seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Local...”
Reviews.Author: msluv2travel23
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on reviews.. I was taking my daughter to school(freshman year) and decided this would be the right place based on it's location. the room was small but clean the bed was comfy too.. Hilton does need to stop charging for every little thing such as the high priced internet(20 bucks) and the extremely high self parking I paid more for parking than the full sized rental I had (38 bucks a day) and on top of that the Starbucks in the hotel that normally offers free wi-fi didnt have it either.. the food was costly but thats ok We went to the cafe bakery on the corner and ate breakfast... (get the blueberry muffins but go early)And there are plenty of great restaurants to eat in, other than the hotel.... Otherwise the hotel is close to everything... good shopping on State and of couse Michigan Ave... lively people watching on Wabash... Close to public transportation because if I did not have to have a car to move my daughters stuff... I would definitely take public transportation.... the traffic in Chicago is RIDICULOUS!!! worst than D.C and NYC!! I love Chicago!!! Would I stay again? possibly (By the way the customer service was really accomodating) but I want to try a different hotel every time I come back to Chi town...

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Hilton properties”
Reviews.Author: MISTERBALI
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent several nights here enjoying the sights and sounds of our third largest city (We live in the fourth !) . Art institute so very close by. I lived here as a young man in the 1940's and while the city has changed greatly overall, I find the Loop area much the same. As a HiltonHHonors member, I was upgraded to a suite and we were staggered at the size and luxury of our accommodations. We found everything in order and spotless. Greatly enjoyed an evening cocktail in the lobby area followed by an excellent supper in the dining room. Hang on, Palmer House, we'll be back !

Reviews.Title: “Nice but they need to watch to maintain this level of service”
Reviews.Author: kawidd
Reviews.Content: I am a regular at the Palmer House. It is a great hotel. The rooms vary a lot in size and appointments. During our last stay, we were given a tiny room. It is a bit shotty for a Hilton Diamond member. We also only had three towels. After asking for four once, we continue to only get three towels. Something like that should not have needed daily calls. We also saw some cracker crumps on the carpet when we first checked in and had to flag down a maid to come in for it. Also, the mail service is a bit irregular. After I have picked up my Fed Ex envelope, I continue to have a message sent to me about having a package waiting for me. Whatever happened to having it delivered to me? Fed Ex is handled by the UPS store in the building and they are not open on weekends so picking up a package can be tricky. Delivery is the answer!!! Otherwise, the hotel is nice but my smaller complaints are signs of decline. The bath tub drain was very slow but they came and fixed it very quickly. As much as I love this hotel, these are the things that tarnish a great hotel. They must put these things to a halt before it loses its position as one of the grand dames of Chicago hotels. Service and amenities in the executive floor are still good. Keep up the good work and fix your problems, please!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shame, shame! Foreign travelers beware!”
Reviews.Author: Sciguymrd
Reviews.Content: Although I have stayed at Palmer House before and have had a nice stay, out of town friends that my family was hosting, recently had an experience that is worth sharing. This is the first time I have awarded a hotel 1-star in one of my reviews and I don't mean to suggest that this is a one-star hotel but rather that we had a terrible experience. I always have read one-star TA reviews with a bit of skepticism that the reviewers were just malcontents, I hope this is not taken the same way. Friends from Chile were traveling to the U.S. and booked a room a month in advance at the Palmer House for their Chicago leg. Their credit card was charged for the room. Three days before they were to arrive in Chicago from Wisconsin, our friends received an e-mail that the hotel was not able to verify the foreign address on their credit card and therefore canceled the reservation three days before their arrival. This although the credit card had already been charged for the room. We called the hotel to straighten out the problem but were told there were no rooms available now and that they were unable to do anything about it except refund the amount already charged. The only room our friends could find in downtown Chicago on three days notice was a run-down Travel Lodge -- a far cry from a hotel like the Palmer House. There were so many better ways for the Palmer House to handle the situation and they should be ashamed for their complete lack of customer service. As a Chicagoan, I am embarrassed as this reflects poorly on the city (country?) as a whole to a foreign visitor. Shame on Palmer House for not taking responsibility! As a side note, I looked through other TA reviews of the hotel for similar problems and noticed that although there were numerous one- and two-star reviews, there was no response from management on any that I saw (perhaps there are responses to some I did not read?). On the other hand, for a number of the five-star reviews, Palmer House management responded, thanking the reviewers for their comments. As manager of a large hotel, wouldn't you be more interested in addressing poor experiences guests have had rather than thanking happy guests? I guess not.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Wedding Venue Ever - Now and Then...”
Reviews.Author: Steiny695
Reviews.Content: This review is for those of you planning a wedding or big event. My wife and I were set to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary on June 23rd of this year. I really wanted to do something special to recognize the occasion. Since we got married at the Palmer House, in the beautiful and historic Empire Room. I called the Palmer House's catering office and spoke with Jane Himmel, the Senior Catering Manager. I inquired as to the availability of the Empire Room for our exact anniversary date, June 23rd â€“ a Thursday. Opportunity struck when I was told the room was not being used for a previously scheduled event that night. I suggested my idea to Jane that my wife and I have dinner for 2 in the Empire Room on the night of our anniversary, just as we celebrated our wedding there 10 years ago to the hour. This is when Jane and her team took over. To my surprise and excitement, Jane took this idea from the start and worked very hard to make this idea, this dream, become a reality. I worked with Jane over the next couple of weeks and days leading up to our night. She helped me pull off one of the greatest nights and best memories my wife and I will ever share. The Palmer House is a beautiful and historic hotel. Please consider when you stay here or have an event here that what you may be giving up in terms of modern amenities and size of the hotel rooms you gain in elegance, class, service, a sense of history and an experience to be had in your lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here whenever you can”
Reviews.Author: lovefood80
Reviews.Content: An iconic hotel in the Chicago loop. Step into Chicago history in this hotel. The lobby is unbelievable and the rooms have been upgraded to a more modern feel. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable room and courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: scom4t
Reviews.Content: We stayed in mid July for a business/pleasure trip. The hotel is an art deco gem - gorgeous to the last detail. The location is great - 2 blocks from fantastic Millenium Park and the Art Institute and just a few blocks from the Magnificent Mile. The room was spotless in every way; perhaps a bit small by luxury hotel standards but certainly adequate for 2, and it is an old hotel so we were not concerned. Furnishings and decor in the room were beautiful art deco and looked very new. Had a bit of trouble with the in-room internet - easily resolved by very courteous, knowledgeable tech support. Room cleaned perfectly each day. Every staff encounter was lovely - polite, cheerful, helpful - not sure I've ever experienced anythng like it from the front desk to bell men to housekeeping. I noticed quite a bit of attention to keeping the public spaces orderly and clean - a challenge with so much traffic. I have no complaints - only compliments for everything about the Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “Palmer House experience was great”
Reviews.Author: AuburnDuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House Hilton over a weekend and wanted convienance and nice accomadations. The Palmer house delivered on all levels. We hoped on the train from Midway made a quick transfer and got off the stop directly at the hotel, very nice. In our travels around Chicago the location with stations on two sides of the hotel made travel very easy. There are also many great things within walking distance, Millenium park being the main one only two blocks away. The staff was super friendly, we even to check in early. We stayed on a hilton honors floor and got access to the lounge on the top floor, this was a nice treat with great options. Earnest was super in just being friendly and making the area feel very welcoming. We would recommend the Palmer for a family or just couples. Nice mix of both at the hotel the weekend we were there. Great stay and great expereince.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: mom2emisandow
Reviews.Content: We booked the Palmer House through priceline, and I was a little nervous because of some of the reviews on here, but we had a great stay! We paid $99 a night (including taxes and fees) for a Thurs to Sun stay. We came into town on the Amtrak, and had no problem checking in at 1:00pm. Our room was one that had been renovated with a king size bed. The bathroom was a little small but both of us could stand in it at the same time so it didn't bother us. THe bed was very comfy, Air conditioning worked great! The only thing that I will mention was that there are a lot of rooms on each floor so it can be a bit of a walk to the elevator and the ice machine. From what I could tell there is only one ice machine on each floor. I saw that another review mentioned free WI-FI, but its not free, you have to pay for it. I loved the overall 'historical' ambience of the Palmer house. Concierge was nothing but helpful, and friendly, even printing out a map for me. I would highly recommend asking concierge for the guide book called 'Concierge preferred, Chicago Icons' just for the maps on the inside alone. Also has good info on where to eat, and shop and what not. We used a 3 day transport pass for our four days in Chicago, which was great! Right outside the hotel there are stops for the red-line subway as well as the blue-line. Easy walking distance to many clothing stores, restaurants, and Millennium park. There is a CVS right across the street from the Wabash st. entrance. We found the Palmer house to be an great hotel in an excellent location! We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “About what we expected”
Reviews.Author: katikat1234
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a one night stay at the Palmer House, and it was about what I expected based on other TripAdvisor reviews. The lobby is gorgeous and the location is fantastic - just one block from Millenium Park, shopping, restaurants, and and the "L." The hotel is huge, but elevators were fast and our room / floor was pretty quiet. We got a good deal through Priceline, so I felt we got a good value for our money, but had I paid rack-rate I would have been disappointed. The room we got was not updated, and although it had classic charm to it, I would not consider it 4-star. Hilton did a good job of honoring my request for a non-smoking king room, so I was happy with that. I thought our room was pretty spacious for city standards, but many of the others we passed on the way out were very small. Overall, I would stay here again if I could get a good price, but it's definitely not worth list price! (Also, as a side note --- the pool area is not worth visiting. The hot tub was dirty --- things floating in the dismal water --- and the jets were not working. Also the pool was completely packed with screaming, splashing kids, so not very relaxing.)

Reviews.Title: “Its the People Who Make This Grand Old Hotel Grand”
Reviews.Author: RVIDI
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palmer House about a half dozen times. I love the grandness of this old hotel and can over look the small bathrooms in the rooms. I love walking into the majestic lobby. I love the Serta Serenity beds (I want one!). I love the location with availability to museums, shopping and some of the finest restaurants close by. It occurred to me on my last trip what I love best. It is the people. It starts when you get out of your car. The doormen are always pleasant and get your luggage. The bellmen are courteous and will get your luggage to your room. The front desk people are helpful and always have a pleasant word. Note, there were long lines at the desk when we checked in but there were several people behind the desk and the lines moved quite fast. The "face" of the Palmer House is a tall, bald, black gentleman who works on the 23rd floor executive level. I am sorry I did not get his name but he is the MOST positive, happy person I have had the pleasure to be around. He works in afternoon/evening time and has been there my last two visits. Yes, I will stay at the Palmer House again. Partly because of the location, the lobby and the beds but it is the people that ultimately brings me back.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreqFlyer2011
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here on numerous occasions while traveling on business. The room is somewhat small but comfortable. The restaurant and the lobby bar were about average for their service and a bit pricey. The free Internet access is nice compared to other hotels around that location. There is a StarBucks right on location. The rates are quite good comparatively for downtown Chicago in the business district. Make sure you stay away from the elevator shafts or be prepared to be kept awake by loud banging noises.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Here, Would Come Again”
Reviews.Author: ejh4isu
Reviews.Content: Nice Hilton with friendly staff, had booked a regular king room and got upgraded to a 2 room parlor king upon arrival

Reviews.Title: “Cool Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bittco
Reviews.Content: Like many old hotels the Palmer House does not hold up to the luxury standard it was some 50 years ago. It is however a great place to stay with a lot of charm. The lobby area is simply awesome with its painted ceiling and various sitting areas. There seems to constantly be not enough people at the front desk- every time I saw it the lines were long. Also the luggage check guys were a bit rude when I checked out. I stayed on the executive floor which was nicely put together with free snacks/breakfast and a quality lounge. The rooms were nothing special featuring old school tvs but the furniture in them was very nice and the bathrooms well renovated. The location in the loop is right next to several El stations so I have nothing to complain about there. Overall I would definitely stay here again despite some minor flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a grand palace!”
Reviews.Author: Cuban_cita
Reviews.Content: Palmer House is the best of a perfectly restored grand papance and a modern hotel. The food, ambiance, accommodations and service are world class, and the facility is a true work of art. Don't miss the historic tour with lunch and a famous Palmer House brownie.

Reviews.Title: “The Lobby Was Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: BlueBellGal
Reviews.Content: I loved the lobby of this hotel. The rooms were on the smaller side, as is typicaly of a city hotel. Bathrooms were in good condition & the decor of the common areas were very special. Hosted a client event onsite and the food & service were very good. Loved the location & was able to walk everywhere. Staff was very accommodating & made the visit very good.

Reviews.Title: “My LAST stay here”
Reviews.Author: LouLou33388
Reviews.Content: Yes, the lobby is beautiful. A grand old hotel. Location and Lobby are the best things about this hotel. Service was good, except one rude bellman. The peeling wallpaper in the room was a bit concerning, but in retrospect it should have been a warning sign. What absolutly ruined my stay was the COCKROACH in the ladies bathroom on the meeting rooms floor (3rd floor). It was a biggie - several women were snapping photos of the astonishly large creature. I was lucky enough to witness this right before our business meeting lunch. I skipped lunch, and cancelled my plans for a quick dinner at the hotel lobby bar. To top things off, the towel in my room the next morning was dirty. Not stained, but dirty like stuff sticking to it. Very disgusting. BTW, when I complained the desk clerk seemed more surprised by the dirty towel than the cockroach. Such a disappointing stay, I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: FlowerLover77
Reviews.Content: The hotel ambiance was wonderful and up-scale, the decor was art nouveau and beautiful, and my room was very comfortable. My two co-workers felt the same way about their rooms and the ambiance that night.

Reviews.Title: “This place is charming”
Reviews.Author: Judith513
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most charming hotels I have ever stayed in. The service is impecable. The rooms were perfect - large, clean and designed beautifully The lobby was beautiful it was exactly as they show in there advertisement The hotel is a little out of the way but they serve you by taking you by car anywhere within a 2 mile radious. They even supply you with a French Press coffee maker and free use of their computer. There are flat screen TV's and comfortable sheets and beds. It was perfect. I wish every hotel I stayed in was as quaint and charming as this one was

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: chilady34
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over July 4th weekend. Beautiful hotel & we got a last minute deal on the room so it was fairly inexpensive. This place has been continuously opened since 1873 - you know they are doing something right! Indoor pool & spa are on the smaller side but not that many downtown hotels have an indoor pool anyway. This hotel is more than perfect for a weekend getaway, great location, and good value. If you want a super luxury experience then spend some serious cash & stay at the Ritz or the Peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and friendly”
Reviews.Author: mb27_11
Reviews.Content: Take the time to look around this historical hotel in the heart of Chicago's loop. From the grand lobby to the meeting rooms and the guest rooms, The Palmer House Hilton is a wonderful place to stay. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. The location is prime. Guests can walk to many of the attractions to be found in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Room was dingy, disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ScholarGentleman
Reviews.Content: Start with the positives: The lobby is stunning. The location can't be beat (especially for my visit). Every member of staff I interacted with was friendly (though a note on this below). Outweighed, unfortunately, by the bad. The room was worn to a shocking degree. Peeling wallpaper, insects in the bathroom, a very worn and stained carpet, stained floor in the bathroom and cracking grout, peeling paint and a door nob about to fall out in the bathroom. I found the bed linens to be scratchy--something I've never run into in a Hilton--though some of that could be psychosomatic. The room felt dirty, not helped by two long dark hairs left on the fresh towels. I got to be serenaded by the couple in the room next to me when it was time to sleep; the walls were paper thin. As I said, folks were friendly. I was a bit surprised that they had two people working the line for check in. One trying (awkwardly) to make conversation, the other with cold water (a very nice touch on a hot day). Had they trained one of these people to help with check-ins, though, we wouldn't have had as long a wait. As it was, the check-in process was slower than it needed to be, even after I got to the counter. I chose the hotel based in large part on the positive reviews here on Tripadvisor, and on the location. I had been here for a conference a few years back and been unimpressed by the meeting rooms, but figured I'd give it another chance based on the generally good reviews here. I suspect that had I gotten one of the renovated rooms (I was on the 21st floor), I would have had a much better experience. I've lived in NYC and Tokyo, small doesn't bother me. I guess I could have requested being moved, but I was exhausted and had no way of knowing if this was actually the standard of the hotel. I guess the take-away is that Chicago has a lot of very nice hotels, and hotels that cost less and provide a nicer stay. For me, at least, I doubt I'll give the Palmer House another chance, Honors points be damned. Happy to come and have a drink in their beautiful lobby, but otherwise I'll pick one of the other nearby hotels that provide a much better value. If you do decide to go here, make sure when you are making your reservation that you have a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jersey_Ron46783
Reviews.Content: First time at the Palmer House, will not be my last. The rooms are small, but this is an old hotel that has been beautifully restored. Everytime I have stayed at an older hotel, the rooms were generally about the same size. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and quiet. The restaurant, at least for breakfast, was fast and pricing was acceptable. The food and service was good quality. At check in, I was treated professionally and the process was fast and efficient. Check out, using the phone system was easy. I highly recommend the Palmer House for business or personal travel to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful experience in a venerable historic property”
Reviews.Author: LoisAnthonisen
Reviews.Content: It was pleasant, start to finish. We were blessed with superior service for our group event in the beautiful, high ceilinged lobby. Our guests were very pleased with both the food and drinks, as well as the superior service. The rooms are older, but very pleasant and sparkling clean. Alll in all, it couldn't have been a better experience. We would go there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it, but...”
Reviews.Author: Vee0811
Reviews.Content: I liked where the hotel is situated-right in the heart of Chicago. One thing I really appreciated was the fact that there is parking available that is easily accessible from the hotel. Although expensive ($38/day), for me, it was worth it.The hotel looks magnificent!The staff was friendly and professional. Besides the bedroom being very spacious and clean, there was nothing special there. The bed was comfortable and they do need to upgrade their TVs .The bathroom was small and I think they could have done a better job by adding a soaking tub. I hated the fact that they charge for internet access.($15/hr if you're in your room; I think it's less if you're in the lobby) but I guess it's because of the clientele they get which I noticed was more of businessmen. So if you are like me, traveling across country and just need to check on some stuff for few minutes, there's a Starbucks right down the street with free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: CassieG225
Reviews.Content: Pros- The Palmer House Hilton in Chicago is a beautiful historic hotel. It is in a good location. You can walk most places in the city, or take a short cab ride. Cons- When I checked in the representative did not slide my credit card correctly, so the payment never went through. He gave us our keys so I obviously assumed that everything was fine. On our second day there, our keys stopped working so we went to the front desk and they just made us new keys. They didn't mention anything about us paying. On the morning were were checking out at 8:30am a security guard showed up at our door saying we needed to go downstairs to the front desk. We called at first and discovered that they said we never paid and had to come down immediately and pay. We asked if we could just wait until we checked out (only a couple hours away) but they refused. So we went down to the lobby, obviously very irritated and upset. They said that my card was not swiped right when we checked in so it showed that we never paid. We found out that the reason what our keys did not work the day before was because they had locked our room but the person we talked to failed to inform us of that. The manager acted as though it was our fault that her employee didn't check us in right. She had the nerve to tell me that she was not putting us out at all by this. My response was that I was in her lobby at 8:30am in my pjs! I did end up getting a partial credit, but it was not worth the bad experience. I understand that computer issues happen, but the way they handled the situation was extremely poor. Sending a security guard to my room for their mistake is unacceptable and very poor customer service. I am sad to say I will not be staying here again, despite the hotel's beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a cool, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: pfish1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House Hilton in March, 2011 when I traveled to Chicago for a wedding. I primarily chose this hotel for it's proximity to the Chicago trains, and it worked out great. Upon landing at O'Hare, I took the blue line into the city to the Monroe station, from which the Palmer House Hilton was only 2 blocks away, The room I had was small, but nice. While the Palmer House Hilton is an old hotel, the room I was in was definitely renovated in the last few years and very clean. Service was also great. What I most liked about this hotel was it's location. Sears (Willis) Tower is only a few blocks away and within walking distance. Also the Adams/Wabash station is right outside the hotel, which puts you on "The El" elevated train that loops around the central part of the city. The Palmer House also features some really cool architecture if you are interested in that, particularly the lobby. All in all - had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay if you plan on moving around in your own room!”
Reviews.Author: curvygirl524
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 10 month old took a quick trip to Chicago. We stayed one night at The Palmer house after reading that they were a four star hotel. I guess I am just confused as to why they are a four star hotel. Yes the lounge area is nice but the rooms were so small I couldn't set up a pack and play for my son. I had to call and "upgrade" my room just so my son could have someplace to sleep. The lower levels have been updated which makes them slightly better than a Holiday Inn. The wall paper is peeling away from the walls and the shower was dirty. I will NEVER stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby and Ball Rooms - Carpet Needs cleaning”
Reviews.Author: DadzCanoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House at the end of June and first week of July. The Lobby and ball rooms were Beaux Arts spectacular, Rooms were mostly clean but light on amenities, no coffee in the room or lobby, just Starbucks on street level. The carpet in the room and hall was stained and dirty. And they charge an outrageous $15.00/day for ethernet internet access, no wireless. Don't be in a hurry, because the elevators for the 18th floor and above take forever.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: OccasionalTraveler22
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 4-6, 2011, and were very happy with the experience. Loved that it's on the Orange line from/to Midway. Supremely comfortable beds. Very quiet (on the 13th floor, at least), pretty, and clean. Capable and friendly staff. Even loved the mirror in the bathroom. A few cons: no fridge in room, and it's a pretty good walk from the heart of Magnificent Mile, and from Soldier Field. But, overall, a definite recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: Sailor6700
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palmer House for 2 nights in June. Staff was very courteous, room was clean, but small. A/c did not work the first night, but repaired the second. I have stayed at the Palmer House quite a few times and requested the honors floor which as $40/night more than the others, but you got a Continental breakfast and snacks at happy hour. It was not worth the additonal money. Fitness Center was good and reasonable for $10 a trip. What really frosted me was a charged for valet parking of $61 at night!! This is an unmitigated rip off, and I should have asked for the charges before hand, but assumed $35 per night. My fault. Even though I was on the honors floor, they charge $20 per day for internet. So when you check in clearly ask for all the incidental charges before you have a stroke when you get your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 6inavan
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on priceline and the location is fantastic - so close to art institute, millennium park, el stops. Beautiful hotel. Only complaint is that they charge for wireless - really should be free. Why nickle and dime?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service but small room”
Reviews.Author: L_R_Rozman
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and very accommodating staff for everything I needed - especially when not feeling well on first day of business travel. Manager was superb in solving a noisy canine "guest" in an adjoining suite and giving me very accommodating options - including complementary dinner! She truly made my stay more enjoyable and could not have been more helpful. The Palmer House is a Chicago classic, very nicely updated, with beautiful use of classic lamps and furniture. I was surprised at the small room and tight quarters. I had to stand at the side of the dresser to get clothes from it, and close bathroom door to get around it to the shower behind. If you are a business traveler or tourist, this may not be a problem. Smaller-than-most closet may tight for multi-wardrobe couples or fashionistas.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel- Great location!”
Reviews.Author: rustysgirl8
Reviews.Content: There were so many great things about this hotel and only a few drawbacks. I traveled with two of my friends for a girls trip. We arrived on 6/29/2011 and checked out 7/3/2011. The pros: - GREAT location - Beautiful lobby and historic hotel -geared toward the business/executive traveler -friendly staff -very clean & comfortable The cons: -pricey if you want Executive level service -no free wi-fi -slow elevators -thin walls -expensive to park Check in- The hotel let us check in early to our room with no extra charge. Upon arrival everyone was super friendly and so willing to help. In addition to the check-in/reservations desk, there is a concierge as well as a transportation desk. Lobby & Common area- The lobby is simply breathtaking. It's easy to imagine yourself transported back to the roaring 20s surrounded by flappers and mobsters. Lauren, the assistant manager at the restaurant, showed us around the Empire Room, where everyone from Frank Sinatra to Liberace has performed. You MUST go see it. Also, don't miss the Red Lacquer room on the 4th floor. It was a favorite of Al Capone and is in my opinion the most beautiful place in the hotel. Take some time to explore and look at all of the black and white photos hanging in the halls. It's worth your time if you're a history buff like me. Room- We booked via Priceline and received a great rate (under $100/night) so we expected to get the lower quality rooms in the hotel rather than the executive level. We had a non-smoking double bed room. The room is small, but not unbearable. I would compare it to a Holiday Inn or the like. The bathroom is definitely not spacious, but was perfect for what we needed. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the showers were hot. What more can you ask for when you pay a rate like we did? One caution though- the walls are REALLY thin, which is to be expected in an older hotel. The Staff- The staff here was great. Everyone was ridiculously friendly and helpful, from the concierge to the maids. No complaints here. Location- You couldn't ask for a better location. You are about 3 blocks from Millenium Park, 8 blocks from the Sears (Willis) Tower, just south of Michigan Avenue shopping, and are right in the middle of everything. The El train station is right outside the hotel, as are several bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend - the perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbBB_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palmer House with a group of girls for a Chicago weekend. The staff was extremely helpful. The facility is gorgeous. The rooms were lovely and the beds were among the most comfortable I have found in my travels. The Peacock martinis and appetizers at the Lockwood Bar were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Architecture but Rooms Could Use an Update”
Reviews.Author: pradamary
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Palmer House Hilton while visiting family in Chicago. I stayed at Monaco last year and loved it, but for less money I could stay at the Palmer House and have self parking, which was a plus for me as we had to go in and out of the city daily. The famous lobby is absolutely awe inspiring and my son and I had cocktails there every evening. No better place for a drink. The building is beautiful and the common areas are also very nice. The rooms, however, not so great. The decor is dated and not up to the standards of the rest of the hotel. The room with two beds also had two baths which was a plus. But the bathrooms are very dated, nice marble floors but the fixtures and tile work were shabby.The first three nights we looked out onto a wall and had the sound of the "L" all night. The noise didn't bother me but we couldn't see any sky at all. On the last night I asked for a room change and we did have a very nice view of the city. The room wasn't any nicer, other than the view. There is no refrigerator in the room either. My son bought some beer and put in the trash can with ice. A fridge would have been nice and/or a mini bar. The location is great and you can walk just about anywhere, right near the Art Institute. All in all it was comfortable, convenient and has some beautiful features, but once you get to your room, it's pretty drab. Too bad, because other wise very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful,Relaxing stay..we're comin back!!!”
Reviews.Author: MsLaLa66
Reviews.Content: Staff was excellent,helped w/directions,cabs right there (GREAT SERVICES,STAFF was pleasant!)

Reviews.Title: “Second visit was even better than the first!”
Reviews.Author: Calif0rnia_traveller
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful stay at the Palmer House last fall, when my wife and her two sisters decided to get together for a birthday celebration (husbands included, although it was touch and go for a while!), there was no hesitation in returning to the Palmer House. And we weren't disappointed! As other reviews indicate, this is a wonderful, classic hotel. There is old-world luxury everywhere - certainly the mural on the lobby ceiling, but in many other details, as well. Don't pass it by too quickly - look for artwork everywhere, and elegant details in every things from lamps to furniture. The early check-in went great - thanks to Jurgita at the front desk. We had three adjacent connecting rooms on the executive level. I don't think I've ever seen 3 connecting rooms before - perfect for a group of 3 couples. The executive level is well worth the extra money. A private elevator to the top 2 floors is a nice treat! Plus a huge lounge, which was a great place just to hang out in between sight seeing. One of the lounge hosts, Ernest, was incredible. In addition to making us feel welcome and taking care of all our food and beverage needs, he's a wealth of knowledge about the area. The included breakfast was typical continental, but certainly adequate. The evening snacks could have been a full meal - two hot choices every night, plus fruit, veggies, cheese & crackers, etc. And the world-famous Palmer House brownies were available all day! As was fresh, hot coffee! The location is perfect. Just steps from the Orange Line train from Midway Airport. Millennium Park and Grant Park are only a block away. Buses run frequently right in front of the hotel to take you wherever you want to go - Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile, Museums. And a 3 day day transit pass is only $14! No need for a car here. The rooms were in good shape, although the hotel is well over 100 years old. If you're looking for something brand new and modern, stay at the Holiday Inn Express along the freeway. If you're looking for a truly luxurious experience, stay at the Palmer House!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury, A Must If Staying in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ajalloh
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I booked the king suite and when we opened the door we were blown away. The deco was fantastic, size of the suite was cavernous and the quality superb. The location, grandeur of the hotel and feeling of being welcomed all made for a unforgettable vacation. We will make this an annual event and can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “A splendid hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: PeterOdgaard
Reviews.Content: We had 3 days and 2 nights in Chicago which we spent on The Palmer House at our recent trip to the US. It was certainly a nice hotel to stay at, and it do also have a almost perfect location in Chicago. We had an executive room, which made the stay even better. The lobby is just magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Best 20th Anniversary Trip to The Palmer House”
Reviews.Author: 2talltodd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Chicago for our 20th wedding anniversary. We have never been there and wanted to stay in the downtown area. Choose The Palmer House after reviewing numerous hotels. Had to self park next to the hotel property but this is typical for downtown Chicago hotels. The bellboy at the entrance was extremely friendly and after welcoming us told us where to check in. Check-in was quick and efficient though other times while passing the lobby there was a line with approximatley 10 people in it. The front desk rep was also very nice to us and upgraded us to a room with a king sized bed. Very nice. The hotel lobby was historical, beautiful and full of character. Did not know the history of the hotel until we were there but it was fun knowing how it came to be. Very fun. Rooms were clean, comfortable and big enough. Ask for a room away from the elevated train and from the elevators. We got one and heard no noise the entire time we were there. The hotel is near everything. You can walk to most places or catch a bus, el train or subway. Buy an unlimited transportation pass at the train stations and ride everything as much as you want. A 3 day pass was only $14 and well worth it. Not knowing how to get to any specific place we had to go to the concierge desk for everything. We worked with Phillippe Gills and he was incredible. He looked up addresses, gave us maps with directions and put down notes of what buses/trains to take. Each time he helped us we felt like he wanted to and made us feel special. Also, he remembered us when we showed up each day and greeted us personally. If you need anything ask for Phillppe and the hotel should give that man a raise! If we go back to Chicago we will definitely stay at The Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel, good location, but everything is extra”
Reviews.Author: DanRandom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a June weekend to see the Nationals visit the White Sox. Was impressed by the professional friendliness of the staff - everyone from the door man who greeted us to the person who checked us out. The hotel is beautiful, turn of the century classy, and the lobby is breathtaking. The room (8-137) was huge - two double beds - and you could easily fit two more in there! No view, but it wasn't important to us. Bathroom was decent sized and clean. Only issue was the lack of free things one is used to in the hotel. WiFi was $7 an hour. The gym was $10 a visit. The hotel lobby bar was steep (and closed by 12 on a Saturday!) I can only imagine what parking cost. It is extremely transit accessible, with the El and Red line subway right out the door, and the Blue line a mere block away, and Grant Park two blocks away. Location was awesome, price was definitely right. Just be aware of the little extras you'll have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Aging hotel that needs makeover”
Reviews.Author: Nobarbe
Reviews.Content: This property is no longer a 4 star hotel. While the lobby remains grand, the rooms are very small and in need of a makeover. The carpet was frayed, wallpaper was peeling off and doors and door frames are beat up. You can barely turn around in the bathroom, and when the closet door is open you cannot get to the bathroom or bed. The TV's are ancient, and there is no coffeemaker nor refrigerator in the room. The front desk clerk was rude to my wife when she checked in. The hotel charges a fee of $10 per person per day to use the fitness facilities and another fee to access the internet. Valet parking is over $60 per night. Could Hilton possibly nick us for any more fees? They are worse than the airlines. The only reason we stayed here was that all the other downtown hotels were booked up. In the future that would be the only reason we would ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service....again!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyPeach
Reviews.Content: The service at The Palmer House continues to be stellar, and is why I continue to go back there. The hotel is rich in history, and the architechture and murials are really lovely. Even though I was on a business trip, it made it so much more pleasant to be out of town when you get to stay in such a lovely hotel, with service that is so advanced. We had breakfast in the Hotel all 3 mornings, and the servers were very pleasant and happy to share their bright side with us each morning! Yes, I would recommend it to all of my business peers and my friends. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good except the room smelled”
Reviews.Author: KMKC08
Reviews.Content: I booked this last minute for business and got a great price. The hotel is centrally located downtown which makes it great for business or site seeing. I was able to check in 4 hours early, which is a big plus when you need to prepare for meetings. Breakfast at their Lockwood restaurant was good and the bar seemed to have a decent crowd. The room was very big and clean, however there was one MAJOR issue. The room smelled like mildew. I would have changed my room but I had so many meetings, I didn't have time to deal with it. I will send a note to the managers, because, had the room not smelled, I would definitely come back for business.

Reviews.Title: “What a glorious old hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WHSBookLady
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Palmer while attending my son's graduation from Kellogg. The hotel was clean, staff from friendly and helpful. As I was traveling by myself, I felt safe! The hotel is so convenient to all of Chicago. My room was gorgeous and had great beds! I highly recommend,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Tripcritic2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located. All services you need are available. The beds are some of the most comfortable we have experienced at a hotel in recent years, even their rollaway beds are comfortable. Service is great and easy to see that it is a popular spot with tourists. My only wish was that the 2-bed rooms had queen-sized beds instead of full-sized, but wasn't a huge issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great blend of historic elegance and modern amenities + location”
Reviews.Author: PAOPAOFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Palmer House almost every time we visit Chicago and are never disappointed. The biggest plus is the location- easy to get to by train from either O'Hare or Midway, and the Art Institute, Millennium Park, Michigan Av are all close by. The history of this place is amazing and the lobby is worth a visit on its own. The rooms can be small but I've never been in one so small that it is uncomfortable. The beds are so comfortable. The Executive Lounge is very busy in the morning, but they keep everything well stocked and fresh and I love it. I noticed that they just started a tour of the hotel, highlighting its history-- didn't have time but plan to do that on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere and the location”
Reviews.Author: BandBenthusiast
Reviews.Content: I had a great time. The lobby is beautiful, it is walking distance to the Magnificent Mile, the room is very comfortable, the towels were very soft, and I slept great. You didn't feel that you were in a large hotel as I couldn't here anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a grand hotel, worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: rac-columbus
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in some beautiful old hotels, but the lobby of the Palmer House puts all other "grand" hotels to shame. Spectacular ceiling mural, huge, original Tiffany lighting sculptures, a "red lacquer" ballroom that is amazing, and a grand ballroom that is stunning. All public areas are amazing. My room had two double beds and two bathrooms. My guess is that in the recent renovations, they took two small rooms and combined into one. Beautiful furnishings. Bathrooms were small but nice. Room was very quiet. My Hilton Honors membership gave me quick check in. No free wi-fi, but I did get free high-speed internet. I always carry my iPad, so good thing I brought my laptop along with me, too. Good location, close to art museum, lakefront, Macy's (former Marshall Fields flaship store), and only a reasonably short walk to Michigan avenue's Mag Mile. This was a very nice stay for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Historical and impressive lobby, but don't expect anything grand in your room.”
Reviews.Author: RedSnapper25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very impressive especially in the lobby area. Staff was very nice and efficient when we checked-in. We only stayed there for one night and we would not wish to stay longer. It was the last minute decision to stay there using Hotwire.com. We didn't want to pay $200-$300 per night in Chicago Downtown area for just one night. It was about $120 with tax. Pros: Centrally located in Downtown Chicago area. Cons: Business people oriented, very old hotel. Prepare traveling back to 1980s in the room. Don't expect anything. It had very thin walls. I woke up at 6AM because of a businesswoman talking on her cell phone.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location but,,,,”
Reviews.Author: loverotravel
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a excellent area, beautiful lobby, BUT the lines for concierge and to check in are long. This hotel also not offer any in room amenities and I mean none. The rooms are like boxes but again its all about location, location. Excellent on that but poor on amenities and size of the room The fitness room is EXCELLENT.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Last_Girl
Reviews.Content: While my room was more like a closet than a hotel room, the location made it worth enduring the lack of space. Definitely in need of some TLC (TV was ancient, closet door wouldn't stay open). The lobby is beautiful and frequented by lots of business travelers meeting and greeting. The only problem is to get to the check in area you have to walk thru the lounge areas which can be a bit of an obstacle course with luggage. Service was wonderful. I treated myself to room service both mornings and the food arrived very quickly (within 15 minutes I think). The food was good and just as I had ordered it and the servers were courteous (this coming from someone who hates everyone until I've had my morning coffee!) My view was of the other side of the building and the fire escapes, so nothing good there. They also only offer wi-fi in the lobby (not even available as a pay per use option in the room). Showers were not good. Bad water pressure and both mornings about half way thru my shower it decreased by half all of the sudden as if to tell me that i was taking too long. But again, if you can get a deal (I only paid $113 per night), the location definitely makes the small inconveniences worth putting up with.

Reviews.Title: “reasonably convenient for business, rooms are really small”
Reviews.Author: q2435V34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for professional conference in early March 2011. We booked the room through Priceline for $80 per night. The total, including tax, for our four-night stay was $380. (Yes, this was a very good deal.) The big advantages to the hotel are (1) its location, (2) its historical value. On the first point, the Palmer House is a quick walk to the Art Institute and Millenium Park and only a slightly longer walk to Michigan Ave and the great shopping. On the second point, it's a historic building, and the lobby and decor are really fun and charming. You can tell people you meet in Chicago that you are staying at the "Palmer" and they'll know what you're talking about. The big drawbacks: First, the hotel is huge but the rooms are small (like, New York City small). Tiny, stuffy, cramped...there's not much room for two people to move around comfortably. Second, you have to pay for things that should really be included -- specifically WiFi and the fitness center. (The fitness center, if you go, is actually really nice...but they charge $10 each visit.) Third, I pity the fool who tries to stay at this hotel while there's a large conference going on. We were part of such a large conference and, needless to say, attendees for our conference were everywhere and took up all the free space in the lobby and the elevators were mobbed. I felt badly for the poor tourists trying to get around. Overall, it's a nice hotel and a great catch on Priceline if you can get it. But it does have some drawbacks that nicer, perhaps less historic properties don't.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: WTurville
Reviews.Content: Fantastic architecture make this famous hotel a tourist destination in it's own right. Very conveniently situated for the shopping and theatre districtsas well as Grant Park (we were there for the Blues Festival - highly recommended). Has 2 excellent pub/restaurants nearby - Miller's Pub, right next door to the Wabash exit , with superb wings, ribs,steaks and a huge selection of craft ales or the Exchequer about 100 yds further down the road with great ribs and pizza. Staff all very efficient and helpful. Rooms are not their best feature, although beds very comfortable. Avoid rooms with 1 queen bed, as these are quite small with tiny bathrooms. Overall though, would stay again owing to the convenient location and magnificence of the public areas.

Reviews.Title: “A Chicago Landmark Hotel”
Reviews.Author: momideerst
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is gorgeous, the bar has great service and it's a terrific place to "people watch". We were there for the Chicago Blues Fest and it was an easy walk to Grant Park. Our room was very clean (hopefully it is on the list to be updated). We fully expected the high price (229 a night - which did not include the 38 dollars a day to parkt) but next year we'll save a few dollars and stay at the Hampton Inn across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, charge extra for everything”
Reviews.Author: swedgeman
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is spectacular, i got a lot of time to admire it as it took over 20 mins to check in. I wish the hotel had paid the same attention to the rooms..very old fashioned and in need of a makeover. No coffee maker in room..there is a $12 charge to have a pot of coffee delivered to your room. Gym is also a $10 per useage charge plus as ever they charge for internet as well. Stay at Trump towers or any of the other major chains where they look at customers as a chance to offer a high level of service and not a chance to rip the customer off. Incidentally i made a comment about the $12 coffee charge to a colleague in the elevator..the response from the other customers in the elevator was very strong to say the least...Congrat Palmer Hilton management because of your nickle and dime approach you are pushing customers to other hotels..oh and did i mention the noiise from the trains!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic lobby, decent rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: Erinchhh
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via priceline since it was non-affordable my a normal booking site for us. The hotel lobby is fantastic, one of the best lobbies we've ever seen, fascinating. There's a starbucks inside the hotel which you can enjoy. Rooms are not as classy as lobby, the tv was not a flat one, but the bed was comfortable, room was wide enough for two people. Also, it's quite near to monroe blue station, easy access to everwhere in the city. As a result, It is a very good hotel you can choose for a nice trip to Chicago, but it does not worth to pay too much money for staying.

Reviews.Title: “A Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel060
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2010 and enjoyed our long weekend in Chicago. We did not have a car and were able to walk to the Art Institute, Navy Pier, and do some shopping on Michigan Ave. The lobby of the hotel is fantastic, beautiful, and elegant. The rooms are small and somewhat dated, but clean and have the necessities. Check-in went quickly and smoothly. Overall a nice base for a long weekend in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, beautiful hotel, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Ibct
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It has such a long and facsinating history. It's very elegant but not pretentious at all. I had great service in the restaurants and the food was great. Corner Bakery is right around the corner in case you just need to grab something fast. My room was a bit on the small side and my view was the bottom of the interior of the hotel, but I was there for business and it was fine. If a view is important, make sure you let them know that when you book your reservations. It was very clean and had an art deco feel to it. It was a bit noisy- only due to other guests allowing their doors to slam when entering or leaving their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Aging Grande Dame in good location”
Reviews.Author: 2Itravel4fun
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is a Chicago landmark. She's played hostess to presidents and the well off and beautiful. She's earned her place in the sun. Still, like many of her kind, the years haven't necessarily been kind. While glimpses of her former beauty and personality still shine through, her features have slackened and become somewhat unrecognizable through the years. Her main lobby, complete with dramatic staircases, more often resembles the chaotic terminal of an airport, than an elegant and serene foyer in which to relax with a pot of afternoon tea and pastries. In the three days I was in residence there, there was virtually no time - save very late in the evening - when this lovely area wasn't besieged with families of travelers and their resulting luggage. It seems as though the hotel might choose to find another location that their arriving and departing guests might lounge with suitcases, rather than the elegant, main lobby/tea room. The rooms, (at least our room was), in good repair, clean, and reasonably attractively furnished. The view wasn't outstanding, but I rarely blame an urban hotel for that. Everyone can't have the best view, and that is an acceptable point. The bathroom, while clean and adequately furnished, was very small. Subsequently, it was very crowded for my my own, as well as my husband's, toiletries to fit on the small shelf over the sink. The shower was fine. This was not a four or five star hotel in my opinion, but likewise, we didn't pay four or five star prices, either. The interior hallways leading to the bedrooms need a little attention. The wallpaper is peeling in places, and lends a dingy feel of neglected grandeur. Room service was delivered on more than one occasion, and the hotel was notably quick with their delivery - both times in less than half an hour. The restaurant, as well as the more casual bar, were both very pleasant experiences. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant every morning. The buffet was more than adequate, but in addition to this - any person paying for the buffet had the opportunity to order off the menu as well at no additional charge. For example, if a person would prefer an omelette or Eggs Benedict rather than the scrambled eggs offered in the buffet line, this option was readily made possible for the guest. I travel frequently, and I'm not aware of any other hotels with this nice offer. Dinner in the same restaurant was fine also, but not inexpensive. We tried a pre-fix menu of three courses paired with three different beers. It was an interesting concept, but the dinner wasn't anything especially noteworthy. The location was convenient to most major attractions, and of course that is a huge boon for those vacationers interested in seeing the sights in and around the downtown area. Many tours leave directly out of this hotel, as well. All in all, the hotel was a good choice for those desiring a reasonably priced, nice place to hang their hat while sightseeing or otherwise spending time in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Chi-town”
Reviews.Author: saltyseaB
Reviews.Content: I booked the Palmer House Hotel in Chicago for a friend's bachelorette party. It was a beautiful, historic hotel, and I'd definitely stay here again. Rates were very reasonable compared to other places around town, and we had 2 bathrooms which made for a very spacious room. Hotel bar and lobby were very nice. Staff was always ready to answer questions or provide directions. Very clean rooms. Nice concierge breakfast and afternoon snack. Location is pretty good, and within a block of a subway station so you can go anywhere. I'd highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Would deifnitely return”
Reviews.Author: shorty_qc
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the spacious well appointed yet relaxing lobby, yet had only to go outside to discover the fast-paced activities. Great central location for the sites we chose to visit, only short bus ride to Shedd Aquarium and museums. Didn't have time to check out all amenities, but did not find any problems with those we did utilize. Concierge was very helpful with transportation info. Extra charge for WiFi/internet in room, pool and hot tub/whirlpool.

Reviews.Title: “One of the world's great Hotels.”
Reviews.Author: dross157
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went back to the Palmer House for our second trip to Chicago. The hotel has been completely renovated and the entire staff couldn't be nicer. We booked our room on the executive floor where we had stayed during our first visit. The floor has a large sitting area where breakfast is served every morning and great appetizers in the afternoon. If you are going to Chicago treat yourself and saty in one of the world's great hotels The Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price - beware the additional fees!”
Reviews.Author: surfsister_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and wasn't impressed. To be fair, there was a large restaurant convention/trade show going on in Chicago, but then again - when ISN'T there always a large convention in Chicago? The hotel was extremely busy and crowded. Check-in took forever and when I got to my room, I discovered it was a smoking room. Went back and had to stand in line all over again... the staff were pleasant, but I was not impressed with all the extra charges. Not only was it extra to use the internet (which I've come to expect) but also to use the fitness centre? They try to sell you a "business package" for an extra $20 that includes internet and fitness, but that's just cheap. Rooms were incredibly small and the bathroom especially so. I didn't use the pool (was over-run with kids/families when I checked) or fitness room. The lobby and central bar area is gorgeous due to the history and heritage, and the location very central, but I would never stay here again, especially since it cost almost $300 for one night including taxes!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, Terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: parkmusic42
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a visit to Chicago for business. I also stayed at the Intercontinental and the Omni. This was by far the worst of the three. Yes the lobby is amazing but the rooms are so small and stuffy it killed my stay. A small tv, no wifi, and out dated decor. On top of being the bottom of the three I paid the most to stay at this hotel. I will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We were surprised that our stay at the Palmer House Hilton was so nice. This is a very large hotel with a fairly ornate lobby that is definitely worth seeing. We had a very nice room with a comfortable bed. The person who checked us in took time to check the hotel room map and tried to make sure that we had a nice room for our stay (this is a strategy to consider when checking in, even if it means delaying check in until a nice room is available). We were at the Palmer House for multiple days and noticed considerable variation in the size of rooms. Our room did not have wireless Internet, but did have Internet access over Ethernet. The Internet at the Palmer House Hilton is overpriced ($15-20 per night if I remember correctly). This is far too high. They should also have wireless Internet access in all rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: ead_angel
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel two days before our departure to Chicago on a discount website and received a room at a price considerably lower than those listed on the hotel's website. Considering the price we paid, our expectations were met. Check-in was very quick, we arrived around 5:00 p.m. The room was clean and well-maintained. The style and decor was "older" in keeping with the historic reputation of the hotel, but everything was in good condition and not "old" in a sense of actual age and usage. There is an el station nearby, but we were not bothered by any noise. In fact, considering how large the hotel is, we never had any noise problem. The bathroom had a blow dryer and several designer soaps, shampoo, conditioner, etc... Yes, the TV was a "tube" but we were on vacation so didn't plan to watch it anyway! The main downside is the wi-fi is quite expensive. I imagine many people use this hotel for business and expense the cost and that is how the hotel gets by with it. We survived by going to the Corner Bakery next to the hotel which did have free wi-fi. There are several parking lots nearby. As with all city parking, independent and hotel-sponsored, you will likely spend over $30 per day. We used a lot on Monroe that was $34 per day. I would skip them though, because their credit card machine was broken, and they made us pay cash which was a big inconvenience. My suggestion is to use the hotel's parking garage. The hotel is located within walking distance to the red line subway / el, as well as another line which we did not use so I cannot recall specifically which one. Bus stations are also nearby - we took the 146 to Museum Campus. Millennium Park is practically one block away, as is the Art Museum. The hotel really is in a great location. We walked all the way to Navy Pier and back one evening as well. We would stay here again. The lack of free wi-fi is disappointing, but considering we were able to get access nearby, it was ok!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it- Hope to come again”
Reviews.Author: selina21
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a conference, the hotel is wonderful; huge beautiful lobby which is lively in the evenings. Front desk/ reservations staff is great, you must see George at the front desk, he is friendly, professional and patient. The rooms are well appointed (updated/hip look) What's also nice is there is a Starbucks in the hotel. Thanks Palmer House & George!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but beware of noise and gym”
Reviews.Author: arualpalm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights and was overall pleased. It is one of the most beautiful facilities (think Titanic or Daddy Warbucks) with a charming aura from the 1920's-1940's. I marveled over the architecture and wonderful artwork. The location is perfect; there are tons of places for cheapskates to eat (such as Subway, McDonalds, 7-11) right outside of the hotel and is within walking distance of major attractions. If you choose to stay here, be aware you must pay to use the gym, which also has limited hours; this was lame, and I would not stay here during the winter due to the gym usage fees. I used the pool and got plenty of exercise walking to and from work. If you stay here, make sure to ask for a room away from the elevators and as quiet as possible. It is true you can hear people through the vents and doors. If I had not been lucky and had quiet neighbors, I would have probably made the staff's lives hell. Check-in man was a little condescending, but everyone else I encountered was quite pleasant. No free internet at this time, but you could probably go to Corner Bakery and get free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very good time”
Reviews.Author: JimE65
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, very clean and the staff was top notch. Excellent central location for a trip to downtown Chicago. We will stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful! Would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: napz
Reviews.Content: The staff was all very friendly, the room was very clean and well kept. Everything ran smoothly my entire 3 night stay. I appreciated the Bell Service at no extra charge to hold our bags while we took some more time the morning of our departure to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: bouledogue
Reviews.Content: my husband & I spent 5 days here to celebrate our 45th anniversary. The hotel was absolutely beautiful, and they treated us like special guests. The concierges were so helpful, and the recommenced restaurants were fabulous, and not overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Classic!”
Reviews.Author: IowaWhiz
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House continue to be a classic stay in Chicago. The history has been well preserved but the modern touches are noticed. This isn't a budget hotel by any means, but the cost is well worth the luxury treat.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with most of what has been said so far...”
Reviews.Author: ibanadine
Reviews.Content: I came to Chicago with my Mom for the Oprah spectacular in May and we stayed at the Palmer house. I was the first to arrive in Chicago from Atlanta as my Mom was to join me later since she was flying in from Baltimore. I arrived much earlier than check-in time and thought I'd just take a chance on leaving my bags at the counter so that I could rush to the United Center and pick up my tickets to the show. Being that I am not from Chicago I wanted to leave plenty of time to get to and from where I needed to go. The gentleman at the front allowed me to check in early. I was able to request a top floor since I'd read to do so to prevent noise. I got on the 19th floor I believe it was room 19-113 lovely room, two beds and two bathrooms (which came in handy so that Mom and I could get ready for the show at the same time). We had a great stay here. It took some getting used to for me at first because of the grandeur of the hotel. It's very opulent, but I get it, it's historic. I'm used to more modern, chic hotels, but the main lobby does offer this and I think it's cool that the downstairs is right off of main streets and you can not beat the accessibility to the best that Chicago has in the way of tourism. The staff gave good old fashion accommodating service. I came in not sure if I would stay again because at first I felt it was over the top, and I left not sure if I would ever be able to stay anywhere but here. It was a great time in Chicago, and a wonderful at the Palmer House. Excellent Staff! Warning, the Concierge desk does get pretty busy so leave enough time to wait and ask your questions. Also leave a night to eat at the restaurant adjacent to the lobby. Felicia the manager is awesome and a true value to hotel! I hope this was helpful enjoy your visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve0465
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the Loop, within short walking distance of Millennium Park, the Museum of Contemporary Art, launching pad for Architectural Tours and right on a couple of key transit lines --- this is well worth consideration. The double room I had (8-219) was fairly large -- much bigger than most top end hotels that I utilize on business trips. The room was clean, comfortable and - of great importance to me - very, very quiet. In five days, I did not hear any ambient noise from adjacent rooms or outside. The view from this particular room was not great. The hotel is huge, with entrances from three streets --- beautiful lobby. One complaint ---- the internet charge was $20 a day --- ludicrous.... but the bakery on the corner has free Wi-Fi and great pastries.... Another minor irritation --- the TV programming could be improved upon, and the TV was kind of old school --- but I don't watch much TV so that really didn't matter to me.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone Deserves an Executive Level Stay: Add to your bucket list!”
Reviews.Author: Lafemmegiselle
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: I have stayed many times at the Palmer House Hilton when I lived on the East Coast and visited Chicago frequently. Most often I utilized Priceline and other on-line services because I am an seasoned bargain hunter. One cannot imagine a more grand lobby, which harkens back to the days when craftsmanship and style were appreciated. The rooms have indeed varied in size as pointed out by many reviewers. However, I won a Mother's Day prize from this hotel and took my Mom for an overnight. What a tremendous experience, filled with delightful surprises from start to finish! Dianna Freiss made the arrangements for us, and even after some changes from my Mom Dianna remained the ultimate gracious professional. The lobby, always a selling point before, was taken in methodically during our afternoon tea. That is the perfect time to study the architectural details which put a smile on my face. Each time I looked up I saw something new, or at least saw it in a better light. Our waiter was cordial and charming, and offered my Mom some champagne. The champagne was at the level one should expect from a luxury hotel, and Mom's cheeks were pink from either the alcohol or the smiles. The service was precise, the offerings for tea featured some brands I have not seen in my travels (order the citrus tea and your eyes will roll back in your head), and the selection of sandwiches and sweets was well balanced. We were offered a room on the Executive Level and having experienced the difference I will not waste quality time haggling over a few dollars on the internet ever again. Two full beds featured triple sheets and down comforters with emblematic French tapestry reflecting the other French accoutrements of the room. Mama bowed out of plans to tour the Art Institute because she realized how this special upgrade was to be savored. We each relaxed in separate full baths until it was time for hors d'oevres and conversation one floor above ours. Both of us are people watchers, and were fascinated with the myriad languages we heard and the stories we designed in our fantasy world. Although the small tables were all taken when we arrived, by the time we made our way through the buffet seats were available. We easily struck up conversations with other women travelers who elicited advice on sites in downtown Chicago that should not be missed. It felt like a lovely cocktail party and we stayed for at least an hour. Returning to the room, I noticed the added level of security for the Executive Level: a separate elevator that required a room key to operate. I consider this an important feature for females traveling solo. Naturally, Mom was impressed with the inroom safe for the same reason. Back to the room: each of us had a separate closet in addition to the abundance of drawers in the TV armoire. There was also a comfy chair and what appeared to be a pull-out sofa in front of the wide screen TV. The desk was equipped with wifi options and electrical outlets were plentiful: perfect for a business traveler or a long term stay. I will return with my hubby when he can free himself up from work. It will be such a treat for us! It was also a comfort to note many security guards who were very attentive. Indeed, I spoke with Dave and told him I might apply for a part-time position undercover! This is an environment I could drink in while working.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: Seemann11
Reviews.Content: Everything was very good, the room was small but clean, location and lobby are amazing. But the walls are thin, you hear clearly through the walls. Thanks god our neigbors did not watch tv at night.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: seg82
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had some appointments in the city, and hhonors points to use, so I convinced him that we should use them at this hotel. My parents had stayed in the past, and it was highly recommended. Check-in was a breeze with the separate area for HHonors, which was great because it felt like there were at least 3-4 wedding parties having pictures in the lobby area. We ended up on the 9th floor, and when we got to the room (the elevators are very slow at times), we found it to be very clean and decorated nicely. There was no view, however, and it didn't have things you'd expect in a hotel of this class (only a single sink in the bathroom, no coffee maker, no mini bar, etc.). When we went to bed, we found the biggest downfall of the hotel -- there is absolutely no soundproofing between the hallway and rooms. When one of the wedding parties hit our floor around 2am, neither one of us were as excited as they seemed to be. Oh, something else curious...the bathroom appeared to share a vent with the room next door, and light came through it all night. Overall, we've been to better places in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A grand old hotel. I wish I could say as much for the staff.”
Reviews.Author: BruceScott
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House this weekend for the first time in a long time. The hotel is a grand old lady with great architecture and art but the staff lacks a lot.
