Our room was not supplied well, we had to request soap the second day, they wanted $10 to use the fitness center, internet access was $20 per day, the concierge argued with me and the executive lounge was crowded, filled with kids, the food stuck in a small room and crowded with people. I booked my room through Price line and even though I'm a Diamond in the Hilton Honors program everyone took great pride in telling me how thatdidnt do anything for me when I booked my room through them. They wouldn't even allow me to get credit for any incidentals. It was great incentive to not spend a dime in the hotel I didn't have to spend. All in all I can tell you that given a choice I will not stay at the Palmer House again. I wouldn't recommend anyone else stay there either. There are plenty of other great hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, rest is just mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Mianel
Reviews.Content: Old hotel with a magnificently decorated lounge, however extremely noisy and busy. Check in took ages as the front desk was understaffed and there was a long queue waiting. The Palmer House is expensive ($275.00 per night) as are most hotels in Chicago. I booked a room at the executive floor, the price was $30.00 more than my colleagues paid for a regular room that they booked through the congress. The room has all you need, but is not very fancy, very small bathroom, old fashioned TV set, which is not acceptable in this price range. Internet is another $20,00 per day, even at the executive floor. The executive floor has a quiet lounge, soft drinks are for free, continental breakfast included, and free snacks from 17.00-19.00hr. It was an oasis of rest in a very hectic hotel. I booked this hotel for its location between the convention centre at McCormick Place and the city centre. In the end it is too far to walk to the convention centre (50 minutes) but for the city centre it is OK. To my opinion this hotel is overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Palmer House”
Reviews.Author: auntiemame333
Reviews.Content: This older grande dame was a wonderful location to spend Mother's day. The lobby is beautiful, staff very helpful, corner room with two windows and nice view given how packed the hotels are in the loop. The bed was comfy and the room was spotless. The location is perfect for walking to Millenium and Grant parks, the Art Institute, around the loop, or up Michigan Avenue. I got a great rate by doing a little searching on the net...can't be a better combination of comfort, elegance and value.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel if you don't want to be ripped off”
Reviews.Author: biztraveler211
Reviews.Content: The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location. The location is very convenient to the CTA lines & some key attractions. Other than that, there is NOTHING to offer. There are way better hotels within a few blocks of this hotel. My biggest complaint is about the internet or lack thereof. The fact that internet is not free (even in the lobby or the Starbucks downstairs) is unacceptable. In my experience having had wonderful past stays across the country at IHG, Kimpton, StarWood Hotels (for example), finding out that the internet in this hotel was not complementary & that there was no wifi even in the lobby in the hotel was unacceptable to me. Some more unpleasant surprises were that the use of the business center or fitness center were also not complementary, but in fact completely overpriced. I found this hotel to be a rip off which NICKELED & DIMED for everything. in principal I was against paying for these things which are free in every other hotel in my past experience, not to mention necessary for business travelers. I called a few hotels nearby, including The Kimpton because I was planning on switching hotels & confirmed that they not only offer free wifi, but also a free fitness center, free Starbucks coffee in the lobby and a free wine & cheese every evening in the lobby. I will be taking my business there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “For the right price this hotel is more than adequate”
Reviews.Author: Stinz3
Reviews.Content: I read some of the previous reviews and Iâ€™m starting to wonder if itâ€™s me that is not picky enough or other travellers that are too picky. This hotel is very acceptable, conveniently located, clean and well appointed. It is important to distinguish between â€œold styleâ€� and â€œold materialsâ€�. The room featured an older style of dÃ©cor, but the materials (i.e. curtains, carpets, wallpaper) all looked relatively new and in great shape. The pros: -Excellent location -Beautiful reception area/main hall -Clean and decent sized room with king bed -Elaborate and beautiful â€œold styleâ€� furniture/dÃ©cor in rooms -Very clean bathroom with great lighting and amenities (designer shampoo/conditioner) -Very comfortable bed with 5 pillows -Friendly and polite staff -Free newspaper in the morning -Lots of elevators - Easy access to trains and subways (including the blue line from the airport) The cons: - Long line at check in (around 3pm) - No wi-fi (wired internet available at 15$ per day) - No coffee maker in room - Room numbers/directions not clearly indicated - Breakfast costs 20$ Things to consider: -The elevated trains pass on one side of the hotel. I can imagine that rooms on that side of the hotel would be very noisy. -Our room had a huge window, but the view was the building next door (at least no train!) -Classic gem of a hotel featured in a few movies -Fantastic cafÃ©/bakery with free wi-fi (called Corner Bakery) located next to the hotel -Tube TVâ€¦I couldnâ€™t care less, but it seems to be important to a lot of people on tripadvisor. I can see how someone might be disappointed if they paid 300$ per night for this hotel, but at the price we paid (115$) it was very worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “what a mess”
Reviews.Author: BeniaminoD
Reviews.Content: great expectations from the hotel of THE FUGITIVE! Wonderful lobby! AND THAT'S IT! The room was old in style and furnitures, the tv was from the other century, no minibar, no wireless internet, no wireless adapter enough for the number of the room, those guys ignore that we are in the era of IPAD without cable connections. small room, small bathroom, rude service room. they have lost my credit card number and want CASH ON DELIVERY for a breakfast of 20 dollars. Robbery in the business center, 0,59 cents a MINUTE for internet connection, you have to pay to use word, or excel. NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed but can't complain too loudly”
Reviews.Author: redweaver23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a group of friends. We actually stayed in one room (the 6 of us) because we were trying to save money. We got a decent price on the hotel through some connections of friends of friends but we weren't really impressed with the decor, amenities, and other things that were in the room. The second night was interesting since we got up early to be one of the few to get into the pool and hot tub area. The pool was suppose to be heated (it wasn't as heated in the morning as it should be) and we had to call a member of the staff to warm up the hot tub since it wasn't even luke warm. Considering a hotel of that size (over 100 rooms) only had ONE pool and ONE hot tub with a maximum of amount of people allowed in the pool and hot tub area at a time you would think they would have more than just one of each kind of amenity. Also there wasn't any one to enforce the rule of 8 people at a time in the hot tub. At one point there was 10-12 people in it. The staff was friendly enough but not extremely great. We had to ask for extra bedding to accomodate the people that were going to be sleeping on the floor. We thought we were going to get a room that was going to be big enough to accomodate everyone like a suite that offered a couch of some sort. But it was a standard two "double" sized beds. The room itself was equipped with two closets and two bathrooms which was nice to have. It would have been nice to actually have been shown the room before checking in. We waited awhile in line when checking in at 6 pm. I actually work for a hotel but not of this calibur so I can understand the reason for waiting that long. We got lost a few times but eventually found our way to the hotel and to the self parking that was cheaper than getting the valet parking. The hotel didn't have many resurants near them or any information on what to find around the area. But not having free internet in the room was kind of disappointing. The trip itself was fun since I was with friends but we pretty much went with the flow. Definately ask for one of the more renavated rooms if you expect a more positive stay. Over all I am honestly not impressed. The decor in the lobby should reflect something of what the rooms look like. Every hotel is judged by what the first impressions of the potential guests get when entering the lobby. The lobby was gorgeous and everyone in my group was expecting a nice spacious room that we could be comfortable in...but I guess we will have to try some other place next year.

Reviews.Title: “very fine classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: socaltraveller18
Reviews.Content: If you love classic hotels, this is for you. Hotel lobby and general areas really are special. Rooms are clean, well decorated although the TVs have not been upgraded. Otherwise rooms are well appointed. Bathrooms are small but well done. I had a view of a brickwall, but the rooms were paid for by my business, just make sure to get a room with some sort of view. Great spot for a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A true grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chessed
Reviews.Content: This is a very fine old style grand hotel in a prime Chicago location. Luscious decor, nice and spacious rooms (we had a 2 bathroom business room), attentive and friendly staff. The self-parking was a little hard to find and we would have liked to find glasses next to the wine cooler and not only plastic cups for the toothbrush, without having to ask. But these are minor quibbles in an otherwise very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay icon of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: alzo
Reviews.Content: stayed two days in april it really is a very big hotel at least 5 ways to enter and takes up a large block on its own ,the hotel is non stop 24 hours ,but we love to stay in old iconic hotels with history and this really is a gem the art work within the hotel is stunning ,room was nice ,no view from the room but only used to sleep in all and all a real pleasure to have stayed in this great hotel,not for all people some reviews say its dated and they are so right it is and has been restored as a beautiful hotel,location very good you can walk to most places and tube and loop rail at rear exit to get to the airport ,when in chicago again i will stay again alan billington

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel...very elegant!!”
Reviews.Author: Brizkiz
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a business trip and loved this hotel. While my room was a little dated- my co-workers had very boutique updated accommodations. The staff was beyond friendLy, helpful and professional. I would come back in a heart beat! Make sure you check out the hotel lounges- very cool!!

Reviews.Title: “The Palmer House in chicago exceeded our expectations in every way; spacious room, very clean, quiet and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Nana60950
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is easy to get to from the Airport by any means of transportation. Conveniently located in "the loop" we were in walking distance to sightsee and enjoy the Chicago cusine. The room was spacious and clean and the bed was very comfortable. We enjoyed the lobby-lounge to meet with family members and have a cocktail. The service was excellent from the moment we arrived till we departed. We were happy to leave our luggage after checkout and be able to go sightseeing then return to pick it up before going back to the airport. The Hotel is so beautiful, it was like stepping back in time with the marvelous decor with the service and amenities that are state of the art.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful piece of history”
Reviews.Author: ohletsgo
Reviews.Content: Business trip. Some of rooms small and noisy, but overall pleasant stay. Room 18_218 was away from train and larger than most.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: MeggieBeth
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my stay at the Palmer House. I would stay there again without hesitation. The staff were fantastic, and the room was great. My only complaint was that it was pricey, but that's to be expected in downtown Chicago. The parking was really pricey though which was a downfall.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: WorriedMother2
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed there for the weekend. The location is perfect for shopping and sightseeing ( the hop & go trolley stops there). The staff is wonderful and if you like old world charm - this is the place. Once you enter the lobby it is like stepping back into Chicago in the 20's. A beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 6 nights”
Reviews.Author: traveller4803
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had wanted to stay at the Palmer House for many years because it is mentioned in our favouirite film, "The Music Man", and it was the main reason for going to Chicago on a holiday from the UK. When we booked in, the receptionist apologised that there was no room with a King sized bed and offered a room with 2 double beds, which we accepted. The room was very good and very clean and all staff were always very helpful and polite. We had breakfast in the hotel every day and thought that the cold continental was excellent and good value. We had one dinner, which was excellent, but the main course much too large! We were not disappointed in any way and would certainly like to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: spunkmarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Palmer in 2006, pleasantly surprised to see the rooms beautifully renovated in 2011. Gorgeous decor, extremely clean, courteous staff, perfect location. Had a great time! Lack of free wireless is a bummer, but it's available at the cute coffee shop next door!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Lafj
Reviews.Content: I had to stay there for a conference. The room was quite small and the interior dated. Neither the room or the bathroom were very clean. Very dusty ...and under the bed and found till receipts from previous occupants!!! NO wireless internet in the room. On the plus side, the location is excellent and around the hotel there are lots of lovely coffee shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palmer Hilton, location and sleep quality the best!”
Reviews.Author: teresa-sterling-va
Reviews.Content: I know the price paid for a hotel room plays a big role on our expectations and our view of our experience. If I were to rate this hotel only based on my experience, I would say the bedding and air conditioner were both excellent and allowed me to rest so well. The location is excellent, close to both casual budget friendly and upscales restaurants, one block from the blue line train direct from OHare airport, close to shopping and the magnificent mile where you can find so many stores. Close to the Art Institute (on thursday they have free admission at 5Pm), Pier, Parks, Willis Tower. The people in the hotel and in Chicago were very friendly, and helped us many times with directions and answering questions. Now, I got a great deal at this hotel thru Hotwire. I felt I was staying in luxury but paying so much less. If you pay the regular rate, maybe in comparison to other 4 star hotels, you may be expecting more. They should add more people for check in. The hotel is not new, not contemporary, but it is elegant and beautiful. But I believe this is a nice hotel, at a great location, with great bedding, and that to me is worth something.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly shabby”
Reviews.Author: Unhhonorable
Reviews.Content: I feel the rooms in this hotel are desperately needing an upgrade. As well as being tiny, the interior is dreary and the walls seem as thin as paper - I was lucky enough to be able to hear conversations and televisions from nearby rooms until late into the night. More of a hinderance was the lack of wireless internet in the rooms. Being told that they had no wireless routers left without an apology was frustrating - especially when one of the few perks of Hhonors Gold is free Internet access. On the plus side I guess the gym and the gym staff were nice, it's just a shame about the Internet when I had some work emails to send (luckily Starbucks saved me).

Reviews.Title: “The staff was wonderful and everything was top notch standards”
Reviews.Author: elizabethtaylor53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in the Palmer House Hilton for five nights. I had read some reveiws previous to our stay. Boy, were they off the money. Don't fall for the negative reviews you see. The staff and concierges were wonderful. They were attentive to our needs and fulfilled them prefectly. The hotel was always very clean as well as our room. The beds were so comfy it was like being at home with our high count sheets and feather bed. The sound of the trains was faint so that was not an issue. The hotel was situated to alot of sights as well as resturants. We also walked to alot of places. If I ever go back to Chicago I will definetly choose the famous Palmer House Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby, great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: Seismo_mid
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers have commented, the lobby is incredible! It's historic and you really feel that this is a special place. The location is great, although the noise from the El can be noticeable. The room was somewhat disappointing. Ours was very small, the bathroom was microscopic (like a cruise ship), the TV is color (but alas not a flat panel). I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Palmer House”
Reviews.Author: Mary301
Reviews.Content: I took my three adult girls and two small grandsons for a stay at the Palmer House and to visit the Shedd Aquarium. We got a great package deal which included tickets to the aquarium. The hotel brought back my childhood memories of staying there with my parents many years ago. The staff was very courteous and helpful and it is still a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: rrmr62
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel; clean and up to date. Had a nice roomy corner unit. Close to Symphony Center. Really appreciated the Hilton breakfast buffet. Food was very good and service was excellent. New mattresses are very comfortable. We have stayed there before and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing lobby bit run down”
Reviews.Author: Xymyz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old and the rooms show it. We however had a great time due to the hotel's location which meant we could walk everywhere. The lobby was also great place to have a drink after hard day of sightseeing. We stayed in executive level and the extra service there was good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, good location”
Reviews.Author: klfield
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband at this hotel for 3 nights (4/20-4/23). The hotel has an old elegance about it, and felt very relaxing. The location is very good - near the art museum and parks. We had a king room on the 21st floor, which was very quiet. The room was a bit dated (chair and curtains a little shabby) and small, but was it very clean with comfortable bedding. The lobby is beautiful - we enjoyed appetizers and drinks at the lobby bar. The food at the lobby was very good with typical hotel prices and the service was excellent. we had breakfast at the Lockwood one morning. we ordered from the menu and did not do the buffet. The food was good and the service efficient, though abrupt and unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in a classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: fitfunfab
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Palmer House Hilton for three nights. It was the overflow hotel for the Chicago Hilton, for the American College of Health Executives annual conference. While initially i was disappointed not to be staying at the Hilton, in actuality the Palmer House was a much better hotel in every respect. The setting was certainly impressive, from the elegant lobby to the four poster king size bed and over-sized closet. At all times i felt well taken care of as all staff executed superior customer service. I was also fortunate enough to stay on the Executive Level, where the free breakfast and daily happy hours were an added bonus. And on the Executive Level was a nice seating area with flat screen TVs and a small business area with a computer, printer etc. It was an extremely efficient and comfortable setting. The gym/health club (for an extra $10 a day fee) was also completely outfitted with the latest in equipment, steam room and fitness classes including aerobics and yoga. The location is also quite good. There is a CVS across the street and a COSI's next store for a quick, inexpensive meal (compared to the 2 hotel restaurants. All in all, a great stay. Highly recommended for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “In Chicago for Business, Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Audie79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House Hilton while in Chicago for a trade show at McCormick Place. The lobby is glamorous, thereâ€™s a Starbucks on the main level, and the food at nearby Corner Bakery CafÃ© is really good, but thatâ€™s where my praise of this hotel ends. After being checked in, I wasnâ€™t directed to the elevators. I figured they would be easy to locate, but I actually had to find a hotel staff member to point me in the right direction. Once I got to the right floor, the halls and room numbers are confusingly laid out. The room was clean, but nothing special. The worst part of the experience was the business center. I needed to print meeting materials and make copies for the tradeshow booth, and while the computer had my credit card and was charging me by the minute and for printing, neither of the printers would print anything! I had to call a 1-800 number to talk them through the situation to get a refund for what was charged to my credit card. The copier was also broken. I ended up standing in line at the FedEx Kinkos at McCormick Place to get the materials what I needed. What a hassle!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were ok, but staff was great!”
Reviews.Author: CAWeekender29
Reviews.Content: I generally favor more modern/chic rooms, so the decor and room set up wasn't quite my style. I did enjoy my stay though. Nice walk in closet, however the full length mirror was on the opposite side of the door, which was a little inconvenient. The desk was nice, it was spacious and had plenty of light. What really charmed me was the staff. The front desk, bartenders, doormen and even housekeeping staff were notably friendly and enjoyable to speak with. They really improved the overall experience of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with home-town hospitality”
Reviews.Author: EMJWisconsin
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at Palmer House. It is now my hotel of choice in Chicago. The Palmer House is elegant, but I always feel well cared for--as if I was the most important guest. During my stay this time, the hotel was observing Autism Awareness Month. It's nice to see obvious evidence of the commitment to a good cause (one that I care about personally). Between business meetings, I spent time relaxing in the beautiful lobby (worth a trip just to see it!) and very much enjoyed the food in the lobby bar area (great burger!). No negatives at all. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Roxelle44
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. The luxurious lobby and the History is Hott tour with Ken Price made us really feel part of the Palmer aficionados. Everyone was so friendly and helpful, the room was beautifully decorated and housekeeping was perfect. Great location and superior ambiance!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant public rooms, but guest rooms disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mountainoutin
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is a Chicago icon so I was looking forward to the stay there. Indeed the initial impression of the grand lobby met that expectation. So did the attentive service received from hotel staff, from the bellman who greeted me on arrival to the front desk staff. It was apparent that the staff was well trained in customer service. My room, however, was a great disappointment. The inside room had frosted windows which, when opened, revealed a view of the indoor pool one floor below. With this came the noise from the pool area and the humid chlorine smell associated with indoor pools. While the room was a nice size, the only place to sit was at a strait backed chair at the desk or on the bed. There was no coffee maker, refrigerator or microwave in the room. There was an internet connection--for a substantial daily fee. The bathroom fixtures were cheap, such as you might find at a discount plumbing supply company. There was no grab rail in the shower/tub--nothing to hold on to when climbing in or out, and no curved shower curtain railing--just the old fashioned strait variety. On the positive side, being an inside room, there was no traffic noise, the central heating/cooling system was quiet and easy to adjust, the room was spotlessly clean and the bed was great. And, being an older building, the closet was huge. Nonetheless, I found the room a great disappointment, and vastly overpriced for the amenities provided.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated and over-priced”
Reviews.Author: earz
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel previously a few times. The atmosphere is wonderful and historic in the common areas. My room, on the 8th floor, overlooked a fire escape. Only has wired internet at the cost of $20/day...really? The gym is really nice, an extra $10/day. The room itself was comfortable, but the EL going by early in the AM, made it difficult to sleep later. Staff did not seem very interested in service...from the bar to the front desk. Having stayed in 5 different hotels in the past month, this one was the most expensive and the least value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Eh”
Reviews.Author: dgold86
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine. Service was generally underwhelming, rooms were clearly old but clean. Location was good but otherwise, eh. There are other hotels in chicago that for the same price, if not less offer better quality and serivce.

Reviews.Title: “Best Sweet 16 Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Rpm420
Reviews.Content: Took my daughter (16), her best friend (15) and my best friend to Chicago to celebrate my daughters Sweet 16. Even though we booked on Priceline the staff went out of their way to accommodate us. Upgraded us to the Executive level which made the teenagers swoon. Cocktail hour made the adults swoon. New adventures in Chicago made this a memorable visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, warm and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NCS53
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at the Palmer House Hilton. I am so glad it is part of the Hilton chain. It is located close to great Michigan Ave shopping, Millennium Park is 2 blocks away. I had breakfast in the hotel, it was very nice and very reasonably priced compared to most hotels I stay in - all in all, I would seek out staying at the Palmer House on my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: curdmudgeon
Reviews.Content: I was attending a convention recently for which the Palmer House was the Convention Hotel. The rate was significantly higher than I've paid at other convention hotels recently. But the big problem was with the quality of the hotel services relative to the $$$ charged. The first room we were in did not have internet. It had an ethernet wire on the top of the desk--right next to a telephone instrument. But neither one plugged into the wall. There was no place to plug them in anywhere in the room. They were just completely phony decorations. I complained and we were relocated to an equivalent room that did have working connections and given a check to use at one of the (overpriced) Hotel restaurants. But that should never have happened at a hotel like this. All the furnishings in the room were tired and sagging. A bench at the end of the bed wobbled crazily--it needed to have somebody tighten some nuts in the frame. I mentioned that to a guy delivering food to the room, and his reaction was "hey, not my job!" There was no coffee-maker in the room and of course no refrigerator (not even a mini-bar) or microwave. Somewhere on the sprawling floor there was probably an ice machine, but I never saw it. One day I tried to use the little safe and at the end of the day, it refused to open for me. They security guy who came promptly to open it laughed and said "this happens all the time." The bathroom shower was supposed to have a pull cord that you could use to hang up washables, but it was broken. The toilet paper was mounted in an almost unreachable position behind your left shoulder-blade. There was only one suitcase stand. Don't most couples have two suitcases? Where is the other one supposed to go? The lamp frames were bent and the effect was that the place looked sort of crazy. There was no guide to the TV channels to tell you what content was on which channel. It was not all bad: good points: the room was bigger than average; there were plenty of towels that were pretty good quality; there was a sufficient number of good-quality hangers. The individual employees we dealt with were pleasant and seemed competent in their jobs. The bed was fine (that's important!), and the street noise was not too bad. But overall, the place just didn't work. Try to find something else nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are the best thing about this Hotel..Manager needs a tune up”
Reviews.Author: MarinaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: There are some really nice staff at this Hotel. But, there is a serious lack of attention to detail in he management of this Hotel...so if anyone is reading this who audits operations - it's time for a check up because this gem could be so much more...it's just not managed up to its potential...

Reviews.Title: “it's the palmer house”
Reviews.Author: greatplainsbaby
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for my husband's conference. We've stayed at the Palmer House before. Our room ended up with 2 double beds - but we had a huge additional space with easy chairs, floor space. Yes, it does not stack up to more modern hotels. But - come on - it's the Palmer House with it's prime Loop location, beautiful lobby, very helpful staff. If you want more hip modern don't stay here. If you want Loop history, it's a great place.. PS - many cheap breakfast joints close by,,,

Reviews.Title: “Only if you get a great rate...”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak56
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed here 4 days in April. I had a good rate so maybe my expectations weren't as high as they would have been had I paid over $200 (the quoted rate for that weekend). As everybody else has said this lobby is gorgeous. We sat in the lobby a couple of nights for drinks. It was crowded and the waiter came over to take our drink order. I asked for a Martini menu and he said, "We don't have one." I found out the next day, indeed they did and was given the menu. No big deal, just that he didn't want to be bothered and knew he'd have plenty of drink orders since it was crowded. Check in was quick, with not many people in line. I asked for a room with 2 beds and that was no problem. I got to the room and it was a nice size with a nice bathroom. It had been recently redecorated/remodeled. It had a very European feel. Doorknobs were antique and the furniture art-deco. Televisions are not flat screen, but that didn't bother us. Internet was listed @ $15 per day. Gym cost $10 pp per day. We used the swimming pool and hot tub on the 8th floor. They were just o.k. The hot tub was really old and not very clean, This area needs some serious updating! The first night (Friday) there were people in the next room partying and LOUD. You could hear exactly what they were saying:( We thought it would stop but it didn't . I called downstairs and they said they call them and take care of it. NOT. I banged on the wall, they banged back but it stopped. (12:30 a.m.) The last night Sunday night, around 11p.m,. someone in the hall was banging loudly on a door across the hall from our room. It went on for nearly an hour. My daughter opened our door and a lady said, "Sorry, my daughter has locked us out" After nearly another half hour, I got up and went to check and there were two security officers unscrewing the safety lock to access the room!!! Once they got in, they left pretty quickly so I supposed nothing concerned them. It did however concern our night's sleep. This whole scene should have been handled differently. Two of three nights sleep disturbed:( I ordered room service for breakfast and it was wonderful: food, service and price! The location of Palmer House is excellent. One block to the Art Institute, walking distance to Macy's, and lots of shopping. I did take a cab to the shopping areas near the central part of Michigan Ave (Magnificent Mile) Only $5. The bus system looked easy and safe. Next time I'll use it. I did take the El Orange Line from Midway and was surprised at how easy, safe, and clean it was. Cost was $ 2.25 and dropped me right at the door of Palmer House. Used it going back too. It took about 25 minutes which was probably faster than a cab. People everywhere were so helpful and friendly all over Chicago. One of the highlights was Garrett's popcorn!!! YUM!!! We ate at Miller's Pub, Beef and Burgundy, and Gage. All these are less than a block from the hotel. I'd stay here again IF I got a cheap rate. Otherwise other places I've stayed in Chicago are better.

Reviews.Title: “Palmer House Hilton”
Reviews.Author: LostCountess
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had reservations and were given a wonderfully large corner room. The staff were very friendly and it made our trip so pleasant. The registration personnel, maintenance, housekeeping, room service, restaurant staff, the list goes on. The maintenance man was doing upkeep in a hallway was very accommodating to suggest places to visit in Chicago, as well as in the hotel, i.e. the 8th. The hotel has a lot of history to share. Very friendly. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Reviewers Must be Smoking Crack”
Reviews.Author: jimnick
Reviews.Content: I have 2+ million miles flying, hundreds of hotels, thousands of nights, 30 reviews on this site and even 8 different ones in Chicago. As far as the developed world goes this is up there with the worst managed hotel. Not the worst hotel, it has a beautiful lobby, nice people but the worst managed. So if you get your room cheap - which means under $130 a night you might want to stay here. Otherwise you will not get what you pay for. First impression, 18 minutes in the Hilton Honors line to check in at 8PM on a Saturday night. Imagine what it is like on Monday. First room 12X15 and this is in an upgraded room I measured. The others are smaller. No toilet paper, no tissues, all of the lamps unplugged, pealing wall paper and pealing plaster in the spaces between the wall paper. Then the pipes began to scream and bang. Called the desk asked to send up an engineer they sent a security guard for the screaming. Explained the issue called the desk, they said there was no problem. Started again 30 minutes later so I held up the phone this time and they said they could hear it through the phone but would send a plumber. He came said of course he knew it happened it was old pipes. Called the desk a fourth time put him on and they said the onl king room was on the executive floor but I would have to pay for. I said fine. Went to put my suit in the closet. This is not a lie the closet was narrower than my coat hanger. Then went to use the TV. Did not work they sent a repair person. Then went to use the wireless. They said you need to come down to the front desk - waited 15 minutes - to get an old bridge, leave a $200 deposit, went back plugged it in nothing. Wireless only works with a bridge, get one when you check in. Called down the sixth time in 12 hours and they did not have any engineers working Sunday sent a bellman with a new bridge. The internet did not work in the room because the plug was torn out from the wall. Called down a 7th time in 12.5 hours and they said they would find me another king. They would find me a work room in the mean time. Sent a bellman he told me he was there to move me to a single - the old 12X16. I said no. I took the key went here and now am online and decided to write. Can't wait for the next 3.5 days. Check your room before you agree to make sure it is OK. BTW when I complained around call number 5 the desk person said they were sorry they did not know how the hotel had 4 stars when the Hampton Inn around the corner was better set up with better rooms and services. Another desk person said they have been complaining for years but Hilton will not put any money into the hotel. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend escape”
Reviews.Author: jek_review
Reviews.Content: Service was exceptional, the room was large and clean. Chicago is Chicago, great places to eat and shop! Teenagers had fun... parents had fun - doesn't that say it all?

Reviews.Title: “History is Hott Tour a MUST see!”
Reviews.Author: OBB1103
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not only beautiful because of its breathtaking architecture and modern elegance, but because it has remarkable history to go with it. We signed up for the History is Hott Tour. Itâ€™s definitely worth it (includes lunch, glass of wine and dessert)! Bring your camera, youâ€™ll want to take pictures! Tour Guide Ken Price has a dynamic personality making the tour educational & fun. Also, the hotel is in a perfect location of walking distance to many of Chicagoâ€™s attractions. Clean rooms, friendly staffâ€¦.you canâ€™t go wrong. I would recommend staying at this hotel to family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has lost whatever positives it once had.”
Reviews.Author: fshea
Reviews.Content: Friday check in 6:30PM Hilton Diamond Member--meant nothing--check in very impersonal , care less attitude. No consideration of membership status at all when given a room with 20 year old TV and paper thin walls. Friday and Saturday night--no sleep due to loud and out of control party next door. Called security on numerous occasions and all they did was ask the multiple people in the room to "please keep it down" . Parties on both nights went until after 2AM and this hotel could care less. Checking out of this "hotel or club" in one (1) hour to go home and get some sleep. I have stayed here in the past but will be sure to find alternatives in my 4-5 visits to Chicago per year.

Reviews.Title: “Old Historic Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesStevens13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem with stunning architecture and modern elegance. The hotel is good for a little romance and relaxation. Good location in the heart of downtown Chicago. Staff was incredible, but the rooms don't have much of a view. Our room was luxurious but small with one king bed, beautifully decorated in the French empire style. I would recommend this hotel to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful and great location”
Reviews.Author: jrp0629
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Palmer House through hotwire and got a excellent deal on it. The hotel itself is beautiful and in a perfect location. One downfall is the VERY expensive parking, but it's like that everywhere in Chicago. I would definitly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel Starting to Show its Age”
Reviews.Author: 2011ChgoWanderer
Reviews.Content: I had some mixed feelings about Palmer House before I checked in after reading the reviews. And given the fact that I'd won the room through Priceline's Name your Price option, I wasn't expecting much. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby, as others have reported, is gorgeous. There's a lovely old fashioned hum all around that makes you want to get dressed up in a 1930's style dress with your best pearls and have tea. When I checked in, the staff was pleasant and accommodating with my request for a room on one of the higher floors so I was not bothered by the noise of the elevated train despite my room being on that side of the street. I could hear people in the hallway pretty well but experienced no problems with noisy neighbors. And the room, although not huge, was roomier than I had expected. The bed and pillows were comfortable and with ear plugs I enjoyed a good nights sleep. Yes, there was no flat screen TV but as I'm one of the few who doesn't have one at home i wasn't bothered by it. Channel selection was a bit limited but adequate. Where the Palmer House is showing its age is in the upkeep. When I opened the door, the overall impression is pleasing but after a few minutes things start to become obvious like scratches and gouges in the furniture, missing paint on the windowsill, badly repaired bathtub area and jam on the carpeting. Overall, a nice enough stay but there's the feeling that this would be one of the better hotels with a little more TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is over rated. Staff is rude. No DVD players in the rooms you have to pay extra to use the gym, Internet and the rooms are crammed.

Reviews.Title: “Check your bank account for unauthorised tranascitions”
Reviews.Author: Visitor255068
Reviews.Content: Whilst the Hotel & staff were friendly upon arrival and throughtout my 2 day stay, the room & Lockwood restruant were also fine, it wasn't until my arrival back home & after checking my bank balance found there was a ATM tansaction for $146.00 made 2 days after I had checked out and left the state. Five phone calls later I finally spoke to a Front Office Manager who attempted to assist me. The outcome was nothing they could or would do. Advice is double check your bamnk statements. An otherwise enjoyable visit ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Rude Bell Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: dawinters
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my stay at the Palmer House. I have stayed at many hotels, but this hotel, by far has the rudest bell staff!! They don't greet you or even open the door for you when you arrive at the hotel. I pulled up at the hotel and asked the bellman directions to the garage for self-parking. He mumbled something and made a gesture up and to the left; however, he never offered to unload my luggage. Upon my departure, I was loaded with luggage and the bellman never offered to assist me or even open the door!!! I have no idea why the Palmer House have bellmen...they certainly provided no service!! Also, as a side note--this hotel was recently on the news for having bed bugs!! I loved the location, but will never stay here again for numerous reasons!!

Reviews.Title: “An AMAZING blend of nostalgia, sophistication, casualness, and kindness.”
Reviews.Author: DavidYorkPortland
Reviews.Content: THE quintessential Chicago hotel. Loads of history. Halls are lined w/ framed photos of the many legendary performers who've performed there: Garland, Durante, Nat King Cole, Sinatra, etc. The opulence of the magnificent lobby radiates with class, beauty, and good taste. But it's not stuffy. I felt completely at ease in jeans and a sweatshirt, or in my suit, due principally to the consistently superb staff - from the restaurant hostess I had first mistaken as the concierge, who happily answered my question and redirected me when it became clear that I sought more detailed information than she could provide; to the desk staff who were truly helpful in allowing me to check in early; to the concierge who conveyed genuine joy when sharing about 'his' city. Since returning home and glowing about the Palmer House, folks who've also stayed there told me stories of having been proposed there, and having fond memories of Chicago that were inspired by this grand and elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikef147
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a combined work / personal trip to Chicago. The location was excellent for both purposes, and the hotel exceeded expectations. I booked this through Hotwire so did not pick this specific hotel. The rate was excellent ($81/night), and for this price the hotel was amazing. Room was as expected, although small. The elevators were typical for Chicago. The room was quiet and the bed comfortable. Room service was good and timely. Biggest complaints of this hotel would be the maze of hallways, elevators, difficult to find registration desk.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: CarolinainDallas
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is a beautiful historic hotel. This is the best thing about the hotel. Otherwise, it is not a pleasant place to stay. It charges for everything....a coffeepot for our room, the fitness center, etc. The rooms are small without a proper reading chair. We could hear our neighbors all the time. The elevators are very slow. And yes, I did complain to the manager on duty who did take care of some of our issues but I would not stay here again. There was just too much hassle. One other point in its favor though is the location...great location for shopping and eating.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed my weekend stay at the Palmer House.”
Reviews.Author: porterladyp
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is so pretty. The staff was really helpful and on post to greet you and offer help. The beds were really comfortable. The room was nice. We had two bathrooms which were a little small. I have no complaints. I do plan to return soon. Linda Porter Decatur, IL

Reviews.Title: “Always Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Vacation-Advocates
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is located close to shopping, restaurants, and entertainment therefore perfect for a romantic getaway. We always stay at the Palmer House when in Chicago. The staff are attentive and always ready to please.

Reviews.Title: “expected so much better”
Reviews.Author: Lp3506
Reviews.Content: Was expecting so much better from this hotel, good location but that is all i can rave about regarding this hotel, For a 4 star hotel i was very disappointed. If they had put in as much as effort as they did in the lobby towards there guests rooms it would have being great. poor guest rooms, very small and the view I had out the window was looking at straight at another room and a brick wall. TV is back in the old age and you could hear everything in the rooms beside you, even if your talking quite. i would avoid hotel if looking for hotel to stay in chicago.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: ingrid_pariss
Reviews.Content: Find a cheap rate for a king size room at the Palmer in Chicago. Was very excited until I stepped into the room. The bed was taking all the room space. We always bumped into the tv stand or the desk. We could hear the neighbors taking their shower or watching tv. Ok the lobby was nice and beautiful, but we don't sleep in the lobby. No Wireless Internet in the rooms as well. The location was perfect since it was on Monroe and State Street and the cab only cost $5 to go everywhere we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “The Palmer House Hilton is the BEST place to be in Chicago, IL”
Reviews.Author: suitcase_10
Reviews.Content: The Palmer house has everything - elegance, history, superb accommodations, great professional and friendly staff, excellent location with access to easy public transportation to all parts of the city, health and fittness facilities, as well as great restaurants and shops and in-house parking facilities if you're driving in. And, if the guests you're staying among are important to you then you'll definately like the hotel which caters to national as well as international crowds which makes stays there interesting and exciting. The Palmer House is my home away from home when in the city - wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. Try the Executive Level for an even greater experience!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Palmer House for ruining my 40th birthday!”
Reviews.Author: romanose
Reviews.Content: I would like to start off with the positive, the doorman & staff were beyond exceptional. Top Notch. The Lobby is truly beautiful. A Chicago Landmark. I live in Chicago & was excited to stay at the Palmer House for my birthday & I love Hilton Hotels. I booked a King from AA vacations with my miles stating that I only wanted a King or Queen. At check in we were told our room was a double. 2 people in a double..Ouch. Well, I'm pretty easy going, gladly took my key & went to my room. So sad, the bed was so tiny and the room was the size of a closet size coffin with the bleak view of a inner courtyard. I have stayed in Hiltons across the world & really love the touches they add to their rooms. However, this was not the case at the Palmer House. Honestly, I would say you could do better at the Holiday Inn. Not only was the room tiny, we could hear our neighbors discussion about how their dresses didn't fit & people in the hall casually walking by. It felt like the walls were paper thin & we were sleeping in the hallway. Besides that the heating system was as loud as a small helicopter. I'm all for vintage charm( my house is over 100 yrs old) & truly not a high maintenance person but this was really crappy. We went to an art exhibit down the street, hoping when we got back, somehow are room would grow on us. It didn't, it was throughly depressing. We checked out, after 2 hours. The front desk was surprised and offered us another room with 2 Double beds. We declined. It was a nice suggestion but really, the idea of sleeping ala Lucy & Desi was not appealing. Let it be known..2 People really don't fit on a double bed..2 double beds really doesn't solve the problem for a couple. We left & chalked this up to a bad weekend. Went home, had pizza & slept in our own queen size bed. The bad part about all this is A) I will never have another 40th bday. B) Iost about 11,000 miles on a room I didn't want or stay in. C) No apology from management or staff. That's downright crappy. Thanks Potter Palmer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: wick1979
Reviews.Content: Since the rehab of this hotel it has come into its own. Everything about this hotel is beautiful. Really enjoyed the updated rooms. New bars are great little over priced but not outragous. Great location, parks and museums down the street. L Stop one block west, you can not beat this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay at the Palmer House”
Reviews.Author: DebraGail
Reviews.Content: I always have enjoyed the old Chicago, historic significance of the Palmer House. I love that it's a short walk to the Art Inst., Millennium Park and so much more. We were warmly greeted upon our early check-in, which was very appreciated. Our room faced the front of the hotel on the 20th floor. We had two double beds, two closets, one bath. It was very quiet, spacious and nicely appointed. It would be nice to have a coffeemaker but we went to the corner McDonald's to start our days. The Concierge had the info we needed and the staff was helpful and cordial. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better, even after 60+ years of our family staying at The Palmer House”
Reviews.Author: remaxdave
Reviews.Content: I made reservations about 10 days before arriving on February 19, 2011. They asked if there was any special requests, and I just said that it was our 45th anniversary. I also talked to a manager about the blog on the internet referring to bed bugs at this hotel. I was assured that it was a disqruntled customer and really never believed it anyway. Our family has been staying at the Palmer House for 60+ years, and I can never remember an instance of poor service or bad food. The lady who checked us in (Natasha) was a delight from the first greeting. She handled the check in quickly and had our luggage taken to our rooms. I told her it was our 45th and she congratulated us and wished us a great time. Later that evening she sent up a bottle of Champagne which was a very nice touch and certainly not expected. When we checked out three days later she called me by name when I came to the counter. She asked if we enjoyed our 45th and wished us many more. That kind of personal service is something you can't buy and is only given by people who truly care about their customers. The entire staff at the hotel did a great job with food, service and positive attitudes during our stay and we will certainly stay there whenever we are in Chicago. Cheers To The Staff at The Palmer House. David & Victoria Warthan

Reviews.Title: “First class in every way”
Reviews.Author: DestinationInterface
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House Hilton for one night and attended two full day on site meetings. The hotel was first class in every respect. I arrived very early (9AM) and was given a room right away without hesitation. The room was spacious and very comfortable. Old style luxury with modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the most gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: drmom3017
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I stayed here while visiting colleges in the Chicago area. The hotel was magnificent in every way- clean, beautifully decorated, centrally located and the staff could not have been more pleasant or helpful. We were first time visitors to Chicago and the hotel was perfectly located near public transportation as well as downtown attractions. With an advance purchase the value of this hotel could not be better - we felt like we stayed in a $400 a night hotel for a fraction of that price. I would not stay anywhere else in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, to enjoy nightlife in downtown chicago.”
Reviews.Author: PR21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Dec2010, we booked it for its location and location was really great if you want to enjoy the downtown strolls, though there are no scenic views from hotel rooms,most of the Malls , and theaters are at walking distance, and you can visit Navy Pier and shed aquarium within $10 taxi fare...

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roggger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Palmer House Recently. It is still a grand old hotel. The lobby is the epitome of elegance. The rooms are large and nicely decorated. Walking around the hotel takes you back to the past, when big name entertainers performed in the Empire Room. Lining the walls of the hallways are pictures of the entertainers. You can picture the guests walking around in their suits and dresses, occasionally bumping into one of the stars. The hotel is the same, the service is still topnotch, the food is excellent, but the guests are much more casual now. And the neighborhood around the hotel is not conducive for walking at night. It is sad, but the reality of the times. If you are looking for an elegant hotel that will transport you back to a grand old era, with the same great service, stay at the Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular room in gorgeous historic hotel with such lovely service.”
Reviews.Author: JeanneDH
Reviews.Content: The location is great (near Art Institute of Chicago and Magnificent Mile), the room was like what a princess might have in a castle, and the staff went above and beyond to make dealing with the snow a breeze. Just lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Palmer Hilton should be a historic site!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bea_2010
Reviews.Content: Great location near the insitute of art. The service was very good, a special thank you to the maintenance gentle man who came to my room to help me unlock my suitcase (it had a safety tag and I had no cutting implement) and refused to take a tip for his trouble. The lobby is spectacular!!! Rooms were very clean and beds comfortable. WIth regards to the comment made by another reviewer, yes the tv is off to he side of the bed but it did pull out and turn to face the bed at an angle so not a huge inconvenience. My minor whinge is that the bathtub was mildly clogged hence I showered in about 3 inches of water which I'm not a huge fan off. But overall a very pleasant experience in particular for the price of the room (I got a great rate)!!

Reviews.Title: “OLD!!!!”
Reviews.Author: eburns7
Reviews.Content: In the lobby old is charming. And it is a beautiful lobby! However, when it comes to the room, the pool, the bathroom, the windows, the decor in the rooms, the walls between the rooms, the elevators, and the hot tub, old is less than charming. The service was great. The locating is perfect. House-keeping left something to be desired. Granted we were there over new years, but are you really going to leave lime from a drink in the floor for 3+ days? (I say + because we checked out before it was picked up) The hot tub was broken after our third day there. The pool was tiny and poorly maintained. You could hear your neighbors through the walls. The elevators were slow and can't seem to be able to handle the traffic. For the price we paid i expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Blister1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, well maintained hotel with great location. Have read unfortunate reviews experiencing bed bugs. My 3rd time to the Palmer House, never a problem. Wouldn't hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful upgrade”
Reviews.Author: mlperkins
Reviews.Content: Myself and my 2 children (aged 3 and 11) were upgraded to this hotel as our travel agents messed up our other booking. We stayed for two nights. Spacious rooms with 2 double beds. The hotel has been totally renovated so the facilities were clean and in keeping with the age/style of the hotel. Nice toiletries in the bathroom and plenty of towels. We ordered room service which came quickly but as usual was expensive Breakfast not included but we ate at a couple of the local cafes outside the hotel. There are a couple of cafes etc in the hotel incuding starbucks. Concierge was helpful. Bellstaff quick Great location to catch the open air tours, easy to walk to the main attractions, close to millenium park

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, everyone was fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: winter05
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, the hotel was everything we expected and more. Everyone was very helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE FRONT DESK SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Hahns_Girl
Reviews.Content: My husband was surprising me with a romantic evening at this hotel for Valentine's Day. I left work to meet him there. A very helpful gentleman tried calling his room, but there was no answer. I then had to go all the way back downstairs and outside to try and use my cell phone, reached my husband to find out that he had stepped out to get me a special gift. He gave me the room number and said to get a key from the front desk or meet him up at the room. Unfortunately, the nice, polite and respectful gentleman who had previously been assisting me was assisting another customer, so another agent named Suri called me over to see what she could help me with. She explained that I could not have a key to the room as that was the hotel policy, which I was fine with. I was not trying to change anyone's policy. So I politely asked how to get to the room number my husband had given me. She said that she would not give me that information. That I would just have to wait standing there in the lobby until my husband was able to come "pick me up". She then called the next customer, so I guess she had had enough of trying to assist me. To be honest the entire exchange with her was terrible and not to the standards that I would hold a hotel with such a great reputation as The Palmer House.I walked over to stand out of the way. Very hurt and upset for being treated so rudely, once my husband arrived and found me standing there visibly upset he wanted to know what could have happened. So I explained the whole story. He was so livid that I had been treated so badly that he walked straight over and asked for the manager. So after a few minutes the manager emerged and stated that she had already been informed by Suri exactly what had happened. After another very rude and disappointing conversation with the manager my husband and I went to our room, but as we entered the room we decided that spending our Valentine's Day evening at a hotel that really didn't care whether or not their patrons were happy or treated respectfully we would just go elsewhere. My husband went back downstairs got a refund and we drove to The Allerton on Michigan Avenue. Now that hotel knows how to hire competent and respectful staff. Long story short, The Palmer House experience was terribly disappointing and I would never recommend it to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and near everything!”
Reviews.Author: sunflower110
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not only beautiful an historic, but the staff was pleasant and accommodating. We chose to pay a little more to update to the priority floor so that we would have coffee and lite breakfast every morning. It was well worth the extra money. There was a waiter names Will, I believe that was a special joy. I will stay there every time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Chicago Hotel, worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: krippelz3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Palmer House for a Valentines Day get-a-way. Overall its a great hotel and definately worth staying at. Here is the break down... GOOD- -Lobby- This is the most amazing lobby of any hotel i have seen. Great bar to relax and enjoy the atmosphere. We spent hours grabbing a drink and walking around. I noticed some reviews complaining about prices at the lobby bar. Its Chicago! Drinks are going to be more expensive anywhere you go. A martini is $12.00 and beer is $6.00. Not bad for the atmosphere you are drinking in. -Location / Parking- It was nice to have a safe affordable self parking option right across the street. My wife and I walked from the hotel down Mich Ave and back. -Executive Floor- Its definately worth the minor upgrade to the executive level floors. Happy hour is a blast with great drinks and food all covered in the room cost. Also breakfast in the morning is wonderful. Plus private elevators (with benches) are a nice benefit. BAD - Check in- Now i am sure it depends on who you are dealing with. But the person helping us had a lousy attitude. Our room "package" came with a free breakfast, but he argued with me about it even though I had the paperwork to prove it. After dealing with the manager we recieved a free breakfast. Why offer the free breakfast deal if the staff doesnt know about it? Dont let this sway your desicion to stay here - Room smell- Our room smelled like bubble gum times 10000. Im sure it was a air sanitizer but it made our stomaches turn. Why anyone would spray that much of anything in a room i dont know. We didnt complain, just opened the window for 5 hours while we were at dinner. Still an executive level room shouldnt have this problem. - Room in general- I was disappointed with the room size and ammenities. For an executive level room, it was small and slightly dated. Very clean and bed was comfortable. But the more modern chicago hotels have much better rooms. OVERALL- The reason to stay in this hotel is the lobby and history. Its truly remarkable. If you want a modern luxury hotel with large modern rooms then stay at the Trump. This hotel has a great "old chicago" feel. You will feel like VIP's while walking around the lobby, lounge, restaurant, or just the hallways. Its worth a stay at least once. You wont regret trying it out. I dont think its for everyone. Our negative reviews seemed very circumstantial and could have happened at any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: smoochie13
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice yes and in a good location but the valet was terrible! I worked for a Hilton property and I was very embarrassed to even say I worked for the company after receiving the service that I did. I pulled into the hotel and no one wanted to direct us where we should go, no one took our bags, valet was just standing around didn't even approach us when we pulled up we had to go to them. The Hilton property that I worked at the valet is super attentive along with any other time I have had valet. Then when we walked into our room there was wallpaper ripping off the walls and hairs on the lamp shades, I was mortified. No one was helpful at directing us it just seemed like a very unorganized hotel I couldn't believe it.

Reviews.Title: “Great old hotel, beautiful, but needs a little upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Mikestages
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is an historic hotel located in the center of the downtown loop area. It is a block from the art museum, park on the lake and very close to most major downtown theatres, greek town, and the Golden Mile. It is a grand beautiful old hotel with a magnificent lobby. The service is fantastic. Philippe at the concierge desk couldnâ€™t have been more helpful, and my check in attendant was equally wonderful. The rooms could use upgrading to join the rest of the hotels in the 21st century, like flat screen tv's and wireless telephones. The room was great. Although, I must say, in our party of three, the sizes of the rooms varies, so ask for a big room. One of our party was in a room so small they could barely get their suitcase in, but my room was huge, with a hallway to the bathroom. As a Hilton Honors member, I received free internet discounted gym entrance and the opportunity to partake of the free breakfast and happy hour snacks every day. I am HH Gold. The room was nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The TV is not even a flat screen old style. It is a relic, and sat far from my bed, making it tough to see. There was no coffee maker, but they are available upon request. The room safe was big enough for the largest of computers. There are very nice amenities in the bathroom. Water pressure was perfect and the water was hot. The downside of this hotel is the extra charge situation. Everything costs extra. There is no mini-bar because they want you to order from room service. Coffee is $8 plus $2 delivery charge and 21% service charge, plus tax. The gym is $10, internet starts at $14.99 for a few hours and $19.99 for a day. A scotch in the bar was $17 with tax and tip. There are plenty of places to eat in the neighborhood like Au Bon Pain which has a great lunch. You can watch your favorite TV show if you missed its initial run for $4.99 and movies are available at a much higher cost. I highly recommend the Palmer House Hilton. Itâ€™s a wonderful old hotel, just watch your wallet!

Reviews.Title: “An incredible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LauraHasulo
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is a beautiful hotel. From the lobby, to the elevators, to the rooms and the historical drawings, paintings and photographs everywhere, I don't have one bad thing to say. My husband and I walked from the train station with no trouble at all. The El and the buses right outside the door took us all over to the various sights we wanted to see. An easy walk to the theatre to see Wicked too. We walked over to Millenium Park and then up the Michigan Mile to the John Hancock Building. The Palmer House is so centrally located that no walk was too far. We walked to the Sears Tower (now called Willis) and to Giordanos for deep dish pizza. I give it a 10 out of 10 and will stay there again. The service was great, the hotel employees were friendly everywhere throughout the hotel and the only slightly negative thing was the cost of drinks at the lobby bar but that can be said for most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly amazing”
Reviews.Author: electrical_steve
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive suite on the 22nd floor. This room was spacious, and clean. The hotel was very quiet for being downtown. Along with staying on the 22nd floor, we were allowed to visit the executive lounge on the 23rd floor. All the food and non alcoholic drinks were complimentary, and they had breakfast too. I would definitely recommend this hotel, no matter what room you stay in. And make sure you visit the other floors of the hotel. The architecture is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: fredtravel92
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located in downtown with an amazing lobby . Good service at reception . Rooms are not too big but clean. There are many restaurants outside the hotel but nice to take a drink in the lobby. Just upset by wifi access price , absolutely too high for a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge floor conundrum”
Reviews.Author: buffy18
Reviews.Content: Weekends on concierge floor are chaotic, like black friday shopping. Many people scarfing down free food are not legitimate guests. During the week the place is very nice and worth the $39 bump up cost. Hotel in general is past prime but still American regal. Concierge staff were shining stars of the establishment. Front desk personnel can be inconsistent, some were brusk and condescending, offering misinformation and unwilling to recognize/ dismissive of concerns about weekend concierge floor conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected!”
Reviews.Author: manktripguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palmer House for one night on a recent trip to Chicago. As a HHonors Gold member, I was uncertain of what to expect, however found the hotel to be clean and the staff friendly. I was upgraded to a larger king room on the executive floor. The room was spacious and clean. The offerings in the executive lounge were above average. All the staff I encountered were friendly. The food at Potter's Lounge was good. I would not hesitate to stay here again, especially for the bargain prices you can find during the winter months.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby but rooms are in need of an update”
Reviews.Author: travlingman54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Jan. and was very disappointed in my room. Very small room about 200 square feet and it makes you feel like you are in a closet. The tiny bathroom was about 6 feet by 6 feet you had to maneuver around the door to get in and bend over the toilet to turn the shower on and this was after I had asked to switch rooms. I especially hated the TV and old 24 inch Phillips tube TV similar to what I had in my dorm room 20 years ago. There are much better chooses for the same price in Chicago (Ritz, W) but do visit the lobby it is stunning it just ends there. Also the train runs until late at night so do not expect a nice quiet experience. I was really surprised by all the positive reviews I guess if you are staying it is imperative you pay for an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing lobby and grand rooms”
Reviews.Author: MtlFire
Reviews.Content: A quick two night business trip in Chicago. This was my first stay at the Palmer House and one of the nicest Hilton properties I've stayed in. Quick check-in with no one in the Hhonors line. Was recognized as a Hhonors Diamond before check-in and upgraded to a room on the executive floor with two double beds and two bathrooms. The room was very nice and I liked the period decor the second bathroom was great for travelling with colleagues. There was a small walk-in closet of both sides of the room. The executive lounge was located one floor above mine, a quick walk, or there was reserved elevators that only served the executive floor and needed key card access. It was one of the largest executive lounges I'd seen, staff was polite and attentive to our needs. I know the lounge is advertised as 'continental breakfast' but this was still one of the few lounges I've seen that didn't have some sort of scrambled eggs or bacon for breakfast. On the 22nd floor we could just barely hear the elevated train go by, I'd be worried about a room a little lower down as the train runs down the street at the height of the 3rd/4th floors. But on our floor the noise wasn't an issue at all. The hotel was centrally located with several restaurants in the area. The front desk was quick to point out local places to eat. I didn't have time to experience the on site restaurants, or fitness area. The lobby area bar was always quite busy and we ran into a few people that came there for drinks but weren't staying at the hotel. I'd have no objections to staying at The Palmer House again and would even consider going out of my way to do so while in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Palmer House is beautiful and in the most convenient location”
Reviews.Author: CathyInFlorida
Reviews.Content: I would stay at the Palmer House Hilton again. The room we were upgraded to had 2 double beds and 2 full bathrooms. The room decor was a bit outdated and the tv wasn't a flat screen in HD, but we didn't come to Chicago to stay in the room. The location of the hotel is just one block from Lake Shore Drive--the Chicago Art Institute, and Milinium Park. There is a Starbucks inside the hotel itself and an EL stop right out the front door. Also a CVS across the street and Millers Pub right next door. Locations was everything. The lobby is breathtaking, but drinks were very expensive--but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel with great value.”
Reviews.Author: bluebeemer7914
Reviews.Content: Ornate ceilings in the Lobby are stunning. Our room was large and clean with his and her bathrooms. We were convenient to the theatre district, great restaurants, and shopping. We were on one of the two conciere levels and enjoyed morning breakfast, afternoon snacks, and a private bank of elevators. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For superior service and comfort stay at the Palmer House Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: librarylover2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a wedding at the Palmer House and stayed at the Palmer House for 3 days, 2 nights. We found all employees helpful and friendly. I had to call on Security two times to help me. Once they helped get him to his feet after he had fallen. Later they delivered first aid supplies for his arm. The Security personnel were courteous, helpful and very professional. The three rooms we used for the wedding activities were lovely. The food and service were excellent. One could do no better for superior service than the Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “The closest to royal treatment in the United States”
Reviews.Author: EvelynOfBoston
Reviews.Content: The hotel decor is absolutely fabulous. The staff couldn't have been more attentive. The place to stay in downtown Chicago. No need to look elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but a little impersonal”
Reviews.Author: binniecambs
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed here over New Year. The 'el' was so close to the hotel, you can hear it. It's fine once you get used to it, but needs a little adjustment before you do. Our room was lovely, mainly I think because we had a corner room which made it light and airy, with a view down to the lake. Also, because we had two beds, whihc meant it was reasonably sized. We heard a lady in the elevator complaining about the size of here room and when we went past a room beign serived and could see inside it, it did seem quite small. The bathroom was good with great products, the bedding was lovely and the location was fabulous. Most things were well within walking distance. There are plenty of places to eat close by, so no need to starve here. Our complaints were around the lack of... no kettle for tea or coffee making in the room. Why? And wifi was available, but at the most rediculous prices! It was something like Â£14.99 for basic (good enough to check your emails) a DAY or Â£19.99 for the faster stuff. As my cousin said - how come most of the coffee shops provide free access while you sip your $2 coffee, yet hotels charging huge amounts of money can't offer the same service? I'd advise you to go for a coffee to check your emails! Our other complaint was about the pool area. the pool is TINY, no changing facilities and the jaccussi was out of order for our whole trip, which was rubbish. We were really looking forward to a nice soak after a lot of walking and were hugely disappointed that it wasn't in working order. That aside though, we had a nice visit. The hotel lobby is as amazing as everyone says - but all manner of people can wander in and out of the area unchallenged, so make sure you lock everything up okay. We recomend the gage, which is on Michigan Avenue for a lovely meal. And finally, you can print your boarding passes out in the buisness centre for free :) The rest of the internet charges are high in there, but it was great to be able to pop in and print off my boarding pass with no hassle at all.

Reviews.Title: “As I have always found with past stays the Palmer House is one that I always enjoy come back to.”
Reviews.Author: MainStreeter
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is always helpful, going out of their way to make sure your stay is everything you want it to be. It is a great location, walking distance to the Art Institute, restaurants, theaters and shopping. Enter from Wabash, climb the stairs and emerge under an outstanding example of architectural history - it never disappoints me.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a Reasonable Rate”
Reviews.Author: MrsNoodleham
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is, in a word, wonderful. The lobby is breathtaking and filled with people from all walks of life, and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The hallways are lined with photos of legends from the music world who performed at the historic Empire Room located in the Palmer House. The beds are amazingly comfortable; between great quality mattresses and down comforters, I slept as well there as I do at home. I have stayed at other hotels in Chicago, but since I discovered the Palmer House, I haven't stayed anywhere else. The location is perfect for shopping the Miracle Mile and we saw White Christmas just a block away. We were able to walk from the train station to the hotel and thanks to the complementary luggage service were also able to leave our bags and start immediately on our shopping plans. I was able to get a great deal on the room as well, thanks to a "Christmas in July" special a few months before the trip. (I would have paid almost as much to park my car as I paid for the room.) I highly recommend the Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “The service is always stellar!”
Reviews.Author: ARO2011
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Palmer House at least 3 times since November. I actually go back this upcoming Sunday. The hotel is bright and clean. I'm a bit of a germ-a-phobe so I am big on clean spaces. I love that everything is clean and actually smells clean and fresh. Each time I check in, they welcome me back and make sure that I have everything I need. The weather has been less than ideal so I've called for room service a few times. The room service staff members are great, they always answer the phone in a cheerful manner. My order is always right and on time (often early) Each level of service is stellar. Anything I need is just a phone call away. They never seem bothered, and are willing to help in any way.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of relaxed luxury!”
