Reviews.Author: MimziTravels
Reviews.Content: Our first getaway in years, we're so glad we chose the Palmer House! It was relaxing, elegant, close to everything we planned to do and not extremely overpriced. We chose the "historical package" that included a behind the scenes tour of the hotel and a look into the history of the hotel and it's founders. What a treat! We highly recommend it! The room was clean and well appointed, with only the need for an update of the TV (to a wall mounted flat screen, to give more space in the room) and a chest of drawers relocated to the corner of the room. We enjoyed breakfast at the in-house restaurant each morning - wonderful oatmeal! Concierge was very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: gialluca0429
Reviews.Content: This has been our second stay in as many years, great hotel and staff, it is close to many fine restaurants and the theater district. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago. It has that old world charm that I enjoy, and the service is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Night furniture moving for two hours by staff in next room”
Reviews.Author: 627CWV
Reviews.Content: From 1o p.m. for two hours employees made lpud noises in the room next to ours. I called the front desk three times to complain and ask that someone in management intervene. No help came eventually after more than two hours of loud bumping bnoises of furniture being moved, it stopped. By then it wa well after midnight. It tainted an otherwise nice stay over Thanksgiving weekend of Thursday and Friday nights. I also complianed when Ichecked out on Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago History Buff loved it”
Reviews.Author: larryncarol
Reviews.Content: Got a free room here as my husband cashed in some of his Hilton points. He's a diamond member and we received numerous free perks and a stay on one of the Executive Floors. Was fascinated by the historic rooms, elevators and exquisite lobby. Great service from a friendly staff. Very clean and quiet except for the L trains, which incidentally didn't seem very frequent past about 10 pm or so.

Reviews.Title: “Nice history, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Menglert
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a little bit of Chicago history, this is a great place to stay since it has has been around since the 1800s. This hotel is massive, so if you are looking for an intimate, boutique hotel, this is not the place for you. The location is very convenient, it is located within the Loop and the El is steps outside of your door. One thing that did annoy me was the lack of a coffee maker in the room. There is, however, a Starbucks on the ground level if you would like to pay $4 for your coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: VAgirl505
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights to attend a wedding that was there this past weekend. For the price we paid, I thought it was a very good value. The hotel is located within a few blocks of the train that travels to/from O'Hare airport, which made it very convenient for us. Additionally, there are so many shops and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel that we didn't need to walk far for anything we needed. The hotel is huge and upon entering the lobby, it is very beautiful and impressive with the high painted ceilings and elaborate decor. We arrived around noon and had no trouble checking in early, which was nice. Our room was spacious with a very comfortable bed. My only complaints about the room were regarding the bathroom. It was nicely decorated and clean, but just very small. I liked the deep tub, but the water pressure was so low that it took a long time to fill the tub. Other than that, we were very comfortable in the room and had plenty of space for our bags and clothes. The wedding reception we attended at the hotel was in a beautiful ballroom, and we enjoyed the food we ate there and at brunch the following morning in the hotel restaurant. Also, I appreciated that one of the doormen went out of his way to help us find a cab that would bring us to the suburbs (for the church wedding ceremony) for a flat fee. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to others visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Had Expected”
Reviews.Author: KikiChere
Reviews.Content: Before I had stayed at the Palmer House I had looked at their website and was impressed at what I saw, the pictures looked magnificent and fabulous. I was getting really excited. The lobby area with its murals are beautiful, the rooms are not so. The rooms looked like they were from a Super 8 or Motel 6. It had a CRT Tv, paint chipping off the walls in the bathroom and the floor next to the toilet was stained yellow. I was disappointed and I had stayed there for New Year's Eve/My birthday. Probably have to pay alot of money to get a better quality room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cathtap
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in the Chicago area and had two separate stays at the Palmer House. (Spent a night in Oak Park for a wedding) The first stay was disappointing but the second made up for it. The first time my boyfriend and I arrived at the hotel we were not offered any help with our luggage. I had three heavy bags and was clearly struggling. The staff was standing around in front of the door but no one could actually open it. It was very windy and the doors were heavy and the effort to open the door made me drop my suitcases. For the age of the hotel the room size was generous. The only problem was that the room was dirty. The dresser was sticky and one of the decorative pillows had a stain on it. The concierge was rude but the dinner recommendation she gave was good. The second time I arrived at the hotel valet immediately greeted us, the bellmen helped with the baggage and there was someone to open the door. My party arrived at 11am, but were able to check in early. (the rooms weren't on the same floor but we opted not to wait for closer rooms.) My boyfriend and I received an e-standby upgrade so for an additional $74 a night we got a HUGE room. There was a dining room, wet bar, large living room, two flat screen tvs, and one and a half baths. We had dinner in Lockwood one night and it was pretty good. They had run out of the sparkling wine I wanted but there were plenty of other options. Overall my biggest disappointment was the gift shop (which I think was operated by an independent group...) The hotel has such a rich history and a beautiful logo but there weren't any souvenir options that reflected this. The only hotel specific items were one out dated postcard and a tee shirt. The picture on the post card did not show the current furnishings and decor of the lobby and the shirt was very plain and over priced. I would have liked a hotel magnet or something with the peacock logo.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Palmer House”
Reviews.Author: anonymoussfh
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel to Chicago, I stay at the Palmer House if at all possible. It is very close to the metro and bus stops as well as the theater district and restaurants. The inside is just beautiful as well. Seems that there are many different sizes of rooms, some are a little small but still comfortable and some are quite large. All are clean and very well decorated. Noise has never been a problem for me at the hotel. The staff has always been helpful. This visit I chose to attend a BlackHawks game...they provided all the necessary details on what buses to take there and back and it definitely reduced my anxiety.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Grapeman1991
Reviews.Content: Went for New Year's eve. Hilton Diamond member. Hotel is decorated very nice. However the customer service was terrible. 1) Extra rollaway bed was placed outside of our room. Upon going to dinner, asked to have it placed inside and set up and to refresh towels. Return 2 hours later. Rollaway was placed inside room, still standing on end and wrapped up. No towels. Had to inquire again. 2) Restaurant service - non-existent. Drinks made wrong. Can't find waiter. Excalate to manager. 3) Private party on 4th flr resulting in ALL people to have room key shown at elevator (to prevent non-Palmer-House guests from crashing party). Requires ALL guests to go to reservation desk to get keys for all people in family. Huh? One private party inconveniences ALL guests at hotel? Whose idea was this??????? Escalate to Manager 4) General questions to employees - met with general responses. Overall perception of unwillingness to help. Valet parking service confusing - took 3 people to finally explain the different drop-off / pick-up location/process. General - rooms very small. Fitness Center is excellent. Good location. Valet parking at $55/day. Extremely disappointed. Easily the worst customer-service experience I had at an upscale Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: BAF126
Reviews.Content: We live in Chicago but wanted to get away for a night. This was our first time staying at The Palmer House. We felt like we were on vacation. The room was wonderful and the staff we encountered were all very nice.And we were able to finish our Christmas shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Timeless elegance and always enchanting”
Reviews.Author: chriscraft1999
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Palmer House over the Christmas Holidays for the last 26 years with our children. The rooms have never dissappointed..always clean, updated and elegant. With children (of any age), the large rooms with double baths have been a necessity. I have always appreciated these upgrades offered free by the front desk staff. The decor of the rooms, while very tasteful and elegant ,is far exceeded by the hotel lobby. The lobby not only takes one back to a slower and more leisurely time, but offers a great place to lounge, read or simply explore the architecture. During the holidays, we especially appreciate the Christmas decor. A wonderful hotel and an ongoing part of our Christmas tradition.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and luxurious, as expected.”
Reviews.Author: hurrydog
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton is a gorgeous, classic hotel. We booked our rooms a month in advance and got a very good deal for downtown Chicago the week before Christmas. We were hoping for a hotel closer to the Cadillac Palace Theatre but there were no rooms available so the Palmer House became our next choice. It was only a $6 cab ride to the theatre. Our king-sized bed was very comfortable and our daughters enjoyed their two double beds with separate bathrooms. The door staff were very friendly and helpful and the valet service was prompt. $11 for a martini seemed a bit steep at the lobby bar, but in fairness, the drinks came with an awesome view of the lobby and its ornate, painted ceiling. The girls thought the place was great even without ever making it to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “stay here, but eat and drink elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: mechg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely one of the nices places I have stayed. Everywhere you look is just enchanting, I especiallyloved the old pictures on the wall. Perfect location for theater and shopping - all within walking distance. Rooms clean and romantic. Downfalls, dont' bother eating or drinking there. The service we received was horrible. Very unfriendly staff in bars and restaurant for breakfast. Food not worthy of hefty price. People attending function there had to use bar bathroom, so there were people constantly walking by, blocking the tv ,making noise. And finally, do not leave anything in the room, as you will not get it back! I left phone charger in lamp next to bed, and was told, the "housekeeper must have missed it". Nice job. And thanks again Faith, for all your help. She was the only employee that performed at the level of standard the Palmer House should be!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: twdsuz
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is the place to stay if you are into the decor and service. Done in Art Deco, and gorgeous paitings on the ceiling of the lobby to start. Way to much to mention but I am always in awe and it gives you the feeling you just want to hang out in the lobby, lucky for me the bar serves in the lobby and I have seen people eating dinner there also. The rooms are very clean and quiet. You might hear a slight rumble of the "L" going by but to me it sounded like rain, didn't bother this country girl. I have had a small double room and a large double room, if you need the space go for the large room when reserving. Plenty of space to walk around and not trip on your family. Staff is very accomodating. If you want to save money self parking is right around the corner. It was a nice walk to the theatre district, unless the weather is bad and a quick taxi ride to the Mart. There is also wonderful shopping right outside the door, including the best Macy's I've been to. FYI there are some rooms that have not been updated that my friend once had, and wasn't happy with, but the staff was glad to give her a different room. If you stay here you will feel like you've been swept back in time, in the days of luxury but with all the new ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “A Destination hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: 29556Traveler2010
Reviews.Content: Our experiences with the Palmer House, has made it a destination in itself for any season. When we have friends and family in town, this is the place to take them. Chicago has so many world class museums, an aquarium, incredible big city scenery and shopping on the Magnificent Mile, and it is all within walking distance of the Palmer House. This hotel has a lobby that is a work of art in itself, where a friendly afternoon tea can be ordered for the lobby or more private areas. The staff are unfailingly polite and friendly. My husband accidentally left his cell phone at the desk while registering, and before we had even reached our room, a message had been left, where we could find it. We have stayed in a single room and the executive rooms and both times the rooms were very clean, and quiet. Everyone, from the desk clerk, bellmen and people who help us with our cars are more than willing to direct us to the nearest cafe, or point of interest. We have stayed in hotels, in London, Paris, New York and Fort Worth, and our experience with the Palmer House has been consistently world class. When we want to show our friends and family the best of the Midwest , we take them to the Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: iceal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House the day before Christmas Eve. The hotel was decorated beautifully for the holidays. They also upgraded our room for us. I had sent an email asking if they could. No charge. Awesome. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. The upgraded room was super. Two bathrooms, and very clean. Bed was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful trip to the Palmer House!”
Reviews.Author: dhimberger
Reviews.Content: As usual, my travels took me to Chicago ... which in December is always an adventure! The best part of the trip is always staying at the Palmer House in the Loop. I always marvel at the decor (the ceiling of the main reception room continues to amaze!), and am consistently pleased with the service. The Executive floor is a great place to unwind and get snacks and drinks, while those working on that floor - and everywhere in the Palmer - are pleasant and happy to help in any way they can. I tell others to stay at the Palmer House ... and everyone always agrees that it's terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Christmas Getaway”
Reviews.Author: WarmthSeekerChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palmer House in Chicago so that we could get together with some family members to exchange Christmas gifts and have dinner. My niece lives directly across the street from the hotel so the location was phenomenal. I booked on line and purchased the 7 day advance nonrefundable king deluxe room. We had a corner room which was spacious, beautifully decorated and extremely clean. Our luggage was delivered in the time frame promised, coffee delivered via room service on time and check in/out was painless. We had dinner with our family at the Lockwood which was excellent and the breakfast buffet included in our room rate. I can't say I have eaten at a breakfast buffet with such a selection and with such quality in a long time. The hotel was decorated beautifully for the holidays. The staff had a bit of holiday cheer so it was just such a pleasant stay for us. For those shoppers - State street is right there. It is a very fine hotel. Try it out next time you are in Chicago - I don't think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, iconic Chicago hotel in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: travel_junkie3000
Reviews.Content: Frank Sinatra, Judy Garland, George Burns, Frankie Vallee, and Nat King Cole have all performed at the famous Empire Room at the Palmer House Hilton. Itâ€™s a hotel that holds a place in Chicagoâ€™s history with the original hotel being built in 1871 and being destroyed in the Great Chicago Fire just a few days after it was finished. It was immediately rebuilt, and then rebuilt again in 1925. That is the structure that still stands today. The lobby is grand â€“ these were the days when folks flocked to the lobby to socialize and people watch (remember no TV). It is still a great place to sit, people watch, and enjoy a drink. We visited in December so everything was beautifully decorated for Christmas. Our room was on the 20th â€“ Hilton Club Floor. One room was a double and was very large â€“ plenty of room to spread out with a large walk in closet and decent size bathroom. The King room was a bit smaller, but completely adequate. In both rooms, it looked as if the bathroom had recently been freshened up with new paint, wall paper, vanity and sink. The tub was a little tired but clean and I like the vintage look of an older hotel. The hallways are decorated with pictures of all the celebrities that appeared in the Empire Room. It was fun to see all the people that performed there from the 30â€™s to the 70â€™s. We were able to walk into the Empire Room as there were no events scheduled. It would be a great place to rent for a wedding or large party. The fitness center is very nice â€“ lots of cardio machines, weight machines, plus free weights, exercise balls, and mats. It cost $10 per day, less if you have status with Hilton. The pool and hot tub? Well, we were there on a December weekend so there were lots of families staying in the city for a holiday tripâ€¦. therefore the pool and hot tub were crowded with kids. Maybe other times wouldnâ€™t be so bad. The hotel staff was very good, friendly and efficient. Parking costs were outrageous! Park in one of the nearby parking garages and walk or take a cab to the hotel. It would be cheaper than the $55 per night at the hotel. Overall a beautiful, iconic Chicago Hotel in the heart of the city. Great atmosphere, great location.

Reviews.Title: “45th. wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: theonlyone54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed just two wonderful nites on the 11th. and 12th. of September. We will be doing this for the balance of our married life. Thanks Palmer House for an outstanding experience.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on me for staying here yet again”
Reviews.Author: Buckhead720
Reviews.Content: I reviewed the Palmer House in Dec 2009. Sorry to report that my opinion has now been downgraded. There is no "service" in this hotel whatsoever. The front desk was condescending and did not care one bit about my promised upgrade. No bell staff. No concierge, just a vacant desk with some brochures scattered on it. Internet is now $20/day. My room was so forlorn, with furnishings right out of the 1970s or 1980s, worn carpet, DIRTY towel, hair in the tub, no amenities whatsoever, not even a coffee pot, and the same tired TV channel offerings. Workers were picketing over union affairs at all three entrances and banging trash can lids and hubcaps together - all night. Real nice touch there, Palmer House Hilton. And you did nothing about it. Last time I will stay here and I strongly suggest others stay elsewhere. Plenty of nice hotels in the vicinity. Palmer House is a tragedy these days, I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!! Part 2”
Reviews.Author: Momof5part2
Reviews.Content: By the am the hotel upgraded us to the executive level but our 3 rd room for a two night stay. If you do stay here it is worth the money to either get the bigger rooms or the executive floors... I will also add I so irritated in the am do to repacking twice and getting to sleep at 1 am, the staff at the lockwood restaurant did not flinch at poor disposition and the excellent food renewed my attitude

Reviews.Title: “Palatial Lobby, Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Govt_Traveler52
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Chi. for 2 weeks to attend some Gov't training. The Hilton-Palmer House is a very historic building, originally built in 1871 and rebuilt after the Chicago fire of the same year in 1875. There were additions in the 1920â€™s. So, while the hotel lobby is extremely palatial (reminded me of the main room in Grand Central Sta.), the hotel room I had left LOTS to be desired. As a Hilton Honors member, I called a few days before arriving to ensure that a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker were part of the room amenities. I was assured that they were. Unfortunately, upon arriving in my room, nothing I was promised was there. The Hotel said that they would provide these amenities; however, there would be a daily charge for them. After arguing with the desk clerk that a Hilton hotel ought to have such items, the hotel DID finally comp. me for these amenities, however, there was not a lot of space in my hotel room for them. The king bed and side desk took up almost the entire space. And, the bathroom, as others have complained, had no shelf, other than what little space was on the counter where the modern bowl sink was. For anyone with lots of toiletries, you were out of luck for shelf space. The clothes closet reminded me of my parents 1900â€™s built house with small 3â€™X5â€™ closets, again VERY small space. And the room thermometer apparently worked when it wanted to. When I arrived, the room temperature was 72 degrees and the thermostat set to 65 degrees. In order for room temperature to be reduced, I had to open the window, wide, so that the room temperature was more closely related to the thermostat setting. I had latter set the thermostat to 60 degrees to reduce the heat in the room. It didnâ€™t work. Heck of a way to heat/cool the room. The only chair in the room was a desk chair. Spending two weeks in this hotel, it would have been much more comfortable to have some sort of upholstered chair with an ottoman. Course; there was no space for a chair like that in this room either. My Govâ€™t laptop has so much security on it, it would not work in my hotel room. However, if I had wanted to use a computer in my room, the charge would have been $15/day. This really highlights this hotel, they charged for EVERYTHING. If I was spending my own money, I would have stayed at some other hotel, this is an embarrassment for the Hilton chain of hotels. Staying in this hotel for two weeks was a hardship and not comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price.”
Reviews.Author: BigJZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Palmer House for her 30th birthday. It was very nice for the price I paid. The staff was nice and helpful. Rite down the street from Millennium Park and close to shopping. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in the heart of Chicago! Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: gphenom24
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at the Palmer House Hilton over the summer during the Taste of Chicago. It was a belated birthday trip for my gf (and a sneaky engagement plan....she said yes). The Palmer House Hilton was a pleasant surprise. First off that lobby area is immaculate. It's a beautiful lobby area, very classy & upscale. My girlfriend immediately thought I'd laid out big bucks for our weekend stay. Check in was fine. There was a short line, but it moved quickly and our desk clerk was very courteous and we had keys in hand promptly and were off to our room. Also, the baggage check was free after our checkout and we didn't leave until late in the evening (we did tip though). Now we did have one of the smaller rooms, which was a slight disappointment. The setup and decor were excellent. But initially I felt a tad uncomfortable with the lack of open space. I got used to it by the 2nd day, but it's by far the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in. That said, I didn't have to climb over the bed or squeeze in between anything. There's just enough space to do what you need to do. Not much extra. I must say though, the beds and pillows were extremely comfortable. I slept very well. The view from the room was not much to see. All we really could see was the fire-escape. But that wasn't an issue as we spent most of our time there out & about exploring the city. Location was excellent. It's right in the mix of the city. Millennium Park was only a few blocks away and we generally just walked when going to the Taste. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, but walked next door (literally) to Miller's Pub for dinner the night of our arrival. The next morning, we walked less than a block for breakfast (can't remember the name of the place). There were tons of stores & restaurants within a few blocks. A few things to note: parking is very high. I knew this beforehand & chose to fly instead of driving. Mass transit in Chicago is wonderful anyway. Bus or subway will get you anywhere - quickly. Second: the pool costs $$$. But we didn't really have a desire to swim at all during our trip, so didn't affect us. Third: no free wifi. Overall, it's a great place to stay, especially if you find a decent rate like I did. I'd definitely stay there again if I visit Chitown and just cross my fingers that I get one of the larger rooms. Staff was courteous & helpful. Excellent environment.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTraveller999
Reviews.Content: This will be the third time we've states at the palmer house Hilton and i doubt very much that we will ever stay elsewhere in chicago. Though for some reason the place felt a little shabby this time?? The lobby is magnificent but looked like it could do with a spring clean and the room was pleasant albeit a tad basic compared to the last two times. We did have a lovely view from the window though and the location is fantastic and handy for the El train to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Paying customers are a bother to this place.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler40-2011
Reviews.Content: Condescending front desk staff, noisy rude cleaning staff at 5am, restaurant too lazy to bus the tables and was given the wrong order, and overpriced no-frills executive level. No reason to waste your money here when there are so many good options in Chicago. Stayed here twice before and had good experiences but this place has gone down-hill in a hurry. The staff is sorely in need of re-training. Tried to give the hotel a chance to redeem themselves but only got a half-fearted apology for the morning noise. This hotel no longer lives up to its grand reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kennewi-CLE
Reviews.Content: We came to Chicago to attend a Christmas concert (Dave Koz and friends) playing at the Chicago theatre. We flew in from Cleveland to Oâ€™Hare airport, took the â€œELâ€� downtown (stop is about Â¼ from hotel), walked to the hotel, and even though there was a lot of activity, we were able to check in fast and efficiently. We have stayed at the Palmer House before; it is a fine old hotel that has stood up to the test of time. Although there could be some updates (old CRT televisions for one). The room was large and spacious, although we did peak into one room on our way to our room and did find it unusually small. The room was very quite, we had a family of four with two very active kids next door, and when I saw that they were next to us I started to worry as they were full of energy as they were entering their room at the time I went for ice. Once in our room I could barely here them, with the TV off!! One of the staff showed me to the ice room, not only did they point me in the direction, but they took me to the room. The room never got serviced since we put the â€œdo not disturbâ€� sign out after we came from breakfast. We did not have a view from our room, but they have the window coverings designed in such a way that no view is required. I like this hotel and its downtown location which is centralized with everything!! We would defiantly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! A Bucket list visit”
Reviews.Author: Kaikoura
Reviews.Content: What a dream to stay at the elegant Palmer House hotel! We were treated like honored guests! The lobby is to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Palmer House is our new favorite hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fundad1967
Reviews.Content: Ok, based on the reviews we were a little nervouse about staying here. However that all changed as soon as we stepped in the lobby and saw how beautiful it was. Our room was a two double with sitting area and two...yes two closets!!! Our room was huge!!!! We have stayed all over the country and different countries,,, this room was very large and nice!!! We slept great!!! no noise whatsoever...The location is great!!! Walk out the door to state street and bam, there is the Christmas parade!!!! The starbucks is over priced since it is inside the Palmer house, and we did eat at the Lockwood restaurant, very good!!! A little pricey, but what nice hotel restaurant isnt? The service was phenomenal!!!! The only complaint I had was with the concierge...I asked the lady where the lady for directions to the parade, and she just looked at me and said "state street"....uh...I tolde her we weren't from Chicago, so where is state street??? She coldly replied " take the escalater down and turn right, walk out the doors and thats state street...???Like we were supposed to know that since it was our second day at this hotel...I guess she was unhappy about working on Thanksgiving...oh well...Her problem, not ours...They should also have flatscreens in the rooms by now, there was still a huge tube tv in our lovely room, so that was outdated....I wonder if Palmer purchased any flatscreen hd tvs with the 179 Million they spent on renovations?? beside those two quirky things we loved this hotel!!! We will stay here everytime we visit Chicago!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice historib building, lousy experience”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_235711
Reviews.Content: Well, the good things first: The building is nice, the location is perfect, people were friendly. The rest was quite shabby: The room was smallish, no bar, nothing, not even a bottle of water for their esteemed hilton honors member. Internet at horrendous prices. Light switches don't work, one must press about fifteen times to get light. Not too fast, though, otherwise you switch it off directly after one of the precious few times it actually switches on. There is a safe mounted in the closet that makes it impossible to hang pants there. There is a connecting door to the adjacent room that is paper thin, and one can see light through the gap around the door. Naturally, on can also hear the neighbors breathe, or whatever biological function they might be executing. The air con does not work well, the temperature fluctuates between too cold and too hot. The closed window lets in a draft that freezes your feet, should you try to sit at the desk and work without shoes. One vending machine expects you to bring ten quarters for a bottle of mineral water, the other one at least accepts one dollar bills. No change machine, take a hike to the lobby for change if you get thirsty. Stylish, but useless sink in the bathroom: No shelf or desk space for toothbrush etc. In short: There are much better hotels in that price category in Chicago. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent/Friendly Service!”
Reviews.Author: wtrlilys13
Reviews.Content: For our anniversary, my husband and I stayed 3 days 2 nights. Hearing great stories from my grandparents who stayed quite frequently in the 60s-90s, we were very excited. I'm a Hilton Honors member so check in was fast and easy. We stayed on the Executive Floor which is worth the price given all that's included. The service and food from the Lockwood was excellent. We did Tea Time and Dinner with them. Ask for Javier. If you can, buy the Parking package as parking is expensive especially if you're staying more than one night. Locatrion was great. We walked to Michigan avenue for shopping. The room was excellent. We had 2 bathroom and closets which was prefect. The bed was very comfortable. The only issue we had was the sound-proofing as we could occationally hear people above us moving furniture, but it is an older hotel. Overall it was an amazing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: AJH7566
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Palmer House many times and always choose it because of its LOCATION! Easy access to the hotel from the airport via the blue line "L" and the Miracle Mile shopping, restaurants and attractions via the red line "L." The staff are helpful and friendly. Book on the executive floors if possible because the executive lounge is worth it! A GREAT place to hang out, play board games, read, use the computers and printers, plus a nice continental breakfast and snacks all day long! Plus: your own private concierge! FIVE STARS!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Thanksgiving Parade and Michigan Ave Shopping”
Reviews.Author: Gibby74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House to be close to the Thanksgiving Day Parade. In the past we have stayed there and found the rooms very small and some what dated. We soon discovered the hotel when through a $170 million renovation since our last stay. We would rank the hotel with our stay at the Waldorf in New York. Very elegant, but family friendly. The lobby was nice to meet friends and take in the architecture from floor to ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Good location dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: bselerski
Reviews.Content: Good location but the room was a little dated. Staff was helpful. Would think that the room would have at least a coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice stay, but beware thin walls”
Reviews.Author: winpop
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and price is reasonable for downtown Chicago. Being an older hotel, I was prepared for the smaller room size. Bathroom is on the small size. Sink offers no place to place your toiletries. This could have been mitigated by selection of a better sink type for the room. The sink itself actually took up all room. Service was quite good as one would expect from a hotel of this level. Check in was quick and efficient. As others have noted, the hotel does try to nickel and dime you for everything. No coffee maker in the room. For the price, this is acceptable. The only real complaint that I had was that the walls are quite thin. Bring ear plugs as you will definitely need them. The hotel also allows animals, which I simply do not understand. We had two small dogs next door and with the thin walls, it actually sounded as if the animals were in the same room with us. I kept expecting one of the little butt sniffing creatures to poke his nose between my cheeks. Why dog people think everyone is a dog lover, I don't know. At any rate, I did my best impersonation of the witch in the Wizard of Oz ("I'll get you...and your little dog too"). The thin walls actually helped as the creatures shut up for the rest of the night. Beds are quite comfortable. The room comes with a safe, which is always a nice feature. The lobby is quite beautiful. Overall, a nice stay. The thin walls and pet policy prevent this from being a 5.

Reviews.Title: “At the Palmer House you don't need a time machine to travel back in time.”
Reviews.Author: Wonposet
Reviews.Content: Thanksgivingtime is not always the best time to travel. I wasn't surprised when I had difficulty calling the front desk before my arrival to make sure I had the kind of room I wanted. When I stayed on hold for twenty minutes, I looked at tripadvisor reviews and began to worry because there were a few negative reviews. My experience at the hotel, however, demonstrated that there was no foundation in fact for my worries. The hotel exceeded all my expectations. Tatyana at reception listened to all my needs and fulfilled them. I have arthritis and need a large tub in which to soak. I also had three bags and needed adequate closet space. She showed me plans of the rooms and selected one that met my needs. To my surprise without my asking she upgraded me to the executive floor thanks to my Hilton Honors status and discouraged me from selecting a room that had the potential to be noisy because of its location. As I walked through the lobby and looked at the ceiling, I wondered whether Michelangelo or one of his students had painted the ceiling. The lobby itself deserved an hour's tour. The elevator to the executive floors was fast and had a seat! When I arrived in my room, I called for my bags, and within two minutes, Lindell, the bellman brought them to me and welcomed me to this historic hotel by sharing a little of its history. My room was large and immaculately clean. The furniture was in brand new condition though it made me feel that Teddy Roosevelt was going to walk through my door. The bed coverings, upholstery, and carpet might have been the same ones he used in 1901 though they looked brand new. Only the modern television brought me back from my time warp into the 21st Century. A lady from housekeeping told me more about the hotel and welcomed me again and gave me excellent directions. Later I spokewith Ladelle Crawford, who had worked for housekeeping for 14 years. She was as dedicated and knowledgeable as the others whom I encountered. She explained the red and blue line trains, which are both near the hotel entrance. Her information was correct and helpful. Last month when I stayed at another hotel, the concierge gave me the wrong information and added an hour to my trip. Ladelle was better than her competitor's concierge. To be sure, the bathroom was small, but it was clean and adequate. The tub was large and deep. The water was hot and had good pressure. The toilet was next to the tub and near the sink. The size of the bathroom didn't bother me as much as the quality of the cosmetics, which were barely adequate. Soap, shampoo, body wash, and conditioner reminded me of Ivory Soap and didn't compare with the cosmetics at higher level Hilton's such as the Waldorf=Astoria and the Roosevelt in New Orleans. The service at the Palmer House, however, was at least as good as that at the Waldorf=Astoria, and each employee I met acted as if he or she owned the hotel and truly cared about my experience. There is no doubt i will return to the Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: AgentSmithDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Palmer House 3 years ago during renovation and was back again on business. The street level is beautiful, as is the lobby. Lots of convenient bars, shops and restaurants on site. There is much to like about this historic hotel, including personnel who are responsive and pleasant. The fitness room is excellent, and the location is convenient. However, annoying service issues and average furnishings detracted from the stay. First, the service issues. I waited 25 minutes to check in, and I was lucky. The line was twice as long when I finished. They were grossly understaffed on a very busy night - an inexcusable way for a guest to start their stay. The elevators on my wing were unreliable, and I got stuck for 10 minutes one evening. On the way out, I waited 10 minutes for what apparently was the sole functioning elevator to arrive on my floor. My room (a suite) was spacious and well-appointed, but the furnishings were somewhat dated, including TVs that must be 8-10 years old. I was alone, which was fortunate, because the bath was tiny. (Conversely, there was a nice walk-in closet) I am sure this has to do with the age of the property, but given the size of the suite, I would have expected something more contemporary. Be advised that one side of the hotel faces the elevated rail.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms: Dirty, Loud, and Tiny”
Reviews.Author: Ipilly
Reviews.Content: The best way to experience the Palmer House is after visiting Grant Park or the Art Institute walk the block and a half and enjoy a drink in the stunning, beautifully restored lobby. It's a wonderful experience in a grand institution of Chicago. When you're finished with your drink, leave. Nothing good comes after that. As older hotels are prone to do, the Palmer House has small rooms. How small? I've literally stayed in hotels that have larger closets than the rooms in the Palmer House. But small rooms aren't always bad. As a solo business traveler, I really don't need a suite. But the layout and functionality of my queen bed room (King wouldn't fit) was poor. The ancient CRT TV took up about 20% of the available room space. I've seen larger bathrooms on cruise ships. I could honestly have brushed my teeth while sitting on the toilet. And to reach the toilet paper requires a Cirque du Solel contortion act. But what has me rating the Palmer House as 2 stars is the fact that the room was loud (the walls are paper thin) and was apparently cleaned in the dark. After two cleanings there was still rubbish from the previous guest on the floor. Hair that obviously didn't belong to me was in the bathtub, and a hand towel soiled with make-up from a previous guest remained in the room even after I set it on the floor to be replaced. I mentioned this to the front desk and they sent someone up to "re-clean" the room. While someone did come-up, they still didn't do things like replace the previous guest's hand towel, etc. The wallpaper was torn on the wall and the desk was obviously damaged (missing pieces). I asked four times to have the ethernet cable replaced in my room because the clip was broken so every time I moved my computer I lost internet connection, and they never replaced it. All completely unacceptable. As a Hilton Diamond member I received free internet (which I couldn't use because of the cable) and access to the Executive Lounge. The Concierge in the lounge was probably the grumpiest person I've ever encountered. I asked her about recommending a supper venue for myself and three other colleagues and she barked at me, providing no valuable assistance. The lounge itself is good to grab a cup of coffee (none in the rooms), but unless you like mini croissants the "breakfast" is worthless. No upgrade was offered (as per the terms of the Hilton HHonors program), despite the hotel selling higher class rooms on their website for the exact length of stay I was there. I filed a complaint with Hilton regarding the condition of my room at the Palmer House and an Assistance Housekeeping Supervisor called to apologize and offered a free room for a future stay. While I'd normally appreciate the gesture I will never stay at the Palmer House again. The rooms are tiny, dirty, and loud. The staff, for the most part, treats guests like inconveniences. Even a free room at the Palmer House is a lousy value. Avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: rita0327
Reviews.Content: Ugh. We got a deal on priceline but it was still very expensive for one night. The room was large, but my husband and I had the choice of 1 single bed (huh??) or 2 doubles. Not the best when you are celebrating an anniversary. No coffee maker or minibar in the room, and for that price, very disappointing. Little things (soap dish) were broken in the room also. The fitness center closed at 7 pm Saturday, which is exactly when I wanted to go. The place was very clean and the check in staff were nice. Too little, too late.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, a trip back in time”
Reviews.Author: tmglover
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is what I love about Chicago - historic charm, but with all the modern amenities and world class service. Staying at the Palmer House is like an event - it's memorable, not routine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent staff and service.”
Reviews.Author: joeguerra
Reviews.Content: Hotel at great location: close to State Street and Michigan Avenue for shopping, restaurants, Willlis Tower (Sears Bldg) theatre, parks, library, Chicago Art Institute, Millennium Park, Buckingham Fountain, shoreline walks, all within 2-3 blocks. Friendly staff and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Last Stay there was not as it has been in the last 2 yrs.”
Reviews.Author: MQTMorningStar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is almost always very helpful. This stay caused me to re-think if I like the Palmer House. I had dirty covers for the bed. It was also the smallest room in the hotel I am sure. My husband and I usually come 8 times each year. He is there doing Business and CTA work. We are not pleased with the size of the room at all now. Rooms have always had two chairs, desk, and usually 22 by 25 feet. Not this room on the 11th floor. It was only 15 X 17 approx. The service men at the doors have always said a welcome but not this time. In the past we had a bell man steal a $300. pair of sun glasses and the hotel did nothing about our loss financially.

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GogoSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in October while I was attending a conference, and enjoyed the experience very much. I had booked a pretty cheap rate (it was under $200) and after reading on here that some of the rooms were quite small, I decided to try for the e-upgrade that the Hilton offers in their email confirmations. The one I ended up with was on one of the two executive level floors, and I paid $35.00 a night for the upgrade, which I believe was well worth it. When I checked in I was a little taken aback by the long check-in line, but it moved very quickly. The person checking me in didn't mention my e-upgrade request, so I asked about it and he checked around and found me a room on the 22nd floor. I liked staying on the executive level. It had dedicated elevators, and what elevators they were! They were very old-fashioned, and had an upholstered leather bench to sit on in case you got weary on your ride up. My room itself was very good-sized, it had two double beds and a sitting area with a TV and a comfortable but very worn easy chair, a chair and desk and two tiny bathrooms. I have to say though, I literally laughed out loud when I walked in the room because the interior design was so old-fashioned. The beds were covered with elaborate, tapestry-like covers and the elaborate draperies looked like they came from Marie Antoinette's boudoir. I did check out the hospitality suite on the 23rd floor that was for the executive level guests one night, and it was quite impressive. They had a full bar (non-alcoholic drinks are complimentary) and an amazing spread of hot and cold snacks, including things like cheese and crackers, eggrolls, hummis, etc. I ordered room service a few times and it always came around the time they said it would. I would say the room-service food at this hotel was a cut-above the fare you usually get at this type of hotel. My favorite part of staying here was the lobby, it was just breathtaking, and I don't think I ever walked through it without a big smile on my face. I had lunch in the restaurant just off the lobby one day and really enjoyed it. This hotel seems to be the hub of a lot of activity in Chicago. One day I walked outside to see a huge police presence, and found out that former President Clinton was speaking at a fundraiser at the hotel that day. I later passed the concierge desk and overheard the concierge assisting a guest with getting tickets to an event the First Lady was holding there in the future. Overall I fully enjoyed staying here, but it's not for everyone. I can think of a few close friends who I would never recommend this place to, because they prefer modern W-type hotels. But if you like grand old places, give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Simbathebigpoodle
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the Palmer House. It is a great location. My room was extremely small, but I got it through priceline.com for $100/night. The room was a bit noisy. If I had paid the regular rate, it would have been too much. The hot water pressure was bad; the staff sent engineering to fix it, but even then it was still low pressure. The staff was nice. For my $100, I thought it was a good deal. I would stay there again. It is full of history and beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Very Interesting and Historical.”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Iris_SP
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are comfortable and the social area very impressing, I wouldn't recommend this hotel because I think that having to pay for breakfast and internet in an Hotel rated above USD 200 per night is unacceptable. Anyway, if you think the price is good and like old fashion styled places, then you should certainly stay there. One more thing, the room acoustics isn't very good... as I would always arrive quite tired, that wasn't a problem for me but could be if you have trouble sleeping. If you are by car, you won't find a place close to the hotel charging less than USD 29.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous fall weekend in the city!”
Reviews.Author: shoegirl96
Reviews.Content: My family & I enjoyed our stay at your hotel this past weekend. The location was perfect for us. We spent time shopping on Michigan Avenue and State Street. We loved that Fileneâ€™s Basement was located a few blocks from the hotel. Our weekend was perfect from beginning to end. In fact we are planning a spring trip to downtown Chicago and will choose the Palmer House Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, best location in the city”
Reviews.Author: tifgmu2003
Reviews.Content: My mother and I decided to do a long weekend in Chicago to meet some friends. We had a great time, and in no small part to our lavish hotel. Obviously from my pictures and from previous pictures, the lobby is gorgeous. We enjoyed some wine (albeit expensive) at the lobby bar to take in the scene before dinner. I reserved our room via hotwire.com for only $90 a night! Though that means I was not surprised that when we arrived, the only room available to us was single double bed room. Well, that wasnâ€™t going to work. Sensing my distress over a girlsâ€™ weekend off to a rocky start, the man checking us in offered us an upgrade to the executive level for $50 more a night. WHAT A DEAL: we had two double beds, TWO bathrooms and of course the amenities of that level, which included breakfast, snacks, and appetizers at happy hour. Our view was of another side of the hotel, so nothing to brag about, but the room was still nice. It was large, the beds were new as they were the soft, plush kind that I like (despite the dÃ©cor still being â€˜classicâ€™ unlike the more modern remodeled rooms). The bathrooms were standard sized and nicely appointed. No complaints about the room other than poor insulation; I could hear our neighbor turn on the shower at 6 am and start hocking up loogiesâ€¦.ew, I know, but luckily that was the only incident. The breakfast was the best part of the exec level in my opinion. Oh and it was wonderful that my mom and I each had our own private bathrooms on either side of the room. The staff was friendly and trying very hard to keep up with the replenishing coffee, pastries, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, juices, cereal, etc. Since we always had dinner plans set, we didnâ€™t indulge in the wonderful-looking appetizers that were out for the 5-7 happy hour. Drinks not included. I saw one review way back that complained about bed bugs, so needless to say, I was worried about it. I checked the sheets for any tiny spots of blood (a tip recommended to me by a fellow traveler) and saw no such stains. And I can say with confidence that we were not bitten once so therefore there were no bugs on the 23rd floor, room 211. The hotel was in the best possible location and we walked everywhere. All in all, staying here was a wild success for our long weekend enjoying this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Landmark Hotel, Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: OZinOC
Reviews.Content: Once you ascend the steps or escalator to this grand old hotel the ceiling of the foyer will take your breath away. Our check in could not be faulted. The hotel is large, so be prepared to walk a long way to your room if you are at the end of one of the corridors. The hotel was busy the weekend we were there - but we did not have any issues with elevators or noise. The service in the lobby bar and room service was mixed - more wrong deliveries than right with our drink orders. We had a King Suite - which had a very large sitting room, separate (smaller) bedroom, and small (one basin no vanity space) renovated bathroom. Beautifully decorated and cleaned. The location of this hotel is fabulous within walking distance of Michigan Ave, State Street, Grant Park and the Lake Front. We had a wonderful time here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Postage stamp size rooms”
Reviews.Author: CMXC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, and has a nice lobby, but the rooms are extremely small. The door hit the bed as I entered, and it took me a moment to find the hidden bathroom. I had to keep my TV on to muffle the hallway noise. I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Night of Sleep in a long time”
Reviews.Author: RLOPkgQueen
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous elegant hotel. I felt like I was in one of the finer hotels in Europe. My room was so spacious I could have held a dance in there. The bed was extremely comfortable and I slept fabulously. I had an issue with the internet connection and they sent a technician up right away and got it squared away. I loved that there was a Starbucks in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: InLove46383
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night in one of the suites to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Never have we felt more special than at this hotel. The main room measured about 50 by 20 and included a wet bar. Talk about space--there were two bathrooms and four closets! From the moment we checked in, every single member of the staff went out of their way to make our stay there the best. And it was.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ideal for few days stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: avisanddavid
Reviews.Content: This hotel proved a real winner with me and my 25 year old daughter. The room was huge with 2 double beds, beautiful decor throughout. Reception was friendly and helpful with directions and ideas for our stay. Restaurant good , breakfast was excellent order the American Breakfast and you can literally eat as much as you can . Cannot wait to return and this time will make full use of the swimming pool as well . Big thank you to all the staff. Whilst in Chicago get the open top bus tour , hop on and off for a set price - great way to see the City . Visit the Millenium Park and see the Bean - have the camera angled correctly and you will get some brilliant shots.

Reviews.Title: “Better be ok with nickel & diming!”
Reviews.Author: NC1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beyootiful. Lovely rooms, lovely lobby. We enjoyed the luxury of this place, for sure, though you should be ready to hear the ELs go by at night and early morning. Here's the thing: they charge you for everything. For instance, there's no coffee in the room. You have to choose between a Starbucks at street level or expensive room service. I talked with a man who had worked in the mailroom there and you have to pay for them to hand your mail from the postman to you. Local phone calls begin at $1.50 and are .50 a minute after that, or something like that. Wireless or in-room internet access is another charge. (If you fly Southwest, you can access the business center and print your boarding pass for free.) For the kind of rack rates they charge, you'd think the Palmer House would throw in some things that are standard and free in other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Hilton hotel! 3*at most”
Reviews.Author: Fidelino
Reviews.Content: The lobby is impressive but the room we stayed in was dreadful. Old, dark, weirdly decorated... not what youd expect from a Hilton. The location is convenient, but there are far better hotels nearby for this price.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: trek58
Reviews.Content: I attended a business meeting held at the hotel and had extended my stay by two days to see the sites with my wife . I observed the operation both from attending a conference as well as just two folks staying at the facility. I would rate the overall service, quality of the food,and appearance a reflection of the staff at all levels which i found to be sincere and appreciative.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: none17
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I were travelling to a trade show in Chicago but didn't want to break the bank on accommodations. In this way the Palmer House was the perfect solution, as many of their rooms have two queen beds, and two bathrooms. Our room was clean, quiet and well appointed for two people who spent most of our time out in the city. The lobby is truly lovely - a great place to have a drink at the end of the day. The concierge was helpful in getting us restaurant reservations during a busy time. The location is perfect not only for walking to surrounding shops and restaurants, but for hopping on the El train to get to other parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful classic hotel! Relive the grandeur of old!”
Reviews.Author: Calif0rnia_traveller
Reviews.Content: While we had some concerns based on other reviews, the appeal of staying at a classic historical treasure won out. And we weren't disappointed! If you stay here, make sure you slow down and take a moment to enjoy the beauty. The most obvious is the main lobby with the gorgeous mural on the ceiling. But all around you are smaller, more subtle works of art - various statutes, paintings, ornate fixtures, and ornate trim all over the place, inside and out. We had a room on the top floor with a private elevator that only went to the top 2 floors (and the fitness center, I believe). So there were no long lines and not stops at all 23 floors. Our room on the executive level had two beds, two bathrooms and was very large. Everything was in great condition and clean. Even the rooms had touches of elegance - pay attention to the details everywhere, even on the lamps. We did not hear any noise from neighboring rooms at all. The executive lounge was above average for a Hilton. Don't miss the original recipe brownie created right here at the Palmer House for dessert! While the hotel has been completely renovated, if you want a super-modern experience, go someplace else. But if you want to experience history in luxurious (for the day) setting, with all the modern conveniences thrown in - this is the place! Make sure you check out the hotel's website (not the Hilton one) to get the history before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service”
Reviews.Author: skates26
Reviews.Content: Had a bad experience - would not stay here again. The staff at the reception desk were cold and rude, room was unbelievably small, hairdryer did not work in room, and walls were paper thin. In addition, we received apathetic and rude treatment from a staff member at the luggage room when dropping our bags off for the day after checkout. To top it off, a charge for the hotel bar mysteriously appeared on my checkout bill when neither me or my traveling companion went there. In the end, the charge was taken off but it took about 30 minutes to do so. There are many, many hotels in downtown Chicago which are much better than the Palmer House. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nickled and Dimed To Death”
Reviews.Author: Chicago60603
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Palmer House with over a hundred extended family members for a wedding which was also held at Palmer House. There were well over 100 in our party. The hotel is quiet beautiful and our double beds room was large and very nice. Family members in king rooms were shocked at the tinyness of their rooms and all those in interior rooms facing walls were disapointed by the "small dark feeling of the rooms." Requested a late checkout (12:30 rather that 11:00.) Was told, "No." The manager was rude and unhelpful. Finally agreed begrudgingly to let us stay for a $25 fee which we would have been happy to pay if given the option in the first place. $10 fee to use workout room $20 fee for internet unless you'd like "slow" internet for $16. $200 deposit for wireless apparatus. ridiculous. The attitude was "take it or leave it, babe." No feeling of warmth or interest except by the housekeeping staff who were friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it: location, posh lobby, nice room but teeeeny bed.”
Reviews.Author: bl0s5m
Reviews.Content: To revert several years in age: omg, this hotel was amazing + I loved it, it was perfect for my sister & me. The only thing I wish I could change was the size of the bed -- a double? A full? Whichever is smaller. And the room itself was quite compact, particularly when compared to the huge + spacious suite that my family friends (one of whom was running the marathon that weekend) had received. But I still think our beds may have been the same size :D I also felt just plain lucky to have scored a room the weekend of the marathon. There were *tons* of marathoners who had booked here too (I'm guessing from our check in!), and frankly, I had simply lucked into getting this room through Priceline the night before we left for Chicago. (In a nutshell: I was super pumped about the great deal I'd gotten with Days Inn Chicago, which I'd picked after all the TripAdvisor recs. But after mapping out that location, compared to the PHH location, especially given the proximity to the attractions we were interested in -- our walking pizza tour, shopping, the Mag Mile, other attractions all accessible by a short short subway/metro ride -- I just had to see if I could match my Days Inn deal through Priceline. And it worked! Nuts!) But back to PHH: the staff was so friendly -- both check-in and housekeeping. The check-in was apologetic they couldn't offer anything larger or with two beds, but I was certain I wanted non-smoking and that room was all they had. The lobby was *gorgeous*. There are 3 elevator banks that go to certain floors, so they went pretty speedily. The room---again, while small--was very neat and tidy; the toiletries were nice; great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The grand old Palmer House still has charm”
Reviews.Author: codysmomnow
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago recently for a convention and stayed at the Palmer House. It was still a very nice hotel. I had stayed there many years ago. The rooms have been recently renovated so they seemed more modern. The lobby area is a relaxing place to sit and have a drink from the Lobby Bar. The ceiling of the lobby is a beautiful piece of art. The staff seemed friendly. I did not have any problem while staying there. The rooms are a bit pricey. I would stay there again for a business trip. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, really beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeye35
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were driving across country to attend a friends wedding and we decided to stop here for a night as neither of us had ever been to Chicago. I can't speak on the price of the rooms as our reservations were made as a gift for us by family but I must tell you, this hotel is wonderful! We drove from Connecticut and arrived at the Palmer House right after check in time had begun. I can tell you, after driving for 17 hours straight, we looked a fright, but the staff never blinked an eye or treated us as if we were out of place. Everyone from the valet to the bellman to the front desk attendant was professional and kind and made us feel welcome before we even checked in. The hotel is within walking distance of a number of shopping centers and restaurants and only a few blocks from the famous "Bean" in Millenium Park. There were two restaurants at the hotel which had menu items we'd heard of but after reading the descriptions, felt all of the recipes were "trendy" and "obscure" and in all honesty a little intimidating-designed for people with a very broad palette and for the prices, my fiance and I were not about to try out anything we weren't sure we would recognize let alone enjoy so we ate outside the hotel. The rooms themselves are a standard size and the bathroom, while a little small (it was a squeeze to have two people in there at the same time) was very clean and beautifully decorated. We were on the 20th floor and could hear the subway (which ran right beside the hotel) from our rooms which I'm sure would bother some folks, but we found the distant hum to be quiet plesant and soothing. I would definitely recomment this hotel to anyone looking to spend and night or two in the area. The rooms did not have mini fridges or microwaves and the price for connecting to the internet is quiet high so I wouldn't recommend it for a lengthy stay, but if you have the chance to stay a night here, do so, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, paper thin walls, upgraded room big, regular rooms tiny”
Reviews.Author: Southside
Reviews.Content: Just got back from four nights at the hotel, tagging along with my wife who was staying at the hotel while attending a convention in town. As indicated by the title of my review, it was a very mixed experience. The bottom line is that because of the very thin walls I wouldn't go back there, though otherwise it was a pleasant stay. On the positive side: 1. Since I am a Hilton Diamond, we were upgraded to a very large, comfortable room on one of the top floors. 2. Especially since this is such a huge hotel (1700 rooms?), the service was very good, starting with check-in and including almost all other interactions. Picking up the phone to get room service, housekeeping, etc., I rarely had to wait at all to speak to someone and even if I did wait it was quite brief. And everyone I dealt with was helpful, efficient and polite. 3. Decent lounge and minimally adequate buffet breakfast spread upstairs. 4. Very large, well equipped fitness center. 5. The hotel seemed to offer a pretty good suite upgrade deal to Hilton members, of about $90 (including tax) to get into a very large suite of about 1,000 square feet. It wasn't available when we were there since the hotel was full. But good to know about for less busy times. 6. Easy phone check-out system On the negative side: 1. Perhaps the thinnest walls I've ever seen...or really, heard! We could very clearly hear the televisions and conversations from the adjoining rooms on both sides of us. And it did not sound like the folks next door were shouting or being excessively noisy. My wife, who is a very sound sleeper, had to put in ear plugs. I would have thought that such an old, classic hotel would have had more solid walls than usual, but that was not the case. I did notice that there were doors connecting our room to those on either side of us, so perhaps that accounted for the noise. But I don't know if our room was unusual in that respect. 2. While our room was fine, my wife's colleagues reported that the regular rooms were tiny. 3. For those who love views, most rooms here just look out on interior courtyards; and some (as other reviews have noted) overlook the noisy elevated train line. 4. Even though I'd requested it in advance, I only got the nice upgrade when requesting it upon check-in. Kudos to the nice reception agent for putting us into it, but my point is that the Hilton automatic upgrade system for available rooms was not so automatic.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: navellar
Reviews.Content: Impressive entrance on Monroe St. and stunning lobby. Building is listed on the National Register. Service is sorely lacking. No doorman at door to offer help with luggage, waited in line to check in, then a further wait while staff tried to locate a room for me. I have had a confirmed reservation for over 6 weeks so delay in assigning room was inexplicable. Room itself was commodious and included 2 very small bathrooms. Appointments were attractive, but not recent or fresh. No in-room coffee pot, refrigerator, or free internet connection. Service in the bar was non-existent. Sat at a dirty table for several minutes, complained to hostess, returned to same dirty table for several more minutes and finally left. Concierge was very helpful but, again, had to stand in line to get service. Hotel rules state that all but one ground floor door closes at 9:00 pm. Not true. Street people lounging in elevator lobby several times during my stay. Room not tended until late afternoon. Disturbed by noise in next door room; however, beds and pillows were very comfortable. All in all, the approximately $450 per day room rate was excessive for the service received. This hotel seems to be most successful at providing large blocks of rooms to conventioneers who let somebody else pay the bill. Will look for other accomodations next time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, versatile, great location!”
Reviews.Author: DrSkater
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. Our room was exceptionally neat and comfortable and also spacious and quiet. We loved the convenience of the bars and restaurants and had so much fun just exploring this magnificant space. The location is next to the Art Institute and Crown Fountain. It is not a budget hotel, but you get so much for what you pay for--a total package.

Reviews.Title: “Still Dumpy After All These Years”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: I looked forward to staying here after hearing the renovation was finally finished. I was wrong! The room was hardly big enough for the bed, the thermostat and light switch were actually behind the television set - that's how small it was. And it is loud as ever - the sound of plumbing from other rooms in our little cell was deafening, drunks roaming the halls sounded like they were screaming in our room, and we had some traffic noise. The old school, Shining-set charm just doesn't make up for this nonsense. There are much nicer, better built places to stay nearby for the price. Stop by the Palmer lobby for a drink and spend the night elsewhere. Enjoy Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the haters...still a high quality great experience”
Reviews.Author: JFKforinternational
Reviews.Content: A lot of people told me that the hotel has seen better days...that the lobby is still greqwt but the rooms will be old, maybe stuffy. i got treated incredibly well at check-in. Even though there were ten people in line, the had 5 or 6 agents on it and I was done in 10 minutes. I got the King bed i had asked for, on a high floor with a sweet view...and i don't have status there. Forgot my too brush...got one to me in 10 minutes. Great service to get cab, etc. And just friendly, service oriented people. It's no W, but i find the uber-hip hotels aren't functional for work...I'd rather have a hotel with all of the luxuries i like--good Crabtree and Evelyn shampoo, etc. I have to say that i was just pleasantly surprised at how pleasantly surprised my experience there was. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ambient, nice, best location but I wouldn't call it family oriented”
Reviews.Author: tupes92
Reviews.Content: Stepping into this hotel is like stepping back into the 1930s. The decor, the atmosphere, the music played overhead and even down the hallways that take you to your room. The rooms are the same way. One of the things about older hotels like this one is that rooms vary greatly in size and decor. It isn't all uniform like newer places. We had very nice and very clean rooms (the hotel itself was very clean). The only signs of aging that I saw were the closet and bathroom doors. We had 2 rooms that were joined by a door-one was a 2 double and 1 was a king. Warning: the large KIng is equal to your standard King anywhere else. The hotel's "standard" is a CLOSET(we happen to walk by one that they were cleaning)! The 2 doubles room, however, was a pretty good size with a sitting area. It seemed quiet as far as not hearing other guests so the walls didn't seem thin. If you book, definitely request a higher up room. We stayed on the 9th floor and we could hear everything outside! FYI there is an L train station literally right outside the hotel so if you stay on a lower floor-bring ear plugs! It goes by often. or request a room on the other side of the building. Great location otherwise-you couldn't do better. There's a CVS and walgreens on the same block for forgotten items, a starbucks in the hotel. It's right in the heart of downtown where everything seems to be in walking distance or a short cab ride away. 8 to 10 min walk to the water tower. We also took an $8 cab ride (that includes tip) to the mall where the lego store is. Countless shops around this area. No free breakfast here, just to let you know and to rent a fridge i think is $30 and a microwave is $40! Also you have to pay to use the fitness center but not the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for 4th of July Fireworks”
Reviews.Author: MI_TRVLERS
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Palmer House for the fireworks. The location is great! The staff very friendly. Overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: angela7p
Reviews.Content: Hotel was wonderful and staff very friendly! We are putting it on our list for a place to get married at as the hotel was gorgeous and within walking distance of everything that Chicago has to offer! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite hotel located in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JoAnn70820
Reviews.Content: Our room was HUGE and we had TWO full baths. With our Hilton Honors status we received free breakfast (contintal.) and afternoon snacks in the Executive Lounge. The breakfast was especially nice. This is a very old hotel with a fabulous lobby. The only disadvantage was the constant noise from the elevated trains. I always bring a white noise machine when I travel so this was not a problem for us. We were on the 19th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Visit The Palmer House in the Spring”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraBurlington_WI
Reviews.Content: Chicago is in FULL BLOOM in April with tulips everywhere. Be sure to visit Michigain Ave. with millions of tulips blooming in the median. The Palmer House was dazzling with displays of Pink Tulips EVERYWHERE. Huge floral displays in the Grand Entry. WHAT A SIGHT ! Bring your camera.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarlosTCuracao
Reviews.Content: This a great old Hotel with a nice history. it's my second visit here and will be back soon. Everything is close, almost walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pjdcrupi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palmer House recently for a weekend get together with friends. Had stayed there many years ago and remembered it as being quite grand. The lobby is lovely, a throw back to a different time. The bar is in the lobby area but seating is limited. As we were in a bit of a hurry in the mornings we went next door to the Corner Bakery for a relatively inexpensive and quick breakfast with very good coffee. There is also a Starbucks in the lower level of the hotel but it is usually quite crowded. The hotel restaurant is available but a bit pricey. The location of the hotel is a block off of Michigan Avenue across from Millenium Park near a number of nice bars and restaurants. The rooms were very nice, well decorated and clean. We asked for larger, recently updated rooms which the front desk accommodated. Our friends had a room on the same side as the elevated train and found it to be noisy so, if this is a concern, you might want to mention this when booking. The bathrooms are small but well appointed. Overall, a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag - depends on what room you are in”
Reviews.Author: jod3303
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights during Lollapalooza in August 10, we were upgraded on the second night and that was a real plus. The first room was supposed to be a double room, but it had possibly the smallest bed I had ever seen in my life for two people. The room layout was ok but our friends that we were staying with had a similar room, same size bed but the layout of the room was so poor you couldnt even even walk past in each without bumping into one another. The second night we asked if they had a room with a larger bed, it didnt even have to be a bigger room, just a larger bed !!!. The lady at reception was very helpful and advised that the only room available were held for gold card members, our friend was actually a gold card holder and so we were both upgraded - we dont know why they didnt do this on the first night- that was a bit of a mystery !!!. Anyway the second room was wonderful, large spacious bed, nice linens and drapes, great bathroom and even a fireplace in the bedroom... we were givem complimentary breakfast and appetizers in the afternoon, what a difference a day makes !!!. The hotel is stunning inside, very good location to Lollapalooza at Grant Park and i would recommend it, just ask for a room with a large bed !!

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get much better than this!”
Reviews.Author: dad03
Reviews.Content: This was an overnight trip to Chicago to meet family coming into town by train. From the front door all the way to our room the staff was friendly, helpful, and unobtrusive. At check in we were offered a room upgrade which we accepted and are glad that we did. While I'm sure that the room we originally booked was just as nice, the room on the Concierge floor included several nice additions making the stay all the better. We needed a recommendation for dinner within walking distance that could accommodate food allergies and the Concierge staff came up with a great suggestion that fit our needs perfectly. Elegant in the tradition of early 19th century architecture, yet comfortable and up to date. Convenient to theater, shopping, parks and the Art Institute of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: starnight05
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful, only able to stay one night at the Palmer House but would have loved to stay the week. We had gorgeous views of state street and the city. Will not stay any where else the next time I visit Chicago. Service was excellent, we were definitely treated like we were the only guests at the hotel. HIghly recommened, the Palmer House will not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “They listen to the customer!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FranklinsFresno
Reviews.Content: We were at the Palmer House Hilton on a business trip for 6 nights. We were assigned a lovely room, however it was very small. My wife went to ask was that normal size of the Hilton Honors room and with no hesitation; I had "Armonde's" complete attention.
