He understood the problem, and then proceeds to fix it by placing us in a much larger room. I felt like he knew we were going to be there for 6 nights and it could become very uncomfortable for us. He further indicated that if we were not happy with the new room to let him know. Then he took the time to write a personal note to us offering further assistance if needed. We needed no further assistance. Wonderful location and close to lots of shopping and restaurants. We could hear the train outside, but there was no stop there, so it became white noise. Great housekeeping service also.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else... Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoanneM05
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, have been for the past 5 years and I am booked again for December. You can walk Chicago from this hotel, Macys is a stones throw along with the many shops State street has to offer. Love that you can drop bags back and go off again after a lovely Baileys on ice in the lobby. Can't recommend this hotel enough, family and friends and they all loved it too....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bozo700
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a 2-night weekend in September with extended family. We all agreed the hotel was very nice. The Priceline deal made it all that much better. The rooms were clean, a little small, but not out of the ordinary for a bigger city hotel. I am still surprised to see older tv's in upper tier hotels such as this. The standard tv was fine, but hotels of this caliber should have HDTVs in all rooms by now. It would have been nice to watch some of the football on HD. Everything else was great. The staff here are likely some of the best I've ever encountered. There was a genuine quality about the staff that is hard to find. The concierge helped with directions, getting as detailed on how to get somewhere from where I was exactly standing. There is a Starbucks right by the elevator, but strangely my entire group all thought our drinks tasted "weak" and "different." They made mine twice but it still tasted off. Our group visited other Starbucks locations that weekend and the drinks tasted normal, so we aren't sure what was going on at the hotel Starbucks. The pool was closed when we went to look at it, but I heard it is nice. The king bed was fine, not fantastic but comfortable. I know bed bugs are exploding all over the country so it's hard to "blame" a hotel for it, but I did find one or two bumps on my legs after staying there. I'm not saying it was because of bed bugs at this hotel, but I'm also not sure where they came from. Our room was located on the inner side of the hotel (not facing a street-side) so we didn't have any problems with road or city noise at all. In fact, I don't recall hearing any neighboring rooms either. The windows opened slightly which was nice during the cool day. Bathroom amenities were great and the shower was warm. There was no exhaust fan in the bathroom. You can't beat the location. If you can do without a car I would recommend it. Parking across the street is $38 per day. The trains make everything we did incredibly accessible. My sister came from Midway Airport on a straight-shot, 35-minute train ride. We also went to Wrigley Field on a straight-shot train ride as well. Miller's Pub is a great place to catch a bite and beer right next to the hotel. I would definitely stay there again if I had the means to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: pdavis1
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great lobby, great rooms. Me and two other friends came to Chicago for a girls trip. We wanted to stay somewhere where we would feel safe. We LOVED our room. We opted to spend a little extra and got the extra size room w/ two bathrooms. Well worth the extra $50 each of us spent on the trip. Staff was amazing and the room was very accomodating. The beds are very comfortable and the sheets and pillows passed by "sheet snob" standards. All in all, a great hotel. I would recommend friends staying here and, above all else, I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected and immediately saw pictures of bed bugs on their website when I got here.”
Reviews.Author: tribs12
Reviews.Content: Beautfiul lobby. I give that 5 stars.....otherwise, our check in was terrible, nothing we requested....the rooms are very small AND I had recently heard about the bedbug situation and when I came to this site, the first thing I saw were pictures of bedbug bites. I called to make sure my room didn't have any, I kind of got the run around and am still not sure. Being I called and checked with them specifically, I am going to be way more upset if they lied to me. Concierge was very informative, she also get's 5 stars, the rest, I'd pass on as far as my first day here. I will update if things got any better. Mind you, this was an executive level room. See pictures.

Reviews.Title: “The stay was awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fashion007
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 55th wedding anniversary - which is where we spent our honeymoon. Everyone from the maintance man to the General Manager was so friendly. Ken Price was wonderful in making the arrangements for us. We have stayed in many hotels but there is only one Palmer House. Happy 140th birthday. Patty & Lew Stiff - Mattoon, Il

Reviews.Title: “Tale of two hotels”
Reviews.Author: ABZ_James
Reviews.Content: We were there for a wedding and were party of a large party that all booked into this hotel. After 5 days there I feel that this hotel has two sides and the owners should address this. It has a fantastic hotel lobby and public areas, full of history and grandeur. Very impressive. However, thatâ€™s where the grandeur ends. Some of our friends had the newly renovated rooms which were nicely decorated but extremely small, and I mean small, barely enough room to walk either side of the bed. We were in a room that had not been renovated but it was fine, nothing spectacular but functional and clean, reminiscent of a generic airport hotel. It was a lot larger than our friendâ€™s rooms and much more in line with what we expected. If you are staying here, request a larger room, I donâ€™t think there is a price difference and youâ€™ll be much happier. As for location, it cannot be topped, close to everything and within easy walking distance of the subway, â€˜Lâ€™ train, lake front parks and the Sears tower. Hotel staff were excellent, very efficient, helpful and welcoming. All in all, this hotel offers good value for money, but I think that there is a gap between the standard of the lobby and public areas and the rooms that needs to be closed in.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out....Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: ieduca8
Reviews.Content: Chicago is Number 5 in bed bug problems and I personally found out why. On August 4, 2010 I stayed at the Palmer House Hilton for one night after seeing the play "Billy Elliott". I stayed in Room 13-120. I went to bed ~ 11 PM and when I woke up at 6 AM that morning, I was surprised to find my upper torso and my left arm and hand covered in bites. Since I live within 40 miles of the Hilton, I went to my doctor to check the bites. Imagine my surprise when I was told they were bed bug bites! I contacted the hotel so they could immediately have the room exterminated and I was put through "hotel hell". After over 35 minutes, I was told I must speak to security and file an incident report. I spoke to Lucien Muntean, head of security, and he assured me the room would be vacated and an exterminator would immediately check out the room. I emailed Lucien several days later to ask what the exterminator discovered and never heard back from him. 2 weeks later, another head of security, Ishawa Stephens, returned my email and said he would file my incident report. When I asked him what the exterminator report stated, he said it wasn't done until August 14th, and "no bed bug activity was observed"! Ishawa could not explain to me why it took 10 days to have an exterminator check out the room and he apologized for the poor follow-through by Hilton. He knew by the photos I sent him that I definitely had numerous bites all over me. He said he would file the incident report with the Hilton management and I would hear back from them within 3-4 days. That was on Sept. 2, 2010 and I still have not had any follow-through from either Ishawa or Hilton management. I have been put through the discomfort of severe itching , as well as the worry that I could infect my own home with bed bugs traveling back home with me from the Hilton. Needless to say, I have had many a sleepless night over that! It's a shame the Hilton cares little about their guests. It really is a great hotel location and the room was beautiful, but the bed bugs and management mis-treatment is difficult to overlook.

Reviews.Title: “Kept expecting Bette Davis to walk by”
Reviews.Author: cxg2
Reviews.Content: When I first walked in at street level I was a bit skeptical--right up against the L, marquis lights at entrance, bustling, and then an escalator to the lobby--but holy toledo! The ceiling is many stories high and painted with murals like a cathedral somewhere in Europe. The lobby is dark, with marble and velvet everywhere, 20's or 30's feeling...and crowded and busy...I felt like I was in Vegas for some reason. The front desk service was great, I even had an apple while checking in, and my room, renovated on the 19th floor was lovely...fresh, clean, large, with two big windows so lots of light. The elevators were a bit slow but fun, and dessert and a drink in the lobby was quite delightful. I'm not sure I would stay again, I prefer smaller boutique hotels, but I had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the loop”
Reviews.Author: Tswords
Reviews.Content: I stayed Labor Day weekend with my family. We liked staying in a hotel that is a throwback to the glamorous days of grand hotels. We arrived early in Chicago but had no problem getting into our room. Rooms are older in design (love to still see walk in closets) but furnishings and decor have been updated nicely. Room was somewhat dark - since we were right in the loop its hard to see the sky. Inddor Pool and hot tub were perfect for kids. Pool room is very large but not a lap pool by any means. Seems to have a nice spa and new gym but we didn't use them. The El stop is very close and there are bus stops right out the door that can get you to the Museum Campus and all over the city. The 3 day CTA pass is $14 at the airport and is the way to go for adults. No need trying to find change or add value. Kids under 10 have a special reduced fare card you can get from the attendant at the station (we were at Midway Airport). Millenium Park is about 1 block and is a fantastic urban space. Concierge was helpful with information if not particulaly enthusiastic. I booked the room through the Hilton website and got $157/night which seems good for upscale in the Loop. Overall its a great hotel in a reallly good location for getting the very big city vibe. As long as you're willing to try public transportation its cheap and easy to get all over the city. All the CTA drivers and attendants were very courteous and helpful. Downtown they obviously deal alot with tourists so dont feel bad if you a little confused or uncertain as you get on. Just be polite too! There were plenty of kids staying here along with older and younger people from ll walks. Nice to experience a more grand style sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Chicago Elegance in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MadCityRob
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton is a classic Chicago hotel located in the heart of Chicago's Loop near Millennium Park and many of the city's best attractions. As you enter into the hotel, you first notice the ornate, two-story lobby. This grand public space is still a great place to sit and watch the crowds pass through the hotel, allowing you to imagine the barons of Chicago society once mingling in this lobby. As a Hilton Honors member, check-in was a breeze - however, the line for regular check-in was much longer (though it moved quickly). The front desk also was accommodating of our requests and made check-in quite enjoyable. Our room was spacious, with a view of downtown Chicago. The furnishings were standard Hilton, but were nice and fairly new. However, not all rooms are as spacious - even if you are paying the same rate. Other members of our party had rooms that were much smaller, with limited views. While these rooms were adequate, they would be tight if more than a couple of people were staying in the room. Clearly, these rooms were remnants of a different era and not what you'd expect in a big, downtown hotel. However, while this hotel has been updated, it is from a much different era. Overall, we would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the heart of Chicago. It's a fine hotel that has been updated, but it is older. However, we didn't notice that - we were having too much fun running around Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Rendezvous with History!!! - Great Hotel All Around”
Reviews.Author: demienef
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palmer House over the Labor Day weekend. It was very busy but we managed to get checked in quickly and they kept my request for double beds. Lobby is beyond beutiful! The bar really doesn't 'fit' into the other masterful decor but it's ok. Positives - Will impress your date/love/girl with it's swanky style Close to everything - Staff is quick and attentive to your request for help and privacy. Beds and linens are VERY nice and comfy! Spacious room! Negatives - A tad noisy between rooms but it's an historic building. Bathrooms are entirely TOO SMALL for grown ups and seem out of place for such a nice room. Room was recently redone but no flatscreen, seemed a bit cheap...

Reviews.Title: “Too big, too noisy, too little service”
Reviews.Author: HuarenToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 7 nights in June 2010. Overall, the rooms are small (and the room sizes in each category vary significantly), the front desk is not helpful (seems like they select which HH guests will get the bigger or smaller rooms. The hotel has over 1000 rooms (and if it didn't, it felt like it). In many ways, the staff treated guests as if you were in Las Vegas and didn't need service, just check you in, ignore you and make sure you pay for everything. The lobby restaurant was ok - don't order desserts. The service was good, but slow - really slow. And that was when there were 5 other tables occupied. Imagine what it would be like if it was packed!!! The pool is interesting and small - and will so many rooms and guests, well you get the picture. The only good thing about this hotel were the housekeeping staff. The ones you don't see do a great job of cleaning your rooms, making sure you have enough of everything and make you feel like you're getting something for all the money you're spending. Why is that? I don't get it. Shouldn't the front desk staff be the best? Overall, a terribly unmemorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and wonderful accommodations”
Reviews.Author: conks48
Reviews.Content: Fast check-in. Gorgeous lobby - one of the most beautiful ever seen. Everything was perfect. We were on the 21st floor with two double beds and TWO bathrooms (loved that option!). Room was clean and tastefully decorated. The concierge was so helpful with anything needed. Loved that you could walk to many places for shopping, leisure (esp. Millennium and Grant Parks nearby), and good places to eat that were reasonable. Will definitely stay there on future visits to Chicago. You MUST try Bertha's famous brownie at the hotel for dessert - to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Palmer House Hilton!!!”
Reviews.Author: mamabear28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with three other couples recently visited the beautiful city of Chicago, and stayed at the Palmer House. This hotel had been recommended by a friend, and it did not disappoint. The hotel exudes a deep history of days gone. Recently renovated the rooms are comfortable and well appointed. I fell in love with the Peacock doors and the story behind them. Much of the decor mimicked the swirling lines of the peacock, right down to the carpet, I was mezmerized! The staff couldn't have been more accomodating and friendly. I visited the concierge on serveral occasions, and they were always ready and willing to assist. The lobby has a nice open bar area, where you can relax, enjoy a refreshment and take in some people watching. I would highly recommend this hotel, and am hoping to revisit Chicago and the Palmer House in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price! Great for the location!”
Reviews.Author: lulu1994
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a recent getaway. It was very nice for the price (got a great deal on Hotwire). Our room was standard. Larger than some others I saw on our floor. It was big enough for two adults. The bed was fantastic and the location was within walking distance (if you like to walk) to most everywhere. I'd recommend it, but if you are a Hilton Honors member, book directly with the hotel. None of your perks apply with a Hotwire reservation. Staff was courteous and very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: deliciao
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about the room sizes having read the reviews, as my teenage son likes to sleep on the floor. When I asked for a bit larger floor space room, they upgraded us to the Executive Floor. All I can say is, what a treat! The rooms were gorgeous. The whole hotel is gorgeous. The lobby is amazing, and the ambiance of old Chicago permeats every pore of this hotel. The staff is lovely - don't expect modern big bathrooms and such, that is not what this hotel is all about - enjoy the history and the aura. Everything is lovely, and you can just visualize ladies in sweeping dresses walking through the hallways, and elegant gentlemen in top hats. Take the time to look at the pictures and portraits on the walls, the Executive elevator is a treat, the Peacock doors are amazing! The only improvement I could ask for is a bit more of the stories behind this hotel to be available, perhaps in the guest book, or as a brochure in the lobby, or plaques.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: JimboinGR
Reviews.Content: I was very worried after reading the reviews for this hotel after getting it on my priceline bid. That all changed once we arrived, the guy at the front desk was very helpful and pretty much let us pick our room. We ended up with a room that had double beds and more room than I have ever seen in a hotel room. The kids were able to actually run around in the room. The beds were OK but we are just used to our bed at home I guess. I am not a big fan of down pillows. The room was very clean and outside of a very strong smell of what I can only describe as some sort of cleaning agent, I have no complaints. I think charging for internet that you can get for free pretty much everywhere is a bit much but it looks to be the norm in high end hotels in town. Parking is a bit steep at 38 a night but again I have seen worse downtown. The location is perfect if you want to go for a walk. We walked to the park (two blocks away) and had dinner at Bennigans. There are not any rooms with a view because this hotel is surrounded by other building but you know that going into it. Over all I think for what we paid (100$) it was a great hotel with tons of charm and history.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: andre2p
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, service at check in, room, lobby bar, and room, everything was top notch. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worse Hiltons that I have stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: govan99
Reviews.Content: I won the Palmer House Hilton for a single nite during a Chicago visit. I bid $105 per nite for 4 star in Chicago Downtown. I got the Hilton Palmer House on Monroe for $105 plus feed/taxes per nite.. At checkin, they gave us (myself and GF) one double bed...which I know technically they can do (as that is all Priceline gaurantees)...good thing myself and my GF are not too big...this Hilton room had no view and room was smaller than Hotel Felix (where we stayed for 3 nites)...some wallpaper in room was peeling...bathroom ceiling was in primer...some rust on shower head...very old TV...bed pillows were bad....checkout was 11am...was not too impressed...was thinking how good Hotel Felix was compared to what Hilton gave us...though Palmer House does offer great location...Hotel Building itself is kinda neat..nice lobby...when at Hilton..it felt like we were on an assembly line...missed the personal touch of the Hotel Felix... ..opps, almost forgot...few other things about Palmer House Hilton...you have to pay for Internet Access and you have to pay for the fitness facility... Overall...not much to like...

Reviews.Title: “Central Downtown Hotel for Business”
Reviews.Author: The_Lewis
Reviews.Content: Over a number of stays at the Palmer House have found it to be a comfortable, traditional downtown hotel with an elegant lobby. Because of its age, the rooms are varied. In particular, the smaller rooms have some problems with noise due to the thinness of the walls. If you can get into the two bathroom variety, they offer soundproofing and space. Have had some wonderful dinner suggestions from the Concierge desk. The lobby is a great place for drinks later in the evening. But one of the real secrets is to exit out the back door and have your after work drink at the Miller Pub - traditional service and atmosphere can't be beat. My only complaint would be that the internet is not included, which is ridiculous in a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't honor reservation; poor maintenance of plumbing”
Reviews.Author: drumman358
Reviews.Content: I had two issues when I stayed at this hotel: 1) I reserved a King Non-Smoking room, yet upon arrival I was told that they only have Smoking King rooms available. I informed the agent that I could not stay in a smoking room, so rather than offer an upgrade, they stuck me in a non-smoking room with two double beds. 2) The shower in the room was gross. Within seconds of entering the shower, the bathtub started to fill up. It took over 15 minutes to drain after I was out. When I called the front desk, their resolution was we'll let the management team know.

Reviews.Title: “The Palmer House Make Your Vacation Special”
Reviews.Author: ycnanb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a delightful 3 day weekend in Chicago. Our friend choose the Palmer House Hotel because he had stayed there in the past. Many things they did made this holiday very stress free. We arrived into town at 7:30 a.m. and they kindly checked our bags in a storage area for us. Secondly, they made a real effort to ensure that all 3 rooms were located close together, and because they weren't too busy on a Thursday, they allowed us an early check-in. Weekend check-in seemed to be very slow, however, they passed out champagne to the tired travellers while they waited in line. I thought that was a great idea to at least recognize that the hotel staff were aware of the problem. The hotel employees were friendly and did their best to please us. We never got the impression that anyone got better treatment because they were big tippers. Yes we tipped, but baggage clerks did not give you the impression that they had any expectations. The rooms were very nicely decorated and comfortable. The bed and linens were the topic of discussion at breakfast because we had all slept so well. The location was great if you liked to walk. Many of the best shopping locations were a 15- 20 minute walk. The restaurants we choose were usually a 5-10 minute cab ride. Cabs were readily available outside the hotel. The security around the hotel kept an eye on things, and I felt very safe in this environment. I would go back to this establishment on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Mary26Pat
Reviews.Content: 2 Years in a row we attended the Blackhawks Convention. As far as information or promises made., get it in writing. You See the Chicago Hilton makes no mistakes at least will not admit any mistakes. Instead "sorry for the inconvenience ". First year the passes were included with the price of the room . Hilton never mentioned this , I am good at finding out all info. Not this time I bought an additional 5 passes $300.00. When I expressed my surprise Hilton , "sorry for the inconvenience ". This year more problems, mix up with old bank account , they made a refund to a 9 month old closed account .Double charged new account. "sorry for the inconvenience ". at check in the guest service agent assured us that one credit card was being used for each night providing a computer for viewing . When we saw the mistake 3 weeks after our stay we called Kelly ,customer relations , then a few more then Jennifer , and Mr. Mc Ardle , "sorry for the inconvenience ". . Mr. Mcardle assured me he knew I was worrieed and would figure it out right away . I waited 4 days and left him a message . Jennifer , Mr. Mc Ardles, assistant called and offered to split the loss, or help me find the lost credit and "sorry for the inconvenience ". Unable to share the account number , only hint .... it was a Visa ,. While on the phone with Jennifer , Mr. McArdles, assistant I found her a Visa phone number . After several other calls and being sent through 5 lines , we are told in was actually a debit card for a closed checking account, Jennifer supplied them with my old debit card number and that it was a Chase Bank account through Visa debit. A bit demeaning at Jennifer's reluctance to share my info with me Jennifer , Too much chaos from a fine hotel. Still waiting but Jennifer did state "sorry for the inconvenience ".

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was at an amusement park or zoo”
Reviews.Author: LUVSHOPPING
Reviews.Content: The check-in line was a maze and had ropes to herd you through the process. Not enough staff available. As a result, the bell captains were trying their best and it was hard to get an elevator quickly. The Lobby Bar was busy and very loud due to the crowds not like in the photos on the website. Strollers & suitcases were near various chairs. Tacky. Our room was tiny but renovated. Great bed! Tiny closet. The valet was always overwhelmed due to crowds. I feel that the place looked like they had given out coupons for a cheap rate. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Jusloretta
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference and was required to stay at this property. I was very disappointed with the accomodations for the price of the room and the location. The property has been updated but the quality of the bedding and the taste of the decor is odd. Many of the rooms have no views at all facing air conditioning units or office buildings. The location is an unusual neighborhood with no nice restaurants, bars or shopping nearby. The property also charged me $5 to RECEIVE a fedex package in addition the the outrageous $51 for valet parking. On a positive note the gym-spa is really nice with great equipment in a large space. For $219 per night there are much nicer hotels in much nicer neighborhoods in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for parents with kids going to Lollapalooza”
Reviews.Author: Craddock01
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel near Grant Park since our kids (17 & 20) were going to Lollapalooza at Grant Park. We also wanted something centrally located where we wouldn't need to get our car or take a cab. I read all of the reviews and found that the Palmer fit all of our needs. I was a little worried since some of the reviews mentioned tiny rooms and/or being located near noisy elevators but there will always be a bad review or two. Our fears were solidified when, after check in, we entered an elevator with a disgruntled British woman who was clearly unhappy. She couldn't stop complaining for the entire ride on the elevator. When she got off of the elevator we all wondered what our experience would be like. Let me back up...I booked through Priceline and called a few days later to put in a few requests. We were reserving 2 rooms for 4 nights and I wanted the rooms near each other and I wanted one of the rooms to have 2 double beds. When I booked through Priceline all they showed left were Kings. When I contacted the Palmer directly, they had no record of my reservations through Priceline. They stated I could book 2 rooms as insurance and cancel up to the day before our stay if need be once we worked out the problem with Priceline. I got everything worked out and the hotel was very helpful. The rooms were rather large, were not near the elevator, they accomodated my requests (the rooms were connected with one being a double and one a king). We had a very nice stay. No problems - very comfortable beds. All hotel staff were friendly. The only downside is the parking. $51 per day - but you're in downtown Chicago where every square foot of real estate has a price. They also charge for internet - wireless or wired but with more and more hot spots popping up this may not be a problem much longer but if you're on the 10th floor you may be stuck. Hotel is very close to The Art Institute. Within walking distance of Magificent Mile (a long walk - 1.4 miles). Near shopping on State Street. We walked to Navy Pier. There is a Cafe on the corner right next to the hotel (no access via hotel but cheaper than eating in the hotel). Starbucks within hotel. Willis Tower, Millenium and Grant Parks within walking distance. Hop on/Hop off double decker bus has a stop at Palmer. The El is directly outside the hotel. Water taxi from stop at Willis Tower is within walking distance. I would return. I could not find anything to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby, room was small but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CallaBudgie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at a tour operator in Germany at a great rate. We liked it a lot. The room was small but clean and comfortable. We did not hear our neighbours or suffered from a small bathroom. Everything was fine. We had dinner at Potter's Lounge (a bar style restaurant) which was fine with good cocktails, burgers and salads. Ther lobby in art deco style is just amazing. The hotel is located within the loop and close to everything. It is just a short walk from the Art Institute and Millenium Park. We liked it a lot and will come again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, I will stay here again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shushopin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer Hotel 7/29/2010 - 8/2/2010. PLEASE DONT LISTEN THE BAD REVIEWS OF THIS PLACE!!! I almost stayed at another hotel because of the negative reviews. The hotel was perfect I arrived at 8:00am for early checkin and did not have any issues. I am a clean freak, to the point I was prepared to go across the street to CVS and by cleaning supplies if needed. The room was very clean , I doubled check the bath room drains and shower curtain and under the bed and it met my expections. I did turn down the comfortor because I dont trust that to be clean no matter where I stay. I had a room with two double beds and found it to be spacious. Yes, the bathroom counter could have been bigger - but at least it was clean with granite top and marble floors and more mirrors than I will ever need! Yes, the view outside my room was of the building next door but you are in downtown chicago what do you expect (room 14-264)! Also the train is near the hotel but I didnt hear it nor did I allow it to hender my stay! This Hotel is right in the middle of everthing, everything is within walking distance. Michigan Mile, Millineum park, restaurants, Filen's Basement and starbucks is INSIDE the hotel!!! We only took a taxi when we went to Gibsons steak house it 's further north by Ohio and Rush streets. $6 taxi ride. Everytime we returned to the room it was clean with fresh towels - again no complaints. The concierge was very helpful but the line was very long. TIP B&B restaurant on state st. next door to the Hotel will deliver to your hotel room - we had breakfast in bed every morning and the food was sooo good!! I have no complaints about the hotel other than they should add a dance club then it would be PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: LLindaC
Reviews.Content: i arrived with 16 yr old daughter and her friend on Friday of Lollapalooza around 12:30. They went to concert, hotel was a zoo and rooms were not ready till 3. I had been up all night. I sat in the lobby for 2 hours where it was horribly loud, crowded and the muzak was screaming. Finally I went to a small room off the lobby, put down my 3 pieces of luggage and put my head down for 30 min. I was awakened by a security guard who told me I could not 'sleep on the floor" I explained that I was exhausted, waiting for a room, but he made me move. Next, i checked in with my HHonors number. The clerk replied" you haven't used this in six months". That's all he said. not welcome, nada. I checked into the small dark room on 13th floor room 244 where I had a view of a brick wall. The room had no coffee maker, nor did it have a refrigerator. The next day, the room attendants did not replace the dirty glasses, nor did they dust the furniture or vacuum beneath the bed., I went to the workout room where I was charged $10 to use a treadmill and bike. The pool was too short to do laps. The hotel also has no free internet, just free boarding pass. The final straw was when I checked in my luggage the last day. The tall fellow said in a rude way "THANKS SO MUCH" when I didn't have a tip. i was out of cash and came back with money to tip on picking up the luggage. However, he was quite rude. I stay in Chicago every year, sometimes twice. This hotel is no different than a Motel 6 for what it offers. The food and drinks are overpriced. The employees are rude. I will never ever recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chocolateloverLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located. We had a standard room which was very clean and spacious. You can print boarding passes for free in the ground floor business centre, but have to pay for wi fi connection for anything else - I always find this very strange in any hotel! For a plush city hotel I also felt that bath robes and coffee making facilities should have been provided in the room. For breakfast try the Corner House bakery on the corner outside the hotel - great food and prices.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has great amenities and is one...”
Reviews.Author: IliveITB
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great amenities and is one block from the amazing Mullennium park. On two rail lines, including right on the Red Line, it's perfect to get to Wrigleyville. Some people have complained about iPhone coverage and mine is 100% everywhere in the hotel (even works in the city subway - something New York needs to get on!). The room is smaller but adequate, with a desk and nice leather and wood swivel chair. The decorations in the room are tasteful and the hotel lobby is beautiful. There isn't really a view in the room but with the park next door, who needs that? Overall - great hotel! I am sure that being on the L line side would be miserable but request another area. It's not the Intercontinental Paris but it's pretty close.

Reviews.Title: “Grand lobby, small rooms, pitiful service”
Reviews.Author: Justtravels988
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 4 night stay at this hotel (stayed here last year for 1 night). Grand Lobby- the hotel is very proud of its heritage (a tv channel dedicated to it). the lobby is grand- from a past era. the rooms were recently renovated, but they're really tacky (peacocks on the carpets, green silky/satin cheap pillows, lime green velvet chairs, etc). The rooms are the size of closets. To the point where they feel unsafe because the hallway door opens directly next to your bed. needless to say, even at 12AM when I tried to sleep, i could hear everything in the hallway and surrounding rooms. its like there is no privacy what so ever. I can get over the small rooms since its an old hotel, but the service is seriously awful and amateur. 1). To use hotel wireless (at $14.95 per day- even for HH Diamond members such as me) you have to get this UFO device from the Front Desk. I inquired, they gave me the device, I had to fill out a waiver, then the desk agent went on a 7 minute search for the instructions. Finally, i told her to stop looking and just had them keep it. seriously, a 12 minute ordeal to pay them $14.95 per day. And, they never offered this at C/I. 2). At checkout, i was charged 8 times for the $14.95 internet. Was charged $85 for the restaurant- which was not my charge- and when I brought it up to the FD, they said it couldn't be fixed until Tuesday- that is, if they decided that I wasn't the one who spent the $85. Why don't they read the folios before they put them under your door- internet charge twice a day for four days?! 3). On day 3, the housekeeper came to my room at 8:30AM, opened the door while i was asleep...i asked her to come back later....left for the day, returned at 6pm, and room hadn't been cleaned. 4). I had access to the exec lounge- it was pitiful. dirty tables, dirty dishes everywhere. only used it one time in 4 days and that was just for coffee and an apple. the food offerings were gross (the turkey on a deli plate was green). So, overall, don't go here. it's just a hassle. there are so many better hotels in this city. i'm a hilton diamond member and won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: jersey1977girl
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, the bellhops were very informative on Chicago. They were more helpful than some of the other staff. I loved the history surrounding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Small dark Rooms”
Reviews.Author: egglestn
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton is in a great location, it has a magnificent lobby and is most immpressive. Check in was smooth and effecient and our room was pleasent, but small by US standards. The bed was also a standard double which felt somewhat small amd being built in a square the view was simply of the light well in the centre, which meant blinds tended to be kept closed. However the room was comfortable, spotlessly clean and the location next to the El made up for those minor gripes. The concierge was very helpful pointing out local sights and places to visit. The Palmer House is just off Michigan Ave and only a short walk to the Magnificent Mile, and the Sears Tower, it is close to most of the Subway and El lines I must recommend the Arts Institute of Chicago, it is a very short walk and a fabulous way to spend a day, particularly any Apple Users who will recognize large numbers of the desktop art

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: badler25
Reviews.Content: I and my two children stayed three nights at The Palmer House. It was exquisite. We had an air conditioner that chilled the room to the low sixties, the beds were great, and we had a two bathroom suite, so there was plenty of room. We had a wonderful view. We arrived at The Palmer at noon, so I did not expect our room to be ready, but it was! The staff was great. The food was great. I did discover some lipstick on a water glass, but that was the only flaw. All of this was made even more enjoyable as we had left The Drake Hotel after spending two nights there. Reverse all the superlatives for The Palmer, and there you have The Drake, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough that this is where President Obama was staying.”
Reviews.Author: AustinBeach001
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton on E. Monroe Street is a beautiful, grand hotel. I arrived at about 6pm on August 5th for 1 night. I had booked a 1 King Bed room (Room 17212) and it was on par maybe a little above the average Hilton although clean and very comfortable and it had a good size but the lobby was impeccable. I was LARGE and had big, over-stuffed couches for people to sit in and had restaurant service with them. It had been a long day so I decided to go eat in the restaurant and ordered "Grown-Up Steak and Mac n' Cheese" and it was very good. It was a well cooked steak with 4-Cheese Mac n' Cheese with mix-in's and other stuff. It was fabulous. Although after my 2 drinks, salad, and meal and after tip, my meal, for 1 person, was $86. Oh well. My company paid for it so it was ok! My company whose office was in the Willis Tower was convenient to the hotel. It was about 8 blocks so maybe not walking distance, but the taxis don't like doing short distances either. I would most definetly stay here again and recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “The Palmer House in Chicago is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara0123
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Palmer House was outstanding. The customer service and amenities made our trip extra special. We truly enjoyed the best musical ever, Billy Elliott in the threatre district along with the shopping opportunities. All of our activities were within walking distance of the hotel. The elegance of the hotel, the breakfast and hospitaility hour were very nice perks!! The best place to stay downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ABC360
Reviews.Content: Beautiful common areas and the staff was very friendly. I had a bit of bad luck in that it took me thirty minutes to recheck into my room on the second day of my stay. The friendly staff made up for it nicely by giving me $50 in vouchers that my wife and I used for a nice breakfast on Sunday morning. I would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations with great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: beachwalker58
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Palmer House is like taking a trip back in time. The lobby is awesome. The room was small but attractively decorated and vey clean. The experience was top rate. The breakfast that was included was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review - had several problems, but staff was earnest in their efforts to solve them”
Reviews.Author: aqp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights for a business meeting, and in that time I had three rooms. I checked in at 11:30 pm and had to wait in line 15-20 minutes. The room I was given was far below Hilton standards - I wouldn't have given you $50 a night for this room! It was a long walk from the elevator bank. Everything was worn out and old, looking like it hadn't been updated in 30 years. Old stained floral carpet, an scraped-up armoire that looked like it came from a garage sale, wallpaper peeling at the seams. The bathroom was very tiny, just enough space to cram a tub/shower, toilet and sink. The a/c rattled loudly. But what caused me to insist on a new room was the amount of mold. The upholstered chair at the desk had green fuzzy refrigerator mold growing on it, a patch as big as my two hands together. The wall near the A/C vent had black mold spores along the ceilings and walls, and heavy amounts had collected in the split seams of the wallpaper. The hotel was sold out and I was scheduled to have a roommate the following night. As a temporary measure, I was moved to a single room for the night - had to wait in line at the front desk again. It was a nicer updated room, but the mattress was not very comfortable. The next day I had to check out of this room, store my bags, and then stand in line and check in again for my next room. This last room was recently renovated, huge, and very comfortable. I felt like Goldilocks - too moldy, not enough beds, just right. My bill was incorrect and I had to call the hotel twice after I returned home to straighten out the charges. That said, the staff was very helpful and really tried to solve all the problems. Everyone seemed to really care about me as a guest. The lobby and common areas are beautiful, and you can't beat the location - a two-block walk to Millennium Park and 1/2 a block to the El. and the subway. In summary, if you can get a renovated room I think you will enjoy your stay, but without a guaranty of a renovated room, I cannot recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LilNoel25
Reviews.Content: The lobby was so relaxing, I actually fell asleep there listening to the piano and watching ppl. The french resaraunt is awesome, especially at breakfast. Room service was great and it was an all around relaxing few days.

Reviews.Title: “Iphone users beware”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-Gru-U
Reviews.Content: FYI.....Hotel is nice. Iphone reception is VERY poor all thoughout the hotel. Even a staff member said Iphone users never have any quality reception. Also....note you MUST pay a premium for internet access, even wireless in the lobby required you to pay. You can do much better for a hotel in Chicago. Hilton let me down with this property! PS: There is not coffee pot in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Hilton's in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Browne333
Reviews.Content: Second stay at a Chicago Hilton this summer. Both rooms were dark with cost saver yellow lighting; looked out at other rooms, not at the street or sky; were huge but only partially furnished; and were ice cold - even with air cond off. Lobby's nice, room's not up to par with pleasant rooms at other hotels.These rooms will make you want to go home for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JasonL2
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel was a great central location for all the tourist attractions. We were able t o walk to everything including restaurants. The stay was quite and very relaxing environment and the staff and concierge was very helpful in finding things to do and places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location for 4th of July!”
Reviews.Author: profpat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed her for the 4th of July, overnight till the 5th. We stayed here once before to see the Chicago fireworks and found the location to be perfect. This year the Chicago Fireworks were "spread out" to three locations, but this hotel was still perfect. Location The location is only a few blocks west of Lake Michigan. We passed the Art Institute and then the Taste of Chicago entrance on our walk to the lake. Instead of eating at the Taste, we walked to the lakefront and enjoyed a (crowd-free) hotdog at a small stand overlooking the docked boats. As you walk along the lake, there are plenty of place to eat. Ironically, there is a Robinson Rib stand right on the lake. I was laughing thinking of the hot, sweaty line you would be standing in at the Taste, when a great rib is only a short jaunt away! The following morning, we had breakfast at a local McDonalds conveniently located one block away. Rooms The ceilings are low but the decor is lovely. The bathrooms are small but efficient, with gorgeous marble sinks, great lighting and large mirror. The toiletries are brand name Crabtree and Evelyn products that smell heavenly. The safe is conveniently located in the closet. Most importantly (for us) the soundproofing is excellent. We slept late and enjoyed a very quiet sleeping environment. General Areas After arriving, we threw our luggage in the room and went downstairs to have a cocktail in the lobby. We sat at a marble table with bar stools and people-watched as we sipped our drinks. The lighting, decor and general ambiance of this hotel lobby is wonderful. We grabbed a cab having dinner elsewhere. We arrived back to hotel after dinner and walked down to the lakefront for the fireworks. The fireworks from Navy Pier were readily visible. The hallways to the rooms display classy B/W photos of old movie stars which is a nice touch. Service When we first arrived, check in was a breeze even though it was a holiday weekend. Check out was super-simple. We got a bill slipped under our door in the middle of the night. We simply called the number on the bill and checked out over an automated phone system, leaving the keys in the room. We enjoyed our stay here and really like the historical "feel" of this hotel. It's a gem!

Reviews.Title: “IF DISABLED, DO NOT STAY HERE; NOT AT ALL ACCOMMODATING . ALSO STEALTH CHARGES!!!”
Reviews.Author: Roberttbiboy
Reviews.Content: First off, my wife selected this hotel, not only because of its great historic nature, but, because they assured her that, I, who am disabled, would be amply accommodated during my stay,especially for my birthday. Well, this did not happen! Our room was located extremely far from the elevators and was very difficult to orient in; it was set up very poorly! It was not at all "disabled friendly"! For example, no curbside ramps, no commplimentory valet parking for the disabled, which incidentally I had to have; valet parking was a whopping $51.00 a night! Additionally, no cable or satalite TV, no free internet access, no wet bar, no free coffee in the room, not even free continetal breakfast was offered. A mandatory 20% gratuity for room service is automatically added to room service charges. And this is only a few of the disappointments; there are many others! "Pet friendly"; wrong, there was a steath and outrageous $75.00 fee added to the room rate, if you possess a pet; this was never mentioned until we checked-in! We opted to spend good money ($259.00 a night) hoping to be catered to, but all we experienced, was a money sucking vacuum cleaner, with strong suction! Everywhere we turned, there was some sort of charge! On a positive note, the hotel had comfortable beds. Overall, I will never stay here again and I strongly do not recommend this hotel, especially, if you are disabled. Chicago has myriads of fine hotels that do not fleece you; opt to choose them! Highly disillusioned, Robert F.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed at the Palmer House for 2 nights...”
Reviews.Author: juliekannai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House for 2 nights this week. The public spaces in the hotel are spectacular, and I'd recommend you stop in the lobby for a drink whether you stay at the Palmer or not. The rooms are small, like many older hotels, but they are very well maintained. The linens are soft and beautiful. CONS: It is noisy. My room facing the courtyard had a continuous buzzing noise like a generator. My biggest beef is that the operable windows were locked shut - I wanted to open them to listen to the rain (which would have been a pleasant counterpoint to the generator noise) and I could not.

Reviews.Title: “So, I really wanted to love this place...”
Reviews.Author: fergieam
Reviews.Content: So, I really wanted to love this place and my initial impression was fantastic. The lobby is beautiful & luxurious and I couldn't wait to check-in and relax in our room. And here's where it all went downhill. The front desk clerk was a little on the snippy side. We were given our keys and sent on our way only to find that she had given us a room with ONE double bed which is not what we had reserved. You would think the front desk clerk would have thought something was amiss when she checked us in. My husband was standing right there and at 6'6 would barely fit in that bed by himself, let alone the both of us. I immediately called down only to be placed on hold for an eternity so the manager could be consulted. The manager never even bothered to speak to us to apologize and had the clerk handle it. I had to tell them that I had the printed documentation/receipts that proved we were guaranteed more than that. At this point, the only room available was a handicapped room with 2 double beds. At least one of us wouldn't have to sleep on the floor. By the way, the first room we were given was quite shabby and on par with a "Days Inn" level. The wallpaper was peeling. The furniture looked old & worn. The second room looked like it was more recently updated but still lacked the oomph that nice hotels should have. It was a failed attempt at replicating the look of Kimpton Hotel properties. The TV was extremely dated. No wifi!!!!!! In this day & age???? And, of course, they charge for it. And they charge for the use of the gym!!!!!! Seriously? How can you give your customer subpar accommodations & claim to be a luxury hotel? The only reason they get 2 stars is because of the lobby, friendly bellmen and location.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Building in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: joe_cool_joe82
Reviews.Content: This is a much nicer building than most Hilton Hotels with beautiful architecture. It's situated in the heart of downtown in the Chicago loop. We didn't eat in the restaurant or drink in the bar, there is a lovely Corner Coffee shop on the corner of the hotel selling reasonably priced coffee and a good breakfast. There are lots of local restaurants. It's a bit of a walk to the Magnificant Mile but possible. I tried to go swimming but it was full of kids (it was 4th July!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkwaldrop
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is a beautiful hotel. The lobby is amazing. We had a 2 bed 2 bathroom room and it was spacious, clean and quiet. The hotel is in a great location...close to dining, shopping and city transportation. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Your paying for location and historic ambiance”
Reviews.Author: lindainmadison
Reviews.Content: If you want old world charm and a great location - this is your hotel. But you'll pay for it. We got the AAA rate of $189, and used Hilton points for another night. I believe it's over $250 a night otherwise. I've stayed at several hotels in downtown Chicago, and many other hotels around the world in my lifetime. Each trip gives me the chance to reflect on what I want, for that trip. In this case, we were meeting a group of friends with small children, and they really wanted to stay here for the location and oppulance. But for us, with a small child, we really prefer something with a fridge and a microwave. So this hotel wasn't our favorite. If you're traveling with friends or a spouse, this could be your splurge because it's walkable to a lot of famous sites, and easy to the "L" and bus stops to get to other famous sites. The room was relatively clean. I mean, what hotel doesn't have issues in that realm? We found a nasty stain on a bedskirt, but just tried not to think about it. The staff was extremely friendly. Again, what do you want in a hotel? Location and charm? Low price with small appliances and a free breakfast? You have to do the research and find out what works best for you. For our family, we would skip this beautiful historic hotel and go for something more practical.

Reviews.Title: “The worse hotel in Chicago ever”
Reviews.Author: BKgirlinSD
Reviews.Content: I had to come here to work and it was the only hotel that had rooms, now I know why. When I walked in the bed was unmade and checked the rest of the room and it was not clean. Then the chair I was sitting on had vomit on it. The water has been dripping in the tub and I must leave the tv on just to go to sleep. You have to pay $5 to use the gym worse, who does that? The staff is plentful but not helpful, for the price of this hotel it is the worse. I stay at the Reniassance and that is representative of the cost compared with amenities and sercices. I won't stay here, I am actually going to hotel by the airport it is bad

Reviews.Title: “Classic old hotel, great location, executive floor worth extra cost”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palmer House many times over the course of several decades. The fact that I keep coming back says something about the hotel. The location is great and you do feel like you've stepped into another era...until you see someone walk through the lobby wearing a t-shirt and baseball cap. We had a great stay in a room with 2 beds and 2 baths on the Executive Floor. The Executive Floor cost $40 more per night but it included a private elevator that skips most floors (this is a huge hotel and the elevators are full and slow), complimentary soft drinks, snack mix, and cookies all day. Complimentary hors d'oeuvres during the happy hour (my glass of wine was $10) included cheese, fruits, crackers, spinach dip, and hummus. Complimentary breakfast which included cold cereals, coffee, juice, bagels, hard-boiled eggs, meat, cheese, muffins, croissants, and granola bars. Words of warning. The room sizes vary a lot so your room could be not much bigger than a closet or extremely spacious. If you are next door to a wedding party that is in and out of their room all night, you will get a lousy night's sleep. The check-in line is always slow (though they handed out free popcorn and bottled water while we were in line). Internet access is outrageously priced. As in all city hotels, parking is also very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MeterReader
Reviews.Content: Old very big hotel. i booked a room thru a conferance very early. when i got the room it was on the interior of the hotel no view at all. i opened the door and hit the table next to the bed. you had to go outside to change your mind. plumbing was noisey all night. for +$250/night it could have been better. Eleavator service at checkout time was terrible. My wife liked the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: natty33
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for the 4th of July weekend. The Palmer house Hilton was a lovely hotel that had been recently renovated. It is in a great location, near many parks, lake Michigan and close to CTA transportation. The entire staff was exceptional and very friendly, with the exception of the bartenders. The bartenders were snooty, aloof and inattentive. I was surprised by their behavior, compared to the rest of the staff. The hotel was beautiful. The room was well kept. Check in was fast and easy. The hotel staff was warm and hospitable. The concierge desk was always helpful, friendly, and thorough. The bellmen were helpful and kind. I really enjoyed my stay here. We loved the location, and were overall very impressed with the Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised.”
Reviews.Author: smileytrips
Reviews.Content: I certainly wouldn't recommend this hotel for families. Even with an upgrade to the Executive Floor's complimentary continental breakfast and hor d'oeuvres there just isn't much there worth fighting the crowd over. We were there as a couple and were very impressed with the cleanliness and service of all the staff. We were upgraded to the Exec. Floor and had a king size room with an average size bath so I can't complain. We did not do priceline but I think I might in the future even if we got one of the smaller rooms. The best part of staying here is the location. We did not dine in their restaurant because there was a line every morning and we don't care for buffets anyway. There was never a wait at the Starbucks in the hotel so that worked out better than the Exec Floor coffee. We did use the Valet and service was exceptional. Conceirge very helpful too and housekeeping did a spotless job. Pleasantly Surprised!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: bearsocks1
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel by using Priceline. My budget is that of a 1 or 2 star establishment. I was so impressed that I will definetly return to Palmer House even if I need to pay the full rate. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Our room was cleaned daily. The bed was very comfy and my daughter loved the pool. We did not take advantage of the restaurant, spa, room service or valet parking. We did however use the complimentary bell hop service and that was exceptional. Definetly worth staying at for the hospitality, history, and atmosphere. Within walking distance to the Willis Tower and the water taxi service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but wide range in quality of rooms”
Reviews.Author: BK-1K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House with my wife for a weekend away from the kids. As any parent will attest, in that situation, standards are quite low - all you really want/need is a quiet spot away to reconnect with your spouse. The Palmer House offers that - with a great lobby, two nice lounges (yes, they can get loud, but they are nice) and a very good health club (unfortunately, they charge you for this, even if you are HHonors Elite, which is very annoying). I've stayed here before and have come to expect that the rooms at the Palmer House vary a lot - there are very good rooms and ones that give you claustrophobia. We were fortunate to have a decent room (handicapped accessible) with a good sized bathroom. I was disappointed that the TV was an old CRT model, the air conditioner was too loud and the shower had mold around the edges. Also, as others have posted, the hotel has huge floor plans and the wait time for elevators can be quite long, so factor that in to your plans. For the price we paid (under $200) these are acceptable trade offs. If you can get a good deal on the Palmer House, check it out, otherwise, keep looking - Chicago is full of really great hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It was a beautiful hotel but would not choose again”
Reviews.Author: kteacheroh
Reviews.Content: The hotel and lobby were very elegant when you enter but not exactly "kid friendly" The location was excellent for our first time visit to Chicago. The price of everything was very high and i am still having issues with my credit card payment getting settled. Also the room was VERY small for 4 people, and we listened to the shower drip all day and all night for 2 days! The black hairs all over the bathroom when we arrived was not appealing. I will say the conceierge desk was soooo helpful at answering my questions and helping us with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old historic hotel, great location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: dogdazed
Reviews.Content: Our family group of 12 stayed in the Palmer House over the weekend of June 26th, and we were mostly very pleased with our stay. They did mess up our request for adjoining rooms, and put one room on a whole different floor than the rest, but other than that I have no complaints. The rooms are small, but clean and the beds are very comfortable. The service was great, everyone we dealt with was very friendly. Loved the gorgeous lobby ceiling. We had lunch at the hotel restaurant, and the sandwiches were excellent. The drinks served in the lobby are good but a little pricey - $11.00 for an amaretto sour. But the service was good, and it was worth it for the ambiance. All in all, a nice stay and a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Want elegance and sophistication? Stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: ChgoTravel
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Palmer House Hilton the weekend of June 26th and from the moment we walked in, I regretted my choice of this hotel. We entered the lobby late Friday night and were met with loud hip-hop music being played. I actually walked around looking for the entrance to the club that I thought was off of the lobby until I realized it was being played through the house speakers! The lobby environment left a lot to be desired, I'll leave it at that. Our room consisted of a double bed, 3 feet from the door and about 10 square feet of walking space after you account for the huge desk and dresser (which should not be in that room to account for the minimal space). Not only was the room TINY for 2 people, but it was also right off of the elevator lobby, and with the bed being 3 feet from the door, I was able to share in everyone's conversations as they exited/entered the elevator bank. The toilet that ran all night I'll chalk up to a small maintenance problem and these things just happen. Completely disappointed with the room, we headed down to the lobby for a drink. We watched the waiter pass us 3 times as he serviced the tables around us so my fiance walked up to the bar to get drinks himself. Paying $33 for 2 martinis (tip not included) was a little ridiculous but we figured those are downtown prices if only a bit inflated. If you decide to drive to the hotel, expect to pay $38/night for parking in the lot across the street from the hotel. There is no validation, this is the price the lot charges and the exact same price the hotel charges, so don't forget to include that in the room cost. We parked at the lot on Clark and Harrison the second night -walking distance and $8 for the night- after having learned our lesson and paying $32 for parking the first night, and were lucky enough to find free street parking the next day on Wabash and Jackson (beware of the "pay to park" meters that charge $4.25 for 1 hour of parking). Fitness center is $10 to use and don't expect anything by way of free water or anything else because everything they have to offer, they've put a price on. I should say that they did change our room after we complained about the noise/location/size to a normal sized room with a queen size bed and space enough for two people, but I think at that point, the damage had been done and had I been able to change hotels without penalty, I definitely would have. The location of the hotel is great because you're within walking distance to most everything and a short cab ride away to everything else, but I would NOT recommend staying here again to anyone. For the price (room, taxes, parking, fitness, etc), you can stay at a much nicer hotel and I highly recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Downtown Business Class Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MooneyPilot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palmer House twice in the last month. Both of my stays were nice, but not special. The hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to lots of great stuff in downtown Chicago. Also it is next door to the L and makes for easy access around the city. The rooms are nice, but not fantastic. The hotel is very old and has some of the lowest ceilings that I have ever experienced in a hotel. The large size of the hotel makes for long hallways and delays at the elevators. To get to the lobby or meeting rooms, you need to allow for a 10 minute commute from your room. Maybe even more if you are on a higher floor... My first room was a nice corner king room that was fairly large. It had plenty of room and a very comfortable chair to work in. The bathroom was tiny though, and your body (I am an average size male 5'11" - 190 lbs) touches the bathtub and the wall while using the toilet. It felt almost chlosterphobic to use the toilet or take a shower. The bed was nice and comfortable and the room was clean. All in all, for a downtown business hotel, this stay was acceptable, but not luxurious. On my second stay, I was "upgraded" to the Diamond floor. My room here was much smaller than my last stay and reeked of cigarette smoke (literally like someone had smoked in the room just minutes before I walked in). I called down to the desk and they swithced my room. The front desk was very nice when I came down and assured me that I would like my new room. My second room was a very, very large suite and quite nice. I did like it, but also realized that I was given it only because of the horrible odor of my first assigned room. I do not think that it is reasonable to expect this type of upgrade to obviously one of the best suites again. Also, I am not sure what benefits the Diamond Floor has, other than the sign as you come off of the elevator to make you feel important. My room on that floor was very small (just large enough for the king bed and a chair) and candidly not as nice as my room just two weeks earlier on a "regular" floor. The bathroom on the "diamond floor" was tiny, like my former room as well. All in all, this hotel is acceptable for a downtown Chicago stay. The fitness center is okay, very standard Hilton fitness center. The lobby is beautiful, but the rooms are just okay. The staff is plesant enough when you check in. Given the fact that they acknowlegded and fixed the odor problem with a great upgrade, I will stay here again. If you are looking for a true Business Class, Hilton quality downtown hotel, then the Palmer House is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: RG1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent...really grand. I had a great time there. The bar makes some really awsome cocktails. The rooms are nice and big. The hotel is located very close to navy pier and the location is central

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: edward_gibney
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Palmer House Hilton at least five times a year for the past six years. Every experience has been great. This hotel is magnificent. It is very close to my home office, CNA, I have entertained many clients here, and had special times with many of my business colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “It was worse than I thought I would be...”
Reviews.Author: IdealReviewer001
Reviews.Content: I thought that this hotel was OK, and do not recommend it to anyone who wishes to stay here. For one thing when you first walk in it looks amazing and grand, but really everything in there that looks like it's a real antique is just a piece of plastic with some faded paint on it. The service was average and the man who checked us in didn't seem to care that we wanted our room key. All he was doing was slacking off with his co-worker having a good old time completely ignoring my family and I. But overall the service was average. The rooms were very, very small. Not even my family of four could fit in the so called "queen beds". My poor son and I had to take turns to sleep on the floor. That was very inconvenient. We stayed on the Executive Floor which was pretty nice to have continental breakfast in the morning, but sadly the breakfast was not that great, so don't expect much of it. The staff working in there were rude as my son told me there wasn't anymore cereal left, the lady handling the food told him in an irritated voice that "SHE'S WORKIN' ON IT". Both of my children are very well mannered and surprised that the lady was so mad. The location was good and bad; the good thing about it was that it was only one block away from Michigan Avenue, and Millennium Park. The bad thing about the location was that it was located in an alley with a train right above the sidewalk that was very noisy. You could also smell sewage while walking down the street, so it felt like I had to walk to through the slums just to get to the nice part of town. Overall my stay was not the best, so I recommend you DO NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but too big”
Reviews.Author: ItalGrecoLon
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old signature hotel in Chicago. Check in was swift. As a smoker, lack of ' standard ' rooms available and was upgraded. My room was HUGE. 2 double beds, 2 bathrooms, 2 closets. The bathrooms, despite having 2, were not very big by North American standards, but certainly adequate. I did not use the restaurants nor bar so unable to comment regarding food, ambience etc. The location of the hotel is fantastic, a few blocks to Wacker and you're in Theatreland. My only minor gripe with this hotel is it's size. Due to it's age, walking along the corridors to the elevator, which could be some distance, was somewhat ghostly. There were a number of shops on ground level, which gave I likened to a London underground station. That being a minor gripe, other than that, thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mmlrmp
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is nice but their service was not the quality of a Hilton. The best thing from this hotel is the location and just right outside the hotel there is an entrance to the train. The rooms were very small and the hotel as a whole was out dated. If you stay here you don't need a car being that you can walk to where you are going or simply go outside to the trains entrance. Even as a gold member I did not qualify for free internet or breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Palmer House Hilton, I LOVE YOU!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCat314
Reviews.Content: Loved it. So classy, so elegant, so historical. I LOVE that the rooms have 2 bathrooms! I also loved the punch/piano hour that they had. I felt like I was in a time warp at this hotel, it was like stepping into a piece of history. I wish I had brought a formal ball gown to this place! The staff here was equally classy and elegant, from the front desk staff to the doorman who called us a cabbie(he whistles really loud for one, just like in movies! Really cool). They really treated us like we were celebrities. Really memorable place, I wish more hotels were like this!

Reviews.Title: “WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER...”
Reviews.Author: dhirenz
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel is hopeless. I had a very experience. I do not know how to explain it. The hotel did not charge the right credit card even though they were instructed over and over again. The staff seems to be uneducated and unprofessional. I would never go at this hotel again and would never recommend this to anybody especially when they are so many good areas in the near vicinity. Pls do not spoil your vacation by going to this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Marius40
Reviews.Content: I never get tired of staying here. What a grand old hotel. Service was wonderful as always; Alfred at the front desk was very nice. Room was smaller than I usually get, but the new bed was wonderful. Also had Executive Floor access as a gold member with free internet and continental breakfast. The new health club $5.00 for gold was nice, but not especially different from some of the larger free health clubs in other hotels. One caveat. I used to park my car outside on Wabash which was free if you moved it by 7:00 a.m. Now they charge for street parking 24/7, at $4.25 for every two hours, no limit from 9:00 p.m. until 8:00 a.m. then $4.25 per hour (two hour limit) from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. You can still park in the loading zones for free from 6 p.m., but you have to move your car by 6:00 a.m. There are two parking lots south on Wabash that are $10 and $12 overnight, but they are outside and unattended. Cheers. Marius

Reviews.Title: “5 star everything!”
Reviews.Author: ak331
Reviews.Content: great hotel very luxurious and relaxing, probably thee best hotel i ever stayed at, rooms were big and clean and the staff were very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelfun_111
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. Overall our experience with this hotel was a positive one. We both quite enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff were very welcoming and friendly especially the concierge desk. They were happily answering all of our questions and provided helpful suggestions for us. We got this hotel through Priceline so we were a bit worried with the room they were going to give us. Fortunately, the room we got was clean and quite spacious. We were on the 8th floor. The walls are a bit thin but we didn't experience anything that wasn't unbearable. The hotel is conveniently located to public transportation such like the L train, buses and subway. The lobby as per many other reviews was stunning. They do charge for internet use and the fee is bit overpriced so we ended up using free wifi at the corner bakery which was conveniently located steps away from the hotel. We definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip to the not so windy city!”
Reviews.Author: TouristTed
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Hilton Honours guest so was consequently upgraded to an Executive Room (it was also our wedding anniversary!). Executive floor was great - complimentary canapes each evening and breakfast thrown in. Had to pay for alcohol though but soft drinks/tea/coffee complimentary at any time. Internet was also free which was a great bonus. Check-in quick and friendly. Room was spacious and well appointed. Bathroom was a bit small as others have noted but wasn't looking to hold a party in there so not really a problem. Shower was two headed and one of the best experienced in hotels stayed in. Was concerned about the reported thin walls from other posters and also had reservations when saw that the room we were given had an adjoining door to the next room (why do hotels have these!!!!). Needn't have worried though as sleep was not disturbed at all. Only downside was the bar downstairs - service was terrible. Despite sitting at the bar, my wife and I were still ignored by the bar staff on two occasions. We took our business elsewhere!!! Next door to the hotel is Millers Bar - good food. Recommend the ribs. Cocktails at the top of the Hancock Tower also to be recommended. Italian Village also did good food and Yolk is excellent for breakfast. All in all a fab trip - even though it was mighty hot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Chic & Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: breezyg03
Reviews.Content: I went on a trip with some girlfriends over Memorial Day weekend. We got an awesome discount using priceline. The rooms are really cute (design) and very spacious (for 4 girls in a 2 double bed room). The lobby is gorgeous, and it's close to everything. I think Millennium Park was only a block or two away. We walked all the way down Michigan Avenue. Everything was great! The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and even has a Starbucks in it!

Reviews.Title: “Check and take copies of your booking”
Reviews.Author: nubian131
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel as a birthday treat, we had specifically booked BED and BREAKFAST (unusual it would seem in USA), we arrived after a 20 hr journey and were greeted warmly, (despite the heavy rain outside) and given the keys to our room. The room was pleasent and clean though no coffee / tea making facilitys. The big problem came next morning, after a wait of about 5 min we were shown to a table for our breakfast, ( although the place was about 1/4 full) there seemed to be an aurgument going on between some of the staff, I enquired what allowance for the meal we were allowed being booked B&B, I was asked to check with the main desk as the waiter did not seem to understand my question. On checking with the main reception I was informed, quite abruptly that we were only booked as room only. I produced a photo copy of my booking and stated that it clearly showed breakfast included, but they would not accept this and stated that my travel agent had made a mistake by telling me this. I asked to speak with a manager but was told they were busy and that the recetionist would speak to the manager later. I returned to the reception later in the afternoon and spoke to a diffrent person and had to explain everything over and I asked that I be shown the original booking in form to prove my complaint but was told that "the paperwork will have gone now" where it had "gone" on a Sunday they couldnt say but would not produce it. I again showed my copy and demanded that something be done. After a wait I was given 2 small cards and told to present them for a courtesy breakfast. Not wishing to waste a day of sight seeing we had a look around the city but on my return I enquired with a member of staff, was the card valid all week, but told NO only for 1 breakfast.
