I again complained and eventually spoke to the receptionist that had originally booked us in, on checking my copy she appologised and stated that she had mis-read the booking and etered it wrong on the system. this was the first and ONLY appology we recieved from staff at the main reception, however she did sort out vouchers for our breakfasts for the rest of the week. The night before departure I checked our bill using the TV in the room and found that I had been charged for all the breakfasts we had eaten, once more back to reception and and effort to sort it out, I was promised that it was an oversight and that theere was no charge for the meals,( duely wiped from account on return to room and TV check) however the next morning after breakfast and booking out were again informed that I owed for breakfast. (how many times had I been through this) eventually charges dropped and we left for the long haul back to the UK. Moral, Check and take copies of booking paperwork with you, I always take 2 complete copies as well as originals. The rest of the city is wonderful and people are very friendly, even beggers in the street are polite (if your polite to them) and appologise for asking and wish you a nice day even if you dont give them anything. There are several bars near to the Palmer House, a good one is the Tilted Kilt about one block North on the east side of the hotel, the parks and galleries are wonderful and whilst we were there it rained, the sun shone (70f) and it snowed on our last day . fantastic city but watch this hotel gets it right.

Reviews.Title: “I normally don't complain but...”
Reviews.Author: Elaine75
Reviews.Content: I would not have even bothered writing a review about this hotel if were not for the fact that they ran out of cribs. I expressly stated when I made our reservation that we needed a crib for our infant/toddler. When we arrived we were told that they ran out. I asked why. The front desk said that a family extended their stay and needed to keep the one they were using and the hotel did not have any extras. I then asked why, when it became clear that your guests were staying an extra night, you didn't make provisions to get more cribs since you knew we were coming. (I mean, come on, did they think we were not going to notice?) After a very long song and dance, where I was made to feel like I was making a fuss, the front desk got someone to go and buy a portable crib from a nearby shop. Fortunately, even though it was a holiday weekend, they managed to do this. After this experience, I am not sure I would stay here again. (There was also hardened dried snot embedded into one of the bedsheets. Clearly, the laundering facilities leave something to be desired as well. ) That said, it is right next to the Arts Institute - which is a major plus if that is the main thing you are doing.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible upon entering the lobby, welcoming and beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: John54070
Reviews.Content: Our experience at The Palmer House was excellent, when entering the front door into the lobby, it felt so incredible, we were in "awe" with the light/art fixtures and the art work, the ceiling blew me away. The staff at the front desk was extremely friendly and was very welcoming. The room (standard) was very comfortable, the bed linens were beautiful, (both with a very upbeat decor). We also had the opportunity to have lunch at the Lockwood, the food and service was excellent. I would highly recommend The Palmer House to anyone planning a trip to Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “All the staff from the front desk, spa...”
Reviews.Author: jackofalltravel
Reviews.Content: All the staff from the front desk, spa, housekeeping were all very friendly and accomodating. My room was spacious and bed very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Shawnandgerry
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay and shop, the magnificent mile great for shops

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but very very small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: KD8
Reviews.Content: These are the smallest rooms that I have ever seen in my life. A few of the people on my team had o.k. sized room because of updates made to the hotel. But I was told that the hotel is historical and that they didnâ€™t want to damage any of the historical feel :{. With the wallpaper and cracks in some of the walls you can tell that the hotel is old but they have made some nice updates. Lockwood was just o.k. the drink prices are insane, but you can go right next door to Millers and itâ€™s a little cheaper. Millerâ€™s is also rated high on Tripadvisor but after going there I canâ€™t understand why that is. For the nightlife people for Chicago to be such a large city everything closes by like 11:00 p.m. I guess there are about 10 clubs that stay open past 2:00 a.m. but I am not really sure. p.s. Lou Malnatis is really good pizza. All and all, this hotel was just o.k. And they charge to use the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “The Nicest Hotel and Location and Service for our Money”
Reviews.Author: Kimber4438
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for a major tradeshow and had never stayed at the Palmer House before. I was pleasantly surprised as soon as I walked in and knew my company would be please upon their arrival. This hotel is perfect if you are heading to the convention center and had many restaurants in walking distance. The rooms were great and the service even better. I booked the Palmer House again and will continue to do so from here on out!

Reviews.Title: “One night - priceline hotel. Best night ever!”
Reviews.Author: suzbara
Reviews.Content: We used priceline to book a 4 star hotel. I won't tell you what we paid but it was more than 1/2 price what was listed on the Hilton website. Based on what we paid I was worried they would put 2 adults in a room with one double bed. We checked in quickly and were given a KING size bed on the 19th floor. We only had a view of other rooms, but when they offered an upgrade I thought to myself 'upgrade to what?' Another awesome feature was not only do we have a comfortable King size bed, but there were 2 bathrooms. Nice not to have to share ! While all we did was arrive, sleep and leave, it was one of the best hotels I have stayed in- located in a great area. I will be trying priceline again with hopes that I get the Palmer house .. I could become a regular!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TiffaniDuck
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience here! Beautiful hotel, friendly staff, delicious food. The rooms are very comfortable and stunning. The folks that work in the bar and at the information desk were all very helpful. And we loved being so close to the train station, the The one tiny thing that went wrong (we were seated at one of the lobby's restaurants and it took them a while to come greet us and take our drink order...no big deal) was completely made up for when the waitress made us a to-go box of cheese and fruit from the Fantastic breakfast bar! Everything on the the buffet was first-class and delicious, however, take caution if you are on a budget. The breakfast bar has no priced posted or anything and we spent over $25 per person! It was worth it, but if you're looking for something more affordable, check out The Corner Bakery next door. We absolutely loved everything about this place. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: chicagofran2
Reviews.Content: Buyer Beware. I flew my 71 year old Mom to Chicago to celebrate Mother's Day at the spa. I decided to avoid the busy Mother's Day weekend and scheduled our appointments for Sat, May 15th. Much to my surprise, a few hours before our appointments, Spa Chakra indicated they were canceling the appointment because they have too much demand from groupon.com and someone was out sick. In 20 years of going to luxury spas, a spa has never canceled my appointment! Spas are in the service business. What is their contingency plan for covering for sick employees and serving customers. I insisted that they serve my 71 year old mom since she flew all they way to Chicago for her special outing! They did manage to serve my Mom. Please note that this spa has a 24 hour cancellation policy which requires full payment if you don't cancel before 24 hours. Although, they canceled my appointment, I wasn't given anything! So much for service from a high end spa! Buyer beware, don't book this spa for special occasions!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, convenient location, not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: Bobo912
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at Palmer House while on a weekend trip with my 9-year-old. We took the L from Midway. The hotel is just steps away from the Adams St L stop. The Art Institute is about a block away. We used CTA buses to get around and it was very convenient to go to the museum complex and Navy Pier. The hotel lobby is beautiful. Our room was also very nice. The decor was lovely. They have some really cool lamps. We had a double room The room was a little small, but larger than I expected from reading reviews. I saw the interior of some of the single rooms as I passed in the hallway and they seemd to be very small. The bathroom was nice, very clean and appeared to be newly redecordated. We grabbed a quick breakfast at the Starbucks on the lower level of the hotel. There is a restaurant and lounge in the hotel, as well, but we didn't try those. We had Mother's day lunch at Miller's Pub which is on the corner by the hotel. The staff was very friendly, the service was good and so was the food. I highly recommend it. The down side at the hotel was the lack of any soundproofing. I was awakened in the middle of the night by a man's voice in the next room. I could hear every word just as clearly as if he had been in our room. We could also hear the L trains clearly from our room but that didn't bother me. It noticed it when II was awake, but it wasn't loud enough to wake me up.. The swimming pool was closed when we were there and they told us we could use the pool at the Hilton which they said was about 25 minutes away, which seemed silly to me. Overall we had a nice stay, the location was great, and we paid the $89 non-refundable rate, so it was a very good deal. There are a lot of other hotels in the area though, so I will probably try a different one next time and hopefully it will be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & history with comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: amanicen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House Hilton before flying through O'Hare and were pleasantly surprised by the service and condition of the hotel. The lobby is the most beautiful one I've seen, a wonderful combination of traditional and modern styles. We were staying for our anniversary and appreciated the upgrade to the executive floor we received, it made our stay extra special. The room was larger than I expected for a historic downtown hotel, a good size for two people (but I don't know what family rooms are like). The amenities were basic but we loved the bathrobes and abundance of pillows. Hiltons have the best beds, that's usually reason enough for me to stay in one.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Deargoodbye
Reviews.Content: I stayed for just one night but fell in love with the room. I believe it was one of the recently renovated rooms and I just loved everything about it. Sure, there wasn't a mini-bar/fridge but since I was just staying a night it wasn't a huge deal. The room was a double and was a pretty decent size. A friend and her husband were in a single bed room and it seemed that their room was much smaller including the bathroom. Seeing how we snagged this hotel at just $89 a night I feel I got my money's worth and more. The hotel is within walking distance of some great sights and the L.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good Loop locaton”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night for a business meeting. It's a very good location for business in the Loop, the Merchandise Mart, and is a short walk to the Art Istitute of Chicago, theater, and the opera. Macy's in the grand olf Marshall Field's building is a short walk away. It's not a bad walk to the tony mega-shopping district of North Michigan Avenue, although some may prefer a cab. While there are glitzier hotels, you can often get a good rate here since it is so large. You can spend the savings on a good dinner. The room felt recently renovated and very fresh (deatils below.) The public rooms are beautiful in a turn-of-the-last-century grandeur. I have visited the hotel a number of times over the years, and the most recent lobby redo is very welcome. There is a convivial bar and lounge area that makes for a very sociable atmosphere - some past years, the lack of furnishings made the place feel less inviting. Now it's back to being a social venue. Room 13157 had only a double bed as requested (usually there's more floor space when I ask for a smaller bed when I am staying alone than if the bed were larger or with two beds.) Very comfy bed and an assortment of pillows. The room does not set records for spaciousness, but it felt like a good size as a result. There is plenty of drawer and storage space, although the closet felt small with the retro-fit safe. The view of was of an alley and airshaft, but it was also quiet, if dark. The room ALMOST has all the typical business-class amenities (ironing board, hairdryer, toiletries, etc.) EXCEPT a coffee maker, which I miss having. Also: no minibar or fridge, which I don't miss. Spotless housekeeping throughout. Annoying things: there is the situation of the duvet without a top sheet, but you can remove the inside comforter easily if you are too warm and use the wool blanket stored in the closet. Also: there is an internet charge approx. $15, which I always find annoying, but less so since the rate was good. The bathroom is very small, although it also felt recently renovated. There is good counterspace to spread out. The tub doesn't fill as fast as I'd like, but at least there is a tub, contrary to the shower-only rooms that seem to be a renovation trend at other hotels. Very professional and friendly service throughout. The hotel had a nice promotion when I was there for guests: a $50 credit for any spa services at the on-site spa. Unfortunately, I was too busy to take advantage. There is a Starbucks at street level, and a newsstand/gift shop. Some complain about the high cost of parking at hotels and lots in downtown Chicago. Get used to it. It is approx. $40 self-park and $50 valet at this hotel, which is in line with many other hotels. The City of Chicago tries to discourage ANYONE from driving car in, and charges high rates even for city lots. There is the odd open lot here and there where you can get away with under $20 for an early-in or late-in rate, but its how it is downtown. While this hotel often charges a higher rack rate that you expect to Hilton policies, they often have very good rates at the last minute since this is a BIG hotel to fill up.

Reviews.Title: “There are Better Choices in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: FlyRight
Reviews.Content: I just went to a company meeting at this hotel with about 400 colleagues. This is a Hilton Hotel property in downtown Chicago. This hotel clearly caterers to conferences and if you don't like tons of people milling around the lobby you'll hate it. I saw people sitting on the ground with computers and some even sleeping on lobby furniture. You cannot be a truly 5 star hotel and caterer to large conferences- the luxury feel (no matter how grand the lobby) is lost when 20 somethings are in jeans everywhere and sleeping in the lobby between conference sessions. The lobby is grand from the bygone era, so if you like W style hotels forget it. The staff were helpful and quick. The rooms are small and a little dated. Old big box TVs are still in the rooms, as opposed to flat screens. And yes, there are no coffee makers in the rooms. I just think that is ridiculous- I don't need a $14 pot of coffee from room service. Finally, I may not know my way around Chicago that well but I did not find the location very good. Right around the immediate block of the hotel it almost seemed seedy. You have a lot of other choices in Chicago at all price points- I'd look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “antique but didn't seem old”
Reviews.Author: abst14
Reviews.Content: Historic hotels often smell and seem very old but not this property. It's a little gaudy in the lobby but the rooms were very pretty and well appointed. Small but well decorated. The corridors are long and maze like and three separate elevators depending on the floor level. Getting to your room can take a long time if you are in a hurry. Being a full service hotel means you have to tip everyone on top of the expensive rates. It's close to Michigan Avenue and surrounded by many stores and restaurants but the immediate area is a little run down. It's a quick walk to to everywhere. No need for a car. No hotel gift shop - there's a small store next to the hotel but it's not part of the hotel. Expensive property.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Lobby - but everything else...”
Reviews.Author: sergeik
Reviews.Content: This is a magnificent hotel lobby, but once you get to your rooms, not as magnificent. The hotel is showing its age - and the rooms are still small. The beds and pillows really need to be replaced as they're old and worn out. Suprisingly, there were no coffee/tea makers in the rooms - not like the other grand Chicago Hilton or other hotels in town. The staff was really great and freindly, but if you want to stay there, be sure to get a room far away from the "loop". That train rattles the room when it zips by. As far as recommending the Palmer - there are better hotels in Chicago than this one, but you have to at least stop by and see the ornate lobby. It's a block away from the Art Institute of Chicago - a must see as well. I'd not recommend this due to its age and small rooms/value.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent architecture and great service in the heart of Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: RoamingRoman4
Reviews.Content: We selected this because it was a conference hotel, and were thrilled that we did. The Palmer House is a beautiful, historic hotel located in the Loop. The Orange Line train brought us directly from Midway to our hotel. Other trips on the Red Line were just as easy. This was the most convenient location possible. State Street stores had all that we needed, there were restaurants galore, and the Art Institute is only a five minute walk away. Service was excellent. Being a luxury hotel in a big city, they do get you for extras like Internet. Don't pay the extra money; go next door to the Corner Bakery restaurant and use their free Wi Fi. Parking is exorbitant, although typical for Chicago ($40/24 hours). One nice feature is the free boarding pass printout in the business center. The room was spacious, comfortable, and beautifully appointed. I would like to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, good location, beautiful property but not a good valule”
Reviews.Author: Juneblossom16
Reviews.Content: Super small rooms but a really beautiful historic property. The line to check-in was horrible and there weren't enough people working on the Tuesday afternoon that I checked in. The rate is also a little overpriced considering there was a daily fee to use the gym and the Internet was $14.99 a day (I got it complimentary because I was on my company's contracted rate). I did like the Potter's Bar - had a contemporary feel and was pretty cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Good buy, small bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: INtravelers
Reviews.Content: This is a great old hotel right in the heart of things. Price is right. Only caution is: The bathroom is very small. If you are anything bigger than a size 12...use the stool down in the lobby area. No kidding.....The shower/tub isn't any wider. It's very deep though. The bathroom itself is nice, however the space the toilet sits in is 2 feet across at most. Our view out our window was the "L", it was a little noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Common Areas, Average Otherwise”
Reviews.Author: Counterweight
Reviews.Content: The Palmer Hilton House is a wonderful structure with incredible lounges and restaurants. The location is very good for downtown access. It has all the amenities and services you would expect from a Hilton business hotel. My biggest problem with the hotel was the small rooms. I felt like I was in a downtown London hotel. The bathrooms were particularly small, and the overall decor within the room felt dated. I travel a fair amount for business and I'm quite adept at traveling light and minimizing my spread within a hotel room, but I found it difficult to get comfortable even for a 2 night stay. There was nothing fundamentally wrong with this hotel, and I would consider staying there again in the future or even recommending it to friends or colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Palmer house is still a grand old hotel”
Reviews.Author: clbd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palmer House Hilton in 1996 and 1997 for conferences. Thought this hotel and the rooms were beautiful and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful then too. Thanks to a recent hotel deal I jumped at the chance to stay at the Palmer House for our family's recent Chicago trip. Pros: The door staff are quick and friendly. I like being greeted when I get out of the cab with a cheery, welcome home or welcome back. The rooms were clean and kept well stocked. The room was quiet in terms of inside noises (cannot block out all of the outside noise from the city and the El but it was fine). Loved the deeper bathtub since I could soak away tired aches after day after day of touristing. Having our room upgraded to one with two bathrooms was a nice surprise, even if the beds were only doubles (Two bathrooms with three gals in our room? Fantastic!). Concierge people were friendly and thorough. Staff can be as available as you want, but stays in the background otherwise. Location, location, location. Milennium Park and Chicago Institute of Arts within a couple of blocks, Willis Tower too if you do not mind a longer walk. Cons: Checked in around 3 p.m. and the front desk was sllloooowww to respond to the fact that there was a line several people long waiting to check in and that they needed more check-in staff. Hallways to our room were very chilly even though it was beautiful outside (70+ degrees). Minor really for both of these. I really like this hotel a lot and will stay here again if I have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: connie097
Reviews.Content: we will always stay here when we go back to Chicago. wonderfull service everyone was very helpful. rooms were very nice, a little small and could tell a little dated but looked like they have started updating them. the web site needs to go more into the history of this hotel, it makes you want to go into every nook and cranny. just a wonderful hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought”
Reviews.Author: travelista63
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really beautiful and most of the hotel staff was very friendly except the bellhop that delivered our luggage an hour late and waited for a tip. The guys that met us outside were so nice even though it was 10 p.m. and we were both frustrated, hungry and tired. The overnight parking was kind of expensive ($51) a night, but omg it's worth it! The traffic and driving there is crazy. You don't even need a car. It's like New York, walk or take a cab which is inexpensive.The concierge was great! They knew everything and if they didn't they would find out and no matter how many times you kept having to ask for directions or information about something they were more than happy to help. The room was a little on the small side but it felt cozy, it felt like I was in my bedroom at home, and not so foreign. These are probably the best hotel beds I have ever slept on, and I have a bad back. They were awesome to have after walking and sightseeing for hours. I thought the room service would have better food, but why would you want room service where there is something delicious to eat on every corner? The local is excellent! There isn't any thing you can't walk to. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for families with young children. It is a luxury hotel for adults, that has a sophisticated and relaxing atmosphere. You can check on the t.v. so no waiting in long lines. Really like staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Stately, lives up to it's reputation”
Reviews.Author: shendrix
Reviews.Content: I was hestitant to stay here after reading a lukewarm recommendation in Frommer's, but the hotel was wonderful. Gorgeous rooms and friendly staff. We paid $39.00 extra per night for the Executive Level and it was well worth it. We had a nice continental breakfast and afternoon snacks daily, plus the elevator was awesome as it only went to the two Executive level floors, which were on floors 22-23. No views from the room, but we didn't mind. Easy walking distance to everything you need. The lobby is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel overbooked, bumped into reception rooms on camp beds, better service at the Quality Inn, Orlando! disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Ken006
Reviews.Content: We had a party of six including a 74 and 69 year old grand parents but were advised at check-in that our rooms had been ancelled via email from our tour operator. No proof of this could be provided and I strongly suspect that this was a simple case of overbooking and as tourist ( non corporate clients ). We had no opion but to accept being put up in two reception rooms on camp beds for the first night of our three night stay. On the second night when we moved to our actual rooms there were only two beds in each room when we had clearly booked for six adults ( daughter and son 18 and 15 ). When we requested two additional camp beds a very abrupt desk clerk ( Sean ) suggested this would cost an additional $40 per bed per night. A further visit to the reception to confront Sean and his manager Fayth managed to get a concesion on the charge but the whole experience left a very bitter taste and complete ruined the Chicago leg of our trip which was supposed to be the big treat. For completeness I would say we maganaged to extract $200 credit for the restaraunt but with a $36 cover charge for a party of six, six soups and burgers came to $260! not enough really for the inconvenience caused.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: M11Stephen
Reviews.Content: When i booked a reservation at the Palmer House I was expecting a luxurious, memorable experience. The lobby of the Palmer House is absolutely beautiful. The location is great. L stations are within a block of the hotel. The rooms and amenities were not so great. The room was beautifully decorated and clean but that's where the appeal of the room ends. There was no WIFI and the TV had about 40 channels. At a four star hotel I would expect over a hundred channels and WIFI. I didn't travel to Chicago to watch TV and surf the internet so that wasn't that big of a deal. The mattresses and sheets were comfy but there was only one very thin comforter on the bed. I woke up in the middle of the night freezing and couldn't find any additional bedding in the room. The walls of the hotel are also paper thin. The term paper thin may be generous. There was absolutely no sound proofing in the walls. I could hear everything from the occupants of the room next door taking showers, turning on and off the sink, talking, and I'm pretty sure I heard someone snoring. Also, anytime someone walked by in the hallway, you knew about it. God forbid you should have little kids staying in the vicinity of your room. At one point in the night, I was awoken by the sound of someone talking and the voice was so loud and clear I thought someone was in my room. Its not like these people were having a screaming match outside of my hotel room. They were talking at a normal voice level but due to the paper thin wells I could hear it clearly. This shouldn't be happening at a four star Hilton hotel. I've stayed at two star hotels where the rooms were better insulated from outside noise. If you enjoy a goods night sleep steer clear of here. My experience was not terrible but it was far from great. Its not like there were blood stains in the bathtubs or dead cockroaches. However, at a four star hotel of the Hilton brand, I shouldn't be able to hear people in other rooms snoring and I shouldn't be able to clearly hear people in the hallway. Its not like the guests in the rooms around mine were having some loud party. I don't know if all of the rooms in the hotel are like this. I was in a standard room on I believe the 20th or 22nd floor. This hotel was recommended to me by my mother. My mother also had to deal with a noise issue. Her room was next to a loud generator or some sort of machinery that kept her up all night. She also payed extra to stay on the executive level. Again, this is unacceptable for a four star hotel. If you plan on barhopping and coming back to the hotel and passing out cold, I would recommend this place. However if you plan on staying conscious and going to sleep sober I would steer clear of this place. If you do end up here bring some earplugs and strong sleeping pills. My experience is something I would expect from a two or three star hotel, not a "famous and historic" four star Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Free upgrade to suite on Executive Floor, Beautiful older hotel. Knows how to treat Diamond members.”
Reviews.Author: MilitaryTravelleer
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown. Treat Hilton Diamond guests like royalty! Paid military rate, but upgraded to huge suite on Exec Floor with private elevator. The executive lounge features a full bar and has a free dinner. The hotel takes pride in it's opulent presentation and professional serving staff. The location is convenient and my staff always asks to stay at this hotel. I prefer it to other comparable Chicago properties.

Reviews.Title: “Grand oppulence and classical designs with an excellent location-- and priced at a premium”
Reviews.Author: GOPBI
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night (March 30, 2010) as this is our designated crew hotel for all longer layover crew stays while in Chicago. This also happens to be the â€œdowntownâ€� crew hotel for several major airlines. I love this hotel for its location and â€œgrandeur". Walking into this hotel is like stepping back into time to a truly classical elegant hotel. Its location is also excellentâ€”one short block off Michigan Avenue, the main â€œstripâ€� of downtown Chicago. Lobby / Check-in: The lobby is probably the most impressive of any hotel and it is nothing short of breathtaking. Classical architecture with high vaulted ceilings, ornate carpets, accents of gold everywhere. Itâ€™s opulent to say the least. The lobby is an excellent photo-op for the out-of-town-- not to be missed. Room: My room was a mid-level standard. The overall room dÃ©cor is a throw back to the classical Victorian era complete with wood-work ceiling trim. The room is set in darker olive, teak and deep mahogany colors, very elegant and stately. I had a nice view of the surrounding area from the 6th floor, but unless you are on the uppermost floors, your view will be somewhat limited to the buildings in the surrounding blocks. The windows were of decent size and the drapes cut much of the daylight, but are not â€œblack-outâ€� drapes. If youâ€™re a light sensitive sleeper, you may find this difficult after sunrise hours. The glass and walls are reasonably well sound and heat insulated; I didnâ€™t detect any outside sounds or cold drafts. My room had a small semi-circular work desk with multi-power plugs and direct lamp lighting. There is also in-room (chargeable) hi-speed internet access. The flat-screen TV had full national cable channels, movie channels, pay-per-view movies and several foreign language options as well. The TV is also interactive and you can conduct some hotel business, such viewing your current folio (bill) as well as completing the check-out payment process, directly thru the TV system. There was also a self-service stocked coffee/tea maker and min-bar and a half-sized ironing board and travel iron (in the full sized closet). The bed was a true double. It was firm but not overly so. I slept quite soundly as usual. The sheets were nice and quit soft- not typically scratchy. The duvet was sufficiently warm and more than ample. There were several full sized foam pillows provided (you can request down feather pillows from housekeeping if necessary). The room temperature and fan speed can be controlled within pre-set limits from an in-room control panel. Bathroom: The bathroom was ample sized and done in marble and dark mahogany colors as well. It was equipped with a combination tub/shower unit. The water pressure was excellent and the hot water ran hot very quickly. There was a adjustable no-fog magnification (make-up) mirror provided as well as a plug-in hair dryer. There is also a nice selection of Hilton-branded pre and post-bath toiletries supplied. Everything in my room and bathroom was in proper working order and was sufficiently clean and sanitary as I would expect. Hotel facilities and Amenities: Surprisingly, this hotel does have a rather limited number of dining options. There is only one true full service sit-down restaurant- serving all three sittings, a lobby-level lounge with cocktails, drinks and light fare and a lobby bar for drinks. The lobby bar does feature one of Chicagoâ€™s best and most famous â€œAfternoon Teaâ€� services. Reservations for this daily event are suggested as it tends to book full daily. Given Chicagoâ€™s range of excellent culinary options- all with an easy walk or a short cab/taxi/subway ride away, you are not captive to the hotel for eating options by any means. As for guest amenities the hotel features an in-house branch of the famous Chakra Spas. Contained within the Spa property is an excellent and large workout room with numerous exercise machines, free weights, aerobic classrooms (with scheduled classes) and personal training available. There is also a mid-sized heated pool as well. You can do pool aerobics or lap swim. The Spa and related services are priced in line with other branches of the Chakra Spas- and can be charged/billed to your hotel guest folio/account. As I would expect any business-oriented hotel, there is a decent sized business center complete with computers (PC and Mac) print/copy/fax facilities- all with appropriate charge. They can also arrange for pick-up and/or delivery of your UPS, FedEx, DHL packages or standard US Mail. There is also ATM and foreign exchange services on property, as well as a sundry and general gift shop. This hotel is also â€œpet friendlyâ€� and can accommodate selected pets with advance notice and fee. SUMMARY: This hotel has a very grand and opulent look and feel. It is one of Chicagoâ€™s famous and older properties, but is well cared for and maintained. This hotel is not for those seeking modern and sleek, but rather classic and stated elegance. Rooms are average to smaller than average, but with classical architecture finishing and furnishings. While there are a rather limited number of full service sit-down restaurants on property, however, given the hotels location, you are can very easily walk/ride to any number of excellent restaurants nearby. The hotelâ€™s Afternoon Tea service is not to be missed. The hotel staff is unfailingly pleasant and will help as asked and treats you as a respected guest. PROS: Stunning dÃ©cor, architecture and design. You feel as if youâ€™re staying at a palace or such. Location is superb- only one block off Chicagoâ€™s Michigan Avenue and access to the metro (subway) is nearby. One of the most elegant Afternoon Tea services in town. CONS: This hotel is priced at a premium to other properties in the same area and many of the hotels features (such as spa, in-room internet and parking) come with steep surcharges.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect special service”
Reviews.Author: stlgir1
Reviews.Content: In general, the Palmer is a nice hotel in a great location. Specifically, the staff at the Palmer lacks attention to detail. We were traveling with a large group and had some special needs that were not met by either front desk or housekeeping. Some of our special requests were fulfilled after we asked twice, but others were either ignored or not handled correctly. I would recommend it to couples who just need a nice room in a good location. I would not recommend it to anyone who may need a little help or special treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: db2102
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here at least 4 times, and always have a great experience. The lobby is huge and stunning. The bar is always packed and it's a fun place for a drink, and well as beautiful. There are lots of shops and places to eat under the hotel, and it is also located pretty centrally in the loop, with the El right outside the rear entrance, so it's very convenient. The rooms are beautiful. Not sure if they've finished the renovation, as I've stayed in both old and new rooms, but they're always great. Some are very small, but since you generally don't go on vacation to stay in your hotel, this doesn't bother me. Everything is always clean. The breakfast on the club floor is fabulous, as is the club itself, with lots of comfortable seating. The value is incredible; this is one of the least expensive hotels in downtown Chicago, probably because of the sheer volume (the hotel is gigantic), and you really do get a great experience. I try to never stay anywhere else when I'm in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Old, Tired, and Lifeless”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: I am in and out of Chicago a lot and typically stay at one of the Hilton family hotels. I have been to the Palmer House Hilton on many occasions, but it had been a few years. Really the only nice thing about the hotel is the lobby. Take that away and you are staying in a low-rent hotel. Virtually everything about it is old and tired. The staff is less than enthused and they really reflect the hotel itself. Although generally clean there is no pride of workmanship when it comes to maintaining the hotel. Chicago is a city of endless hotel possibilities so why would one want to stay at the Palmer House? Last time for me.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobs-big-vacation
Reviews.Content: Yes, the bathrooms are small. Yes, there is no free wifi or coffeemakers. Yes, lobby chairs are unpleasantly stained. but... The hotel is superbly located for most, if not all attractions. The rooms are beautifully furnished, spotlessly clean,comfortable and quiet. There is a Starbucks in the basement! The lobby has an art deco bar and lounge that is the place to unwind, whether it is classical music in the background or dance. It would be a very easy decision to return to this hotel. Big thumbs up to for the Weber Grill. Big thumbs down for Harry Careys (poor service and overrated food)

Reviews.Title: “Outdated”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMags11
Reviews.Content: I could not be more dissapointed! Ou room was so outdated I could not believe it! We had room 17-255 and the floor was uneven, the bathroomtowel rack was holding on for dear life. Our oom looked like it has not been remodled or touched since they originally built the hotel. The staff is great but I will never book a night at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, needed a better room”
Reviews.Author: laurussell
Reviews.Content: The historic Palmer House has undergone a beautiful renovation, but it's hard to change the size of the rooms. Our king was so small, we could barely move around. The bathroom was good for one person only, and that's if you kept the door open. Finally, the walls seemed paper thin. I would go back, but only if I made very sure what room I was getting and where it was located. The staff was great!

Reviews.Title: “A grand hotel in central Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jacklbarnhart
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite Chicago hotel. The location is wonderful. The rooms are grand and very historical. The restaurant is great. This hotel has charm. This is not a cookie cutter hotel, like many chain hotels are. You will totally enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: iywv
Reviews.Content: The room is extremely small, but is clean and suffices for basic needs. It is right in front of the railway, but our room faced the other side and we were not bothered by the noise at all. $36/ day self-parking is across from the street and is easy to find; a much more economical alternative to $52/ day valet parking. It is in a great location that allowed us to walk everywhere; we did not have to take a cab once. it's one block away from Michigan Avenue and one block away from the Art Institute. It is close to a good breakfast spot, corner bakery cafe as well as a great Italian restaurant for dinner, the Village/ La Cantina (the same building.)

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel...but the fees add up quickly”
Reviews.Author: bd52288
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Palmer House on a Saturday night in March. This is one of the great historic hotels our country has to offer...it is worth taking a trip to Chicago just to see the lobby of this hotel. I booked a standard 1 king room for $89 plus tax (advance purchase) and upgraded to the Executive Level (22nd floor) for $39 additional at check-in. Included with the executive room was a free continental breakfast and free sodas and snacks in the executive lounge. It was a nice touch but probably not worth the additional $40. Parking is $50 here, and a $25 fee is charged for late check-out. I would give this hotel 3.5 stars if I could, as there was someone outside my door talking loudly at 4AM. However, sometimes this just happens and there isn't much you can do. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Be sure to check out Garrett Popcorn one block north on State St.

Reviews.Title: “An extremely disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: rshriner
Reviews.Content: I have found this hotel to be old and dirty. The chairs in the lobby are stained from where peoples' heads have rested against them. We upgraded to concierge level for $39.00 a night. Our room was small....very small. The doors were chipped. The bathroom door was dirty and old. The cleaning service did not really clean our room. We had to pay extra for internet service. The appetizers were decent but the breakfast was less than desirable. To complete this expereience I requested a late checkout. For an aditional $25.00 I could have stayed until 1:00 p.m. The only redeeming quality was that the staff was friendly and the lobby ceiling is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Dingy”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: This place is seriously run into the ground. If you are organizing a meeting, this is NOT the place to do it. I was at a conference of over 1000 people. We were stuffed into the Empire Ball Room, which was probably the fault of the conference coordinators, however, the hotel tried to be "unique" and instead of passing hors doevres like lamb chops, they decided to cook them right there in front of everyone. I have never seen so much smoke in a conference room from food. It stunk and got on everyone's clothes AND it took literally 40 minutes to get ONE lamb chop. What a miserable failure their food service was throughout the conference. The seating in meeting rooms is terrible as well as in the lobby. People are constantly trying to find ways in the main lobby to walk by people and always bumping into one another. There are very few pathways through the lobby to walk and they get clogged with people. The setup is very poor. This is a great location but a disastrous place to have a meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location...”
Reviews.Author: PhilipW4
Reviews.Content: I wasn't looking forward to staying at this hotel as it wasn't my first choice. I was visiting Chicago on business and the hotel seemed to be a bit far from my office on South Wacker Drive. I was pleasantly surprised as the hotel was nice and the location not an issue (a nice 10 minute walk straight up East Monroe Street). On check-in I was upgraded to a corner room because of my Hilton Honours status. My colleague wasn't and was put into a small room with no external windows and a view into the jacuzzi...he complained and was quickly moved to a better room on a higher floor. My room, on the 12th floor, had a seperate seating area, two wardrobes, tv etc. No mini bar or tea/coffee making facilities which would have been nice. The bathroom was very small in relation to the size of the room but was functional. Only criticism of the room was the noise from adjacent rooms and from the El trains on Wabash Street. The hotel was VERY busy with two conferences while we were there. It didn't bother me but the service was delayed because of it. Prices were acceptable although $12 for a glass of wine was a bit steep. I queried one entry on my bill when checking out and it was removed immediately. Overall, cannot complain and would happily stay there again. Some good restaurants local to the hotel - try Mortons, Pizanos or Italian Village or for something different we went to Andy's Jazz bar over by the Trump Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: shar_mermaid
Reviews.Content: This has to be the most magnificent historical hotel I have stayed in. Nothing was out of place but the history was there and in perfect condition. The staff were very friendly and our room was beautiful with a marble floored bathroom. The rooms had been updated but the grandeur of the original room was still intact. We enjoyed out stay here so much we added another night to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Dame of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LyndaD3
Reviews.Content: Have high tea at the Palmer House. The lobby is a spectacular Art Deco masterpiece. You can walk to the Art Institute and the Miracle Mile. Some of the older rooms have been joined to create super large rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Very Plush, The Best Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: 4realguy
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It stands up for the Hilton Brand. It can get expensive as things will add up. It is by no means for you if you are on a budget. It has most ammenities that can be found in a hotel and is in a great location. I stayed here with my wife and two young kids. Parking can be expensive and is located in a parking garage across the street. I had to catch an early morning flight, so I used the business center for a charge to print my itenerary. There was a train station located less than two blocks in which I walked to at 5:00 in the morning with no problems. The last stop was Chicago O'hare and it took about 45 minutes. The cost was $2.50. The beds were very comfortable and the decor was lovely in the room. We did get a fridge with no charge because we have medicine that required refrigeration. That was a small gift at 1am when we checked in. Restuarants are located well within walkind distance as well as public trasportation and taxi's were readily available. I would stay here again if I can afford to and need to be in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but prepare to be nickled and dimed”
Reviews.Author: Margie321
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location - near Millenium Park and the wonderful Cloud Gate Sculpture. The rooms are smallish but comfortable and the staff genuinely helpful and friendly. My only complaint is that - like other high end hotels - they nickel and dime you with fees for things that less expensive hotels give away for free, such as Internet access. Some higher end hotels offer free wi-fi in the lobby, but not the Palmer House. Use of their busines center will cost you, too. They even charge to the use the gym. As someone who travels regularly for business, I rely on hotel gyms to stay fit. For this gym fee alone, I wouldn't stay at this hotel or recommend it to others who want to stay healthy while traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Diverse Appeal”
Reviews.Author: Alice_LUsa
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton welcomes all sorts of guests-on a cool February weekend, there is a diverse collection of guests: The Central Conference of the American Philosophical Association, Hundreds of members of a collegiate business fraternity, a very formal wedding reception, and attendees of a major collegiate basketball tournament. It's an excited, celebratory, diverse community of guests, and the hotel has functioned impressively.

Reviews.Title: “Best Overall Hotel in Chicago - Executive Floor Stunning”
Reviews.Author: Pakse
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Palmer House since I was a kid. We spent our honeymoon here (even though we really could not afford it at all back then). So I'm biased - I love this place. No other lobby anywhere has the grandeur, the opulence or the flair of the Palmer House. Book the executive floor just to ride in the private elevator with a COUCH! This is awesome. Stunning 2 bedroom suites - great views of the city, perfect location to take in the museams, grant park,etc... I've had the staff bend over backwords to assist me (crazy late check-out once 6pm - was on a business call should have ended at 2pm.....they kept talking and talking....). The executive floor - nice. This is a great hotel all around.

Reviews.Title: “The Palmer House Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Tredpositive
Reviews.Content: After Christmas we visited The Palmer House to show our guests the newly renovated lobby area with art work on ceiling to have drinks and appetizer. In the Palmer House's lobby The Lockwood Restaurant & Bar was not overly crowded, service was very slow and unfriendly! We decided not to have another round of drinks as our waiter had disappeared, which he did after taking our order and after serving with his grouchy attitude. Few days after returning home was checking my online billing of our trip charges, alarmingly noticed the charged amount from Lockwood Rest. & Bar was higher amount than our receipt (we always keep our receipts). Come to find out our grouchy waiter decided to give himself more tip money$! Immediately called the management of Lockwood, whom promised to refund the fraudulent charge and take care of the problem with waiter. After 2+ weeks no credit appeared on our charge and the waiter was still working at Lockwood (was this first time this long time employed waiter has increased a customer's bill?$!), we called General Mgr of Palmer House. He advised it was not common practice for their waiters to increase their customers' bill he would pass problem down to his middle management, whom promised a refund. 2 more weeks, guess what, no credit of fraudulent charge$! If you are a Hilton Honors member or not, you can call Hilton customer service number and ask for Corporate Guest Services, who will open up complaint file and investigate a wide range of hotel/customer problems. After 6 weeks with much work and aggrevation ie faxing documents, writing emails, making phone calls, contacting charge card company, being insulted by Palmer House's management whom never followed through until forced by corporate, or really sincerely cared that their customers are being robbed, we received a refund. Now all the manager of the Lockwood Rest. & Bar had to do was issue an immediate credit and simple apology, but most importantly follow though with his promises to take care of the problem instead of sweeping it under the rug and hoping the robbed customer would go away$! This review is to give a heads up to any future Palmer House guest to hold on to all your receipts and make sure to check the total against what is actually charged on your bill $! Hopefully this will save other guests from being robbed and how to get quicker results... In conclusion we will never stay at, or frequent, or recommend Palmer House to any of our customers, friends or relatives after dealing with the extreme lack of customer service from every level of management!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal; loved the executive floor”
Reviews.Author: schellgirl
Reviews.Content: I took four girls downtown for a few days over winter break and stayed at the Palmer House for $109 a night, including parking. We were able to upgrade to the executive floor and a two bathroom room with a fold out couch (I was kind of counting on that given that we had 5 people). Executive floor is well worth a few extra $ - great evening buffet and breakfast plus all the soda you can drink which was taken advantage of by my girls. Room was newly rehabbed and spacious. Hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays and had lots of old charm. Pool is somewhat small and closed early (they enforce closing time too). We walked over to the Art Institute and went ice skating in the park. We've often stayed at the Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton when doing a city overnighter and I was just as happy with the Palmer House. Who knew?

Reviews.Title: “Stay on the Executive Floor and enjoy all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: elleleegreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, as it was where the Chicago Unifieds were held. I booked our room online; I wanted the 23rd floor (Executive Floor) and requested early check in and the room upgrade option (for a nominal fee). We arrived at the hotel a couple several hours before check in, exhausted and not looking forward to getting ready for her auditions in the lobby bathrooms, as we figured it was too early to get our room, but the receptionist said our room was actually ready then and we were welcome to check in, what a blessing that was! We also received the room upgrade. I think it was an extra 19 bucks, we got a big suite with two niced sized bathrooms, closets, etc. It was a lovely room. I would highly recommend staying on the Executive Floor, if your budget allows. They have huge sitting areas, and unlimited snacks/beverages all day, plus breakfast. I think it was well worth the extra $$$ if you are there for a convention and will be spending lots of time at the hotel. The bed was heavenly, as other posters stated. The best night I've ever slept in a hotel. I didn't hear any noise from rooms nextdoor or barely any noise from the street, besides an occassional ambulance, but not loud. Also, this hotel was top notch for a large conference like the Chicago Unifieds. Plenty of conference spaces, bathroom and water availability; EXCELLENT host hotel for Unifieds. Also, we were able to pay an extra $25 (an option on the check out bill delivered under your door the morning of checkout) for a late 1 pm checkout, which again, was well worth it. Check was simple; just phone your departure time to the front desk. We were also able to store our bags for free (just gave them a nice tip) as we didn't need to leave to catch our plane for several hours after we had to check out. This made it easy to do some shopping w/o hauling our luggage all around Michigan Ave. The only downside was internet (wireless and room connection) was extra $$, even on the Executive Floor. Because the rooms are a little on the pricey side, I could see this being a negative for the hotel, but that's the only thing we would have changed. I would highly recommend this hotel if you have some extra $$ and want to feel pampered. Luxurious rooms, accomodating staff, great location; we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: imaswtpni
Reviews.Content: My friend and I got a pretty good deal to stay at the Palmer House through Travelocity. After browsing through pictures of the hotel, we were pretty excited to be staying at a "luxury" hotel. We missed our flight out; when we found out that we would not make it out to Chicago that day, we called the receptionist. She checked us into our room even though we weren't physically there so we wouldn't lose our reservations. When we finally got to the hotel the next day, we just grabbed our keys and went up to our room. One minor setback that I will point out is the elevators. They are extremely slow. We stayed on the 18th floor so you can imagine that wait (stairs were pretty much impossible!). The room was pretty tiny. There was barely any room to walk in between the bed and the TV armoire. The bathroom was small as well. It definitely did not come as a surprise to us because we were warned by other reviewers. The size didn't bother us at all. The room had one window and the view was just the other side of the hotel, nothing special. The room looked a little outdated but I could tell that it was renovated a few years back. The bed! It was the most comfortable thing I have ever slept in! As soon as I put my head down, I slept like a baby. The walls are pretty thin but our neighbors were pretty good about keeping their volume down after a certain time. Maid service was good. She gave us extra towels and an extra pillow. The hotel was hustling and bustling the entire time. I think there was a conference going on. We stayed at PH because of Lollapalooza. There were lots of festival goers staying at the hotel. The people were very friendly and everyone had a smile. If you were to use the services at the hotel, it's very pricey. We didn't use any services like the gym, pool, internet, etc because there was a surcharge involved. Room service was pricey as well. But because of the location of the hotel, you can eat elsewhere. After a night at Lollapalooza, my friend and I went to Miller's pub. We also ate at Pizano's Pizza and the Corner Bakery. (I definitely suggest eating at these places, they're great!) We also walked around the area. There's lots of places to shop on State St. Millennium and Grant Parks are both within a few blocks of the hotel. We didn't rent a car. Instead, we took the el from O'Hare to the hotel. It drops you off within a few blocks of the hotel. It's pretty convenient and definitely much cheaper than paying to park our car in the parking deck. I definitely suggest staying here if you have a good deal. Staying without some kind of deal is definitely waaaaay too expensive. For the price we paid, we made due with what we had.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoncJeSuis
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is primarily the reason why I stay at this hotel. The rooms are great, comfortable, and affordable, however, I enjoy waking up in the morning and walking down to this lobby. The same applies in the evening. I have never had a bad experience at this hotel as I am a frequent guest.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Delight”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinTravelB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Plamer House on the weekend of Jan. 23-24, two couples celebrating a 58th birthday. The lobby was just as amazingly beautiful as is was the last time I'd seen it 40 years ago! I'm guessing low occupancy that weekend allowed both couples to upgrade, upon arrival, to full king suites at a very minimal upgrade charge. While we were not on the "Executive Floors", the suites were beautiful full 3 room/2 bath suites with lovely views of the city. From the moment we walked in the door the entire staff ensured that our stay was enjoyable and comfortable. From the refreshingly friendly housekeeping staff to the waitstaff, any request was cheerfully and quickly fullfilled. The conciege desk is a treat. We did not paticipate in the Afternoon Tea that was offered in the hotel lobby, but seeing it being served, it is a definite recommendation. Great location. Magnificent decor. Superb service. Great restaurants nearby. Save yourself a bit of $, and take the L in from Mid-Way, if you fly in there. (Orange Line/Wabash-Adams stop) Purchase a 24 hr. CTA (Chicago Transit) card for $5.75 for unlimited travel on L, Metro, and Bus. It was most convenient and inexpensive transportation to/from the airport, Navy Pier, Water Tower Plaza, etc. We felt quite comfortable at all times using the public transportation there.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: JenniferJ1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at this hotel for a business trip last August 2009. There were several incidents which happened during my stay that required customer service personal. On one of the incidents that required fixing an error in my room billing. The customer service rep was rude and very unprofessional during my conversation with her. I spoke to a supervisor who then recitified the situation. Overall this hotel is very nice looking but the customer service reps should get some professional training in dealing with customers, since this is the bread and butter of the business.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld02
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using points on our credit card. When we arrived, we were immediately greeted by a friendly face. We arrived several hours before check-in. However, they let us check-in early. They also gave us a free room upgrade. The hotel is absolutely stunning! In addition, it is off of State Street. There are many things to do - shopping, dinning, theater. It is also close to public transportation if you would like to go to the United Center or the airport. The hotel also allowed us to have a late check-out at no additional charge. The room was so dark and quiet we slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DJSteve4
Reviews.Content: Traveled here over the New Year holiday. Everything was great. Looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: Wheels77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic in terms of helping us out and service. The concierge helped us with any request and always with a smile. They gave clear directions and some good recommendations. The rooms were clean and it was simply a pleasure to be there. We have since stayed in other hotels around USA and none of them compare to the Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent US City”
Reviews.Author: Bankhead
Reviews.Content: Stopped over in Chicago on way home from Las Vegas to London to break the journey. Took the Blue train from O'Hare airport to downtown and excellent value at $4.50 return as opposed to over $80 for 2 on a transfer bus that gets stuck in the traffic and takes longer. Stayed at The Palmer House Hilton and this hotel is a must and right in the theatre district and shopping area so you have everything at hand. We upgraded and Executive rooms are excellent with are deco rooms and 2 large queen size beds and 2 bathrooms. The hotel lobby is well worth seeing and very striking and the 'ladies' tend to do afternoon high tea in the lobby for that bit of old worlde extravagance. A very nice city and the people are much nicer than New York, LA etc and very safe and clean to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: AJMick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend trip to Chicago last May. The lobby is indeed gorgeous but beyond that the hotel seemed a bit shabby. The room was decent with updated upholsteries and decorating but it still seemed a bit rough and the bathroom was horribly small. I've stayed in historic hotels before that were remodeled much better - I was hoping for more and was somewhat disappointed. Also, although our room was at the very end of the hall, the other guests were extremely noisy, or the walls were paper thin - not sure which but between the other guests and the train a few floors below I got little sleep even with earplugs. Overall, it was a decent value and if you're at all curious about the historic hotel you should try it for a night or two - perhaps your experience will be better? We're returning to Chicago for another visit soon but will be staying at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: europa00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palmer House end of December over new years for a total of three nights. Hotel was booked through online bidding website, so received an excellent value for the room. The room was spacious, however the room seemed to be missing a piece of furniture, there was room for a chair or small sofa. Bedding, furnishings, etc in the room were all high quality and new. The toilet in the bathroom appeared crooked but was functional. The bathroom itself was very small. The tv from the room next door was audible most of the time in the room. We were on the 12th floor facing Monroe and could hear the EL train but it wasn't too bad, but I know some light sleepers in my family would not have liked this! As the hotel is located on the loop line and also on the red line subway, it is great for public transport options. Hotel valet was $51 - do yourself a favor, drop your bags with the bellman, then drive two blocks away and park in the Grand park lot for $29 a lot better than the $38 self park and really only one more block away. Maid service was OK, but was missing a glass one night. Room was always cleaned quickly enough for us. The lobby bar of this hotel is magnificent and much enjoyed having a refreshment in the lobby. Business Center cost $9 to print a page and send a FAX (domestic). Would stay again, if the price was reasonable, but prefer some other properties like the Hyatt Regency, Sheraton, Intercontinental, etc. All had big, quiet rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Charme of the last century”
Reviews.Author: FrankS7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House Hilton one night. The location was very convenient and we could walk to most of the downtown attractions from there. The room was small, didn't have a view but had all the Hilton comfort. The lobby was spectactular - one felt like being back in the beginning of the last century.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location, BEWARE gas thieves in self-park garage”
Reviews.Author: phil521
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before, both times with a great Hotwire rate, and will do it again. It is old but remember, it's historic and in pretty good condition, and you cannot beat the location for shopping, theaters, restaurants, symphony and dining. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The restaurant was pricey as you would expect, but the food was good. The room was fairly basic, but clean, quiet and with a very comfortable bed. Some downsides, internet in the room was wired, not wireless, and cost $15 a day. The bathtub drained VERY slowly, and the hotel's self parking garage was $38 a day. One night, someone siphoned about 3/4 of a tank of gas from my car. I don't know if this was an isolated incident or not as I did not bother to report it, but if your gas cap does not lock, keep this possibility in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: SabrenaM
Reviews.Content: I got really lucky and booked the Palmer House on Hotwire for $75/night. I'm from the Chicagoland area and have always wanted to stay at this hotel. My daughter and I were in town for my best friends wedding. Customer service was impeccable. The woman at the front deck desk actually upgraded us to a beautiful 1-bedroom penthouse suite for no additional charge. It was incredible. Beautiful decor, great view of the city, convenient to many attractions and walking distance to my favorite Italian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: deparker
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Palmer House Hilton many times. It always seemed like a nice, grand hotel but this grand dame is showing her age. The room I was in was very small and a bit shabby. I understand a lot of rooms at these old, traditional hotels can be small but the room seemed very tired and in need of an update. For exploring the loop, Millinium Park, and the Art Institute, the location is great. The lobby is lovely but I believe I will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton, are you listening? Palmer House has issues!”
Reviews.Author: Buckhead720
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this historic grand hotel several times, in December of various years, in conjunction with attendance at a conference in Chicago. I have stayed here the past three Decembers, about five nights each time. This time was the deal-breaker for me ... no more Palmer House! First of all, I want to know where the Palmer House gets off charging guests for WIRED internet, at the scandalously high rate of $18/day? You can't use your laptop in the bed. The service drops without warning and can be quite slow. Secondly, could you perhaps renovate and make the bathrooms any smaller? Seriously, anyone over about 180 pounds would have to squeeze and scrunch to fit into the bathroom I had on the tenth floor. Where is the coffee pot now? I realize the mini bar has been gone for several years (I never use those) but how about SOMETHING in the way of amenities? Nothing very "grand" about what I had in my room. The carpet had a disgusting stain on it, and I was actually able to make it "less dark" by doing a little scrubbing. Housekeeping? Anyone there? The room had a tube TV and the hotel receives about 15 channels, most of which are of focused interest. How about some TYLand, TBS, AMC, maybe an alternative to the single HBO channel? And lastly, watch out if you order room service. Read the fine print on the menu ... they want 15.4% state and city tax, a $4.95 "service charge" for delivery, and if after 11pm, an *additional* 18%. Thus, a $15 hamburger quickly become $30. Buyer beware. And the food is so-so, at best. Skip the fat- and cholesterol-laden breakfast bar. 22 bucks (+ a host of taxes) for that glop? No thanks. (And no wonder I never saw anybody in there at breakfast.) I've stayed in Holiday Inns, Marriotts, and even a Days Inn in the Loop or River North areas that had more bang for the buck. Bye, bye, Palmer House. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a little overrated”
Reviews.Author: jdizzle262
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for free with some points I racked up on Citi's "ThankYou" network. It was a nice place, and given its history it is definitely worth staying at if you haven't before and you can get a competitive rate. The location is convenient to Union Station and points of interest in the loop. It's a bit of a hike up to Magnificent Mile, but a nice walk or a bus ride will get you to that part of town pretty easily. The only interaction I had with the staff was at check-in, but found them to be very friendly and professional. Additionally, they were accommodating in allowing me to check-in a little early. The room was very clean and the bed was exceptionally comfortable. The bathroom was quite small but still functional. Despite the positive aspects, the hotel has a number of shortcomings. As others have said, the hotel has a bit of a tired feel. The furniture in my room was newer but already showing signs of wear and tear, including a large knick on the dresser and a completely missing knob on the desk drawer. The only seating in the room besides the bed was a somewhat uncomfortable desk chair. The view out of my room was of absolutely nothing besides rooms on the other side of the hotel, which wasn't very exciting. On top of that, the windows are quite small and the design of the hotel made the room feel very isolated - adding to the general tired/dull feeling of the hotel. The hotel tries to portray itself as a four-diamond level property, while in reality the AAA three diamond rating it received is more realistic of what you will actually experience at the hotel. Again, if you can find a good rate and haven't experienced the hotel before, it's worth it for the historical experience. Other than that, it's pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “old dingy hotel”
Reviews.Author: chitraveler22
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice atmosphere, much like the Hyatt Regency, however the hotel rooms are old and dingy (just an old feeling that you can't quite shake off). The customer service is lousy (which is very surprising) Although it's a prime location and the lobby is exquisite, the hotel itself is nothing more than a glorified Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “annoying”
Reviews.Author: slovos
Reviews.Content: sure it's beautiful. location is great. historical. and if you want to step back in time, great. if you are not a business traveller, this place might be for you. here's my gripe: $15/day WIRED internet $15 is already outrageous. if you want to charge me extra for a glass of wine at the beautiful bar and call it ambiance, i get it, it's worth it, but this is internet, there is no ambiance, the hotel is choosing to screw its clientelle at this rate. still, this is, if a little high, toward the average for 4+ star hotel internet rates. what really gets me is that this is internet with a 4 foot cable. you're tethered to a desk. by no means can you relax with a laptop in bed. no way. if i order room service, it comes with a convenience charge, i'm paying extra. i don't have to move. again, i get it. but this $15 tethered interent is the hotel telling you to come to the kitchen, make it yourself and drag it back to your room and pay triple.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: BoysInNY
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton is such a historic hotel. From the moment you walk through the front doors and walk up to the lobby, the view is amazing! It was really nice to walk into the lobby, see everyone enjoying themselves at the bar or just lounging around, and looking up and seeing the detail in the ceiling. Itâ€™s truly a spectacular sight. This is a very large hotel. There are different elevators that go to different floors, so be mindful of which floor youâ€™re going to. Once youâ€™re on the floor, itâ€™s almost like a maze to find your room. There are a lot of signs to tell you where to go, so that helps out. Once in the room, it is very spacious. We had a double room with two queen beds, and the beds felt like all other Hilton beds. The bathroom was a bit cramped, but it was usable. There were a lot of towels in the hotel, which I liked. One strange aspect about our hotel room was the large walk-in closet. It had a safe and ironing board, and it was a good place to store all luggage. Our view from the hotel was just to another hotel room, so be sure your drapes are closed so no one can peek into your room. Overall the hotel was great. The location is nice because the bottom floor opens out to the L at Adams. I didnâ€™t interact much with the hotel staff because there were so many other people in the hotel. This is definitely a family hotel since everywhere we turned, there were kids everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: travellingMaine
Reviews.Content: Palmer House is in a prime location of Chicago, in the center of Museums, galleries, restaurants, shopping. It is elegant and comfortable at the same time. An impressive lobby welcomes you to comfortable seating, genuine service, extreme cleanliness, large rooms, delicious food and accessablility to all amenities outside. I was reluctant to stay there at first, thinking it might be too "stuffy" but I felt perfectly at home. I had the most wonderful vacation ever, did Christmas shopping, went to the Museum, "Second City", restaurants. (All right outside the door.) To top all that, the price was extremely reasonable. through AAA. ($ 135 per night). Large rooms, luxurious towels, pillows and sheets, efficient service, clean, clean, clean. Best vacation I ever had! It didn't even matter that it was 10 degrees outside for a couple of days. Highly recommended. Didn't want to leave, and would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House Hilton for our annual holiday visit to Chicago, courtesy of Hotwire. The hotel's lobby is elegant and true gem. The room we were assigned was fairly small, though well furnished and decorated. The bathroom was functional, however again not spacious. Generally the rooms are clean, upscale and generally undersized. The location is the clear asset for this hotel. With the Red Line subway on one side of the building and the elevated CTA station on the other, nearly any area of the City is easily accessible. In addition, the Millennium Park area, including the inexpensive underground parking structure ($23/day) is just two blocks away. The Art Museum, as well as the entire Museum campus is only a few blocks away. Michigan avenue is a brisk ten minute walk; and the hotel is steps from Macy's flagship State Street store, known by the regulars as Marshall Fields.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Rubencito66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location (at least to me); just a very short walking distance from the Art Institute, Millennium Park, etc. There are a few things that I was extremely surprised by, being this hotel a 4 stars hotel. 1. YOU HAVE TO PAY FOR INTERNET CONNECTION. I have been in Europe in hotels with the same star rating and they offered FREE WIRELESS HIGH SPEED INTERNET (YES "FREE" and YES "WIRELESS.) 2. YOU HAVE TO PAY FOR TV; there are some uninteresting videos for free, which last a few minutes at the most, but the rest is "pay per view" and very expensive, considering the quality of entertaining offered. 3. NO COFFEE MAKER IN THE ROOM... I found it nice to make myself a cup of coffee when I am back to my hotel room from a cold street... All in all, the hotel is a perfect place to throw your baggage and go. But the amenities are far from being welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Jabezgreen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an old one and is very well situated in downtown Chicago. The rooms are nice, but no nicer than a Holiday Inn Express. The largest problem I had with the hotel is the noise. On two separate nights I was awakened by either screaming in the hallways or talking in the adjacent room. The walls are so thin that one could understand entire phone conversations. This also translates in to bathroom use the sound of other people flushing is not pleasant. Overall the hotel is very nice and the lobby is amazing. But the thin walls make me wonder if I will stay there again. I booked it through hot-wire so will not complain about the price.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Palmer House Hilton”
Reviews.Author: onemoretrip09
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in this older historic hotel as result of a successful Priceline bid. Check in was busy but efficient and friendly in the large, extraordinarily beautiful lobby. Room 18-136, a small room with absolutely tiny bathroom. The room was clean and functional with a fairly large closet. The wall paper was showing signs of age. The king bed was exceptionally comfortable. No flat screen television. The HVAC was quiet, effective, and controlled by a wall thermostat. There was some inconsequential noise from hallway and adjoining rooms. The bathroom was tiny and, in my opinion, would be problematic for a large person. Bathtub deep and narrow. No grab bars. Great shower with instant hot water. No curved shower curtain. Towels were large and fluffy. The hotel has a work out room, pool, and spa. Overall, while the rooms are small, the historic quality and location of this hotel made it an excellent Priceline value. However, if I were traveling with family, I would choose a hotel with more family friendly rooms.
