Third, this place is dirty and in bad repair. The elevators are scratched and chipped, as is the signage pointing you to your room once you exit the elevator. The feeling is one of decaying grandeur, as if you are entering something advertised as a castle but which the royals abandoned a hundred years ago. Fourth, this place just has no class. When I checked in, I was told I had a package waiting for me. But in order to get it, I would have to hurry up to the business center on another floor. So I ran up there, and then was told to pay $5 to retain my package. And it was big and heavy, and I was just left to carry it all the way to my room, which was quite a distance in this huge hotel. Beware! This place has a five star lobby, but the stars start to fall from the sky as soon as you step beyond the gildred entrance to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awful cust. service, Small rooms, Good location.”
Reviews.Author: MiamiJoanna
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House, though 4 stars in the decor of lobby, deserves 1 star in all other areas. From the moment we made the reservation to the day we checked out, we were reminded (verbally and in writing!) that we were going to receive no special treatment because we booked on Priceline. When we made the reservation, we called the hotel to find out what kind of room we were going to be in and they said, "We can't guarantee you anything [from bed size, to non-smoking/smoking] because you booked on Priceline." When we were 20 minutes away from the hotel, we called ahead to tell them we were coming and they still refused to tell us what kind of room we would be staying in "because you (we) booked on Priceline." The room we did stay in was a TINY room overlooking someone's apartment window with a teeny bathroom with a shower that didn't drain... not the kind of room you'd expect at a 4 star. When our room was neglected for the 2nd time in a row by the housekeeping staff and we requested compensation from the Manager, he said, "I can't give you a refund or credit of any kind because I see in your records that you booked on Priceline." For our entire stay, we felt like we were being penalized for being savvy travelers and for using Priceline. All guests at the hotel (especially one that's a 4 star) should be treated equally, despite how much they paid to stay there. As two people who could afford to pay top dollar to stay at a hotel and who have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels around the world, we were appalled with the way we were treated at the Palmer House... and Priceline should be, too, since they treat Priceline customers like the scum of the earth. **In addition, the concierge couldn't assist us in booking tickets for a show that, after we walked to the theater ourselves, wasn't even sold out! --Just another example of how unaccommodating the staff was at the Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “Palmer House A Delight”
Reviews.Author: MusicMama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Palmer House. The holiday decor was spectacular (all of Chicago was spectacular for the holidays). When we arrived, they had our date of arrival incorrect, but went out of their way to be sure we had an appropriate non-smoking room and that we would not have to change rooms. In addition, they provided a breakfast voucher for the next morning for our inconvenience. The room was comfortable and everything was in working order. Housekeeping did a great job of taking care of us. The concierge desk assisted us on numerous occasions and their recommendations were just right. All of their staff were high spirited and friendly. I cannot think of a single thing that could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Time for an update!”
Reviews.Author: Kindall
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel after 4pm, when checking in we were informed that our room was not ready as it was not clean. After some time they were able to find a room that they stated was clean. This room was very small, dingy and dirty. The bathroom was repulsive with the wallpaper-pealing, tile dirty, stained and in need of replacement. The shower curtain had mold on the bottom of it. In general I travel a great deal and stay at all kinds of hotels to include Motel 6 that were MUCH cleaner and nicer than this place. The main lobby is very nice but beware the rooms are pretty tacky. It's time for an update to these rooms. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchmannl
Reviews.Content: Fantastic classic style Grand Hotel. You will be amazed when you enter the lobby here, absolutely fabulous. Check in was terrible. It is an enormous hotel, so they have foreseen in many check in locations. However just 3 were open nad the HHonors desk was closed also. This caused a 15 minute waiting time. We were upgraded to the Suits floor. The rooms were great, reasonably sized, with 2 bathrooms. Both bathrooms were identic, also in size: Very small. They better combined both to one, more reasonable sized. Hotel location is great, absolutely downtown. Hotel has a large bar downstairs, also used by a lot of locals.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: CAdriving
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, incredible location - blocks to the El, the Art Institute, the lake, friendly staff, pub right next door. Awesome experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Palmer House”
Reviews.Author: Innesfamily
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Palmer House November 10 -13 In connection with a conference. Having 3 years ago had a terrible experience at the Chicago Hilton Hotel and Towers (didn't honour booking, after we'd been travelling about 20 hours, terrible check-in staff, and awful beds - with no alternative firmer mattresses in a 1700 room hotel!) this Hilton experience was the opposite - an excellent hotel. We checked in around 2; were swiftly given a large corner room on 21st floor with windows on 3 sides - I had specially requested high floor away from elevator and this was perfect, even with a view of the lake - which due to height of proximate building which is higher than the hotel is a rare thing (room 219 - recommended). Check-in was easy and courteous. Next, the beds were the opposite of what we found at Hilton H and T; beautifully comfortable yet firm, with lovely linen and even (rare in US?) a covered comforter. Like someone said in an earlier review - there was definitely a temptation to stay in these beds and order room service! What particularly impressed me, in addition, was the (unexpected) levels of efficiency and service in this hotel - it's clear that they are prioritising customer care. As an example, I reported a toilet which was not flushing properly: within an hour (in my absence) the fault had been rectified, and a card confirming this was on the desk together with a small box of belgian chocolates to apologise for the inconvenience. I have never encountered such swift and thoughtful service - even 5 star hotels can be a let-down in this area. The hotel also made follow up phone calls just to check everything was OK. Need I say more - this is rare indeed! Don't bother though with the Big Downtown - bit drafty and very limited menu - we kicked ourselves because there are so many other, better places nearby which we discovered afterward. By the way take the Blue Line to this hotel - the Wabash exit from the L station is literally 30 yards from the hotel's Wabash Street entrance. Much recommended. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel - it was a great experience; we moved to the Blake Hotel for a further 3 nights, which is a different, boutique hotel experience - but service and comfort wise the Palmer House was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bessca
Reviews.Content: typical Hilton room; but they are smaller then I've ever seen! I think if I were to go to Chicago for leisure, instead of business, I would stay somewhere else. Other than that, it is just okay, nothing fantastic. Although, the lobby is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Glory Days Are Over”
Reviews.Author: Buggs1
Reviews.Content: Years ago, the Palmer House was THE place to stay in the Loop--centrally located and close to the El. The lobby is still one of the most wonderfully elegant settings in Chicago, although the famed Peacock Room is never open to guests and there are no in-hotel places to eat, save for the ordinary yet expensive Downtowner on the lower level. But the room floors? Yikes! The ickiness starts on the elevators, with their irritatingly loud Weather Channel reports. It continues to the dank hallways with their tattered, stained carpeting. The standard rooms are very standard and, after 10 minutes of running the shower, the water temperature reached its apex of cool to lukewarm. We've stayed at the Palmer House a number of times over the years. No more!

Reviews.Title: “Our new regular spot for the opera”
Reviews.Author: kft421
Reviews.Content: We come to Chicago regularly for the opera but this was the first time we had stayed at the Palmer House. We always opted for someplace a little closer to the theater; but not any more. The hotel has excellent public spaces and our room, a handicap accessible room on the 15th floor, was more than adequate. The staff was friendly, courteous and helpful all around. When a bulb blew in our room as we walked out, it was replaced before we returned from the opera. The Downtowner bar was a great place to watch a ballgame.

Reviews.Title: “a grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: RJButt
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 6 nights here in October 2006 for a conference. Central location in Chicago and very accesssible by CTA (though surprisingly quiet area at night), superb foyer and ballrooms, very good gym, room tasteful but not super set-up for business, view average despite request. In short, a grand hotel of the old style, with huge public areas and smaller, somewhat less glamorous rooms. Tip: upgrade to the executive club (or whatever it is called). The buffet breakfast and pre dinner snacks are actually quite hearty and can save you the cost of a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time!!”
Reviews.Author: lovintraveling
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd best hotel I've stayed in in Chicago (only 2nd to the Hilton Towers South Michigan Ave). Prior to arrival I emailed the room coordinator and requested a two bed two bath non somking room and was granted my request within an hour! No problems even thought we got the room for only $100 through priceline. This is a huge bargain rooms usually begin at just under $200 and can go up to $300. All of the hotel staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. They never passed us by without saying hello. The lobby is magnificent and the hotel is located in an ideal location in the Loop. Just a $5.00 cab ride from Union station. The room was exceptionally clean. The Hilton beds are extremely comfortable. The wall paper in the bathroom was quite outdated but goes with the theme of the older hotel. The only other draw back was the bathroom mirror is small but we had two bathrooms so we had no problem getting ready in the morning, we were sad to have to leave the Palmer and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: italytravelers
Reviews.Content: At the last minute we were able to get a room at the Palmer House for 1/2 the price listed on other sites. This is great because all hotels in Chicago were sold out for this date. We stayed on the 16th floor, so you could not hear any street noise. The room was a nice size. The bathroom, however, was not the bathroom I expect of a 4 star hotel. It reminded me of a bathroom of a budget hotel. It was as clean as it could be though. The bed was comfortable. The staff was very nice. The location of the hotel is great too with a metro stop right across the street. For a last minute reservation, this is a great hotel. I do not think that it is 4-star worthy though. We would stay here again, but never pay the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “top notch”
Reviews.Author: ark1
Reviews.Content: 4 nights at the palmer house was a real treat. room was large, well appointed ,clean and classy. the beds were very comfortable and everyone was courteous,helpful and professional. the lobby is awesome.the ceiling is a work of great beauty. they have this huge work out facility on the 8th floor which i think occupies 10000 sq ft. the pool is good. i swam laps 7 strokes end to end so its not nor does it claim to be a lap pool...and they keep the temp at a comfortable setting not near boiling like some places. the palmer house gets highest marks. not cheap altho great rates are possible anywhere with a little luck(pricelinefor ex) and skill.(trip advisor is a great resource) with chicago right outside yr door a trip to skydeck of sears tower (lgt building in no. america) incredible architecture (caf boat tours are outstanding) millenium pk world class city pizza at giordanos on jackson downtown was fabulous. and i know pizza! go / bring lots of money stay at the palmer house. youll love it

Reviews.Title: “It is not 4 stars - more like 2”
Reviews.Author: firstclasstaste_economybudget
Reviews.Content: As you read this review, remember, this hotel claims to be a Hilton category 5 and a priceline 4 stars. So my standards are high - and so was the cost. They should call this place the house of NO. Everything amenity we asked for was no - no newspaper, no bathrobe, no free late check out, no queen size bed, no you cannot have a non-smoking room (watch out priceline customers, Hilton hotels are really discriminating against you.). The lobby was impressive, large and ornate. Fine - beautiful lobby. But that isn't where I am sleeping. I'll give you a quick run down. Carpets - dirty. Bathrooms small, beds - twin ( not great for a romantic weekend). Wallpaper faded and peeling. Service - what service. I get more amenities and help from a $39 Econolodge than from this overpriced glitzy tomb. I have stayed in other Chicago hotels (Hyatt, Embassy Suites, Marriott). And I didn't walk out of those feeling ripped off and pissed off. I am also going to write to Priceline tell them they need to remove one of the stars from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great History, Small room, Everything over-priced”
Reviews.Author: MagnificentAndersons
Reviews.Content: Our family went along with my husband to a conference at the Palmer. A beautiful hotel with a facinating history. I read Driser's Sister Carrie after our stay and enjoyed reading about characters staying in the Palmer. All the main lobbies were brilliant. Coming from a State that has pretty much banned indoor smoking, I was a little taken a back by the over-whelming smell of cigarette smoke in the main lobby. I guess I'm used to not smelling cigarettes in enclosed spaces anymore (even though the lobby is huge, the smell was very present). The small elavator lobbies were also very nice. Our room was very, very small. We booked very late--a possible reason why. I was not impressed with the room at all considering the price. The bathroom was even more ridiculously small. We also heard the EL run all night long, but it did not take long to get used to that. The service was first rate. Except for the cleaning service who regularly tried to come into our room too early to clean even though we had our Do NOT Disturb sign on the door!? The pool and hot tub area are not that nice, esp. for a hotel of this reputation. The pool was was too cold to get into and the hot tub is just not a very nice hot tub. Not impressed there. Proximity to many downtown locations and it's historical value made it a fun visit for our family. Not the best place to bring kids. Next time we'll go alone or stay in the 'burbs.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleLL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the PHH for a conference Oct 10-12. I was on the 21st floor, and as another reviewer mentioned, if you're above the 18th, the elevators are excruciatingly slow. I was in a short hallway off the main hallway, which made my stay very quiet - a rare find in hotels. The old building also adds to the quietness and the coziness that you don't find in newer, more cheaply built hotels. The conference areas that we were in were run-down in comparison to the rest of the hotel, but I like the old charm of the building, so didn't mind so much. My room was on the small side (glad I was alone) but clean and overall comfortable. Instead of the exorbitantly priced room-service breakfast, head out the Monroe Street doors and turn right. Go to the Corner Bakery - YUM.

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience in a good location”
Reviews.Author: nhawk
Reviews.Content: We were here for a conference only for 2 days and have no complaints. We like historical hotels, but I am pretty particular about cleanliness and luxuary. I think the Palmer House is a good example of this. It has the historical feel but I think the rooms are pretty well done. The service was very good - all the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We enjoyed the location - very easy to get to everything. I had never been to Chicago before, so I wanted to see as much as possible in the short time. Easy to do from the Palmer House. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: Alli_1119
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House Hilton with a friend for a conference Sept 13-16, 2006. I read the reviews ahead of time, so I was pretty prepared...and experienced most of the problems others have. The elevators are SLOW...God forbid you are on the 18th floor or above, there is only one bank of three (VERY SLOW) elevators, and we OFTEN spent ten minutes waiting. The room was clean, nothing impressive, neither horrible nor wonderful. The minibar was disconnected, but locked, so you couldn't use the fridge anyway (would it really kill them to let you? Oh, wait...you could rent a fridge for $30/day!) There was bottled water in the room if you wanted to pay FOUR DOLLARS A BOTTLE for it. The service for the conference was rather poor...coffee and hot water for tea were often out, dishes were left sitting, etc. The Downtown Cafe food was ok, overpriced, as would be expected, but DON'T sit outside...right under the El, and so loud! Also, they have a "beer tower" drink, which is literally a giant tower of beer. As one can imagine, it is popular with your stereotypical wannabe frat boys, who also like to sit on the patio and dispense shots into the mouth of whoever walks by...while the staff looks on (even though there are regulations in Chicago against alcohol leaving the marked premises). The service was polite enough but slow, and when you're at a conference, promptness is important (especially when you'll be spending the next five years waiting for an elevator!) Overall, the lobby is OK (in Europe no one would look twice), but you could come in and peek at that if you wanted to. I was happy with the security, they did ask to see our room keys when we came in at night (but would it be that hard to get/find one?) which is better than most hotels, the concierge was very little help when asked a simple question, the staff was ok, oddly enough, the most friendly were the housekeepers and the bell staff, we were allowed to check in early which was helpful, but if I was paying to stay here, I wouldn't have been impressed. Basically...just ok, with enough annoyances to make it worthwhile to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Rocks”
Reviews.Author: kmcmurtry
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention and stayed 4 nights here. Definitely ask for a room with 2 beds even if you're travelling alone, because the room was huge, and preferrably one with the 2 baths. I was charged the same rate as a fellow traveller who had a cramped one-bed room. The staff is excellent and knowledgeable. I could not exit my room without being hello-ed by the cleaning staff even. Good food is on every corner. There is a little mom/pop diner on the same block, check it out for cheap, good breakfast. Room was spotless all week and concierge desk very responsive. No view but I didn't spend much daylight hours in my room anyway, so no big deal. Bellhops fast and gracious. All furnishings and appointments luxurious and newer. I would HIGHLY reccommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: queenieplum
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Entirely luxurious throughout, walk-in wardrobe, great bathroom, TV with internet access. It had everything you needed. A gym on site with sauna, wonderful. Staff were very polite and helpful, nothing was a problem. Right in the heart of the city, near all major attractions. I would definitely stay there again, worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Priceline Customer”
Reviews.Author: trippartners
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the bad experiences with Priceline and The Palmer House, we were a little worried. Then I read the review that said The Palmer House did grant the customer's request of a King size bed and a non-smoking room so we called. The lady on the phone was very friendly and booked us a similar room. However, when we got there, the hotel was very booked due to a wedding. It was also Labor Day weeked. The lady at the counter mentioned that we booked through Priceline and she was sorry, but we would have to take a smoking room with 2 double beds because of availability. Then she gave us $50 dollars in gift vouchers to use at their restaurants because of the inconvenience. The room was fairly small, but extremely clean and had comfortable beds, pillows, and linens. Also, only the hallway smelled a little smokey. The room smelled fine. We did use our gift certificates for a brunch (very good) and later drinks at another restaurant. So we were actually really happy with our experience. My advice if you booked through Priceline is to call the hotel and try to book a King size bed or two doubles.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Lebensaar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome, mainly because of it's location... EXTREMELY close to all of the attractions and business section of Chicago. You can literally walk almost anywhere from here, or take a really cheap cab, or the metro or El. There are El and metro stops within a few blocks in any direction. The hotel itself has an amazing lobby and very courtious staff. The room was adequate and not as small as other reviews had led me to believe. The pool is small, but I didn't use it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: djmom
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Palmer House and was disappointed with the room. We had a king/non-smoking room on the 11th floor. The room was very small with a view of another building, no beautiful Chicago skyline, which I was expecting. The bathroom was also very small and needed some updating. The carpet coming into the room was torn and needed to be replaced. The best part of our stay there was the service we received from the conceirge desk. They were all very friendly and were great with directions and recommendations of restuarants. This hotel is lovely and the location is great, but I was very disappointed with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaylodge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I redeemed some of my Hilton Reward Points to stay a few nights at the Palmer House. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. From the moment you walk into the lobby you can tell that this place is nice. As we were Diamond members we got upgraded to a suite which was great because we were provided access to their executive lounge (free food & drinks). The service was excellent and the location of the hotel is within walking distance of many sights on the south side of Chicago. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone interested in coming to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag.. But good overall”
Reviews.Author: hoel
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is an incredibly beautiful historic hotel. The lobby's staircase and ceilings are something to behold. But there are some flaws that need to be addressed. We stayed 3 nights in a room with a king bed. It was tasteful but small.. perfectly fine for what we needed. The main problem came at 5am one morning, when the old water pipes started rattling very loudly-- and continued to do so every 10 minutes for the next 4 hours. I appreciate the hotel's character and charm.. but this is a bit much. The air conditioning never fully kicked in, so the room felt a little humid our entire stay. Finally, the restaurant/bar called The Big Downtown is nice at first glance. But then, you see the prices after ordering a drink. A draft domestic beer will run you almost $6.. and I'm still not sure just how high a cocktail is. The food is nothing special, and service can be hit or miss. I would give the Palmer House another chance.. I just feel like they've let a few things slip away from them.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!!”
Reviews.Author: yamashitala
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a last minute deal through hotwire & got a room @ the Palmer House Hilton. We weren't sure what to expect but when we got there we felt like we lucked up. Our room was small at first - but the beds are GREAT. There was a loud banging noise coming from the plumbing, when I called the front desk to tell them they moved us immediately & gave us a huge room with 2 bathrooms & 2 closets, etc. The beds are extremley comfortable, the service is nice, and the walk to michigan ave is like 2-3 blocks! We would definitely stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: nyreviewer
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a conference August 1-6. The room was delightful, the staff were knowledgable and always willing to help, and the ambiance was great. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelPitt
Reviews.Content: I'm a little puzzled by the negative reviews I read. Maybe the hotel has a lot of different types of rooms. We had a king on the 12th floor. No view to speak of (unless you count the fire escape and a water tower) and the bathroom was a bit 80s-ish, but other than that it was a nice room. It wasn't small at all, it was average size. I would absolutely go back again. You can't beat the location! The Red Line (to Wrigley Field/Boystown) is outside the door and the Orange Line (to Midway) is about a half-block away. The park is maybe 2 blocks and there are a LOT of restaurants, stores, etc. also within a very easy walk. We were out at night and felt safe in this neighborhood (and others around town). Chicago is a fantastic city and this is a good hotel. The staff was very friendly even though they were very busy. Maybe I just got lucky and got a decent room, but I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: molly-five
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has it all, Luxury, Service, Shops, Courtesy & of course Location. As Two Mom's traveling with Children we were treated with the Utmost care, from moving us close to the elevators to the valet parking. (I have terrible regrets of staying at another hotel the second nite, not only was it more coslty, the service was Lousy, you live and learn) As far as my Family & I--- The Palmer House is the only way to go, we were just in Awe!! and we are still talking about our experience there. Thanks for you're Wonderful Service & Once again our hats off to a Grand Hotel. (Jessie Mcneal, Delfene, BJ, Starsha & Dion)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ElementOwners
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here because of the proximity to everything - the Sears Tower, great restaurants, and architectural tours on the Chicago River. We found the concierge to be very helpful, making us feel a little less lost in this big city. The parking valet suggested we park ourselves and save some money (parking fees are $28-30 but valet is $38). Be aware of the height restriction on their parking structure - 6'7" and our Honda Element with roof rack was too tall, so we needed to find another parking structure. This hotel is beautiful and while the rooms are small, they are comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped, but incredible location and service”
Reviews.Author: GTwilley
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House Hilton is a beautiful historic hotel situated in one of the most convenient locations in Chicago. Pros: 1. 2 blocks form the Art Institute of Chicago (Museum) 2. 2 blocks from Millenium Park 3. 1 block from the L 4. One of the absolutely best locations for shopping or eating as so many venues are within walking distance. 5. Stellar professionalism from those who work in the hotel 6. Walking distance to the free Trollys that will take you to Navy Pier and the Museum of Contemporary Art. 7. The men and women at the concierge desk were (with one exception) all very helpful and knowledgable about the city. 8. If you don't like talking to people, there is also a digital concierge w/a touch screen where you can do anything from checking your flights to making reservations. Cons: 1. The room I was given was small. The reason (promptly explained to me by the desk agent) was because I booked through Priceline - though, I know how the game goes since I've worked in a higher end hotel in the past - not a big issue to me. 2. There was a charge to use the fitness center. 3. No free wifi and actually, no wifi at all - the hotel is still wired through LAN. 4. ** This isn't the hotel's fault, but I could barely get any reception with my cell from anywhere within the hotel. All in all, the Palmer House was really a wonderfully convenient place to stay. My deal is that I only use a room to sleep in, so the size wasn't that big of an issue. The bed was only a full sized, so if you're a bigger person then it might not suit your needs (or, if you are a larger couple). I am pretty convinced that you cannot beat the location. We walked out from our room and could listen to free music provided by the local orchestra in millenium park, we could walk to the taste of chicago, or check out if Blick had any art supplies on sale.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rose1138
Reviews.Content: My 8 year-old daughter and I stayed at the Palmer House over the July 4th weekend, and the experience was wonderful. We checked-in well before the posted check-in time and had no problem getting into our room. The bell staff efficiently and politely held our luggage on our departure day since our flight wasn't leaving until later in the day and much past the check-out deadline. The room was nicely appointed, including a very large closet that had plenty of hangers and room for our luggage. The room was clean and had more than adequate space and good lighting. The bathroom, however, was very small. I don't think I've ever seen a smaller hotel bathroom, but at least the shower was not one those horrible "low flow" devices, and the shower head was mounted high enough on the wall that I didn't have to bend to get under it (I'm 5' 9" and I have this problem at other hotels that are supposedly "upscale".) The bathroom was also extremely clean and well maintained. The beds are very comfortable, and the HVAC worked just fine as did the hair dryer and iron. The hotel includes a shopping arcade on the street level, and all of the employees were exceptionally helpful and friendly without being intrusive. Room service prices are on the high side - even for a big city hotel. I recently stayed in New York City and San Francisco and found lower room service costs so I'm not sure what the reason was for the escalated prices since the menu items were the usual fare. However, room service is an optional service so this doesn't make any difference in my opinion of the hotel. The swimming pool was clean and well-stocked with towels at all hours. It is not a zero-entry pool and must be entered either from stairs or via typical pool ladders, and the depth goes to over 8 feet so those with children who are not strong swimmers must be careful as there is no rope to denote the rather sudden drop from the more shallow depths to the deep water. The hotel is in a great location, and has nice rooms with great service. I'd stay here again on trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Even better location”
Reviews.Author: djd175s
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Chicago and wanting to say downtown, choose the Palmer House. From the outside it doesn't look like much, but once you enter the door, its beautiful. The room was a little smaller than I had hoped, but the bathroom was extremely clean and good pressure on the showers. Check-in was quick with no lines. The location was perfect. We were able to use the CTA train or the free downtown trolley for just about everything we wanted to visit! The Orange line coming from midway was litterally outside the side door of the hotel. On the other side was that Red line, right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby beautiful - rooms TINY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby is truly beautiful but the room we stayed in was incredibly small. The bathroom was the size of a tiny closet and the walls were paper thin. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality”
Reviews.Author: Chief4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Palmer House Hilton for our anniversary and loved the location of the hotel. It was close to everything downtown and within walking distance of all the shopping, museums, etc. that we were interested in. We ended up getting a fairly good deal through [--------------]considering it was the weekend before the 4th of July along with the opening weekend of the Taste of Chicago. The room was fairly small compared to other hotels we have stayed at, but very manageable and clean for our tastes. There are many elevators at this hotel, but we never waited for more than 30 seconds for an elevator at any time of the day or night. We were able to check-in at 10am instead of 3pm since our room was ready. The check-in process went very quickly as they had many people working at the front desk. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A classic, but...”
Reviews.Author: GordonPsy
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is, I believe, one of the oldest continuously operating hotels in the U.S. The staff is very accomodating, and the lobby is grand. I have stayed here 20 times or so for conventions. As you will see from reading other reviews, the rooms vary considerably. Some are large with two bathrooms (as a result of combing two small rooms). Others are cramped and poorly laid out with no view. Interestingly, the price of the room often doesn't vary---small rooms are as expensive as the cheap ones. The location is excellent. Having elevators go to just certain floors can cause some confusion, but it greatly speeded up elevator service for those of us who remember the way they had been. I recommend the Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my husband there June 24th for 1 night. The rooms are small but they are workable. The bathrooms are small - but again workable. How long do you really stay in the room? The walls seemed a little thin - we were woken up by a baby crying at 5:00 a.m. but that's all we heard. We had room service on Sunday morning and it was delivered on time and the food was great. When ever you need a taxi, just go outside and they will flag one down for you. The staff was very nice and accomodating. There is a parking garage that is just down the street from the hotel but it was full so we went down Wabash and turned right and there was another one and they are the same price. This hotel is in a great location, walking distance from a lot of events. Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but perfect location”
Reviews.Author: NNMinAL
Reviews.Content: Our party had 3 rooms. All were $238/night and were obviously in the past 2 seperate small rooms. The wall betwen had been knocked out with the result large rooms with 2 bathrooms and 1-2 closets. Great! Wonderful mattresses and bedding. Perfect location for visiting the Art Institute just 2-3 blocks away. Buses and subway just steps away. Check out the City Pass and/or Go Chicago Pass for great discount on many top attractions. Pass will allow you to skip the main ticket line(line at Shedd Aquarium is VERY looong) and go to the WIll Call door/line. Well worth the money! CTA 3 day pass for busses, subways and EL trains is only $12.50 for adult 3-day.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, quaint and good service”
Reviews.Author: propete
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights at this hotel on a recent business trip before reading the reviews on this site. Naturally, I was very skeptical when I arrived, but during the short stay I really grew to like this hotel. Pros: Great location, friendly and helpful staff (bell hop, front desk, phone operator). Comfortable bed and furniture. Very nice room decoration. Everything worked. Super bath products (Crabtree & Evelyn), nice pool, spa, saunas and fitness room (surcharge for the latter). Cons: Some rooms are a bit small (mine was) and as one hotel employee told me; the hotel is not known for its great room views. I was looking at a fire escape. Surcharge for the internet connection; a common anger point for me when staying in upscale hotels. Room service very expensive. I would stay here again without any worries and recommend the hotel for business as well as pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: RichieBAz
Reviews.Content: Took my graduating son here for 5 days and we had the best time. Stayed on the Executive level due to my Diamond status and had the greatest room-with 2 bathrooms. It's a great old classic hotel and I liked everything about it, lots of free water, robes, view, location. There's nothing I didn't like and I'm a complainer. What a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok!”
Reviews.Author: anisha2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night. The hotel looks nice. The rooms are very spacious. The downsides are the size of the hotel. too many elevators which have access to only certain floors. Its quite a maze to find the elevators that will take you to your specific floor. Be prepared to spend sometime navigating the lobby in search of the elevator. Location is good. Parking even with the discount is expensive. Use a near by garage instead and walk across the street to the hotel. No free internet access (10$/day) and considering the cost for a night you would think that this would come free. We would not like to spend another night here.

Reviews.Title: “The Palmer House was nice...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House June 4 thru June 8 while working a tradeshow. I was a little worried due to some of the previous messages but was very pleased by my whole stay. My check in went very smooth and because I am a Gold HHonors member they tried to get me on the 23rd floor. Unfortunately, the floor was full but they got me a really nice room with a king size bed on the 21st floor and told me I could use the concierge services on the 23rd floor whenever I wanted. My room was small. I won't lie but it was clean and really fit me since I was really only there to work at the desk and sleep. The bathroom was large and I love the Crabtree and Evelyn soaps, lotions and hair products. We did use one restaurant during the stay - The Big Downtown was ok - The food was good but I thought the service was slow. All-in-all I think the hotel did a great job. The price was a bit expensive $203 (special tradeshow pricing) but I definitely would stay here again on business or for personal fun.

Reviews.Title: “I asked for a different room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the room from .Hotels(--)..after looking at a virtual tour. But when we got to the room, it was MUCH smaller than the one in the tour! I went back to the desk and asked for the room that I saw at Hotels.com. They were very nice and gave me the larger room for no additional charge! It was a very nice, but older, room. The bed was a pillow-top and I did sleep better than I EVER have in a hotel...or maybe that was because of seeing Rob Thomas just hours before!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jessjess
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a perfect location!! Walking distance for Milennium Park and Art Museum. Rooms were a little small, but comfortable. The service was great. The concierge gave us detailed recommendations for everything...from where to get a hot dog to how to take the subway. I'd definately stay again. They do charge for a lot of the amenities (fitness room, paper, bottled water) but other than that, I really have no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Most Incredible Service and Stay”
Reviews.Author: mimifg
Reviews.Content: I am very unsure of the reviews I am reading regarding stays at the Palmer House. I am not even sure these negative review were from people who even stayed at the Palmer House. That said, I booked a room for my best friend's 40th birthday party over this past weekend. We stayed in the Executive Towers on the 23rd (highest) floor. To begin, check-in could not have been easier. The staff were very accomodating and allowed me to check in to the room at 11 am and even upgraded me to a room with two bathrooms. Unheard of anywhere else I have stayed at in Chicago! And this was a busy weekend for the Palmer House. At no time did the staff seem frazzled or rude, even though it was so busy. We always felt like we were a top priority to the staff on every level, from Room Service to Concerige. The room was impeccably clean and beautifully furnished. The beds were so comfortable there were days we debated just staying in them and ordering room service all day. The lighting, windows that opened (to a safe height) and all the extras were an added bonus. The Palmer House - who knew of my friend's birthday - even sent up a tray of cheeses, fruits and the most delightful chocolate confections as a surprise for her (and I was surprised as well as I had not ordered it for her.) One day we walked in from a day on the town and voila!, there it was in the room. At the Executive Tower section, bottled water, snacks, juices, coffees, teas, and the like are yours all day for the taking. The bar on the 23rd floow is open from 4 pm to 11 pm. Yes, drinks are expensive, but then this is not the Comfort Inn or the local tavern. The Concerige on the 23rd floor was very, very accomodating...everything from restaurant reservations to getting a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to the room prior to my picking my friend up from the airport and returning. The express elevators to the Executive Level rooms (21 - 23rd floors) were very convenient. My friend works out, so she loved the fitness room - very vast and a wide variety of machines. I myself enjoyed the pool, dry sauna and steam room in the fitness area. All in all, and I don't know who thinks $240 on average is expensive in Chicago, particularly with this kind of service, but the Palmer House was the most delightful stay I have had in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Cold, Dirty, Cramped.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The heating in our room didn't work and wasn't repaired depite numerous requests, the rooms were very small, the litter in the bin remained in the bin for the whole stay, the cleaner made the bed but nothing else, when we returned home my credit card statement showed that the hotel had charged me for the 5 night stay despite my having pre-paid through a travel agent, it took the hotel 2 months to re-credit my card without an apology or offer to pay for my numerous trans-Atlantic phone calls to them.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to an executive suite on the 22nd floor which included access to the 23rd floor which enabled us to partake in a continental breakfast daily, drinks (non alcoholic) all day long and hor'dorves after 5. I was most excited but when we got up to the room, it was tiny. 1 double bed not a queen and the wardrobe door that opened into the bed. We couldn't even get a bag into the closet. First appearances are stunning, but the room was very pokey. Location was good, close to Millenium Park, Sears Tower and if you don't mind a walk, Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: WI036
Reviews.Content: As far as i'm concerned, first and foremost, the room is what i am paying for, so at the very least, i expect cleanliness, space, and quality, in a $300/nite room at a 4 star hotel!!! That is NOT too much to ask for. Room 15-259 (at the Palmer means floor 15, room 259), was small and the decor took some getting used to, not at all great in anyway. See attached photos. The location was okay, right by Millenium Park, restaurants, trains, shopping. However, i will NOT be staying there again at their ridiculous prices.

Reviews.Title: “For expense accounts only”
Reviews.Author: lynnePortlandOr
Reviews.Content: My daughter attended a conference at the Palmer House in March and I joined her (I like Chicago a lot) and paid for the (expensive) room. Our room was past its prime-the drawers would'nt stay shut, the bathroom robe hook was broken, and the door lock never opened untill we tried it many, many times. My daughter needed to receive a fax, and the hotel staff told her (very kindly) that she would be better off going to Kinkos, since the Palmer House would charge her so much. I have never been to a hotel that had wireless internet in the public places but not in the rooms-there was a cable hook up and (of course) a charge for it. I assumed that the bottles of water by the coffee machine were complimentry, as this seems to be common in even inexpensive hotels. It was only after my daughter drank one that we noticed the card indicating how much they cost. I seriously wondered if the Palmer House would charge me for my wake up call. The convenience of staying where the conference was being held was importent, especially since the weather was still unsettled. But overall, being nickeled and dimed was kind of sad-this used to be a wonderful icon of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Uninvited Visitors in the Room after 11 PM”
Reviews.Author: Business_and_diving
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House offers a unique service; staff that break into your room after 11:00 pm and, despite the fact that your bag is in the middle of the room, proceed to make telephone calls from room, ostensiblly to see if someone is staying in your room (nothwithstanding your luggage in the middle of the room and belongings spread out on the table). By way of explanation, this room had a separate seating area and it was only when I was woken by the sound of someone on the telephone (I was asleep in the bed) that I realized someone else was in the room. I was told that he (the alleged employee) was looking to see if the room was unoccupied because another guest needed a larger room. Although I tried to contact the night manager twice, I hung up after several minutes on hold each time. The front desk did confirm that I was registered in the room and there was no confusion on their part. If you enjoy having your room entered (broken into) by alleged staff late at night, then this is the hotel for you. When I was called to follow up on my e-mailed complaint (I never received any kind of response or acknowledgement from management), it was apparent that the caller had not bothered to look at the security report. If you are a business traveler or a woman traveling alone or just someone who thinks you should be able to contact hotel management when your privacy is invaded, you should stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...but”
Reviews.Author: Merritt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The lobby is beautiful, and the overall presentation of the place is impressive. But as other reviewers point out, just stick to the basics. They are trying to gouge you at all turns. The room service is VERY expensive. The vending machine to buy a soda on the floor was almost 3 bucks. A bottle of water was $4.00. The gift shop was a rip off too. The location is wonderful. The hotel is nice. Just don't buy any of the extras, and it's worth it. I got it on hotwire for less than $100 per night, and couldn't ask for more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: gorka
Reviews.Content: I satyed for six days in December and I am very happy with the hotel. I think that I got what I paid for. The location is very convenient and I really enjoyed, the hotel and the city If I go to Chicago again, I will be stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely lobby ,but a bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: GuelphMarlene
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a three night stay at this hotel and while parts of the hotel are very impressive the overall impression was not so positive. I had read some of the reviews and was therefore prepared for a small room. Luckily our room was at the end of the hall and therefore much bigger than expected.The bathroom however was extremely small and in need of a very extreme makeover.I have to agree with one of the other reviews that the hotel is indeed cheap. You get charged excessively to use the internet, to drink the bottled water in the room and then they add a $4 dollar surcharge to any room service. The restaurants didn't look that inviting and the bar was nondescript. One thing that drove me crazy was that our room was never cleaned before 3-4 in the afternoon and sometimes we would come back to the room and have to leave again because they were finally cleaning it. This kind of service is typically done as early in the day as possible, not in the late afternoon. Perhaps the best thing about the hotel is the consierge staff. They were incredibly helpful and always professional. The lobby is indeed beautiful as are the ballroom and some of the other function rooms. The hotel is very centrally located but I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Past its time???”
Reviews.Author: LadyClaret
Reviews.Content: This is a splendid old early-C20th hotel, but there's the problem - it looks great and the lobby is spectacular... but at these prices there are other, newer, better hotels available. The location is brilliant - right in the loop. The arcade is good and the lobby is awesome, but the bar is extortionate and the elevators are torturously slow. Some of the old ballrooms are evocative, but the modern conference rooms are airless, artificial and uninspiring. The bedrooms are OK, but not as large as others in this class and price-range. Visit the lobby, but don't stay here as a first resort...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: secnin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend with family. Hotel was clean, room was perfect and we had 5 in our party - went with larger room with 2 baths since travelling with 3 daughters. Loved location for shopping, theatre, Miilenium park. Bus and Subway just steps away. Only surprise was $10 to use exercise facility but weather was good to run along lake. Would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Penny pinching hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJShorenative
Reviews.Content: This hotel charged extra for EVERYTHING! There was a fee for use of the hotel's own gym, spring water by the room's coffeepot was $3.25 a bottle and the internet access was extremely expensive and inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel :-)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must say, I read the reviews of this hotel before I came and I was a little worried about the rooms. There was nothing wrong with the size of the room. It was an average size hotel room and clean as you can get. I love Chicago, and I will be back to stay at this hotel. We were on the 19th floor and our room was opposite the "el" train. Very quiet and clean. The shops were nice. People were helpful and friendly. I would suggest this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is one of the oldest hotels in the Chicago area. It has elegance and charm, from the moment you walk into the large lobby with the muriel on the ceiling you know you are in for a wonderful experience. From the gentlemen in distinct dress on the curb there to park your car, to the friendly people behind the reception counters you know you can relax! There are beautiful rooms and friendly service. There are reataurants on site and nearby pubs. Within walking distance is the theatre district, fine dining, and every type of store you can imagine. I have stayed at this hotel three times in the last four years and my husband and I always choose this hotel. We do not go to Chicago if the hotel is not available. I am a travel agent and we travel a lot and I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Chicago on business or pleasure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dedra28
Reviews.Content: Okay, I know that it all depend on what room you're given. But no 4/5 star hotel should even have room as horrible as the room I was given on recent stay. Small bathroom with a cracked dirty tub, nasty curtains, dirty rugs. I found out that later that you could upgrade for around $50 but there should be some basic level for all rooms, epsecially for those of us who think we've given this dump enough money already. The plus side is that it has the best lobby in Chicago. And during our stay, they were several wedding, which made the setting even more grand!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, but well done!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very small, as others have expressed, however, this must be expected of any hotel built prior to the turn of the century. The king-sized bed was wonderfully-soft, and the sheets were very comfortable. The room was impecably clean. The $3 bottles of water in the room were insulting to my sense of value and reason. The hotel bar was expensive, but well-done with chipper service and high-definition televisions. However, $27 for 3 drinks is excessive, even for this part of town. Parking at the hotel was convenient and seemed safe. Be prepared to spend $25 per night to park. Make sure you pay for your parking at the hotel, not at the garage. There is a special rate for Palmer House guests. The concierge was helpful. We asked for directions to the Field Museum and they were able to provide us with a sheet that suggested several different modes of transportation. The hotel lobby is a true work of art. The colonnades and beautifully painted ceiling are worth the price of admission. Sadly, the lobby was overtaken by squirlly, misbehaved children during the middle of the day who seemed to run around unabated and unconscious of other hotel guests. Overall, the hotel was great, and everything we expected. I was able to get a fantastic rate using priceline on a Friday night. Expect to pay a little extra for everything at and around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - But Very Expensive To Eat Or Drink Here”
Reviews.Author: Scouse-Express
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a very nice lobby. I stayed on the 21st floor and had a great view......of the next wing! Room was small with little space to move around. Want a drink???? Be prepared to fork out $8.50 + tax + tip for a 22 ounce Sam Adams draft. Room Service for breakfast??? $24.00 + service charges + tax will get you a hot breakfast. 15 mins access to Business Centre is $4.95 + tax. Hotel was okay, but, nothing to rave about.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for this old hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What I liked best about this hotel was that it was within walking distance to the Art Museum, Millenium Park, and Mag Mile. As we entered from the street level taking the escalator up, I was very impressed at the fresco's on the ceiling. It def. gave that old yet opulant hotel feeling. But the rooms were another thing. They needed to be updated. I was staying at another hotel on the Mag Mile prior to the Palmer House and they did a better job at restoring it. I was there for a convention and my company was paying for the hotel, so I limited the complaints. My room got quite noisy when the 'L' passed by, and the ventilation and air in my room got a little stale, so I was stuck with either the noise of the train or the staleness in the air when I went to sleep. In comparison to the Intercontinental (where I was just coming from on the Mag. mile), I would stay there instead and again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: mcewandds
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews. I got tickets on Priceline and thought I might get a "priceline room" ; cramped with a small bed, and noisy neighbors. My request of non-smoking and a king sized bed was honored! It was quiet, except I could hear the subway go by, but it wasn't loud. The room was great, especially the very comfortable pillow-top bed. The pool and hot-tub was nice, but I was disappointed that they charged $10 to use the wet or dry sauna or to use the excersise room. ($10 lets you use all three). Lame! There wasn't anyone using them, so I don't see why they charge. Parking is an issue, It's like $30 to valet and $25 to self park. I parked at the airport for $12 and took the train into the city. The location is great, especially for sightseeing. I think this is more like a 3 star place. I think this is a great deal on priceline ($85) , but I would never pay the going rate ($175). It's expensive to stay downtown, but so easy to get where you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: Meg312
Reviews.Content: I am still here at this former grande dame of a hotel. I'm here for a conference so I'm paying the conference rate (US$160) which seems incredibly high for a room that is smaller than some people's closet (slight exaggeration, but it's tiny). Wish I had a camera. So, high speed internet access is avaiable in-room ($9.95/night). Gym is fantastic for a hotel, best I've seen yet, but it costs (I paid $20 for my entire stay, otherwise it's $10/night). But worth it. The king-sized bed is quite comfy. Be forewarned...the elevators are the the worst part about this hotel...old...slow...and will randomly skip the floor you want and have waited 10 minutes to get to. Room service food is fine but quite pricey. Decent food right in the area you can walk to. Go to the Marquette Inn for delicious, fast breakfast (60 W. Adams). Go to Taco Fresco (23 E. Adams) for great burritos for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with tons of character”
Reviews.Author: Chris888
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance of the tourist sites and the "shopping mile". An unbelievable lobby, rooms that are small but well-appointed, and lots of staff to help you out if required. The only negative was a charge to use the (admittedly very good) in-house gym... $10/day or $15 for 2 days or $20 for the duration of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Give 'em the old Razzle Dazzle...”
Reviews.Author: Kirkybean
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe the good reviews of this place. An opulent lobby does not equal a great hotel. My first impression was of a huge Travelodge with a posh porch. After enduring an irritable doorman straight out of 'The Wizard of Oz', we were greeted by the sight of the aforementioned lobby packed to the gills with literally hundreds of teenagers taking part in some bizarre pretend UN conference. This is not an uncommon occurence, apparently. Proms, conventions and general teenfests abound at Palmer House. We were told that our room - which had been booked several months in advance - was not available. We would have to spend the first night in a broom cupboard situated directly beside the 20-something elevators, with noisy neighbours evident through the paper thin walls. Needless to say, we complained ever so politely (we are Brits, after all) and were given some vouchers for the restaurant as compensation. The room was tiny with a great view of a fire escape and alleyway. The noise of elevators/teens in the room was so loud we decided to have a drink to calm our shattered nerves. No mini bar. And a charge of $3.25 for a small bottle of water. So we went to the bar in the hotel - very expensive for Chicago - more like London prices! And a grumpy bartender to match. No matter what time of day or night it took 15 minutes to get from room to lobby or back again, as the lifts were either not working or constantly busy with teen 'delegates' from Japan, Peru, France etc. Nightmare. The next day they moved us but after a struggle. We couldn't be moved first thing (fair enough) but were assigned a room that would be ready for us anytime after 1pm. We were also told we'd have to move our own luggage, for 'security reasons'. We returned at 3.30pm to be told the room still wasn't ready, but finally spoke to someone who knew what he was doing and got us fixed up within about 10 minutes, luggage and all, in a quiet, spacious room (view still of an alleyway though!). On the plus side, the location is very central. It's clean. And they have nice bathroom products. And the food in the Downtown restaurant, although pricey, isn't half bad. The Palmer House Hilton reminded me very much of another P. Hilton - all Razzle Dazzle but no substance. All dressed up but kinda trashy underneath! Never again.

Reviews.Title: “New Years In Chicago”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House Hilton for New Years. The hotel was packed. We were put in a lower room and then had to switch our second day there to our confirmed room. We were placed in a room in the hallway close to the elevator and being New Years it was extremely noisy all night. However after that everything was excellent. The front desk staff the following day got us a different room that was larger and had a better view of the city. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The restaurants in the hotel are a little pricey but convienent. It is close (within walking distance) of most major attractions. Also you can take a cab or a bus/train almost anywhere as soon as you step outside the hotel. I absolutely loved the city and there were so many things happening for New Years. If I was to go again I would try and see what was happening in the city because we missed so much. I got engaged in the Palmer House Hilton so it was really the perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Palm Of My Hand”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello, I stayed at The Palmer House Hilton for 5 nights in May 2005. I enjoyed Chicago, IL and I enjoyed the hotel. The Palmer House Hilton is right in the heart of everything! It's a beautiful and grand hotel. The location is perfect for; food, entertainment, shopping, walking, chai tea, meditation and all of the above! I felt secure and comfortable. The rooms are quaint, clean and quiet. The inside of the rooms aren't fancy but your basic needs are met. The hotel staff was nice and they were always scrubbing, sweeping, dusting and windexing different parts of the hotel daily. Security Guards were on top of their j-o-b! The front desk staff were professional and concierge was helpful. Yes, I would stay at The Palmer House Hilton in Chicago, IL again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly amazing. The lobby is unbelievably gorgeous-truly, it can't even be explained. The staff is extremely curtious and very attentive. We arrived three hours before check in and were still able to get into our room right away. The location is perfect. We walked all over the city and only need to take a cab because of the cold weather. If you plan on visiting the art instute stay here-its only about a 5 minute walk. The Downtown restaurant located at street level had great food and fair deals-excellent drink specials. I would never come to Chicago and not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago on a shopping trip and stayed in The Palmer House Hilton. I looked up Trip Advisor before I went and I didnt like some of the negative reviews it got.....I thought the hotel was excellent, from the magnificent lobby through to the selection of bars and restaurants. The bedroom had two double beds and two bathrooms. The staff were very friendly and the concierge team were a brilliant help especially when it came to recommending a nice external restaurant. Will definitely be back and would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in the middle of everything.....”
Reviews.Author: UMgirl
Reviews.Content: Great location right by the "L", surrounded by tons of shopping, restaurants and 24 hour places. The hotel lobby is beautiful. Check in and out took less than a minute. My room was very nice, perfect size with mini fridge, very comfortable bed, very nice bathroom and bath products to match. I did get to peek into another room and saw how small a room could be, just enough room for the bed and like a foot around-way too small....so keep this in mind. Overall a wonderful stay, staff was super friendly as well. I will definitely stay here next time in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Chicago Landmark”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House mid-week between Christmas and New Year's of 2005. I have stayed there a number of times and my previous experiences were mixed (mainly because of the thin walls and noise), but this was very pleasant and quiet. I have often stayed as part of a conference on May weekends when it is noisier because the Palmer House hosts many wedding receptions and the wedding guests get rooms and they are loud and in and out all night long. There are newer hotels in Chicago that are more luxurious and have better amenities, but the Palmer House IS a landmark. The lobby is beautiful and had a gorgeous Christmas tree. My sister and I had a 2 bed, 2 bathroom room that was huge for only $154/night (including tax). The rooms are comfortable and clean, but a bit worn around the edges. The 'extras' are expensive, but no more so than in most other city hotels. We didn't park a car (self-park $25/night) or use the high speed in-room internet ($10 per day) or eat at the over-priced restaurants. The concierge was very helpful and check-in and check-out were efficient. The bell staff was helpful and checked our bags for us after check-out (which is 11 am...you can stay 2 hours later for $25) while we shopped. There is an Osco Drug next door and many cheaper restaurants within an easy walk. Try the Russian Tea Time on Adams near the Art Institute.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House over Christmas Weekend and found everything absolutely wonderful. I read the concerns of the other reviews but found none of them in our experience. We had a beautiful, spacious room at $109/night. Two bathrooms - one was small - but we were thrilled to have two as we have two daughters. We found none of the "dark hallways or shabby decor" that was mentioned. Everything and everyone from the doorman to registration to housekeeping were helpful and courteous. Everything was immaculate and over the top in luxury. The beds were the softest we have ever had in a hotel and the towels were thick and lovely. You are close to everything and the location is great. We won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Left wanting more...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House for 5 nights from Nov 10th 2005. The staff were good and the location was ideal. The hotel lobby is not representative of the rest of the accomodation on offer. The rooms are in need of a refurbishment. The bathrooms in desperate need! The wallpaper was peeling off - Don't know why they had wallpaper in the bathroom. The room was comfortable but we had very noisy neighbours - the walls were not very sound proof!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on a trip to the University of Chicago. Our 17 year old loved the hotel and felt like he was in a "luxury" hotel! The location in downtown Chicago can't be beat!! The room was wonderful, service excellent and overall just a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great - Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Sopranofreak
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Palmer Hilton with 3 friends for a "girl's weekend". We booked a two-bath room and it was beyond our expectations. The room was so HUGE...we had space for two rollaway beds. There were 2 comfy chairs with ottomans for lounging. Everything was spotless. Very comfortable mattress & good quality sheets. Even the rollaway beds were comfortable. We expected a flimsy contraption with a foam mattress but it was a good bed with a good mattress. Great little place next door (Corner Bakery) to grab breakfast or lunch. Not fancy but good, quick and reasonably priced. Most of the hotel employees from the check-in desk to the bellmen, etc. were wonderful. Except the concierge...he was snooty & not helpful at all. I got the impression that if I was a man in a business suit he might have been more eager to answer my question. I don't think a travel-weary female tourist with wrinkled clothing rated very high in importance. On the negative side....EACH roll-away bed was $30 PER NIGHT. I think that is excessive considering the price we paid for the room. They agreed to comp one of the beds but we stayed two night so that was still an extra $60. I would return to the Palmer House Hilton when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice first impression, but average underneath”
Reviews.Author: kookabura
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby. Our room was a bit cramped and worn out. Location was great for Magnificent Mile, Millenium Park, etc. Concierge was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: alshartman
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Chicago for my birthday gift and our stay at the Palmer House was wonderful! The lobby was gorgeous and the staff was very nice. The hotel was busy since it was the weekend of the World Series. The elevators took forever, but other than that we can't wait to stay at the Palmer House again. Great location and their restaurant The Big Downtown was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: jon160
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House in Chicago on Friday and Saturday nights at the end of October 2005. We had adjoining rooms, one for us, and one for our 2 college-age daughters. Location couldn't be better. Moderate-priced shopping near the hotel, Nordstrom Rack, Filene's Basement, and better goods on North Micigan Avenue. The hotel is immaculate in the entry and lobby areas. Once upstairs, the age of the hotel, and the wear and tear are starting to show. But everyting is clean, and everything works. Still charming, but definitely not new.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Pleased with Palmer House!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 20th anniversary trip to Chicago. Many of the hotels we were familiar with were booked, so we took a room at the Palmer House. It was just wonderful from the moment we stepped foot on the property. We spent a little more money to get a room in the towers on the 22nd floor. They had just been remodeled, and they were lovely. Yes...the beds were dreamy! Having two bathrooms was an added bonus. The concierge service was personable, accurate, and fast. The location of the hotel was better than expected. We actually enjoyed the experience of being downtown better than staying on the Miracle Mile. We took the train from Midway and we got off within a half block of the hotel. So easy a child could do it! A quick walk around the corner from the Palmer House and you were at the Oriental Theater (Wicked was great), Marshall Field's, Filene's Basement, Nordstrom Rack, Garrett's Popcorn, the Art Institute, Millenium Park,and the always-delicious Italian Village. The icing on the cake was walking three blocks and watching the ticker-tape parade for the White Sox. The entire city of Chicago was electric! We have visited Chicago several times now, and we absolutely LOVE this city!! Enjoy your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a weekend at the Palmer House-what a wonderful experience! Not only was it a Beautiful hotel but everyone was so accomodating and friendly!!I will definetly stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - found it on priceline, and couldn't have been happier....”
Reviews.Author: jcarol1406
Reviews.Content: What a marvelous old hotel! We don't have a single complaint. The lobby is magnificent, the room was wonderful, the beds extremely comfortable, the concierge beyond helpful - what more could one possibly ask for? We'd go back again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug8814
Reviews.Content: I completely recommend this hotel. The lobby is breath taking and the location is great. The beds are very comfy! I had breakfast in the hotel and it was outstanding. Great choice I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations regarding the Palmer House Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A foyer like the Sistine Chapel yes - but the rooms do not live up to initial impressions. We have just returned from a week at this Hotel and felt disappointed. Leaving the magnificent foyer and ascending to the lengthy poorly lit corridors, I observed part ceilings removed, perhaps for maintenance, but left open for many days. Ceilings were stained in a number of areas. The poorly designed bathroom meant there was only about 12" clearance between the opened door and the lavatory seat, so trying to manoeuvre while closing the door required vertical limbo dancing skills that I have never possessed. I assumed that the reason we had been given a room subsumed in gloom that overlooked the opposide side of the hotel was to avoid the noise from the El which runs parallel to the Hotel. It meant that very little natural light could enter the room and led to feeling of profound depression. Each day we returned to the hotel as late as possible, as we just did not like the stygian gloom. Holes in the bathroom walls from previously connected apparatus made the uncomfortable tiny room look even more scruffy. The prices for services could not be justified we felt. On the positive side, it was close to the Art Institute which was the purpose of the trip. But the final black mark against this Hotel was the disappearance of my brand new white broderie anglais pyjamas purchased specially for the trip! They cost me Â£49.99 and I wore them 4 times only. Reported to everyone from Security, to the Concierge to Housekeeping, but nothing recovered,or offered, not even an apology. They failed to deliver the paper for three days, I had to request it and the staff on Reception seemed vague and rather disinterested. To sum up, I would not return to this Hotel and would not recommend it to any other traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: J505
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for a "girls" family weekend and had two rooms on the 21st floor. The rooms aren't large but the beds were so comfortable -- nice sheets and down comforters. The room was very clean. We didn't have a view but it was nice not to be street side because of noise. The room was really quiet. The concierge was very helpful. The lobby is beautiful and busy -- great for people watching. This was an ideal location for a visitor to Chicago. It was a short cab ride or walk to everything that we wanted to do. There are lots of restaurants in walking distance and three in the hotel. We ate at the Big Downtown twice -- pretty good. We ordered breakfast room service once it was quick and very good. We were very happy with our choice of hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kychristy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a great weekend in Chicago and have no complaints about the Palmer House. It's very easy to get to from O'hare(the Blue line on the EL train) and then just a 2 block walk from the train station. The hotel itself is beautiful and the staff is super friendly and go out of their way to help. We booked an air/hotel package deal on Expedia. We expected to stay in a room with a full size bed but for only $45 extra per night we upgraded to the Excutive level! Best decision of the trip. We had a beautiful room with a King bed,down comforter,robes,plush towels etc...it also included a nice Continental breakfast each morning,all day snacks and beverages and a great happy hour! We took advantage of this every day. The location was great..lots of shopping along State St. and to get to the Magnificent Mile was a $5 cab ride or a 20 minute walk! We'll be back to Chicago and the Palmer House!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel near everyting”
Reviews.Author: bodega007
Reviews.Content: My three friends and I visited Chicago for the first time in midsummer on both business and pleasure. Our decision to stay at The Palmer House for five nights was based on a friendâ€™s recommendation and this website reviews. The hotel is quite beautiful with an enormous lobby, high ceilings, ornate murals, gold sconces, and three restaurants. The hotel staff was very friendly and courteous, and they did their best to satisfy any of our requests. Check-in was quick as was checkout. This large hotel was able to accommodate two conventions and a wedding during our stay though you would never have known it because of the quiet rooms. Our room was very large with two very comfortable beds and two bathrooms though one bathroom was on the small side. The room was spacious enough that we were able to fit in a roll-in cot. The room was very clean and nicely decorated with ample furniture, but we did run out of electrical outlets to plug in laptops, digital cameras, and cell phones, so bring an extension cord if you carry many devices. The a/c, iron, tv, coffee maker, and blow dryer worked well. I paid extra for the fitness center which was well equipped and staffed. The hotel is centrally located near everything other than the baseball ballparks and the magnificent mile which are only a subway ride away. Due to our schedules we were unable to eat at the hotel restaurants. The only minuses are the lack of a view and maybe the hallway carpets look to need replacing soon. I will certainly return to The Palmer House on my next Chicago visit.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: mvborn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend at the Palmer House. We normally stay north on the Mag Mile but wanted to be closer to Soldier's Stadium and the Art Insitiute this time. We were able to upgrade to a suite upon arrival at half the price that we paid for a regular room at the Four Seasons two weeks earlier. What a suite!! It was huge.
