The basic living room, dining room and kitchen/wet bar area was one large room. Up to three additional bedrooms can be added by the use of connecting doors. All rooms were spotlessly clean. They even smelled good. Lovely soaps, robes, etc. Lots of large closets. The bathrooms were older but well maintained. Much better than the ones at the Four Seasons. The furniture was nice but worn in some spots. The beds and linens were excellent. Room service was fast. The food and service were great. The pool and workout areas were clean and well maintained. We had one small problem with a burned out lightbulb in one of the lamps. Maintaince arrived quickly with a new bulb. They wouldn't allow me to tip them!! Check-in was somewhat slow as the hotel has been sold out for several weeks. This is a very large hotel, so they have to move a lot of people and rooms. Also, the hotel does not have views as it is configured like an "E". All in all, the Palmer House is a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the Palmer House Hilton”
Reviews.Author: mattnkatsmum
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that after reading some reviews I was a little concerned about my stay at this hotel. I needn't have been. The hotel was absolutely beautiful. Much has been said about the lobby but even so I wasn't prepared for just how gorgeous it was (and trust me, I'm not the kind of person who gets excited about hotel lobbies!) Check in was quick and smooth and our room lovely. Some posters have described the rooms as basic, but that was not my experience. Maybe we fell lucky (we booked in England through our travel agent, rather than on Hotwire - so probably paid full rack rate) but we had a large corner room with two double beds. It was furnished traditionally, not elaborate but not basic either. The beds were exceptionally comfortable. The bathroom was adequate but nothing special, but came with Crabtree & Evelyn shampoo etc. which were replaced daily. The location of this hotel is excellent. Some posters have indicated that they would prefer to stay in the Michigan Avenue area near the Magnificent Mile, but I would disagree. The Palmer House Hilton is so convenient for public transport (the loop stops are directly outside one door, the red line outside another) that I don't really see the advantage of staying elsewhere. True, the loop feels a little deserted at night, but it felt reasonably safe. It is just a short walk to the hotel from the blue line and were able to get to and from the airport without relying on public transport. There is an excellent Corner Bakery next door to the hotel, which we used for breakfast most mornings. One tiny quibble relates to the Concierge facility. I wanted to get tickets for the Cubs and on the first night spoke to the Concierge who tried to get tickets but the website was down. The following morning another we asked another Concierge to help us out but he clearly couldn't be bothered and gave us the box office phone number. The same evening we went back to Concierge no 1 who booked the tickets for us immediately - so if you use this facility the evening guy is better than the daytime one! All in all an excellent trip. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay with your dog”
Reviews.Author: WISCGirl
Reviews.Content: We live in Wisconsin and often take overnight weekend trips to the big city of Chicago with our dog. Be warned that the pet friendly rooms at the Palmer Hilton are old, run down, next to the elevator and a little smelly. Even though you pay the same rate as other guest, don't expect the same treatment. You also have to take the service elevators up/down with the dog. Thankfully Sasha is a toy poodle so we snuck her on the regular one without notice. The nearest green space is blocks away on Michigan Ave. Not ideal for that last outing of the night. Oh - don't even think about letting your dog do any business on or near Centennial Park. The guard actually yelled and ran after us. This was quite entertaining considering the guard weighed about 350lbs. House of Blues is much more pet friendly and there is more green space nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: robynwins
Reviews.Content: We loved the Palmer House. We were able to upgrade to a large room for a very small fee (see picture of room size). The kids loved it too, they thought it was just the most elegant place they had ever been. Very clean rooms and common areas. Quick response time from staff for towels, and the like. Nice location in the city - plenty of places to get by walking. Doormen were extremely courteous and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Palmer House!”
Reviews.Author: magazineprincess
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the Palmer House Hilton in late April, and we loved staying there. We arrived at 10am and went directly to the HHonors desk to see if we could check in early. The hotel did not have any rooms that were side by side, but they were able to get us in rooms on the same floor immediately, so we took them. Our first room was fabulous and really large. It had two double beds and two bathrooms, of course. The bathrooms were small, but very clean. Our room had enough space to really spread out and relax. Our view was of the other tower of the hotel, but we didn't care since we weren't planning to spend much time in the hotel room. Our second room was quite a bit smaller, but just as nice. The bathrooms in this room were slightly larger but the room itself had much less space. This room also looked over at the other towers. My favorite parts of the hotel were the common areas. The lobby was incredible. My cousin and I spent some time just wandering around looking in some of the meeting rooms and ballrooms one night. They were just awesome!!! When we entered the Grand Ballroom there were workers in there cleaning up after an event. They turned the lights up so that we could take pictures and look around. It was great. Several of the other meeting areas were just as opulent. All in all, we enjoyed our stay. We were close to the subway, and the service in the hotel was top notch. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beauftiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiredmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed as part of a large group over the July 4th weekend. The hotel is beautiful, clean and centrally located. We would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “This is why Chicago is My Kind of Town!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: GREAT GREAT GREAT!!! That is how I would describe my stay at the Palmer House Hilton in Chicago. The dining was exceptional, the front desk staff was exceptional - everything was exceptional. And the exercise facility was the best that I've ever seen at a hotel. The suite was small but contained all the amenities needed to have an enjoyable stay. And the staff was just so helpful and friendly. I have a permenant home everytime I come back to Chicago - my experience at the Palmer House was the best that I've ever had at a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: sacto76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Palmer House this past weekend (Friday through Sunday nights, $79 a night on Priceline). The good news: the lobby is very impressive. The location is excellent; walking distance to all sorts of stuff, and just around the corner from the L station. The room was small, but we've had much smaller rooms (such as the Hudson in NYC). The walls were a little thin but noise really was not a problem. The bad news: the bed, one double bed for the two of us. This was really bad news as I'm 6'4" 220 and my wife is 5'9". We were shocked when we walked in the room and saw the bed size, and pretty miserable when it came time to sleep. While we've encountered rooms with only a double bed in Europe before, we had never experienced this in the US. We called the front desk and asked for other options (a king, a queen, or two doubles?) but were told because this was a Priceline room, there was nothing they could (or at least, would, do). After two nights of horrible sleep in the double, they finally offered us a bigger bed on Sunday night. A single doublebed for two people just is not acceptable, at least not in my book. Perhaps this was a consequence of our using Priceline, but I thought, mistakenly, the worst case scenario for a Priceline room was a single queen or two doubles.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility, mediocre customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palmer House the weekend of July 23rd. It does have a great lobby, and the rooms are clean and well maintained. I travel all the time for business and what matters to me is service - and while it's adequate at Palmer House, it's not what I expect from a hotel in this class. For example, I went to work out in the gym dressed in a t-shirt and exercise shorts (the nylon kind) - the attendent asked if I was dressed in workout clothes - I thought the question was odd, but said yes. Then she asked me if I was wearing Jeans - I did raise my eyebrow in disbelief, looked at my shorts and said "no" - she then said "Are you giving me attitude?" When I complained at the front desk, the clerk said she was going to get a manager - she didn't. Instead she called the attendent, who apparently said she had to check attire. In fairness, the front desk clerk did give me a coupon for free access to the center (it's an extra charge) - but it was pretty clear it was more to make me go away than being sincerely apologetic for the attendents inappropriate comment. The internet access was down the entire time of our stay. When we asked about it at the front desk, the clerk just said "it's down." No apology, no idea when it was going to be back up. I look for hotels with in-room high-speed because of my business - not having it is a real problem. Again, the attitude was more irritating than the problem. I had driven there with a colleague and the parking was supposed to be on his room. There were no charges on his room bill so he assumed he would pay that separately when he went to retrieve his car. When he went to pick up the car, the attendant was upset with him that the parking had not been paid for. Eventually the attendent let him pay right there - but the attitude was much more that it was my colleague's responsibility to make sure his room bill was correct. Again, at this class of hotel, I don't expect to be treated that way. I usually stay at the Wyndham Chicago on St. Clair (near Michigan Ave.), but couldn't get a room there for this particular weekend. They have much better customer service and larger rooms. I'd recommend it over the Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms in a nice part of the city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Palmer House twice, and enjoyed our rooms very much both times. Room size may vary. On our first trip, the room was quite small, but the room the second time around was very large. In both cases, the beds were very comfortable and the furniture was very nice. The views out the windows weren't always great (e.g., office buildings), but you have to expect that if you stay in the middle of a city. The pool and exercise center look good, though we didn't make use of them. Nice lobby with artwork on the ceiling. A number of shops are in the lower level. Good location to find a variety of restaurants, stores, and entertainment. Close to Michigan Avenue and the lake. We look forward to staying there again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “nifty, cozy find”
Reviews.Author: spunkygalDC
Reviews.Content: Palmer House Hilton is a nifty and special find. The rooms are a little on the small side, and older than some of the other Hiltons but clean and have a lot of character. The staff was pleasant, location was fabulous, and just an all around fabulous hotel! It's right around the corner from the Chicago Art Institute, 15 minute walk from the magnificent mile, there's a pool and exercise facilities. I love this place and will definitely be returning on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend at The Palmer Hosue”
Reviews.Author: tuffcookie75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palmer House Hilton July 14-17, 2005 and had a nice time. Check-in process was quick and efficient. As far as our room accommodations, the first room that we had was very small. After discussion with the front desk, our second room was much better. We opted for a queen room which had plenty room but we gave up the bigger bathroom that our first room had because of the room size. That was our only complaint! Valet service was great and knowledgeable for directions on the quickest route to Wrigley Field. We would definitely stay at the Palmer House Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay here?”
Reviews.Author: northstartravels
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful and historic. If you want to be in the Loop, it is a good location. After that, not much to recommend this old horse. The rooms can be tiny and ill-kept. The service is good, but the place is huge and there can be lines for just about anything. The little things don't add up-- for instance, the hotel charges $10 to use the work-out room even though it is in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy the Palmer House”
Reviews.Author: InquisitiveTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House from June 8 -12 of this year, which made my third visit there in the past ten years or so, and was thoroughly pleased. As even the most gruding reviewers here mention, the location is superb. It's close to El lines, Michigan Avenue, the Art Institute, Marshall Field's, the Sears Tower, and more. I also was very pleased with my room, and the hotel's service. My room was not huge, but was perfectly adequate-sized, with a queen-sized bed, desk and chair, and a sitting chair (I've stayed in far smaller in New York). The wallpaper and carpet were both very fresh, the bed was comfortable and linens were nice, and the room seemed very clean. The sitting chair did seem a little old, as did the honor bar (but since this was inside another cabinet it was hardly a big deal). As a Hilton Honors member, my check-in was very quick and courteous, and I was given a two-hour extended check-out at no charge and with no trouble. I had no problem with noise or the elevators. On a slight downside, I didn't have much of a view, but that was hardly a major problem. The lobby here is gorgeous, and while the rooms are not "luxurious" (but chances are good you won't be paying luxury hotel prices), they are perfectly comfortable. Some of the complainers about this hotel need a serious reality check.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House Hilton while in town to meet up with friends from Los Angeles for a Cubs vs. Red Sox baseball game. Since hotel rooms were hard to come by and we had seen The Palmer House recently featured on the Travel Channel series â€œGreat Hotelsâ€� we felt fairly confident about booking a reservation. We read the TripAdvisor comments mentioning Hilton HHonors members may have a good chance to get the best rooms so we made sure to check in at the HHonors desk. After waiting for what seemed like an eternity for a woman with some sort of fruit punch drink to go through a laundry list of dazed and confused questions which included wanting to know if each and every one of her friends had checked in yet, it was our turn. My husband mentioned he was a Silver level rewards member and inquired as to the possibility of a room upgrade. Supremely annoyed, the front desk girl scanned her computer screen and informed us that since we had booked through Expedia there would be no upgrade for us. I immediately had flashbacks to the Seinfeld â€œsoup naziâ€� episode - NO SOUP FOR YOU! She then tersely added, â€œYou have a great roomâ€�. Turns out Hilton has a very unique definition of GREAT. Apparently a â€œgreat roomâ€� is one the size of a closet that was last updated perhaps when the Brady Bunch was a hot TV show? A great room also includes a spectacular view of a brick wall, banging wall pipes that give off some kind of random, maniacal Morse code at any given hour and you get the pleasure of listening to your neighbors debate the current state of their marriage because the walls are about as thick as paper mache. And the Great Room piece de resistance â€“ you get your very own, I guess you could call it a â€œroom petâ€� â€“ a petrified giant dead moth hanging out in our bathroom light fixture. We really appreciated a bathroom so clean dead bugs decided to make it their final resting place. The place is not all gloom and doom though. What others have written about the magnificent lobby â€“ itâ€™s totally true - it is beautiful and definitely something to take in and see. From what we experienced during our stay, just make sure you do not book your room through expedia unless you want to experience one of the very special â€œgreat roomsâ€� and better yet, do everything possible to sleep in the lobby because it is, without a doubt, the best part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Palmer is Small but cozy!”
Reviews.Author: Franchise74
Reviews.Content: Reviews of this palce scared me. I thought I made a big mistake. Was I wrong. Panhandlers, yes. Small, yes. Old, yes. This is an old Hotel in a big city, what do you expect. Location was great to all "L" lines. No problems with the staff or rooms. I have stayed in Hotels all over the world, I would hate to see what people think of European Hotels. Lobby was awesome. Make sure you have time to sit and visit there. Food in the area was great, The Downtown and Potbelly for sandwiches are my recomendations. Only time there was a problem with the elevators was early in the morning, otherwise very fast. Panhandlers don't bite, do not be afraid. I spend alot of time in NYC and these guys were nothing compared to that lot. Nice place small bathroom and very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “The only big thing in this hotel is the lobby!!”
Reviews.Author: J051
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House for four nights with our friends. Both of the rooms were tiny and both overlooked a brick wall which made the rooms very dark and claustrophobic. To top it all off our lampstand bulb had blown too! We were woken most mornings by housekeeping shouting to their co-workers down the corrider who were oblivious to the do not disturb signs on the doors! This hotel charges for everything. The internet access was around $15 for 15 minutes and the breakfast was pricey. We had an excellent breafast at the Corner Bakery just outside the hotel. Don't be fooled by the impressive Lobby - that's about as good as it gets. On the plus side the staff were helpful and the beds were comfortable although, again, very small and the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: frombctodc
Reviews.Content: I just spent the Memorial Day weekend at the Palmer House Hilton, in Chicago. We paid a total of $305 for 3 nights (just over $100 a night!) booked through Hotwire. This was a great deal, considering that almost every hotel we looked at was over $150 per night. Pros: -GREAT location for sightseeing, and getting around the city. Several "El" subway lines are literally just outside the door, and the blue line to O'Hare airport is just 2 blocks away. -The art museum, Milleneum Park, the Chicago Cutural center are all within 5 blocks. -Well kept rooms, and clean common areas. -Comfortable beds with nice linens. -Free popcorn and punch when we checked in. -Beautiful ambiance and lobby area... one of the benefits to staying at a historic hotel! Cons: -Room was VERY small, with the TV in a somewhat awkward position. But, the size of the room was actually nice for us... it was kind of cozy --- more like a bedroom than a hotel room. -Toiletries were not great. -Housekeeping kept knocking on the door very early - it was kind of annoying. I guess we should have hung the "Do Not Disturb" sign. -It took me forever to hook up to the high speed internet... don't delay in calling the front desk to get the tech support number. -The website for the hotel says they have iPod connectivity in every room, but, there was none to be found in our room. I signed up for a HHonors card to try for an upgrade - it would have cost $45 per night, so I passed. Maybe you'd have better luck upgrading at an off time. Overall, if you don't mind a small room, this was a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Towels”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler8
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in this hotel. I had just come from the Hilton in Austin, which was impeccable, and expected more from the Palmer House. I found hairs on the fresh towels 3 times. To me, that is just gross. I would think a hotel of this caliber would take more care in inspecting the towels. Elevators are abyssmally slow, and the distance was very far from my room to the elevator. It is easy to get lost if you visit friends on another floor because the hallways wind like a maze and elevators are not well marked. But the on the plus side, this hotel has some historic charm, especially the grand, sistine chapel-esque lobby. Convenient little place called Jacque's on the street level had quick bites and kind clerks. The bellmen were helpful in procuring cabs. The location, right in the heart of downtown, was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pat_frm_CA
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent Mother's Day weekend at the Palmer House Hilton. It was great! I am a Hilton Gold Card holder, so we were provided access to the executive floor at no charge. Nice continental plus breakfast, all day snacks and refreshments, good hors d'oeuvres in the evening. I paid for a double/double room with two bathrooms. It was wonderful. NO fighting over the bathroom. My daughter and I believed that these were the most comfortable beds we had ever slept on--I had to agreed even though at home I have a very expense select comfort mattress system. The hotel is conveniently located to the orange line (Library exit if you don't want to make the loop coming to the hotel) if you are coming in from Midway, Adams/Wabash entrance right out the Wabash exit going back to the airport. The Red line runs underneath State, the other side of the hotel. Get the day passes available at the airport. We got the 3-day pass for $12 dollars and probably used the metro or train or bus at least 10 to 12 times. The hotel is within a few blocks of the newly upgraded Millenium Park and the Art Institute. The area around the hotel is a little old and there were a lot of pan handlers in the area. I was a little uncomfortable coming back to the hotel late at night, so we took a cab rather than the bus. The Marshall Field's nearby is beautiful and the food in the food court is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the Palmer House - Terrible Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: rico8585
Reviews.Content: First the positive...the Palmer House Hilton is well-located in the loop and has a truly spectacular and grandiose lobby. Now the bad part ...everything else. The rooms are miniscule and the staff is extremely rude. And the elevators never work. At one point, I waited 18 MINUTES for an elevator before I decided to just walk the 20 flights of stairs to my room. The high-speed internet also did not work and the staff was unresponsive to fixing it. They were having "technical difficulties" with it for the entire three days of my stay (but yet still charged me an extra $9.95 a day for attempting to get on the net) I ended up having to go to kinkos to get on the internet. An absolutely horific stay that really dampened by view of the Hilton brand. I stayed here because I was attending a conference at this hotel, but in hindsight I would've stayed at another nearby hotel and just walked to the conference at the Palmer House each morning. AVOID THIS HOTEL BY ALL MEANS!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AustinMkh
Reviews.Content: After living in Chicago for years, but never staying in the beautiful Palmer House, I finally got my wish with a work convention there. I stayed 2 nights in a miserable, tired, tiny room that looked out over a concrete roof and an adjacent office building. This room had just enough room for a small full bed, an armoire, and a little desk. The overhead light flicked for several minutes before turning on completely (just like in the movies), the shower was only luke warm (with cheap toiletries), and the halls were dated and dingy. Even the dry cleaning service returned clothes that smelled like smoke! Overall, I was very disappointed in the way the Hilton has not maintained this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: pennstate
Reviews.Content: We were at the Palmer House Hilton from Monday, April 11 for four nights. We got the room for about $116 per night (including taxes) for two people. I was really worried about what we were going to get for a room after reading some of the reviews; but, I was hopeful that my Hilton Honors Card would come in handy, as one reviewer indicated it would. Well, it did. There is a separate check-in for card-holders, and the clerk immediately indicated that we would be upgraded to a room with two bathrooms (boy, did that come in handy). The room was very large, giving us a lot of moving-around room. It is an old hotel, but it has been modernized to the point that it is comfortable enough for the rate. We stayed on the 13th floor, Room 265. Someone previously indicated that finding the room was very confusing. We had no such problem. The bathrooms in our room were quite adequate, not real small, as someone previously indicated; but, they are designed for one person at a time. Everyone we came in contact with at the hotel was nice to us, and helpful. The pastry-snack shop on the ground floor came in handy every morning for breakfast with our in-room coffee. Our coffee maker didn't work the first time we tried to use it, so I called someone, and it was replaced in 15 minutes. A complimentary USA TODAY newspaper is at the door of every room every morning. The elevators worked fine -- no long waits. This is a huge hotel, so there were three separate entrances/exits onto three different streets. The Red Line Monroe St. train stop is right outside the hotel. The Blue Line train stop is one block away (this takes you back and forth from O'hare Airport). We bought the 24-hour train/bus pass each day for $5. They can be purchased at the Osco Drug Store that is on the same block as the hotel. Using the train to get to/from O'hare is a steal at only $1.75 per single ticket one-way. We bought individual tickets at the airport when we came in; but, on the way out, we had time left on our day pass. Now, for the negatives. The beds were way too soft for my taste. I did not get a good sleep on any night. I don't think they are soft out of neglect; I think someone purposely selected that type of matress. What leads me to say that is, the other aspects of the room (bedspreads, sheets, pillows, curtains, towels, etc.) were of high quality. Why, then, would the matresses be neglected? The water pressure in the shower was terrible. I complained to the main desk, and they apologized and took note of my complaint for future reference. I was somewhat puzzled by the "noise factor" in the room. On one hand, we never heard anyone talking in the adjoining rooms or televisions blaring. On the other hand, we could hear very clearly people in the adjoining room hanging up clothes in the closet (like they were doing it in our room). Hallway talking and other noises were also very clearly heard in the room. Running water from other rooms was clearly and loudly heard. Although the noises were astonishing when we heard them, they did not occur often enough to disturb our stay. Maybe we just lucked out, and it really could have been a lot worse with the wrong type of people in the adjoining rooms. At any rate, we were satisfied with our stay. I can envision, however, how things might go terribly wrong for someone in this hotel. There is definitely potential for a lot of negative. I would recommend this hotel to Hilton Honors Card members. I have a feeling, however, that the lack of a card puts one in jeopardy.

Reviews.Title: “My Truck Has a More Comfortable Bed!”
Reviews.Author: mikerman
Reviews.Content: Last week, 4/06/2005, I spent a night at The Palmer House Hotel in downtown Chicago. It is a nice old and elegant hotel when you are in the lobby or one of the restaurants. However, I was exhausted, arriving late at night for a job interview the next day, and really needed some decent food and sleep. My room was on the eigth floor, and I was first directed to the wrong set of elevators due to unclear instructions given at the front desk. When I did arrive at the correct elevator bank, I rode to the eighth floor, and found the signs to be utterly confusing. It took me fifteen minutes of wandering around to finally locate my room. (The next morning, I encountered another guest who complained bitterly, after a morning workout, that he could not relocate his room.) I entered the room, only to find that the air was stifling and hot. I also discovered the interior of the room could be viewed by those at the indoor swimming pool, as I was changing clothes and noticed movement. I went to eat at the Trader Vic restaurant in the complex, and was told, even though it was ten minutes before closing, that they would not serve any more meals. After finding an altrernative for dinner, I returned to a hot and musty room, despite the fact that I had left the AC running while I was out. After finally getting into bed, I discovered that the mattress sunk down to the level of the box spring, and that it was lopsided regardless of any efforts to get it to be level. Considering that this room was about $160.00 for the night (with taxes), and the reputation of Hilton Hotels, I would have expected much better than what I got. The bed of my truck is certainly more comfortable than their "bed" and I did not get much sleep thanks to their apparent unwillingness to replace old mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “History, Beauty, Convenience and Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: CastleBee
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve visited Chicago several times but this was my first time at the historic Palmer House. We took advantage of a special package in the newly renovated executive section located on the 22nd and 23rd floors of the hotel. Known as a hotel within a hotel, we were pleasantly surprised at the level of service and comfort we experienced. The package includes a wonderful deluxe continental breakfast with a variety of cereals, juices, breads, yogurt, fruit, coffee, milk and tea. They even have a small mini-waffle maker. Food is served buffet style and there is plenty of seating in the very cozy lounge area which features two large wide-screen HDTVâ€™s or you can feel free to take your breakfast back to your room. This section of the hotel also has its own concierge and a computer (available for a charge of $9.00 per day). Beverages, cookies, and light snacks are available all day long and hot hors d'oeuvres and a cash bar are available between 4:00 â€“ 11:00 p.m. Our room was spacious, beautifully decorated and best of all â€“ featured two full sized baths! In addition, we found that we were in a prime spot and within easy walking distance of theatres, shopping, museums and great restaurants. All that and a great price! I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the executive level over the Easter weekend. The public areas of this hotel are well kept but once you get to the rooms they are shabby and tired. The a/c in our room clicked and groaned through the night and didnt even work very well. The bedrooms are small and the bathrooms even smaller. The location is good but I certainly wouldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: hikergirl57
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice. The first was with my daughter and it was a delightful and pleasant surprise to have found such a beautiful gem. Centrally located to both the metro, the parks and museum and the downtown. I returned recently and was not disappointed. The rooms were comfortable, the staff friendly and very helpful and the lobby was still beautiful. There are some very good places to eat within a couple of blocks.

Reviews.Title: “At deep discount only”
Reviews.Author: Pickyfrugal
Reviews.Content: There are two good things about this place: location in the heart of Chicago and beautiful historic lobby. As soon as you step away from the lobby, it's a shame. Dirty, worn out carpeting and walls, everything in dire need of renovation. Old shabby furniture in the room, worse than in any cheap chain. And they call themselves Hilton! Awful view from the window, more like a prison. Nothing for breakfast. And, as usual in American hotels, deceptive pricing: you don't know how much you pay because they don't include taxes in the quote. I wonder what will it take to end this rip-off. Stay at Palmer only if you can get a really good price AND want to be in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Second time staying here..”
Reviews.Author: coreysmale
Reviews.Content: In December myself and eight of my friends stayed at the Palmer House for the first time. And for having eight guys in their early twenties all together in one party, they treated us very fair and we were given two of the two double bed / two bath rooms which are the biggest in the hotel. I stayed again this past weekend with a bid I had won on priceline. Unlike most hotels, The Palmer House do not treat you like you are a "priceline customer" upon check-in. We arrived at our room which was fairly small and immediately noticed the bed must have been broken, or at least one of the springs must have been loose. I called the front desk and was told a bell man would be up immediately. He arrived and escorted us to our newer, and much larger room. The location is so convienent, just one block from the CTA blue line and the CTA red line which is the most popular is right outside your door. You literally are a doorstep and maybe a transfer away from everything inside of the city. I'd reccomend getting an all-day pass on the CTA, they are about $5 a day and well worth it. My next time in Chicago will be my third time staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Crooks - Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My group booked a block of 99.00 rooms approx. 6 months in advance. We had to cancel 10 weeks before the scheduled weekend. This is the first time our group has ever had to cancel our yearly trip. Myself and other organizers ate the 1,000+ cancellation fee. We continue to learn that the alledged 99.00 discount is the going rate for the rooms we booked and there is no mad rush to fill this hotel. The group booking department had no interest in reducing the penalty to incompass actual money loss on rooms that couldn't be rebooked. Bad customer service on their part. Of course now, the Palmer House is being referred to as "crooks" for the approx. 50 members of our group for getting paid for rooms they didn't book. I've stayed at the Palmer House and know it's not on par with many of the newer hotels in the city and its regular rooms are not worth more than $99 a night. There's a general consensus among the group that they can't compete with the other hotels in the city and would not have booked the block of rooms anyhow. Now, I wish I'd let this place sue us before I paid them one dime for rooms we didn't use.

Reviews.Title: “Fascinating Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FredC
Reviews.Content: You will either love or hate the decor in this hotel. I found it fascinating, my travelling companion found it gloomy. It has pretentions above its capability. The room was small but more than adequate, the service excellent, very clean, food good but watch the cost of using the hotels telephone system for international calls; $29 for a few minutes to the UK and they tried to charge me $15 for each call that did not go through. Fortunately there was no hesitation in removing the latter charges from the bill. Also $5 for a 500ml bottle of water left in the room is a bit steep. The well equipped gym is $10 for the first day and a lesser charge thereafter. There were no other problems despite a remote booking from the UK. If you are going to Chicago, want to stay downtown and have not stayed here before then give it a try but check the cost of services and food in the hotel complex if you are on a limited budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Palmer House!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came to Chicago last week to attend an Oprah taping. I found a good rate online and then, when I found a better rate, Hilton matched that price and sent me a $50 American Express gift check the very next day after our stay. My husband and I belong to Hilton Honors, so, we received a free room upgrade to an executive level floor. The room was beautiful and large. Two big beds, a big couch and chair and two bathrooms The service was excellent. The electronic wake-up call service went down (not just at our hotel, but, at several hotels). The manager gave me half off the room rate for our inconvenience. I've stayed at many Chicago hotels, including the Fairmont, Chicago Hilton, Hyatt Regency, & the Omni Ambassador East. I would defenitely state at the Palmer House again. The service can't be beat. You should also definitely make the short walk to Buddy Guy's Blues Legends where you will get your chance to sing along with the band! What a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “More about the Palmer”
Reviews.Author: DKraut
Reviews.Content: For the several hundred high school students who came for a model UN convention, the Palmer House was wonderful. It's the ideal place for a young person to experience a classic E-shaped building, three separate banks of elevators, turn of the twentieth century lobby, and street level arcade. I will remember that the atmosphere and faded grandeur of the hotel seemed to help the young people feel appropriately dressed in their suits. Now for the rest of us: location 1 1/2 blocks from the Monroe Street CTA blue line three blocks from the Architectural Foundation two blocks from the Art Institute two blocks from the Symphony Hall technically walkable, but also a very quick cab to the Lyric Opera. one block to the loop train If you are traveling for a 1-2 day stay that includes the above, you may be willing to trade the advantages of this terrific location with the very faded quality of the lower floor rooms. The room was clean, but worn, and the bathroom had been renovated and was excellent. The next time we travel, we will ask for an upgrade to the top floors that have been remodeled. Also, for those of you who really like the old-fashioned ability to open a window, you can do so, safely - the window tilts open. The streets outside are not the North Michigan miracle mile - and late at night the business area is sufficiently deserted to make walking alone unwise. Hope that this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “a pretty chaeap hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through an expedia package and for the price ( about 100 $) it was a great good surprise. First it could be ,if it is not, a national landmark: magnificent lobby, great ballrooms. Then Ok the room is pretty small and the door is thin , but look at the price, and the bed was great. In addition the staff is very friendly and courteous for such a kind of a hotel : no arrogance, l smiles, this adds a lot. Then, everything is clean, discreet, smooth. This classical music we hear everywhere is great. Then for tje sportmen, there is an excellent healthcenter . The situation is ideal for those like me who love museums, music and opera or simply shopping.... So if you are lucky to catch this as an expedia package , do not hesitate

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous old hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby area is elegant. The location is perfect. But with any old hotel, the rooms are small. I stayed in a studio room and it was like my old college dorm room without the roomate. However, I spent very little time in the room. There was too much to do nearby. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: kspire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the week between Christmas and New Years of 2004. The location is excellent - 2 blocks away from the Art Institute, a few blocks from many of the theaters and walking distance to millenium park and shopping. The lowest level of the building housed many restaurants/pubs, and other stores for shopping. The only thing we didn't really like was that parking was at a ramp across the street and the cost was $25/day. While the hotel did offer for unlimited in/out privledges from the ramp, it was still an added expense. But that is always the situation with hotels in the downtown area. The room was very comfortable, nicely decorated and very roomy, we had two double beds (for two people) that were very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great historic 'palace'”
Reviews.Author: march-16
Reviews.Content: we have stayed several times-we always get our rates on hotwire in the 60$ range so we are satisfied with the VALUE but it is such a neat place to explore and close to the theaters-the restaurant scene in the area is a bit bleak but Trader Vics is an experience in itself-get there for the good appetizers for happy hour=the staff has always been polite and usually upgrades us if at all possible....the rooms are small(european)but clean and decorative

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - why do people complain?”
Reviews.Author: MrsMacSpod
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Palmer House 9th to 15th December 2004. Because I'd read the bad reviews beforehand I was really nervous about the hotel, especially since I'd stayed at the Hilton Anaheim the previous year and the bad reviews were spot on. Anyway, we were lucky enough to stay in a two-bath/two bed room - clean, large and comfortable, and we were on the 17th floor, so were lucky enough to have some sort of view towards the city skyline. We were both very impressed - most of the staff were pleasant enough - the barman was especially attentive. As people have said, the lobby is fantastic. Try the Palmer House Hilton but try to book one of the rooms we had, then you'll have a great time. Walking around Chicago didn't seem too scary either (like I had expected) - just keep to the shopping/eating areas and you'll be fine. The hotel is a couple of minutes walk from Michigan Avenue (try Bennigans for breakfast), and you'll be close to all the shops (a good idea if you're Christmas/holiday shopping) and museums. Saks Fifth Avenue had very helpful and pleasant staff. If we ever visit Chicago again (and we hope to in a few years), we'll stay at the Palmer House again.

Reviews.Title: “Still liked it second year in a row”
Reviews.Author: MGreene16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House over Thanksgiving for two nights, same as last year. We reserved a 2 bath room for $119/night through the HHonors web site (Hilton Honors members) then later sent an e-mail basically asking for any upgrades possible. We were upgraded to the Executive level (the one with a private elevator) and actually a view! Of course there were office buildings in the view but we could also see the lake, the top of the Millenium Park bandshell (lit at night) and a sliver of the Navy Pier ferris wheel. So it is possible! The spacious room was lovely, both bathrooms although small were nicely appointed with a really cool flip up shower head, and we had turn down service every night. A free continental breakfast was included. The location was ideal for our purposes of theater, dinner, and seeing the decorations. For a Loop hotel, in-and-out parking for $25/day was quite reasonable even though it was across the street. There couldn't be a better place to see the Thanksgiving Parade. The lobby was stunning but very smoky this year (didn't notice the problem last year). From the sound of the reviews it seems to be the room itself that makes all the difference - apparently people buying a discount room through Priceline or some other third party do not get the same service as hotel program members. Duh, as my teenage son would say!

Reviews.Title: “IMPRESSED”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised to see the negative comments about the Palmer House Hilton on tripadvisor; it was like reading about a different hotel. I stayed in the Palmer House for just under two weeks in September and found the hotel to be very pleasant. Whilst it is no 5 star, the service is good, the rooms were very pleasant (mine was quite spacious) cleaned beautifully and well equipped. The staff were friendly and helpful. The concierge was fairly useless, and unless he had his computer switched on he couldnâ€™t tell you anything. Windsorâ€™s (the hotel bar) is excellent, with a fantastic choice of drinks and cigars. The restaurant (main hotel) was average, with better and cheaper alternates available locally. The reception or foyer was a great place to sit with a drink and watch the World go by. All in all I would say itâ€™s a great hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: flames'04
Reviews.Content: Not impressed at ALL. The hotel itself looks really nice, especially in the big foyer area. Our room was small, and the bathroom needed some major upgrades. It had the green tile, like at your grandmother's house, all over the walls, and 2 people couldn't fit in it if you tried. We could hear the people beside us in the early morning every morning, so obvioulsy the walls aren't so thick. Our room looked directly on to a brick building outside, VERY close, we couldn't even tell if it was nice outside or not. We are assuming we were not in a renovated room from the looks of it, and I felt yucky the whole time in it. I just wouldn't pay lots of money to stay here, there is nothing exceptional about it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Get Honors before you go”
Reviews.Author: Tronunit
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a conference in the Windy City (Nov. 10-13) where the Palmer House was the only remaining conference hotel that was not booked. Frankly, I was dreading the experience based on tripadvisor reviews of the hotel. The last thing I wanted was to spend the conference rate of $200.00 per night for a shoebox. However, I took the advice of a tripadvisor reviewer and registered for HiltonHonors before we left. When we checked into the hotel we were pleasantly surprised to find they bumped us to the executive level on the top floor of the hotel. Sure the rooms are average size (it is a Hilton!) but the terri robes, view of Chicago, free breakfast and private elevator made us feel special. Another perk with the program is not having to stand in the regular check-in line. We were processed in minutes at the Honors desk. Thanks Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “So deceptive...”
Reviews.Author: endir
Reviews.Content: For my first time in Chicago, I had chosen a hotel with a historic reputation and when I came in the Palmer House, I could have thought I was on the right way. The lobby decor is amazing. But, after a quick check-in, time was to discover my room... Terrible! On the 8th floor, just near the elevators. There must be 10 or 12 elevators and there is this "ding" thing each time they stop. From my room I could hear everything... And the 8th floor is the floor for the pool and the fitness room. So all the elevators can stop and a lot of guests too, talking etc... The room was so small and dark... I had a strange feeling... like sleeping in the corridor. .. Fortunately, the second day, I asked for another room and the hotel could give me one... still dark but not so noisy... So, my question is: why giving such room like the first one I've had. At the reception, the clerk knew perfectly the problem of this room. When I asked for change, they didn't even ask why... It seems that they play together, trying to sell it... I am sure the hotel was not full during my stay so why ? When you're in vacation like I was, travelling from far, you expect for more care. At the Palmer House, apparently they don't... care. I will never forget that.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House Nov. 5th through the 8th, 2004. You could not ask for a better located hotel. I learned from the info book in our room that the Palmer House is the longest continuously operating hotel in North America. For it's age, the hotel holds up remarkably well. I loved every facet of the hotel. The best way to visit Chicago is without a car. Driving in downtown Chicago isn't worth the risk and parking is expensive. The roads are a free-for-all. Cab rides are always an adventure as it is. And always look before you cross streets. Red light running is routine. The Blue line "L" from Ohare is easy to find. Just follow the "Trains to the City" signs. It drops you off a block from the hotel at the Monroe St. stop. Conversely, on the return trip, just make sure you go down the Blue Line subway entrance (there is also a Red Line) and hop on a clearly marked train to Ohare. There is also an Orange line elevated train to Midway Airport, with a stop a block from the hotel. Best $1.75 you'll ever spend in Chicago. Once you emerge from the subway it is a little intimidating as you are immersed in a dense sea of skyscapers. It is just a matter of orienting yourself. Read maps to familiarize yourself with the cross streets. Don't be afraid to ask someone if you get turned around. You may encounter beggars, but a polite sorry is all you need to say, if anything. Keep walking. They won't bother you. Once you get to the hotel, it is again a matter of getting oriented in the cathedral-like lobby. Check out the ceiling mural, painted in 1900. The Windsor Bar, just off the lobby, is a great place to hang if you are waiting for someone. They have world-class cigars for sale, big screen plasmas and a Golden Tee 2005. The only drawback is the long walk to the other side of the lobby to the rest rooms. After you check in, take some time to familiarize yourself with the hotel. It takes up an entire city block and has exits to at least 3 of the surrounding streets. You could spend your entire stay without leaving the hotel. There are 3 on-site bar/restaurants in addition to the Windsor, which serves appetizers and free snack bowls they put out that you won't be able to stop munching on. There is a Starbucks-type coffee shop on one of the buildings' corners, and the real thing a block or two away. There are several retail shops in the hotel and on the back side of the building there is an old fashioned mom and pop breakfast diner. There is a Walgreen's nearby and a White Hen, which is a little pantry with several types of coffee, pastries, deli sandwiches and typical convenience store wares, about a half block away. I used the internet access in the hotels' business center to print my boarding pass for my return flight. Make sure you tell the staff you are printing a boarding pass. It is a flat rate of $5 versus $9.50 for 15 minutes of access. If you are an HHonors Gold member, be sure to find the elevator to the 23rd floor, which requires you swipe your key to access the floor. There you will find a free continental breakfast in the morning, free pop and water all day, internet access, free snacks in the evening along with a private cash bar. Millenium Park is a block away. The Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium and Adler Planetarium are a long walk or short cab ride away. Ditto the Sears Tower Skydeck. The "L" and Red and Blue subway lines are a block away. Anywhere you could want to go in Downtown Chicago is either within walking distance or a short taxi ride away. Taxi rides are another story... This is not the place to stay if you are on a budget. Food and cocktails are spendy, but then that is life in the big city. If you are coming here for a once in a lifetime splurge, this is your place. I liked it so much I went out of my way to come back here to write a review. I would not only stay here again, but I'm counting the days!!

Reviews.Title: “Like being below decks on the Titanic”
Reviews.Author: melkmail
Reviews.Content: This is a historic hotel with beautiful common areas, but at the time that the Palmer House was built, room sizes were much smaller than by today's standards. If you book through Priceline into this hotel or choose a standard room, you will find you have barely enough room to turn around (the only room I've seen smaller than this is the Paramount in NYC). I had friends books into larger rooms on higher floors, with eccentric features like TWO bathrooms for a one bed room, as for these larger rooms the hotel has simply knocked down a wall and combined two of these tiny cells into one. I could actually brush my teeth at the sink while sitting on the toilet in my bathroom. And the view was, because of the size and the age of the hotel combined with the lowest calibre room type, of an airshaft. Now that I know a little more about Chicago, I will be able to book a much larger and more comfortable room in almost every aspect elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Good As I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I guess I was expecting a well designed luxurious hotel. The service was good, but there were some very frustrating factors. Our room was as big as a closet. Really!!! It was about 12ft X 14ft with a full bed, a tv stand, a desk (with chair), and 2 night stands. Not much room in there. THe second most frustrating thing was experienced by all who stay there. The first 8 floors of the hotel are actually used up by buisiness people, weddings, etc... This causes an unbelievable elevator jam. We waited 18 min. one night to catch an elevator and go to dinner. I heard many others complaining about the same thing. Actually, it was usually the topic of conversation while waiting fo elevators. This one killed me. The fitness area is an extra charge to hotel guests!!!!!! They want to charge you $10.00 a day extra when you enter the fitness area. You can use the pool free of charge, which is very small for a hotel that size. Finally, I really did expect CHicago to be expensive, but the hotel eateries and bars are unbelievable at $6.00 for domestic draft beer and $8.50 dollars for a mixed drink, not to mention the bar staff was a very rude bunch. I will not stay at the Palmer House Hilton the next time I go to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The Palmer House rocks!”
Reviews.Author: coastda
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Honors award on 11/4 and got a wonderful junior suite on the 23rd floor with lounge access, free pop, cookies and excellent service. After reading some of these reviews I was leary but call in advance and ask nicely for an upgrade, particularly if you are an HHonors member

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Palmer House Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Laura T
Reviews.Content: Had a great time staying at The Palmer House Hilton on my first trip to Chicago. Got a below half the current price on hotwire. The hotel was beautiful with the murals on the ceiling in the lobby. I got a newly renovated room which was very nice. Try one of the great salads at Big Downtown restaurant. It was a very convenient short walk to the Art Institute of Chicago. It was also fairly close to shopping at the Marshall Field's Store on State Street. (If you go here first go to the 7th floor vistor area and get a brochure with buy one get one entry free into the Art Institute). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palmer House”
Reviews.Author: Norskedame
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Palmer House Hilton the first week of October/2004. We had a fabulous stay. Our room was large, with two beds, two baths, and was very clean as was the whole hotel. The staff was helpful and friendly, the services outstanding and of course the location is the best in Chicago. The hotel may have faded a bit over 100+ yrs., but it's still a beautiful and ledgendary landmark in the heart of the city. We expected food and room costs would be expensive, but planned accordingly and so we were prepared to have a great time whatever the cost. Can't wait to return and do it all over again. I will recomend the Palmer House to all who ask where to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Better than advertized”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I actually read the reviews here before travelling and really wasn't expecting much. Sure, there's an air of faded grandeur in some parts of the hotel, but overall I thought it a reasonably good hotel. It is ideally located, very convenient for the L and offers everything that the traveller needs. I had a large room with no less than 2 bathrooms and it was very clean and comfortable - the bed was excellent. Service, highlighted by others as a weakness was uniformly excellent, so maybe the feedback worked! The biggest drawback is the cost of the food - there really isn't a cheap option. Trader Vics and French quarter fall into the very average food very high price category - $60+ for a dinner and drink. Downtown Chicago is vaguely reasonable - $25 for dinner and a beer, but again the food is unremarkable and pretty bland. Best meal of my 4 night stay? - wings and a philly cheesteak from roomservice, a snip at only $30!! If the company is paying, it's fine. If it's my dollar, there's certainly better for less. Gino's East for example, a piece of Chicago history and $25 a head including the cab fare! Overall, a perfectly adequate and decently appointed place to stay in the heart of Chicago, but I would spend $200 a night of my own money :-)

Reviews.Title: “Palmer House came through”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Fri. Oct 8, we booked through expedia. We found that we had a suite with two twin beds. This was not going to work, since we were there for our annivesary. Not only did the staff get us into a king bed, but at 4:30 champagne and a tray of chocolates arrived for the occasion. All on the house. What a great touch. We will be back. It was a great location for what we had planned, dinner at Nine and a concert at the Auditiorium Theatre, walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Nice Hotel, Staff needs customer service improvement!”
Reviews.Author: SanFran2008
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Palmer House, Sept 10-15. They hotel is located in the loop which makes it ideal to get around. The rooms are nice and very clean. It is similar to the Waldorf=Astoria in New York City. The only downfall during my stay was the staff. They are not a very helpful and social at all. Upon check in, the agent did not even make any eye contact at all. I am a Hilton HHonors member and I assume I get an extra welcome, but not this time. Despite that, the hotel is great and they do have some great restaurants. I will stay here again, but I hope the front desk staff is a bit nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Balance the pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: LibertyTheatre
Reviews.Content: We recently completed a 3-night stay at the Palmer after winning a Priceline bid. After Priceline announced the hotel name, I read nearly all of the Tripadvisor reviews about this property. Several of the experiences that you may read below are simply the result of timing. Each property also has positives and negatives which are NOT the result of timing. Here are a few for the Palmerâ€¦ Cons: * Some of the rooms are quite small. Many of the older style bathrooms have little standing room. * Because it is a historic property, some facets of the hotel will show its age. * Because of the dense urban location (no fault of the hotel itself), you can expect the following: even self-parking is expensive; only the top rooms facing the street have any views; beggars are common. Pros: * The location is indeed excellent â€“ close to transportation, tons of restaurants & shops, theaters, the lake, Grant Park and Millenium Park, the museums, etc. * The beds are wonderful â€“ down-filled toppers both above and below the main sheets. * Not just the main lobby, but all of the public spaces are beautiful (for example, check out the grand ballroom). Tips: * Before booking your stay, become a â€œHilton HHonorsâ€� member. There are some perks including a separate check-in desk. * Request your room preference before you arrive. * If your room preference can not be guaranteed (as with Priceline), arrive early on your check-in day to request it in person. * Before booking, check with the hotel regarding any overlap with major event dates (such as conventions). * Leave a note with your tip for your maid. * If itâ€™s an option for you, visit without a car. * As with any hotel, avoid the mini-bar. Buy your drinks and snacks at street level. Overall, we were highly pleased with our stay. Of course, as mentioned above, many of these factors may have been influenced by the timing of our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: missjoyo
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Palmer House this week on my first visit to the States. The hotel was stunning, the staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. Our room was huge and well appointed for the price. Immaculately clean throughout, and excellent facilities for the tourist or business traveller. There were great deals on food too. Only a short walk from Michigan Avenue and 5 mins from the Sears Tower. Overall we fell in love with the hotel and Chicago! Really could not fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House last month for a long weekend with my daughter for her 10th birthday. We had a huge room with two bathrooms for a very good price and the location can't be beat. Close to the parks and Navy Pier and the El stations for the airport and Wrigley were right outside the hotel. Also their were a good selection of restaurants with in short walking distance. Will stay there on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good but....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 10th-13th August inclusive.We had booked 2 twin rooms but were somewhat dismayed to find that we had been allocated 2 double rooms even though our voucher clearly stated 2 twin rooms.When we queried this with Guest Registration we were told that "Twin Room" is not a term used in the US.(Of course we later discovered that it is a term used in the US.)The person dealing with us was not very pleasant albeit that we may have been a little testy having come off a 10 hour flight! Anyway,we requested that the situation be corrected. It wasn't until the next day.However we did get an upgrade to 2 great rooms and the rest of the staff were very friendly and courteous. On balance it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend at Palmer House”
Reviews.Author: ColdwaterNative
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I spent the weekend of 27 - 29 Aug 04 at the Palmer House and had a wonderful time. The location was perfect. The staff was cordial and helpful. My room was cozy and clean, with a bed that was the most comfortable I've encountered in years. I will definitely stay at the Palmer House again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: IronChefNeva
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 4-day stay at the Palmer House--2 days in a regular King room and 2 in the executive tower. Both were a great bargain and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. There are no views outside the hotel--but the inside is wonderful--especially the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Bargain”
Reviews.Author: clarkecrew
Reviews.Content: My family of four just returned from a 3 night stay (July 30 through August 2) and would definitely stay again. We booked a room through Hotwire for $80 a night, which is at least $100 a night cheaper than the going rate for a 4 star hotel in the area. While the room was on the smaller side and the bathroom and bathtub were tiny, it met our needs. We left our room at 8 am each day and would return 12-13 hours later just to wash up and sleep. The most wonderful thing about our experience was the perfect location. It is 1 1/2 blocks from the orange line train from Midway, the red line stops outside the State Street entrance, and the red and yellow line free summer trolleys stop at the State Street entrance. We enjoyed a 2 block walk to the Art Institute and even braved an 18 block walk to the Museum Campus, which only took about 40 minutes with our tired children. A cab ride from the Hancock Observatory to the hotel only cost $5 for the 4 of us. We would walk to Osco to purchase snacks and drinks in the evening, as it was cheaper than the vending machines and nearly as close. Burger King, McDonalds, Wendy's, and various other restaurants are also nearby. I was very disappointed by the early closing times of the restaurants. We were hard pressed to find anything except the hotel restaurants open on Sunday. As for the elevators, we stayed on the 11th floor and never had to wait more than 30 seconds for an elevator. The staff was very friendly and my children enjoyed the Brownies that were passed out at the registration desk.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HISTORIC HOTEL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed June 24th and 25th for the Taste of Chicago. Had a two bedroom parlor suite that met and exceeded our expectations. Not only was the suite luxurious and very large, the concierge level has great food; breakfast, snacks, etc. The concierges were professional, friendly and very helpful. If you decide to stay in this beautiful historic hotel, make sure you upgrade from the standard room, as it is small. Staff is courteous, and there to help you with all your needs...We will stay here every time we come to Chicago!!!!

Reviews.Title: “room needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was highly impress with the lobby on initial check-in. When we opened our room door that was a whole different story though. My bedroom at home is bigger than the room we stayed in. The bed is a full size which is too small for 2 adults. The bathrooms were small too. The toilet paper holder is literally right beside the commote and you almost have to be a real skinny person to not feel it poking at you. It's so small you have to pretty much stand sideways to close the door behind you after you get in. I would only come back to this hotel only if I know I'm staying at a larger room. People who wrote good reviews here probably stayed at the larger suites so I can understand why the recomendations. As for us since we were given a small room and was not able to upgrade I can only give it 3 stars. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Lobby, not so great rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, not too shabby service, awesome lobby BUT room we were in were ridiculously small.! We also only had a full/twin size bed. Luckily we are not gargantuans otherwise anyone over 6ft and 200 ibs would have a hard time fitting. Comfortably anyways. We ask for an upgrade to a bigger room BUT were told all is book. :( Would stay there again BUT only if I know I will be getting bigger room, otherwise NOT worth it. I've stayed in small town motels that has better room b4.

Reviews.Title: “Pass up the Palmer House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Attended conference at the Palmer House July 15-16 and stayed there July 17. Lobby and conference room were very nice, though bathrooms for conference rooms were tiny. Trader Vic's restaurant was dated and dingy, and New Orleans style main dining area looked like something from a bad roadside motel. Room on 11th floor needed some serious updating, and mini bar had something smelly and sticky spilled inside. While I couldn't hear any noise from outside (and the train runs right outside the window), my companion was awakened by vacuuming in the hall in the middle of the night. Would not spend the money to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the Palmer House Hilton and we were very pleased with the room. The beds were very comfortable, the location is perfect, and having two bathrooms was great!

Reviews.Title: “Palmer House - Kid Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: ALASKA
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is a great choice for families. We got a great rate through Priceline and booked 2 rooms instead of one, to have plenty of space for 4 people. (Many rooms are on the small side). The rooms, along with the lobby, have that old-time Chicago atmosphere that we loved. Not that we spent that much time in the hotel anyway. Location of the hotel is nothing short of IDEAL. We walked everywhere. Dining options: Two of the hotel's restaraunts have kids' menus. The French Quarter even has a kid's waiting area at the entrance, with a TV tuned into the Cartoon channel and art boards. You can save money by eating at one of the diners or sandwich shops within easy walking distance of the hotel. There is also a Burger King right across the street where we got breakfast. One caveat: The pool is not all that large, and seemed overly chlorinated. My kids had a good time but there wasn't much room to play given all the other families there. Overall, would consider this a top choice when returning to the area with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in I nicely asked for one of the larger rooms--although I preferred a King, it helped to be flexible about # of beds and smoking vs. non-smoking. I was given a spacious non-smoking room with 2 doubles and a comfortable chair with ottoman. Although it's time to spruce up the furnishings, nothing was in bad shape and the decor was soothing and comfortable, if not stylish. The bathroom was small and lacked counter space, but was adequate. Nice, quiet climate control. Down side is that room (on 8th floor) stared directly into a brick wall, so there was no natural light to speak of. Most rooms here do not have a view. Lobby is gorgeous--I sat in it and read the paper just to enjoy the surroundings and classical music playing. Location is very convenient and there are many dining options and convenience, drug and dept stores nearby. Trader Vics restaurant on the lower level is very nice--check it out. Requests were handled promptly, and staff is mostly pleasant and accomodating. $1.00 for local calls up to an hour--800# calls free for first hour. Annoying 11 am checkout time (only cheap motels have 11 am checkout), but they will automatically give you until noon for free if you call the front desk and ask. The only reason I'd be leery about staying here again is because I might wind up with one of the very small rooms mentioned by other reviewers--they won't guarantee a room type if you book with Expedia, Priceline, etc. If I had received one of those rooms, I might not have enjoyed my stay as much.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Honor Our Reservation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our flight was coming into Chicago quite late due to the time change flying from California. I called ahead before leaving to confirm our reservation and tell them we would be checking in late. No problem...until we get there. No rooms, they move us to another Hilton nearby that was so slammed with people moved from the Palmer House overbooking that they put in normally unused rooms, which were right beneath the laundry! Loud loud loud. I don't blame the other Hilton though as they were trying to absorb Palmer Houses overspill. We met other travellers in the same situation in their lobby. Back to the Plamer though...we were promised a comped stay in any Hilton. What we got months later was an offer for a one night comp'd stay at the Palmer House. Useless, since we're never in Chicago and not what we were promised. The lobby was fantastic, but good luck getting past it! STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Was really nervous about staying here after reading some of these reviews...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-day stay at the Palmer House, and have no complaints. Booked it through priceline, and got a room over the weekend of the Blues Festival and airfare for $300. Room was certainly adequate for two people, very quiet (even though the hotel was sold out), and the staff was friendly and helpful. I wasn't expecting a large, luxurious room for the rate I was paying, and it actually exceeded my expectations. It's a very old, handsome hotel, that obviously some of these reviewers are not accustomed to staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome lobby, bed/room too small”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night on a Friday and were on the 12th floor. We really like the lobby and the ceiling is beautiful. They were working on the ceiling in our hallway. The room was small, but fine for one night. The only problem was that the bed was too small. We told them 2 people were staying in there and the bed was more like a twin size. Make sure you ask for a queen or king size bed. Other than that, great location and we had a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Palmer House!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Chicago. We stayed 3 nights at the PHH. We were amazed at the beautiful and spacious room. The best part was the 2 bathrooms! We couldn't have asked for more and when we go back we will definitely stay at the PHH. The staff was wonderful- especially Steve. He went out of his way to make sure that we had everything we needed. We were close enough to walk to shopping and we had a great choice of restaurants. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be where all the action is.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, rooms not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very, very small. Not overly impressed with the furnishings in the room, could use an update. Lobby is gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly :)”
Reviews.Author: spercle73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pet friendly! Bringing our small dog on vacation can be challenging, but this hotel was most accomodating. The staff offered our dog bottled water when we were waiting for our car to be returned from valet parking... A nice touch indeed. The room was clean, comfortable, and non-smoking... which was also nice. Often, as pet owners, we find ourselves in smoking rooms near exits and loud corridors. This was not the case at the Hilton. Our dog is trained not to bark in these situations, and we didn't hear any other dogs barking during our stay. A few notes on the hotel: Not a lot of rooms with a "great" view... realize you may overlook a parking lot or directly at another building across the street. The lobby is magnificent, but the rooms don't reflect the elegance represented there. It is a great location if you want to visit "The Taste of Chicago"... easy walking distance to that event. And again, it is pet friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is great, but that is all....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby was gerat as picture shows, but that all. Room was small and tight. There is no extra space even for a small air bed. I stayed in Travelodge in the previous night and knew that the number of movie we could choose(purchase) in here was much smaller than that of travelodge!! Air conditioning in room was difficult to control. (too hot or too cold!) I'm very sorry to see my parents not enjoying the stay. My impression on this hotel is "just-the-bobby". That's all.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room was small and heat didn't work right. Elevators came only after 20 minute waits. I needed a VCR and brought mine; they jury-rigged the TV so that mine wouldn't work, and then charged me an obscene $62 to rent theirs. Then they couldn't even bring it on time. Pool is only open to 9, and the staff got grouchy with me when I came down for a brief dip at 8:30. Sure, the lobby's pretty, but next time I'll stay at the Congress Plaza and walk up to look at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A legend in its own time”
Reviews.Author: dalangdon
Reviews.Content: The Palmer House is a gorgeous, historic hotel in the heart of Chicago. Rooms are good-sized, staff is friendly, restaurants are excellent, and public areas are exceptional. I was very pleasently suprised to see that Trader Vic's (on the lower level) is still serving up exotic cocktails and delicious food after all these years. Make sure to stop by and spend some time at this American Institution. This truly is a huge hotel, so it's easy to get lost, but if you do, there is plenty of security and other staff members to point you in the right direction. The only downside is that some of the hallways can be a little bit loud with comings and goings all hours of the day and night, but if you are a sound sleeper you won't be bothered.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's finest!”
Reviews.Author: rfl68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to spend three days in Chicago last summer, and booked via Expedia. When we first walked into the lobby we almost fell over at its' beauty. It's like something out of Europe. We were able to get a free room upgrade, even though the rooms are still a bit small, but its' an old hotel in an old city. It's there for sleeping and showering. The restaurants, lounges, and shops were all wonderfull. The next time we travel to Chicago, I'll be affraid to stay anywhere other than the Palmer House Hilton

Reviews.Title: “a really great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the PHH three times for a conference and have found the staff to be absolutely superb. The conference hosted 1000 students and they handled it with such class and style. The rooms are phenomenal. Having lived in Chicago for three years, I always brought visitors to the main lobby just to marvel at the ceiling. Each room has such class and penache--the red lacquer room, etc... The cigar bar is fun and while the rooms are a little old and the walls a little thin, you truly get the feeling that you are staying at a very rich hotel. PHH has just a great history too! A must stay for the visitor or business traveler to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KINGHOPWAS
Reviews.Content: I could not believe the scale of this Hotel, it was very impressive. The 1st floor lobby is amazing, Plenty of staff and all pleasant and helpful. Room was relatively small but in excellent condition. If I have a criticism it was the noise from corridors and adjoining rooms. Plenty of choice of where to eat or drink, well worth stopping at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for my trip”
Reviews.Author: jesst70
