Reviews.Content: I decided to take my 5 year old son for his first trip to Chicago and decided to take a chance on Hotwire to book the hotel........all I can say is I loved this hotel!!! I assume we had a standard room, but it was plenty for me and my son....the view was of the building across the street, but my son thought it was very cool!!!!! Clean, safe, the staff was soooo nice, all of our requests were handled promptly, and the location was perfect for walking to the sites and near the El station.....I did not partake of any of the restaurants as they were a little pricey for eating at the hotel, but this is Chicago and to be expected. I can not say enough about the staff, they were so wonderful and sweet to me and my son, he got such a kick out of the bellhops, the doorman who hailed our taxi, and even the maid service. Overall, I am very glad we stayed at this hotel, it added that special touch to make my son's first plane ride and "far away" vacation a wonderful experience...he can't wait for our next trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vneuman921
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful first trip to Chicago, due in large part to our stay at Palmer House. From the wonderful downtown location, to the many fine restaraunts and bars in the hotel, to the oversized room with two bathrooms. Just a very memorable experience. Will definately plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Magic!”
Reviews.Author: lyou1086
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Chicago in December for a convention. We booked rooms for the Palmer House on Expedia, at a fairly reduced rate as most other hotels were fully booked and high priced, so I was expecting mediocracy. We were thrilled to find anything but average! The hotel is beautiful, the rooms were cleaned impeccably. We had a very large room..VERY large! The staff was cheerful, helpful, smiling and proved Midwestern kindness. It was my favorite hotel all year, and I have traveled in the US extensively in 2003. We intend to stay at The Palmer House ever year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: vanberk
Reviews.Content: Got a room for 2 nights through Priceline - great price. Had trepidation after reading reviews....but got an incredible deal. Refurbished HUGE room with two bathrooms (was clearly two rooms that had been made into one) with lovely furnishings. Quiet. Gorgeous lobby and common areas. Wonderful staff. Altogether a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent time there for the USC/ND game. I initially booked the hotel because of its reputation. I was disappointed with the Executive Lounge (it was under renovation). I didn't eat at the hotel dining establishments because there were plenty of interesting alternatives. Overall a relatively upscale looking hotel and my room was huge except the bathroom which was doable. The location is great if you want to see the city. Although I'm not sure if I would stay here again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: tallgal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palmer House in September. I thought the room was beautifully decorated and had a very upscale feeling to it. The bathtub was especially awesome. I'm above average height and bathtubs are never the right size for me, but this one was great. We had no noise or problems and we were right across the hall from the maids closet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience in an Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palmer House over Thanksgiving and had a very pleasant experience. Through Hilton Honors we had one free night and the other was $129. We reserved a regular room with two double beds. I e-mailed the hotel about five days ahead and asked for a renovated room on a high floor, and requested a complimentary upgrade if available. The next day I received a response granting us an upgrade to a two-bath room. All of the staff were quite pleasant. The room was very large; the open space could have fit at least three rollaways. It was elegantly decorated. There were a few minor repairs needed - missing door stop on one bathroom, etc., but nothing that affected our stay. The location was perfect - we walked to shopping, dinner and the theater (Lion King), and on Thanksgiving morning only had to walk about 30 feet out the door to watch the parade. Parking, for the Loop, was a real deal: in-and-out privileges for $23/day, good til 5:00 pm day of departure.

Reviews.Title: “One word "Wow"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is the most amazing place in the world! The suits are huge, and the come with two bathrooms, and a robe. I love the lobby. Also the FREE food court!

Reviews.Title: “THought It Was Great”
Reviews.Author: super996mum
Reviews.Content: I must say I was a bit nervous about staying at the Palmer House after reading some of the reviews, prior to my trip. But, as I told friends in the area that I would be staying there, the faces of all of them lit up as they told me what a great place it was. I was there for 7 days, during a conference, and found it to be very comfortable & home-like. As everyone said before me, the rooms aren't huge, but very comfortable, and more importantly, clean! And how much space does 1 person need? The staff from houskeeping to the concierge were friendly. I had to change rooms mid-way through my week to accommodate a visiting friend & found the 2nd room to be plenty spacious for 2, as my first room was for one. One evening when my key would not work, security was sent up to let me into my room. It made me very comfortable when he wouldn't open the door until I showed ID. We ate at all 3 of the hotel's on-site restaurants & had great food in each, although, the waiters in the bar area of the "Big Downtown" could have been friendlier. I will stay there in the future should I ever have the pleasure of returning to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not as prestigious as I thought”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fairly small rooms, especially bathroom. Very friendly staff & great exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here while attending a conference in the hotel. While walking to and from my room I noticed the maids cleaning some of the shoebox-sized rooms where they must put all of the Priceline customers. I am a HHonors member and my room was very nicely appointed and a good size. I received two vouchers for free bottled water from the minibar. The staff were friendly, the service was excellent and the conference facilities were great. The location was very convenient and I found a number of good bars and restaurants within a block or two. The fitness room was the best I have ever seen at a hotel! I have another conference to attend next spring and am looking forward to returning to Chicago and the Palmer House Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “General comments”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. My first impression was that the valet guy outside was quite rude. Inside, the lobby was quite nice and all the stores inside. I used the side bank of elevators for my room. When I got to my room, it was double the size of the average room, but had the smallest bathroom. Barely holds one person. I did have a walk in closet though. Nice touch. Unfortunately, when I opened the window, I looked right into some corrugated metal from some building about 3 feet from the window. Other than that, the hotel stay was uneventful. One of the largest exercise facilities, but one of the smallest pools I've seen among the nicer hotels.
